text: They were prompt, knowledgeable, professional, and really generous about helping us. We hired them to get our fireplace inspected and cleaned,  which they did very well, while explaining and educating us along the way. They gave us tips on our dryer which we hadn't even asked for and helped us with some firewood problems too. Couldn't be happier. We will use them every year from now on.

I really want to like bryn and dane's because their concept is so great, but every time I go to any location I am disappointed. I agree wholeheartedly with some of the prior reviews expressing that this place delivers anything but FAST food. I went to the Bryn Mawr location for breakfast on a Sunday morning. The place was deserted and yet they still took about 20 minutes to make two egg wraps, one smoothie, and sweet potato hash. Totally unacceptable! No sense of urgency and overall, the staff seemed like they had no idea what they were doing. No greeting when I arrived and no apology when they took forever to make my order, looking like bewildered, incompetent idiots the whole time. Very frustrating and irritating experience, and I won't be back to the Bryn Mawr location ever again. They really need to work on training their employees and making sure they know how to make what is on the menu quickly. I don't think that's too much to ask.

everyone was going crazy about how good the hoagies are from cosmis so i got one and wasn't too impressed with the bread ! the meat/ cheese combos are good and priced reasonably. but it's all about the bread !!

Was looking for something healthy on Google and this place popped up. Never heard of it but was open to giving it a try and will definitely be back. The staff was super friendly and the food was actually really tasty. Being a "healthy, fit restaurant" the taste is often not there for most places but the bowl I got was absolutely delicious. The wait was a bit longer than I anticipated (20min) and it was not crowded but the food prep apologized for the wait when I finally got my food. Definitely recommend!

Operated illegally as a contractor with no license for two years, complete disregard for any customer or employee, dishonest, unloyal and no integrity, it was a shame to allow the work and the business from this man, it was a huge mistake to ever use this man beware!
This little  hut has the best Mexican food in the area. Every time that I go there, I can't pass up the steak tacos. Very good!

Delicious food and friendly service!! I personally hate Apple pies. But there apple dumpling was pretty good and nice twist on it. I ordered the bacon egg and cheese sandwhich on white bread which was very tasty. My gf ordered the same but added sausage to it, id go for one without the sausage. The French toast was pretty bland to be honest. But not the worst I've ever had. All in all pretty good experience.

An incredible array of locally brewed beers - the orange creamsicle nitro IPA was truly unique and delicious. So smooth. Great space for kids with board games and colouring available. The craft brewed soda could be a bit more flavourful and the pizza we had was good, but not worth the trip (this is way south for us). Still, the beer and atmosphere were good enough that we'll likely be back.

Got the all American cheesesteak and it was excellent. Roll was soft and the meat was plentiful. Truly an outstanding cheesesteak.  The place on the other hand is next to the bar of the bowling alley, but your not there for the ambience it's the food that brings you in.
The Monte Cristo is a must have for lunch or dinner! Couple it with a bowl of loaded potato soup and you have yourself a meal you will not soon forget!

I'm very familiar with the Spring House location but since I work in Abington/jenkintown it's convenient that this location is in the area.

Small and modest setting but delicious sushi. Very consistent to the Spring House and Philadelphia location. 

The rolls are 8 pieces- I got spicy tuna, tuna avocado, and shrimp tempura (3 roll special: $11.50) and my only issue was the shrimp tempura roll was very small. No veggies and the shrimp was small. 

Another observation, most sushi places I've been to give a ridiculous serving of wasabi but I didn't get half way through my rolls before running out of wasabi! Never thought that would be an issue but the portion was very small. Other than that they have a variety of rolls and options. So good!

I just got home from a big family brunch at the Cheesecake Factory. It was probably my last visit. There was a ridiculously long wait for the food. I did enjoy my pancakes, which were served with only a tiny cup of syrup. My tomato juice was sour. Others needed more coffee, and were complaining about not having enough syrup. There was a long wait for the server to come back, then another long wait for coffee, syrup, and to have my sour tomato juice replaced with supposedly fresh squeezed orange juice. I stopped eating for quite some time, because I had nothing to wash down dry pancakes. The orange juice at least wasn't spoiled, but I have a hard time believing it's fresh squeezed, when my supermarket brand orange juice that comes in half gallon cartons tastes much better. I understand that people are busy, but the service was so horrible that meal should have been comped. No one even apologized for the endless waits for anything, or offered any reasons.
Great Staff! Excellent process from beginning to end! Loved by results!

December 23 came to pick up order, and they were out of an item that we really needed! Ordered one week ago- their sausage bread- and they didn't make enough! I love the rolls, but am now looking for a bakery closer to where I live in Middletown!

Jeff and his squad were great from the moment he came out to inspect the house we were in the process of buying.  We did not have a survey, but Jeff had almost an exact idea of the lines without it.  He was able to get out there 2 days after closing and finish it in 2 days.  The fence was made with excellent wood and the doors were the best doors on a fence I have ever seen.

I moved to Florida knowing I would need a good fence for my kids and dogs.  When we were purchasing this home I knew it was going to be on me to make sure I went through the right company as this lot was missing fence in a big area.  The fence is great and I could not be happier.

The price was better than I even thought.  This told me that Jeff runs his business with integrity.  Would do business again for anything needed.  I plan to refer him and their team to everyone I know.

After hearing about the Franklin Fountain online, the fat kid in me was extremely excited to try a scoop of one of their "amazing" ice creams. So much for having a "long list" of ice creams! It was a short list of flavors you'd pretty much find anywhere else. I ordered a scoop of their pistachio ice cream and it was fairly standard. Perhaps it's the jaded New Yorker in me- being spoiled by the likes of Van Leeuwen, Big Gay Ice Cream, Morgenstern's, etc. but it was extremely underwhelming. 
It did begin to pour while we were on line and I managed to get the only table available indoors. Unfortunately, the quaint and retro ambiance of the Franklin Fountain was pretty much ruined by their employees. Apparently they were conducting interviews for new employees and had set up a table right next to mine. After about 15 minutes of listening to their inane conversations (making fun the applicants, etc.), my boyfriend and I couldn't take it anymore and walked out into the rainstorm just to get away from them. I may decide to visit Philly again... But I'm definitely not coming back here.

I rarely write reviews but will say I've been very happy with Power. If you can look past the sales experience which tends to be a bit too pushy, the rest of the work is top notch. 

The Quality of the windows are outstanding. The first experience was to replace a very large sliding glass door and it has to be the best I've ever had. The seals are strong, the window has held up so well in the last 5 years. The project manager was great and the crew was fast and efficient. Since then I called them to replace bedrooms windows and today bathroom windows. Each time great experience

Back to the sales process: Yes they can be pushy but I set expectations early on. The more you push back however the better the discounts.

I've tried this location and the one in Whole Foods. This last time (from the Whole Foods) is why I've finally decided to complain. 

I thought it was a fluke with our first order, but both times now the food was extra special salty!!!!! From the Whole Foods location we ordered the whole (small) chicken with salad (maybe 2 cups), hummus (2 cups), and pita (6 of them). The chicken was extremely salty and the sad excuse of a salad was even worse. 

Not only was the salad salty, but it was also ridiculously small. It comes in the same size container as their hummus and it's pineapple, cucumber, spices, and some other various things. I'm not sure how that is supposed to feed an entire family???  There's barely 2 cups worth of salad in the container. What!?!?! That's not a salad for a family, that's barely a snack for an individual!

The only good things about this meal - the hummus was ok...salty again, but more edible than the salad or chicken. You get 6 pitas...although, they aren't outstanding pitas and not really worth eating.  

For $36 plus tax, this wasn't worth the price. Throw on top of it that it was barely edible because of the salt content, and I'd say it was pretty much worthless! Dizengoff, you should cut back on your salt for all of your dishes. Then maybe we could actually taste your food. 

We are extremely disappointed and will never eat there again.

What a pleasant surprise.  This restaurant has had many owners over the past 5 years and they were all lousy!   Plus they didn't update the inside.  While you can't eat tables, chairs, paint and light fixtures, it sure helps your appetite to eat in a place that is freshly decorated.   Our meals came out quick, hot and delicious.  The server was kind and efficient.  Most people ordered fancy Thai drinks but I brought my own gin and tonic so remember it's BYOB.  They seemed to be doing a nice takeout business too.  At 7 pm they were nearly half full.  We didn't need reservations but as word gets out who knows?    We can walk there so we are excited to have a neighborhood Thai restaurant that is inviting and that serves excellent food at a reasonable price.

QuikPrint did a great job printing our wedding invites. I used their online form to send a request, and they responded faster than I expected. They sent me a quote for several types of paper so we could choose what fit our needs best. They even called after printing the first page because they noticed the graphic designer made the fonts different colors, and they wanted to be sure we were ok with that. They were able to print our invites and RSVP cards and address our envelopes for much cheaper than was quoted on websites like minted. Great service!

This has been our go-to restaurant for +5 years. However, the food and service at Treno have been deteriorating over the past two years. Menus are torn and stained. Wait staff are pleasant but not adequately trained. The Treno cheese board has devolved from interesting choices of cheeses  and charcuterie to something that looks like leftover bits from last night's party. The sauces are all the same whether its bolognese, mussels or pizza. It was hard to find any short rib in the Short Rib Bolognese.  On the upside, pizzas are still pretty good. However, if you're primarily interested in pizza, there are better choices on Haddon Ave. I really hope they pull it together at Treno. I miss the old place.

I love this place. Obviously the large and frequently changing beer choices are the primary draw, but the food is equally outstanding. I have had many different items on the menu, but I always start with the calamari. My new current favorite dish is the cauliflower risotto. It's the perfect location for a late-night dinner.

I am a guy. I was a little hesitant to go get my eyebrows done despite their unruliness. Also, I had doubts that my eyebrows would turn out too thin, which would look awful on a guy. Nevertheless, I went in and she did an awesome job! My eyebrows are so much cleaner and they still look masculine! The lady is also super nice. Definitely recommend!

Superb place in South Tampa. Lunch was great at Edison's. Staff was kind, knowledgeable and fast. The menu is innovative and its just a fun place to go to. The food is modern with creative twists on usual American food. I had the club sandwich, and what made it unique was the egg dripping though the sandwich, very tasty and extra protein! Bacon was excellent and they put chicken instead turkey, the chicken was of good quality and plenty of quantity.  Looking forward to future ventures.

Olive Garden! Another chain restaurant, but this location in Reno does it right. If you're looking for breadsticks, salad, soup, wine, or pasta look no further. The service here is always great and it's one of the reasons I don't mind coming here. The server I had was named Jacob and he made sure that me and my friends were taken care of with excellent service. He is super friendly and I've never had any problems with the staff at this location. 

The last time I came here the food was delicious, but it's usually hit or miss at Olive Garden. If you're craving pasta look no further. Especially if it's during their endless pasta bowls!

Really friendly staff and great food. Best ranch dressing I've ever had. Definitely get the hot chicken bites with extra ranch on the side, you won't regret it. Lots of drink options- they even have Tito's on tap...

Went in for dinner and never had a problem before.   Tonight is my last visit.  They put the wrong name on my order and after 25 min i asked where my food was.  They were calling the wrong name and my food had been sitting out.  When i said i wanted it prepared again, i watched him nuke one of my plates.  This was totally unacceptable.  I got a refund and left to never return
Came out on time and took care of my clogged line and fixed a toilet that was leaking. Very personable! Highly recommend

Had a lovely dinner at Arpeggio.  The atmosphere is nice and, though I thought it would be noisy, it was no problem conversing.  We had a special appetizer of artichoke heart filled with seafood which was like an artichoke with a crab cake inside.  Very yummy.  We also split the Mediterranean appetizer and ate way more than we meant to because it was SO good!  So happy they have the app that allowed us to look at the wait and get on the wait list before we left the house.  We walked in and waited about a minute or two before we were lead to the table.  The fact that there were no reservations used to make me shy away from going there but not anymore!!

If i had to sum this place up in one word it would be...AMAZING! From the location, the atmosphere, the service and even the other patrons are all on point! I love food and trying different things and places. The Lark was the most amazing dining experience I have ever had. The food was so good, it was hard to decide what to get and even harder to stop eating, I had to unbutton my pants before we left!

My husband and I live in  the apartment complex across from Corner Pub & Grill, so it is usually our go to restaurant if I don't feel like cooking or we want to watch part of a sporting game. Normally if we go on a Friday or Saturday night there is a wait. However the wait never seems as long as they said.  When we do have a wait we hang out in the bar section, We have always had friendly people wait on us.  The food comes out quick. The food is your typical pub, sports bar food. My husband and I enjoy having this restaurant in walking distance to our home. I know we will be back!

Tampa, FL: Last night I enjoyed a good meal at Ulele. Was it the best meal I've ever had? No. Did I enjoy the meal? Yes. Will I recommend the place? Probably.

We called to make a reservation for two yesterday. We were told we didn't need reservations but if we wanted to make a reservation, the only openings were at 7:00 pm and 8:45 pm. We took the 8:45 pm. We ended up finishing our tasks early and got to the restaurant at 7:45 pm. We were chastised - not joking - by the guy at the front, who told us we had arrived too early. We told him we understood and after calming down, the employee told us we could sit at the bar and sit get served food.

After a rude introduction, I enjoyed sitting at the bar. Our bartender/server, unlike the man at the front, was very sweet and extremely attentive - my water glass was never empty the entire meal. Though I didn't drink last night, I also enjoyed the look and energy of the bar, including the unique cocktails the bartenders concocted.

I ordered the Florida Pompano, complete with a creamy tomato sauce, fried carrot ribbons, mashed potatoes, and green beans. As an occasional pescatarian, eating meat is quite heavy on my stomach. That didn't stop me from scarfing down half of the pompano filet last night - the sauce was INCREDIBLE and everything, even the carrot ribbons, worked well together. Though I'd prefer a better presentation - having the carrots piled on one side of the plate wasn't particularly appealing visually - I didn't have any complaints about the taste and creativity of the entree.

I ended the meal with a slice of guava pie. The presentation was lovely, and the taste decent. I didn't mind the dessert ultimately, but I'm not going to be clambering to find another slice.

Ultimately, I liked this place. While I didn't care for the look of the place - it was a bit busy - the location off the park was unique and lovely. I didn't appreciate the employee at the front, and I think the price was a bit high for what I got. The creativity was refreshing though and I wouldn't hesitate to send people to Ulele. It's a "must try" restaurant at least once.

Nothing like having your dishwasher stop draining with a houseful of family visiting for the holidays! After discovering my regular appliance repair folk had retired off to Oregon, I frantically started calling friends and using YELP for appliance referrals in my area (North Shore: Incline Village, Lake Tahoe). When the phone rang and I heard Victor's calm, reassuring voice on the other end, I felt like it was a holiday miracle, and it was. He was on his way to Tahoe City and said he could swing by our house first. He even let my husband know what to check for (hose wise) for a blockage that might be the culprit. When he finally arrived the job was completed with 45 minutes and the culprit was a shard of piece of glass stuck in the pump. Everyone I had called couldn't come for a week, and they wanted well over $100 just for the service call and evaluation. Victor charged $75 for the service call and it went towards all his labor. Final bill: $135. Victor, what can we say . . .  you were definitely our holiday hero! If you are ever in need do not hesitate to call on Victor. Young, handsome, polite & professional! 
~ Carole & Terry Bernardi; Incline Village

If I could give less than one star I would. The employee working could care less that I was a customer. The store had just opened and the employee literally ignored me and I was not served until I asked if there was anyone working behind the sandwich bar. If I had not said anything to the employee who knows how much longer I would of had to wait until the employee finally went into the sandwich area to rudely took my order.
If you're looking for a decent sandwich and customer service this is not the place.

We came here on a recent visit to Nola, we came upon it wandering around after riding the streetcar. And what a gem we found! This is one of the best restaurants I have ever eaten at in Nola. I did not realize at the time but it's listed as one of the top 50 restaurants in America. I can see why. The outside of the restaurant is what caught our attention. Tables outside, beautiful top balcony with very nice plants. We were seated at a cozy table inside and were immediately greeted by our phenomenal server Rene. Impeccable service from start to finish. He helped us pick out a great bottle of wine from their very extensive wine menu, which was at least 7 pages! We were overwhelmed by all the choices. We enjoyed a bottle of Bordeaux called    Diem. They have wines from all over the world here. I never seen a wine list quite like this one. The menu is just as amazing. Unique selections. For starters we shared a seasonal green salad that had feta, cucumbers, croutons and the most delicious buttermilk scallion dressing. Excellent! We loved the flavor combinations. We also shared a small plate of the beef short rib. Fall off the bone tender, with a wonderful salsa verde and horseradish cream sauce. For the main entrees we ordered the crispy goat which came with curried cauliflower, black beans and yogurt. It was presented in a large bowl. It was delicious! Similar to a curry but had large tender pieces of goat. Wonderful flavors and the perfect blend of spices. Incredible choice. My entree was a grilled Zabuton steak with French fries. The steak was cooked a perfect medium rare. Beautifully marbled cut of meat. Tender and perfect. The fries were served with a nice sauce as well. We loved this place so much. We passed on dessert because we were so full. The ambiance, food, and service were simply phenomenal. The prices are very fair and not overpriced. Highly recommend eating here.

I feel like not many people know about Bazille located inside the Nordstrom at International Plaza, but if you venture in there at any lunch hour you will see it's packed.  They do take reservations if you are on a time crunch, otherwise they do a good job of getting people in and out but there may be a small wait.

Food options are a variety of salads, sandwiches, and even some wood oven pizzas.  Bread for the table is available but on request.  The salad I had was plentiful for a lunch portion and was very fresh.  If you're in the mood for something non-chain when at the mall, this would definitely be a good option.

Not bad mole, but could have used more spice to it.  I prefer the mole over at Oasis personally.  The salsa was very good, as were the rice and black beans.  

Some of my family rave about the wet burrito, and it did look good.  Perhaps I'll try that next time.  

Staff was able to take care of our humongous group without any issue, and I appreciate that they have a separate room that they can use for large groups.

This BYOB was super accommodating for what we were looking for.  I'd be interesting in trying more of their menu.

The transaction was perfect.  Easy to schedule.  Pricing was very clear and reasonable.  He installed a particularly heavy and complicated flat screen wall mount and ensured everything was level and secure.  
I recommend Rittenhouse Handyman with 5+ stars.

Did price comparisons and gave Mavis a call and told them what I found. They beat the price on all the other local places including Creamery. They did point out my brakes needed replacing in the back, but I do it myself. They were correct that they were bad and did not try to point out any fake repairs that were not needed. The Toyota dealer has done this multiple times.

Enjoyed a great brunch here on a Saturday with a friend of mine. We arrived around 9:30 AM and the dining room was full. There was a decent overflow of people waiting and I anticipated a much longer wait time than what we experienced which was about 20 minutes. This gave us time to engage in some observation of the clientele as well as the delicious breakfast items being pushed out by the kitchen. 

I loved the decor, clean, modern and welcoming! 
The breakfast menu can satisfy from savory to sweet. My friend and I shared a cinnamon roll before our main dish arrived. She had the eggs Benedict and I had a wonderful has. The food was seasoned really well, came out hot, and was ample in size for our post yoga consumption, I had to take some of my hash home. 

Overall I am for sure a fan of this place and look forward to dining on the patio when the weather is a bit warmer! 

My only criticism is for a refill of coffee they charge you .75 cents.  I don't know enough about the quality of coffee they serve but I can't imagine it's so extraordinary that you'll need to charge customers extra for a refill. Was just a tad put off by this!

been here several times.. but today was my first time trying their signature braised beef noodle soup (红烧牛肉面) it was out of this world!  not only did it really hit the spot for me! but it was definitely my favorite beef noodle bowl so far!  i ordered it on a whim actually lol wanting to try something different.. and it was one of the items on top of the menu, so it must be good right? 

when they served it, i had no idea it was going to be spicy! all the red peppers in the bowl were pretty intimidating.. i started to sweat just from seeing the red peppers and red chili oil everywhere o-o.  luckily, the heat was very manageable! (thank god) i tend to look like i'm crying when the spice level is off the radar so i didn't want to make a scene at one of my regular lunch spots lol

but yes i do recommend trying this! the beef was yummy with the slow cooked radish.  there was plenty of noodles in my bowl.  it took quite the effort for me to finish my lunch today. i was holding my belly walking out nan zhou...  so all in all, lunch-- well served! can't wait to return for another round!

The service was ok, customer service not so much. There was a fly in my son's eggs so they replaced them. Then there was something disgusting all over in the bowl my daughter's fruit came in. The manager was not even a little helpful and looked surprised when I told him how unacceptable it was to have 2 sanitary issues in a single visit. I will never return to this nasty place!

Excellent food, quality is always consistent (and we visit regularly). Atmosphere is a mix of upscale and casual, it's cozy and intimate - you can have an easy conversation without being drowned out. Customer service is excellent!! We brought family here when they visited from out of town and they loved it, too. Our favorite place to have dinner and a drink.

Culinary dropout is another Home run for the fox restaurant group.  As usual they execute their food well, with whimsical ideas such as the cheap beer in a bag and the miscellaneous shot bucket.  The atmosphere is pleasant and bright with a good service staff and fun game ideas like bag toss and ping pong.  Strongly recommend.

I've been getting Brazilian waxes for 5 years now, at several different locations, and this was hands down the best experience I've had. Ivana uses hard wax, which I was nervous about after a horrible experience at another location, but she reassured me and it turned out to be almost painless! It was quick and clean--no stickiness or any little hairs left behind like wax strips. She even helped rid of some of the ingrown hairs that I was really embarrassed about, and gave me several tips to prevent any future ones. Maybe a little TMI there, but that really meant a lot of me. I'm sad I didn't find this place sooner! I'll be back for sure.

Ok, so I'm super sad to say I didn't get to go through the actual museum part and I am really bummed that I didn't.
The company I work for had an event there, and the food and drinks were mediocre but the VIEW. It was ridiculously amazing. As you're eating the stage in front of you backs up to full glass windows from the length of the floor to the ceiling and what is on the other side of the windows in clear view, the beautiful lit up batman building (ATT building).  It's gorgeous. Great cameo pics.  So let's discuss the food, it seemed to be all high ticket items, like steak and the normal nice steak house sides, potatoes, etc. Nothing tasted that great. It was really bland and it wasn't necessarily HOT coming to us straight out of the oven. I wasn't impressed.  The drinks, I stuck with wine and I feel like they tasted skimpy on the pour for the price and a touch watered-down. I know, how is that even possible?  I love that you can walk here while you're inside the OMNI hotel. Perfect!! The band that was playing was pretty good and they played a variety of music, which was another perk to the night.

I would recommend this clinic to anyone. They have taken such amazing care of our pup the couple of times she's had to go in. Dr. Harris is wonderful. She takes the time to talk to us and explain her findings thoroughly and thoughtfully. I know our girl is in incredible hands when I have had to bring her in.

This review is a long time coming.
I began using Campbell Coin Laundry in late 2015. At the time I lived in Oro Valley and the closest laundromat to me was in Catalina. After experiencing several unacceptable issues with that laundromat I found Campbell Coin.
Right away I knew this was an exceptional place to do my weekly laundry. Upon walking in the attendant, Theresa, welcomed me and made me feel right at home. Customer service with a genuine smile and gratitude for her customers is what I appreciated right away.
The laundry itself is large, very clean, newer (some brand new) washers and dryers, a sweet little seating area where you can read a magazine, watch TV, or surf the web with their free WiFi. The prices are fair, not too expensive, and when I tell you that those dryers are brilliant I mean BRILLIANT! My clothes are dry in 27 minutes or less!
Since I began using Campbell Coin I've moved into midtown Tucson, and even though there are closer laundromats to my house for me to use, I keep coming back here because I honestly believe this establishment to be the best in Tucson!
Do yourself a favor and eat this food.  They also deliver.  I use to order delivery once a week, and it never disappoints.  The sandwiches are big enough to share and prices are extremely reasonable.
Delectable açaí bowls/pita and wonderful staff. Ambience was quaint and clean; only downside was lengthy wait time for food.

Always a dream to work with! The service team at Porsche are the best of the best and so professional and kind!  I trust getting my car serviced therre, not only that they will repair it perfectly but honestly as well. I highly recommend using them! Also- they detail your car for you so it's even prettier when you pick it up!

I am a bit harsh on how I review being from a family of chefs. The food was good but we both got whole fish which is hard to show creativity. I expect the rest of the food on the menu would be good based on the olive relish and the other condiments on the plates. 
The wait staff was so-so but the front of house is the hardest to get right in a new restaurant. But I will have to say I was looking at the kitchen the entire night which for me is how you can see if a restaurant is going to be good. The kitchen staff is well oiled and the head chef gets the food plated expertly. He obviously knows how to run a kitchen.
I don't think they are at the top of their game yet but I think they are worth the visit and will be great within a short time.

Unsurprising to anyone, Goldie is a great spot. I appreciate a falafel place with few choices, and the sandwiches come fully loaded unless you say otherwise -- when I don't feel like doing my own toppings combo, this is perfect.

As you probably figured out, Goldie is from the same people as Zahav, with great falafel/everything as a result. When you're ordering, there are only a few choices (plus a couple on an "off-menu" board, for a change of pace) -- for falafel sandwich, you choose the flavor of falafel (plain, harissa, amba, or shug, I tend to get harissa because I forget what the others are). Fries are a cool $3 but super tasty ... you can probably share an order (small bag) with someone if you're like me, but I can also clear a bag myself pretty easily.

Tahini shakes are so great but I have to have room for it -- so rich! In general though, I love that they're on the limited menu, and I love that coming to Goldie is uncomplicated. There're places to sit down and eat in (with a pretty nice atmosphere for a sandwich shop), and in the warmer season, it's great to pick up and walk to Rittenhouse with your food. Thanks for being so great Goldie!

"Oh my God, we're so happy for you!!"

This is what they said to us when we decided to order the December pie for dessert... and they genuinely meant it.  They were actually happy that our night was about to be made SO much better by ordering this pie.

In short, Love & Honey is true to their name.  Delicious food served with a lot of love, and some honey.

The fried chicken was outrageously good.  Crisp, well seasoned skin, and moist on the inside.  The cornbread was superb as well.  And the pie, well I already covered that but it was gone so fast that there was no time for a picture.

Best fried chicken in Philly hands down.
A go to for pizza and pasta - and their delivery is by far the most reliable and fastest I've ever had. Highly recommend

I find Jersey Mike's Subs to be the best sub shop!  The meat is quality, and when you say "extra oil and vinegar " they aren't afraid to load it up!!  My husband likes the Philly cheesesteak but as you can see he smuggled in the cheez whiz.  

12/16/17--My experience at the Jersey Mike's on Virginia was 5 stars as always!  Best sub shop in Reno!  I ordered the #7 regular which is turkey and provolone.  Mike's Way with mayo and extra oil and vinegar !  Customer service is great and you are greeted with a smile.   For those of you that don't know, there is a Jersey Mike's on south meadows and also in sparks.  Haven't tried those locations yet, but I think it's great we have 3 locations here in Reno/Sparks now!

This place is good so don't let the old style decor confuse you. The food was good but I only got pad thai so it is hard to compare that to other local places. The pro is that this place is hardly ever busy and it is close by.

'Welcome to Moe's".  Welcome to fresh... they pack burritos and wrap in traditional tin foil to keep that tortilla soft and supple. Homewrecker is a Joey with Guac.... freshly made, as are the bottomless chips and salsa bar. My favorite is the tomatilla salsa. Welcome to Zionsville Moe's!!!

all of the Drs. are great. Very compassionate. I agree with the other review, the rest of staff must need paid more, or we need to be friendlier to them maybe? If you need to get a return call about anything they are not very good at returning calls. I still will stay here over any where else. I am a pain sufferer for 20 yrs. I've have been a lot of other places and I'm staying.

My boyfriend and I moved to Indy about 6 months ago. It was time for him to get a check up and so he picked somewhere that accepts his insurance, had decent reviews on google and was close to work. He returned very happy with his care and a new patient goody bag! I unfortunately broke my permanent retainer from braces. I searched around close to home, but at the end of the day nothing beats a great review from another patient! The 25 minutes drive was way worth it. They were able to get me in quickly. I knew I was in the right place when the new patient paperwork asked about barriers to care such as time, money, etc. It was a sign that Kingseed Family Dental viewed us as humans with lives and priorities instead of numbers. I had Dr. Ebisinde Akah as my dentist. She gave me more than one option to solve the broken retainer dilemma and even asked if I had enough time that day or needed a second appointment (as a grad student, I wrote time and money as my barriers). Lindsey Davis, EFDA was also a part of my care team. Both women were incredibly friendly and considerate! When I came back to get my new night retainer fitted it was great but not perfect. They sent me home with the great one while making me a perfect one at no charge!  I'm excited to make Kingseed Family Dental my dentist for as long as I'm in Indianapolis Area!

P.S. there are lots of tvs, even one to keep you occupied when laying all the way back in the dental chair. Big perk!
Standard Mexican food. Everything covered in cheese with rice and beans on the side. I've been here once and won't go back. There are too many great places in the area.
Our quick lunch was great! We ordered the sourdough biscuits with crab fat butter, pomme frittes, pork belly crostini, and blood sausage. It was all delicious and the service was great.

Update: 
Sips now has happy hour which makes it much more affordable. From 4:00-6:00 they have $4 wines and bogo beers. Plus, the trivia on Tuesdays is super fun. 

Original post:
Really loved the staff, atmosphere, and concept but way too expensive in my opinion. I got a few "sips" to make my own wine flight and each one was several dollars - making it $20 just for a few sips of wine! I would definitely come back if they had happy hour deals or cheaper wine choices, as the wine and food were very good. Safety Harbor needs a place like this, but not with these prices.

This is the place if you're in a group or if you prefer a night with someone special, it's perfect. I love the food, the atmosphere, the location, & best of all the great service... you can choose to be seated, or have your meal at the bar. The oyster bar is fun & the best raw oysters around. Then, at the cocktail bar you can have your drinks along with your meal, all the while recieving the best service. Whether you chose the bar location or table the staff are surpurb. Every meal has been excellent on each visit. We won't miss an opportunity to have a wonderful night when in New Orleans. It's a must try. You won't regret it.

Hands down one of my favorite stadiums, I could be a bit biased. But now with the 150 million in renovations it just justifies it! They have two huge jumbotron screens that enables you to watch the games from anywhere in the stadium. Perfect to not miss a snap while going in the beer run. 

Beside football games I had the privilege of doing a Spartan race here it was amazing!

Yet again....why do I keep returning to this location? I should have learned my lesson from my previous experience on the wipers?! 
Well I was charged $7.75 for two light bulbs not an issue as I was getting other work done here at the same time.  However I was charged a WHOPPING $56.00 BLOODY DOLLARS IN LABOR!?????
I could have done them myself, one was a license plate? WTF! If you go to Mr. Lube they change them for FREE, even if you don't get your oil changed!
Called to complain, Service Manager gave my husband a snarky attitude.
First time in DuBu and it was a success. Will be back again with my vegetarian friends, large variety of delicious dishes with tofu and vegetables. Squid fried rice was a winner for us!

Great place to eat! We had lunch here and enjoyed several craft beers during our stay. Amazing food and service! Sit on the patio and enjoy a breathtaking view of the Catalina mountains. You may even find yourself enjoying wine and calling it your very own Catalina wine mixer! I would totally eat here again.

The space is small but nice and relaxing.  The mani's and pedi's are fairly good but seem disproportionately expensive for what they are.  They don't have massage chairs, you sit perched on a bench for the pedi's and at a somewhat regular desk for mani's.  Given how expensive their services are, all of the add-on prices seem even more outrageous.  The standard nail polish isn't great.  For some reason it seems like it doesn't dry all of the way, even if you sit patiently for over 30 minutes.  The free mini polish with some of the pedi's is a nice touch and frankly almost necessary given how odd the polish is.  The tecs are very nice but the prices are out of touch for this area.
Every time I go I'm amazed at how good the food is.  Particularly love going for Brunch.  Quick service and friendly staff.

This is one of the worst stores that I have ever purchased from.  I purchased a large order from them and after I came back to my office I realized that I had to exchange one of the desks for a smaller one to fit into the office.  I called the store in Conshohocken where I just made the purchase and found out that there is no way to get through to the store.  Since I did not know the extension number for the sales person I dealt with it said that I can dial by name by putting the first three letter of the first name.  I did and the message I got is that there is no such person in this store.   Calling their customer service call center I was on hold for 45 minutes before a person picked up the phone and advised me that he could not help me as he only deals with purchases online.  I asked him if he could transfer me to the store and his comment was that they really don't like that and that I should just go back to the store to make the exchange.  He said that he will transfer me, he pushed some button did not have the courtesy to wait to see if the transfer sent through and an error message came up that the transfer could not go through.  I now have to go back to the store which is a gross inconvenient since I am far away from that store.  This was my first and now the last purchase I will ever make from this store.  They have no services after the sale.  Amazon is where I will continue to go to as they don't have any of this nonsense.

I've received 2 tattoos from this tattoo parlor & it's always a fun, painfree, & pleasant experience.
Highest Quality artwork done professionally & enjoyable.

Holy smoking butts has smoked turkey legs. I was so happy to see this option. I ordered, waited (it takes a little time) and then enjoyed a perfect smoked turkey leg. The price was right too. I've been back not three times for the same experience. It's a solid four and... I agree that this is the best BBQ in the area.

WB Pizza 

A friend told me the WB Pizza offered a ton of vegan options! 

Located close to the broad ripple area, I finically had a chance to try their pizza. 

From the outside you may be a little skeptical in which it is located in a small strip mall near a liquor store and not much else. 

WB pizza is a local business and has been around for a good amount of time, since 1999. It's always great to support locally run businesses. It is a small restaurant, but has plenty of tables to accommodate big groups if needed. 

Their menu has so many options, including vegan cheese and newly added vegan "meats". They also have a large selection of beer for all of the beer lovers out there. 

We ordered the breadsticks with some of their garlic butter which is vegan and cheese (non vegan) for the others at the table. 

The breadsticks were to die for. Honestly they were my favorite, even compared to the pizza. They were warm, small in size, with a slight crisp, and baked just right. 
(See pictured below).

The pizza we had was "the vegan" with no cheese. However they do offer vegan cheese for an upcharge. We also ordered another speciality pizza that had meat and cheese, which I can't speak of since I don't eat those things. 

I was impressed with the pizza and the amount of veggies on top but I wish the actual base of the pizza would have been cooked more because it was a very flimsy pizza. I would have preferred a little more spice of some sort. I liked the taste, but was disappointed when the check came out...

Two pizzas (12'') and breadsticks, a piece of vegan chocolate cake for almost 80 dollars, not including a tip. Now that is ridiculous!! 

I do have to admit that the vegan chocolate cake really made up for the cost because the cake was AMAZING! I mean it too! It was moist, light, and the frosting was delicious. This came close to being my favorite over the breadsticks. 

The trick is to make your own pizza and add few toppings that you want because the speciality pizzas DON'T state their price on the menu and have a lot of toppings on them which are totaled to the same price as a custom pizza. I get that the ingredients are fresh and everything is homemade, but pizza ingredients aren't that expensive and I know this because I have made my own many times at home. 

If you want to support a local business and want fresh cooked pizza at a high price, visit WB Pizza. 

I am unsure if I will return due to the shock I was in with the cost of the pizza mainly due to the fact that the menu is very misleading. I would definitely return for vegan desserts and breadsticks though!!!

Cool riverside park walk along the park and river. This Hillsborough River flow along the location make the strolling or jogging very desirable. The scenery ever changes along the river make this prime location. The house along the park has clear view toward the river and the park. 

We were here because live orchestra music in the park. Because it close to holiday, they play the Christmas and holiday music. Very pleasant. The park also is a home for canoeing and rolling boat area. There was boat parade when we visited the park. Children are roaming like not limit. 

There plenty tree cover for open air concert. The gazebo serve as a stage for the presentation. Love the Santa make available to the kid and old kid like me. It was great to see old friends from Yelp in a surprise meeting in the park.

Stopped in on the way back from Trenton. Excellent food and I was very pleasantly surprised. The menu was quite large and diverse, but everyone in my party of 4 was very happy with their selections. They also had a special menu which was unique and looked quite tasty. We had some non-alcoholic drinks and soups off of that. Try the hot cocoa!!

The waitress was knowledgable about gluten free options and gf bread was listed on the menu (though gf options were not).

Think of this as a much nicer and tastier diner. If I'm ever in the area again, I'll certainly be back.
First time. Burger good. Not overwhelming. Everything alacarte..thus pricey. Had a vanilla shake it was very good.  Was not impressed with the staff.

This is BY FAR my FAVORITE nail salon. A hidden gem. Nathan and his wife do the BEST work. The staff are amazing. They also have kids chairs for children to get mani and pedi, very reasonably priced. I highly recommend them. Very very clean, great parking, and spacious.
Attend New Orleans Bourbon Street twice in a 60 day span. First for the Sugar Bowl then Mardi Gras. Hands down the best club there. Great atmosphere and the energy is non stop. A must go!

I have only been here twice so far but I absolutely love this place. First time I came in I got a few tacos (wanted to try the steak, chicken, and chorizo) and all were perfectly delicious. This last time I went in I got another chorizo taco and I tried the carne asada torta which I was also very pleased with. It was about double the size of the torta's I have tried in the past, which I will admit has only been a couple, but I couldn't even finish it (which while I hate wasting food this is better than not getting enough). Everyone is always friendly and there are so many other items on their menu I would like to try and plan on making this is a regular place I eat at when visiting Reno.

Our family went to Port of Call in NOLA today. It is a small restaurant, so don't go at noon unless you have extra time on your hands. We waited a while, but it was worth it. We all loved our delicious burgers. The patty was thick and tasty! Not to mention, $10.50 is a reasonable price for a burger and baked potato!

This new coffee shop opened in early December of 2017 in place of the former Lighthouse coffee. They still serve the delicious lighthouse brand coffee, they have updated the space with beautiful new furniture. They have pastries, quiches, cookies and delicious chocolates that they make themselves, called the Carnevale Confections. They are so good! Once you try one.... :)

I can't believe how many breakdowns dealing with the vehicle delivery. Worked out the deal on Sat., 12/23, had agreement with Finance and Sales teams to fax signed purchase agreement to my lending source (preapproved).  Had a tight window for a Tuesday delivery but was assured they could get it done. Dealership told me that I could take car home Sat. but I told them I wanted to have my final terms and  contract completed from my credit union before taking car.   

12/26/17 - I began making calls to dealership to push paperwork and call my credit union to close the loop.  Spoke with my sales rep around 3:30p to provide loan contact and tracking # for car funds, was assured we could take delivery of car. No word from dealer so called by around 6p.  After refusing to get off of the phone, finally spoke to Finance leadership who made executive decision. Had the unfortunate experience of speaking with sales mgr David B. who refused to show any concern about Dimmit's many failure. At one point he told me come get the car or not, he would just sell it to someone else - GREAT CUSTOMER EXPERIENCE Dave. Can't believe that Dave would tell any customer this unless this is the  CULTURE of the Dimmit brand. Maybe your experience is different but this was by far my worst car buying experience.  Dave stayed true and represented the "used car salesman" appropriately, too bad he represents a brand that had a good reputation

I used to go here often, but it's been a while. Their pizza is horrible in every way. Soft soggy crust, no toppings, very little sauce, in a word disgusting. It's back to Blind Onion for me. WHAT HAPPENED TO THIS PLACE?????

Shockingly delicious. Vegan only. Pricing is a bit on the higher end especially since there is 0 protein BUT portions are generous and the quality is superb. We went for brunch. The cubano was awesome and flavorful with a healthy portion of breakfast potatoes. It always stuns me how well their chicken substitute is. It looks and tastes like chicken... go figure. I had the huevos rancheros which were two large portions with guac -- major key. We also did coffee and one of their salads. Food was super dope. Similar to a true European restaurant you pay for still and sparkling water unless you say you want tap. Ambiance is great too. Small, nice bar area, takeout window is cute, music is nice. Might be a good date spot. Would definitely go again.

Generally I am a fan of chipotle and almost always order online for pickup. Unfortunately this location is proving not to be very reliable for a quick pick up. I have twice ordered for pick up and they have not even started the order when I arrive to pick it up.

This place is terrible. This crawfish is soooooo tiny, the flavor is just too salty, the Worst. The shrimp taste like dead meat not fresh like all. This ruined the impression the New Orleans seafood. But 7.99 one, you pay want  you get.

The service here is hands down one of the best in my experience. they are very attentive to my car and my needs. I've never had an issue and I don't feel pressured to try and buy a car every time I come here.

First time using Bob Frank plumbing and I was very pleased.  We had a toilet with a leak by valve and needed new insides.  Came quickly (same day) to make the repair and I felt the price was reasonable. I will defend nicely use them again.

I heard good things about this restaurant from a friend and have been wanting to try it out for years.  We finally did tonight and it did not disappoint. The food was excellent!  We loved everything from the chips and salsa to the margaritas to the fajitas, quesadillas and enchiladas. The service is top notch as well - friendly, helpful, polite and fast.  The entire crew at this restaurant is doing it right. I think we may have found our new favorite Mexican restaurant.  We will be back.  If you've never been, you should go.
Crabmeat Raigotte was great. History was refreshing and traditional New Orleans. Food was ok.

The restaurant owner is arguably the most inconsiderate person I have interacted with at Reading Terminal since moving here 2.5 years ago and going dozens of times to the market. For starters, he charges way too much for his food ($16.71 for the plate in the picture) but that isn't what led me here. He lacks decency. He gave me a salad container that was practically quarter filled only (how it looks in the picture is how I got it), and didn't even explain if he ran out or what the reason was. He just covered the container and handed it to me. I then sat at the place's counter top that has a few high chairs to sit at. He decided he wants to clean the area so he does so while I'm eating and pretty much works around me while giving me "are you done with your food" looks. Instead of taking my plate and throwing it away in the trash right behind the counter he points me to a trash in the corner away from the restaurant to throw my plate away in. I would give 0 stars if I could. 

He just lost a customer :)
Brunch.  Very pleased with their brunch. Completely surprised by the options of food from meal to deserts. Mimosa's are all you can drink(if you choose to). The ambiance is even better.
Best Indian food in town. My favorite is the lamb korma. The kale appetizer is another great dish. You won't be disappointed when visiting!

Dropped in during the week of thanksgiving 17' and felt right at home with the 7a. Olivia, Jay and Tony are all knowledgeable personable and easy to jive with coaches. Coming from Colorado, even a "cooler" week the box was humid and warm with the garage doors open but makes for a true CF experience. 
The training floor itself is very open with plenty of areas to do various movements without bumping into another mate. The equipment was in rougher shape compared to other boxes but the humidity and weather take a toll on metal equipment. 
Overall, this box has an awesome community feel with a wide variety of class offerings throughout the day. Plus the location is easy to reach from all over St. Pete 
Thanks for a fun drop-in week and the Burg Crossfit tee to rep in Colorado!!
This is probably one of the wrost meals followed by bad service I may have ever had. You guys can't make a Cobb salad or kids Mac n cheese taste good. Need new management.

Honest, thorough, courteous, and knowledgeable. These guys are THE go-to place for plumbing in the Tampa Bay area! Matt took great care of me from when he first arrived to my place. He patiently examined and explained everything and even went the extra mile by answering other general plumbing questions/concerns I had. Matt was kind, professional, and didn't unnecessarily recommend things just to make more money (he even left me with some tools to help identify/fix the issue I was having with my sink drain in case it happened again). Overall, I highly recommend Matt at Matt's Plumbing Services!
I give 3 stars cause the good service,otherwise 2 Is not traditional Korean food,very plain side dishes,I prefer Bando korean even if is a little more expensive ,

This place was excellent.  Food, service and did I say "Food".  Not just one thing, but everything was great.  Food cooked well and seasoned so that you really didn't need any tartar or cocktail sauce.  Not greasy even though it was fried and delicious.

Came for high tea (which is available any day of the week, just book ahead!). Was immediately welcomed into the friendly tea house with grandma chic decor and whimsically mismatched furniture. The waitress invited us behind the counter to smell and the teas, it took awhile as there are so many options! We added the savory option to our tea choosing from a quiche or bread pudding. I chose the bread pudding with herbs, mushroom and kale. It was wonderfully reminiscent of stuffing. Im taking one star off here are we waited about 30minutes until this dish arrived. Otherwise the tea service was fantastic. The scones were delicious, i couldn't  get enough of the clotted cream and jam. Everything is made from a scratch, including the bread for the cucumber sandwiches. Cally herself came by to recommend eating the meringue with clotted cream, it was delicious! Although I think that cream could make everything delicious. The high tea was $40, which is cheaper than other high tea options in town. I would return for the lovely atmosphere and delicious scones

Where's Rosie?
I am under a strict dietary meal plan. I was able to enjoy a night out with friends at this Wonderful Place. The server was very helpful and accommodated my needs with a big smile

#SiganPalante #InsternationalBusiness #Entrepreneur

Yes. I give this a solid 5/5 yes for Boise. Vibe / coffee / food. It's the whole package. I got a cortado 3 days in a row. The first two were solid, complex, and delicious. Something was off with the third. As long as the baristas focus on TASTING the espresso shots they are serving and develop their own pallet for what is good vs what is mediocre this place will be a solid 5. When attention to shot weight, distribution of fines, tamping consistency, and shot extraction gets bypassed, they will drop down to a 4/5; just another hipster coffee joint serving mediocre lattes with Rosetta's on top... until then, I can say with confidence that this is THE place for espresso based drinks. Keep up the good work. Also if you are looking to slouch in a couch or comfy chair this might not be the place. Seating angles of the chairs are perfect 90 degrees !!

Broad St location can be a little frustrating at times. They don't have as much on the shelves as other locations due to space. However, it's very close to my house so I continue to go anyway. Everyone is always very friendly and helpful. They all know the store amazingly well. There is also an Amazon locker in this location so if you're worried about having packages delivered to your home that's an awesome option. They've been having a Farmer's market type situation weekly. This store is very unique.

The mozzarella sticks were dried out and seemed previously frozen. The large meat Stromboli was cold inside and the meats especially the sausage were inferior ingredients. If if were to go back it would be for the pizza only.

Well, as you can see from the reply from AJS to Steve that there will be no review and that they will submit it to customer service so that the next  person might get better service.  JP Morgan was right. Don't be one of them like me. Stay Away

This 5 star review is for the groomer I use at Petsmart. 

My fur baby loves coming to see Gail! She leaves looking amazing. I am always satisfied with the service we receive. She's always so friendly and pleasant. I would highly recommend Gail if you need a groomer.

Avoid Terminix like the plague. 

Do not use them unless you want to hire a company to do an incomplete job and, then, avoid responsibility.  

My mother has been paying them for 37 years only to learn--upon the sale of her house--that their work was incomplete and that they were dishonest. Ultimately, this reduced the value of her house by several thousands of dollars.

Closed down? I can't even believe it. It's only been two months since I was there, but I've been dreaming about it. The frybread with green chile was absolutely delicious, the best I've ever had. It was a giant portion, too. I hope the owners can bring it back. It was awesome!

Menu never changes, and the drink list is now sad. place has gone downhill. Used to like the shrimp pad Thai, but the last two times I ordered it I got a mix of bad shrimp and fresh shrimp, it tasted so weird. They should just reopen it as a nectar and stop attempting the Taiwanese street cuisine.

D-lish food. Healthy and fresh. Eat your veggies steamed, raw, sautéed. Casual, clean dining room and restrooms (one sign of a good restaurant). Order at the counter. We ordered classic Bimini-bop #1 beef and #4 tofu. Very friendly staff. When in town we will return.

This has a laid back, bar atmosphere.  The food was ok.  For an appetizer we had the buffalo chicken dip - it was yummy.  We both ordered the salmon, it wasn't the best we've had, but not the worst either.  The staff was pleasant.  Our waiter had worked a double shift, so he wasn't as attentive as he probably was earlier in his shift.  We sat on the front porch, near the bar entrance, so we had the music on the porch competing with the music in the bar from the jukebox.  It wouldn't have been bad if it was the same song playing from both.  All in all, it was a pleasant dining experience.

My experience with Stephanie and Patty the manager was great.  They are very professional and willing to work with their clients.  I wish I could give a higher rating.  I'm glad I went to their establishment.

My first time having Thai food since I moved to Florida and I'm so glad I chose this place! 

After looking over their reviews and menu online, I decided to play it safe and start off with the Pad Thai. I called to place a carryout order and the man who took my order was so patient and helpful. I made A LOT of changes to my order and he made sure to repeat them all back to me. I went and picked my food up about 30min later and it was ready. I checked it while i was there was happy to see it was made EXACTLY how i asked it to be. The portion size was also great. I turned that meal into 3 :)

I am on my second cup of coffee and my server has stopped by twice to say "I will be right back " and still has not taken my order. Trisha is taking care of 6 tables?  Busy dropping off extra napkins and arranging silverware on empty tables. Horrible service.

An "acceptable" level of service, neither good nor bad, and some points for the interior design. However, the WiFi is painfully slow and drops continually, forcing many of us to head over to the nearby location on the interior of the outlet mall.
WOW...!!! Amazing find! Came for breakfast and was not disappointed! BEST absolutely BEST Colombian food. Will make the trip from Sarasota for dinner... easy on/ off I75!!!
Somehow managed to skip the line! Was worth it for that reason alone. Food was good, but I like other hot chicken I've tried better. Place was very clean and the staff was friendly.

I came here a little after the grand opening. The ambience is cool and very clean. The pedicure was amazing, the lady spent almost an hour working on my feet. I also got a dip powder manicure- it looked awesome but one nail completely came off literally the next day... I was so disappointed because dip is so expensive.

Went here for the first time since the remodel, which is actually still partially in progress. 

Some of the screens now have assigned seating with reclining leather seats. Our Sunday evening tickets were 11.99 each. No more cheap seats for the the big box office hits. :( 

Theater smells better (used to be a bit musty) and the sound was incredible. Enjoyed the nice seats, but they don't recline as much as Roadhouse and they don't bring you food. So I think I'd rather go to Roadhouse for a few bucks more. 

However, I might invest in a movie pass subscription which would take away my issue with the higher prices. Check it out if you're a big movie goer $9.99/month for unlimited movies/month (one movie per day) and this theater accepts it!
I love Pali! Every time I come to SB Funk Zone I make sure and stop here. The best wines,l and staff. :)

This is my husband's favorite pizza in the whole area. We've never eaten in the restaurant, we always call it in and then go pick it up. One time they made a mistake on our order and remade the pizza for us right there. They gave us both pizzas to go home with! So we took one to my mom's house since two people and two pizzas is way too much food!

Besides the fact they have kids running the cash register and phones, we've always had a great experience with them.

This place is one of the best places to get breakfast. There's always a long wait on weekends which is typical for breakfast places. It's located at the Iron Works Hotel in the north side of Indy. 

One of my favorites is their avocado toast. They also have great smoothies and sparkling drinks. Their fresh squeezed oj is a must.

Stopped in here for the first time because it was close.  The "breakfast special" is cheap, so you get what you pay for.  It was very bland and not good.  The apple fritter i had was stale. My daughter had a regular glaze which was fine. The servers are very nice. They charge and extra fee for a CC transaction. I probably wont ever return.

If I were rating based on service, this would probably be a 4 or 5, but overall I don't think this is a must do in New Orleans. It's definitely an institution if you want to check it off your list, but for price and time, I'd probably prefer to check out other spots instead. We got the trio of soups to start (sampler of turtle, gumbo and soup du hour which was some vegetable soup for us). I think they were ok- but nothing memorable and honestly on the salty side. We both got fish dishes for our entree. I think my boyfriend's cast iron seared gulf fish was actually quite good- probably the best dish of the night. The pecan crusted fish was good, and supposedly one of their more popular, but I don't know if I'd order again. The desserts were actually pretty decent! My friend is obsessed with their creole bread pudding soufflé and may have raised our expectations too high...it was delicious and quite good! But not like mind blowing as he noted...but definitely worth a try if you're visiting the restaurant. The strawberry shortcake was actually my favorite between the two (we got both). I'll also say the cocktails were pretty decent and not too sweet. I got the sweet potato drink, which didn't taste much like sweet potato but reminded me a bit of a White Russian. Overall lovely staff and restaurant but not in my list of must-dos.

I came into Vegan International Co. on a Thursday afternoon, and it was fairly empty. I was greeted half of the wife/husband combo who own the place. She immediately recognized that this was my first time coming to the restaurant, and she explained the menu very thoroughly. It's a small selection, but it has, in my opinion, everything you could want for lunch. I ordered BBQ meatballs with macaroni and cheese and collard greens. My boyfriend ordered jerk chik'n with rice and collard greens. We also got two empanadas, one southwest and one pizza. The food was OUTSTANDING and very reasonably priced. Both of the owners are such kind-hearted people, and they each asked us several if we needed anything. We were offered many different sauces to try for no additional charge, and we got to try a mango smoothie that had just been made. At one point, they even took a picture of us to post on their Instagram story! We left with a couple more empanadas (pizza, because it's seriously delicious). The whole experience was definitely worth repeating, and I am already excited to go back!

I Dont normally give out 5 stars but its sad to see this place get so many unbalanced reviews. I have  been to this place over 5 times, and like any new restaurants they have their challenges...a busy sat...while maybe a up and down grub hub/ uber eats...but even so each time they have consistently put their best foot forward each time with their service and the food. Listen give this place a fair chance and you will not be disappointed
 They have a huge menu and the flavors are awesome with reasonable prices and great portions!!! Tell them "J" sent you!! And no Im not a sponsor but just a loyal customer who loves good food and hate when a bad review gives the wrong vibes about a hidden jewel of a place!!! Bring friends and eat as a group to try new things and trust me you'll LOVE IT

The staff deserve a five star because they were still open on Christmas Eve. We walked in 20 minutes before closing and were welcomed in instead of turned away and they were still nice and polite, never rushed us the whole time. The food is great, char-grilled oysters were delicious and gumbo was tasty.

I have been in this facility since 12:30 with my daughter to treat a bronchial infection - it is now 4:00 - we still have no update on her X-ray and final diagnosis - never come here for "urgent" care

For the first year it wasn't a bad experience. Doesn't compare to Chicago's Christkindlmarkt, but then Carmel isn't Chicago.  There should be more food options. Still, it was a pleasant evening in Carmel.
Got a few breakfast burritos during the Thomas fire. Tasty. Good price. Good service. Olivia took care of us a to z. She was great. Definitely worth a try!

Owners are Friendly including staff. they have a lot of products that some Asian Store don't have.they are Honest specially with their,,money related total amount.their machine is accurate ,and the cashier is accurate too.the store is small,,and the parking area is small too.but I don't care..just park on your own risk..specially with that light post in front of the store..

Terrible location!! I go yesterday after opening and order the Pike Place, their most popular coffee. I'm told they don't have any brewed. Okay, I get another coffee that's strong. I go today at 4:58 am, they open at 5:00 am. I expect to wait at the door for 2 minutes as SB usually opens the doors within seconds of the opening time. A woman comes to the door and tells me that they open at 5:00 but they don't have any coffee brewed, so it will be about 5 more minutes. She had no intention of letting me in. I commented that perhaps they should have started the coffee 3 minutes earlier, a time that will allow them to sell at the opening time. I leave and go to a SB 5 minutes away. The SB that I went to had the Pike Place ready, at 5:04 am!!! This SB is 1 block from my hotel. I will not be back. It's a new SB, so I suggest that someone in management tell them what "open at 5:00" truly means. It doesn't mean that the lights are on and the door is open, it means open and ready to do business. Obviously I'm cranky if I don't get my coffee first thing in the morning. BTW, I have never left a negative review for SB, as I love SB coffee.

This is my Pedego story. I arrived at the shop and was greeted by the sweetest little Westie, Wesley! Caroline greeted me and we chatted about the bikes, which got me excited to rent one for an hour. I came back and purchased a City Commuter that day! My life changed. I went from a video game playing, IPAs and AMF (yum) drinking lifestyle to biking multiple miles a day! I've lost 25 pounds in just a few months and I attribute it all to my Pedego. Hurry in!
Mention Cam when you go in!

I loved this place the combination of ceviche and poke bowl i think is a great idea! I ordered a bowl with avocado, ceviche, plantain chips and noodles. The service was also amazing, they let me try different things before choosing and were really kind

Christmas Celebration with dear friends at Ruth Chris is a holiday treat. The valet parking is very easy and helpful. We had reservations and were seated immediately. Our wait staff, led by Steve were prompt and very informative of the menu. Since it was a special occasion we treated ourselves to the special seafood tower as an appetizer - deliciously fantastic; it included jumbo shrimp (and they were jumbo on steroids); Lobster and crab legs. Our party ordered various entrees from filet, ribeye and N.Y. strip. Sizzling hot, cooked to perfection and a serving size that required us to take home the leftovers. We also enjoyed the lobster bisque soup which was excellent. The lobster Mac and cheese for a side was an unusual combination that we had never enjoyed before- it was a real treat as well- very tasty. Always a evening to look forward to at Ruth Chris!

I've been disappointed by the Des Peres store on Manchester before and  I'm sorry I didn't catch my husband in time to tell him to order from the Twin Oaks store. We ordered 5 pizzas last night - more than $100 - for an impromptu family gathering. He ordered at 6:15 and was told 30 - 40 minutes. The pizzas arrived late (just shy of an hour), lukewarm, soggy and pitiful. The veggie pizza had a generous portion of veggies, but the pepperoni and the sausage pizzas had so little meat on them, they were difficult to distinguish from the cheese pizza. Seriously. I had two pieces of the sausage and there were a total of 5 pieces of sausage between the two pieces, each about the size of a lima bean. In addition, the pizzas almost entirely lacked spice. All you could taste was provel cheese. That is absolutely the last time.

I like this little spot. It is probably not as hidden as it seems, but I like that it was not packed to the brim. Went in and you order at the bar; basically right when you walk in. The food is reasonable and the quality is good. They have TVs and a big bar for people to sit and watch the games/news/whatever is on. 

I had the burger, and it was good. Sometimes, a simple burger and fries is all that is needed to make your world happy again. My friend had seafood something, since she only sticks with fish. She also loved her food. I would definitely return here; it is to me somewhat of a hidden gem. I can definitely understand some reviews about rude / rushing bartenders, tho. She was curt but somewhat friendly when we ordered. Maybe that is just their brand? Not sure. I was just friendly and smiled and she seemed fine with me.

Amazing cheese tea place in Chinatown. The cheese foam was sweet and delicious. It took bubble tea to another level. The tea itself was very good too.

 Besides their drinks, the decor was unique and cool, and the customer service was very friendly and sweet. Definitely a place to come back to all the time.

Great sandwich spot! I love this place. While its a little on the pricier side it is totally worth it! The service is great, everytime I go, the counter people are really friendly. Their crispy chicken west is mine and my bf's favorite!
Never showed up, claimed they tried to call me and I didn't answer (they didn't) and that my car was gone on arrival (it wasn't - they never arrived). Wish I could give negative stars.

Another excellent meal tonight. Glad that they were busy but I had to wait a whole five minutes for a table tonight. I was going to call bs in a two star review below but I wound up having to send back my toast. The first piece was fine but the others were basically croutons. It literally broke apart into pieces. They replaced it no problem but I was surprised. So happy they are local now.
One of the best lunch options in the area! I've been numerous times, and everything has always been freshly prepared with everything ordered present. Fast and friendly service!

This place is so pretty. The design and decor are very aesthetically pleasing. The decor is bright, sleek and modern. There is an appealing use of geometric shapes and marble throughout the place. Check out the in the table inlay, potted plants and the sky garden near the octopus. We sat on the very comfortable bar stools for lunch. 

I chose the pain killer for my beverage. We had the cauliflower sandwich and Quinoa. The cauliflower sandwich was the best surprised even though the quinoa was delectable too. The sandwich was a roasted cauliflower steak with smoked cheddar with fermented chili sauce. It was on perfect buttery toasted bread with a side of thin sweet potato french fries. They don't have ketchup but they do have an aioli sauce that is even better. The quinoa had kale (uncooked), black garbanzo beans (first time having them), squash and chili shrimp. There was so much food that we took home some of the quinoa and it was just as delicious the next day. 

The description on Yelp is a little misleading, because it says seafood as one of the main categories. While it does have despite on the menu it is actually vegetable-driven that is sustainable and local sourced. They have all proteins on the menu with veggies. If you read their web page then you will learn little octopus is a nickname for the chef. The menu is vegetable-driven, so yelp change your description.

We ordered two couches and two tables. The store has continued to disappoint me with their lack of service. No one has ever called to confirm anything from the order to the delivery to the return. I had to go out of my way to call every single time, despite being told that one of their associates would be contacting me. In addition, I caught one of their sales associate lying to me multiple times and had to get the manager involved. The manager was nice and gave me a credit on my account since I had financed through them. Their furniture is nice but their awful customer service means I'm never shopping here again.
We ended up returning the couches. We loved them, but unfortunately another couch we were planning on moving to a different room didn't work and we had to send them back. Trying to return them took about a week and a half (despite calling the day after only one couch was delivered) to return them. Once again, I was told that someone would call me to schedule a time to return the couch and no one ever called me. I called in the middle of the week and the next available time was the following weekend.
I got my bill this month and I saw that they charged me for the protection plan for the couches (despite me returning the couches before I was even charged). I also never received the credit that the manager had promised. When I called billing to clarify this, they were agreeable to credit my account for the protection plan, but the manager who previously helped me refused to give me the $125 credit because I returned the couches (despite him never saying this was the stipulation).
I called a week and a half ago to sort out this refund issue. Despite being promised it would go through, no refund has been issued. I called the store to discuss this with them and spoke with a different associate who was not even aware of this refund that was supposed to go through.
Excellent tacos & burritos. First time, but had heard good things before visiting. Definitely recommend this restaurant.

I wish this restaurant was around while I attended UCSB (although I probably couldn't have afforded it at the time!) because the food is fantastic! Can't wait to drive up again for a weekend getaway to stop in and try more dishes at The Lark. We tried the pimento cheese on toast and the lamb shoulder confit. The pimento cheese on toast was good but didn't blow me away. The lamb shoulder confit was a different story--I could have eaten three plates of this stuff! Even my boyfriend agreed it was delicious and he usually dislikes lamb. Well not the case with this lamb, this lamb was the best! Also, wanted to mention the ambience is beautiful. Great for date night and also girl's night. Try it!

Love the food and service.   However, I just witnessed one of the cooks quickly sprinkle some water on his hands for maybe 2 seconds,  no soap, and then hurriedly leave.   It seriously degraded my dining experience.   I would greatly appreciate it if the manager could conduct a hand-washing class.

Timothy is a master at his craft. The cuts and colors he produces are by far some of the best I've ever seen and the icing on the cake is that he is an amazing human being. If you ever have the chance I highly recommend you go see him.

One of the worst dining experiences i have ever had, ran restaurants for a long time and the wait times and service was out of the world, ordered simple dishes (bowl and chicken fingers) and after waiting for our food forever we were told it is a standard 45 minute wait for those kind of dishes. At any restaurant no food should take longer then 20 minutes tops.
