The manager Annette Borbon was not much better then our tweaked out service who kept grinding their teeth, all she said was that there was nothing she could do, it is company policy that food takes at least 45 minutes. Exact words. She didn't even listen when i tried explaining what was going on and kept insisting she is not in a position of power to do anything. Once galaxy theaters is built in town i plan on never returning to this business again.

This is the second time my boyfriend and I ate here, and we once again were amazed with the food, service and overall experience. Concetta is a doll, and really makes that place feel like a home! I already can't wait to go back!

This is a great spot (smaller than El Vez) for dates or catching up with friends. They have great drinks and food, plus a great happy hour with cheap items. It's easy to miss walking by but a cool place to check out.

I couldn't even get as far as the sales pitch. 
Any business that isn't up front about pricing isn't worth my time. I shouldn't have to fill out a questionnaire and talk to a salesperson before being able to see pricing. 
I need to know 3 things. What's the initiation fee?
What's the per month price? How much will it cost to cancel if I'm not enjoying my experience?

I don't need the used car/timeshare sales pitch. 
It's a gym. I can see the equipment from the door. 
It looks clean enough. Your hours are convenient. 
Let's cut to the chase.

Matteo's, an established Italian restaurant in Noblesville, has expanded to the Northwest side of Indianapolis. New to the location once held by Franco's brother, Arturo, visitors will be happy to know that the family recipes have returned to this charming little spot.

I had the pleasure of meeting Adam, the Marketing and Sales manager, at an event where he was announcing the opening. He'd brought a creamy tortellini dish that was as absolutely wonderful! We exchanged info, and he reached out to share more information about catering. 

Before long, I'd made plans to visit the restaurant and experience it for myself. Located on the southeast corner of 86th and Ditch, you need to pass the Starbucks to find it. If you're familiar with the old Cinema Grill, its right next to it. 

Exquisite stained glass doors make for a stunning entrance, nicely framed by a pair of topiary trees. I was immediately greeted by the hostess and hung my coat before being seated. 

The craftsmanship of the woodwork throughout the bar and restaurant area exudes pride and prestige, in line with the ambiance of the rest of the surroundings. This is a perfect location for a dinner date or special occasion. A floor to ceiling cellar is displayed, further complimenting the atmosphere. 

As I was seated, freshly baked bread was served with a savory olive oil.  asked for a wine recommendation and thoroughly enjoyed Matteo's Private Label Cabernet Sauvignon with my dinner, Lamb chop Marsala. The sauce was luxuriously rich, slightly sweet and packed with flavor. My chops were tender, but required a serrated knife that I requested. 

Service was impeccable throughout, and Franco, the owner, came out to greet guests personally in the dining room. I couldn't leave without the temptation of the dessert menu, and chose Franco's mother's own Crème di Fragole pie, a blissful combination of gelatin and fresh strawberries and cream. 
 
Before departing I was able to see the Private Dining room, available to seat up to 60 guests. It was a tasteful layout and had potential for a nice reception or alternate meeting location. 

I'm thrilled to see Matteo's expansion and look forward to returning with colleagues and family!

A night in St. Louis brought me a nice surprise by stumbling into this cute restaurant.

Went there when they opened. Ordered arugula, egg, and avocado sandwich with strawberry shortcake biscuit. Oh and coffee. Everything was very good. The cashier was very pleasant and kind despite the fact that it was 8am. 

I stayed for about an hour to finish my food and work one some things. People definitely trickled in as time went by. Check out this unique biscuit restaurant when youre in St. Louis!

Update: review is from before when it was Bay Harbor Hotel under construction. The place was basically a mess with a lot of riff raff.
Pros: gorgeous views of the water and sunset.  Tables and chairs outside behind the building. Restaurant has decent food and drinks. Staff is nice. Recieved 2 $10 vouchers for cafe in lobby.  Cons: hotel needs updating. Pool was not heated and birds were bathing in it. Needed maintenance. Too bad because the pool area could be a chill spot to relax and have drinks or get some sun and read, go for a swim but it's only used as a short cut from behind the building to bar/restaurant. Also, the beach bar was under construction. Last time we were here there were fire pits and volleyball and 2 bars. False advertising as far as the beach bar being open and "heated" pool being ice cold. Also, hallways in hotel were not air conditioned.
 When I asked a housekeeping maid if I could switch out a few dirty towels for clean ones, she basically told me no. Then changed her answer when she saw the look on my face. I have worked for 3 different hotel chains with impeccable hospitality. They need to work on theirs here. Rooms and hallways smelled stale and AC unit vents were not adjustable, so they blasted air toward the pillows on the bed, drying out our noses and throat.
No food at a place with kitchen in the name was surprising. Very cheep beer. Service was poor; the bartender was out back smoking with another patron for most of the hour I was there

This place was absolutely amazing. I had the fish and chips and they could not have been cooked more delightfully. They weren't greasy or heavy in any way, they were light and fluffy. I'm from Pennsylvania and visiting the area and we came across this place based on its good reviews. The reviews are accurate and the staff is super accommodating and friendly. Deductively would come again if we were closer!

The spice for the chicken here is good; the chicken's dryness and lack of a bite is what makes the place a restaurant where I would not go if there are other closer choices. I tried out the wings and hot chicken and waffles. Wings had a good crisp, but past this crispiness was unflavored chicken meat. The hot chicken n waffles were good, but nothing too memorable. Nashville is only about a twenty minute drive from Rivergate, take rush hour out of the picture, and I would definitely make the drive downtown just to get good hot chicken. As other reviewers stated, definitely call in beforehand and you will get your food in a timely manner. Helen's is convenient for those living in the area who crave some chicken, yet again, I would take the extra drive to Nashville for amazing hot chicken and sides.

I just had 20 guests for dimsum. It was totally yummy- big selection, fresh, enormous variety, lots of choices for our vegetarians. The staff were patient and helpful. The owner gave me a tour of the kitchen. IT IS CLEAN AS A WHISTLE! Odor-free, orderly, all floors clean. We will go back soon.

The inside is beautiful! We walked around the building for about 30 minutes before we went to get food. When we went for food, there were a ton a really good options. The food, and amount we paid for it, was great! I had the chicken kabobs with vegetables. It was so well seasoned and the chicken was super tender.

This place would be fine if it was less expensive. The burritos are very basic and you get charged extra for ad-ons like guacamole or extra salsa. You'd think that at a place called Guacamole, guacamole would be added by default. I live a block away and every time I eat here I regret not getting in my car to go to Honest Tom's.

Exactly what you want when you walk into a burger joint. Burger made to order. Amazing staff. Family
Vibe, good energy and good food!
Your usual Denny's diner. Just more empty and a little dirty. You get the usual big portioned, tasty meals. Lots of parking at this location.

This is probably my favorite Honduran restaurant I've been to in Louisiana as of yet. Amazing food, clean and quaint environment.  Wish the service was friendlier, but I came for the food and left satisfied.

Sawmill is near the top of Tucson's Sky Island. For long time Tucson residents it replaced the ramshackled but beloved "Pie Place".  They have a beautiful deck to enjoy in the summer and fall. During the winter months there's a fireplace inside to make it cozy! The food is good, but expect higher prices than in the valley. There's a cost to do business on the mountain, increased delivery charges and labor. Most employees have to commute, so please keep this in mind while tipping. The weekends are crazy but if you can get away during the week it's a delight. I really enjoy the Friday Fish Fry! Service is sporadic depending upon the staff. We have seen indifference to the amazing Josie. That girl could give lessons. She wasn't our server this visit but it was a joy to watch her non stop smile and her attention to details.

My Experience at Sushi Yobi was horrible . I would 0 stars if I could . Placed a Togo order at 840 the lady told me it would take 20 min.. so 9:05 rolls around I'm leaving my apartment and she calls me and asks where I am.  I tell her I am on the way and should be there in 5 min. I pull around the circle and she calls again, in an extremely rude tone and tells me to pay over the phone , which I would rather not . She tells me to hurry up because they are closing soon and starts screaming at me over the phone to hurry up and come and HANGS UP ON ME . So I called back and told her to cancel my order and I don't appreciate rude customer service . Not even 2 min later the guy / chef whatever he is, calls me and tells me to come get my food. I tell him I don't want it anymore because his staff hung up on me and is rude " I will go elsewhere ". Then to my surprise he starts screaming at the top of his lungs at me in a hateful manner , which left me speechless. Didn't apologize for rude staff or anything . I will NEVER dine at sushi Yobi again . Extremely extremely rude/ hateful  staff.

Cool Beans, I heart you! Fishhawk has long been in need of an establishment such as this. Cool Beans brings people back to an area that has long looked like a ghost town... It's a great little coffee/wine/small bites shop that offers simple flatbreads, gelatos, coffee, teas, pastries, and most importantly, wine! I am a big fan of the chicken artichoke flatbread and their mac & cheese is so dreamy. 

This is a fun place to take out of town guests to give them a good taste of Fishhawk--especially on the weekends for mimosas or in the evenings for live music and fun atmosphere. 

If you haven't already, consider supporting this locally-owned business!

Watch out with this business! 

I got a quadrajet from these guys for my 350 sbc. Opened up the box and saw a nice looking carb. Bolted it on and started up quickly. Everything seemed alright at first until trying to drive it. The carb did not perform consistently. Sent it back and they looked at it. Said it was fine and shipped it back. Still had problems. I bought a used carb for 30 bucks and my car has been running A LOT better. Go figure! Got a little frustrated and reached out to them. They agreed to a refund. Long story short, once they got their product back and I sent them my core, they refunded me less money than we had agreed upon. Now they will not work with me. Very upset with this place. Trust me. Just go with someone else!

Not much to say about this place except it's the BEST breakfast place in town hands down.

While I can't take away a star for it the only negative thing I could say is they are not open long enough! Come on open earlier close later please!!!

This place is the bomb go eat there right away!!

We have used Tony several times on numerous big projects. He is very straightforward and tells you what your options are. He has always been far more reasonable than any other quotes we had. His quality of work is outstanding. We have yet to have any issues with our masonry work.  We have had him do tuck-pointing on our 100 year old garage, and reinforce our retaining wall in addition to other work. 

He is very fast and punctual. When he says he can come out tomorrow he will be their bright eyed and ready to go. I never have to wait weeks on end to get something done. We have always been satisfied with his work and will continue to use him

Definitely not the place to eat if you're looking for authentic Mexican. My taco shell was cold and my moms burrito shell was cold too. They don't put on grill long enough and there just wasn't much flavor to anything. Won't go back. Just okay 
Mexican chicken better than ground beef.. obviously

I travel for work to New Orleans area regularly.  

Some of the worst wait time estimates ever.  Told us 25 minutes.  Show up 20 minutes later.  They say 10 to 15 more minutes.  Showed up in 10 and stand in front of the door.  20 minutes later they say we missed our time and we would be next.  20 minutes pass and 16 more people go in.  Ask and they tell me 25 more minutes.   

At least I was able to pay for 4 drinks at the bar and drink them outside.  

Wont go back.
The only thing that is good about this place is that they are fast. I would not recommend going here. They have terrible service,staff attitude,and 9/10 times have a broken ice cream machine.

My mom & I went to the grand opening of the Crispy Bird, & the interior was chic & modern. The hostess was able to seat us within 5 minutes despite the business and we didn't have a reservation. My mom has a gluten allergy, and they were able to make a gluten free fried chicken for her. The biscuits were also very good and the honey butter that came with it was delicious. The best thing my mom & I ordered was the grits that came with butternut squash- they were fantastic. However, despite it being a fried chicken place specifically, both my mom and I were underwhelmed by the fried chicken. It was good, but nothing spectacular. However, the restaurant is newly opened so I imagine they have some things to work out. I would definitely go again soon!

I wanted to love this place.  I ALWAYS want to eat Sushi, my husband on the other hand, not so much. He generally is happy with a quality burger and fries. I thought PERFECT!
We went last night (BOGO Sushi) which means you get one free regular roll with the purchase of one specialty roll. 
The atmosphere is cute, bright and funky. Our server was VERY nice and took good care of us. The martini was very good and he made sure to clarify dirty or not dirty and asked if I wanted vermouth. My husband got a beer, they had a decent list. 
I ordered the Big Tuna Roll which was SPICY TUNA, AVOCADO, SLICED SALMON, TUNA, EEL SAUCE, WASABI MAYO & RED TOBIKO. I had them hold the sauces as I don't like mayo on my sushi. Well, I think they forgot the tobiko and the slices of tuna and salmon on top were literally so thin you could see through them. Not very good and too large to easily eat. I ordered the Philly Roll also, which is usually one of my go to favorites. I asked for light cream cheese, just a bit.  I am pretty sure they gave me 3x the normal amount of cream cheese and literally a teeny piece of smoked salmon. It was very tiny.  I most likely would not order the sushi again. 
My husband ordered the SMASH BALL BURGER $14 SMASHED BALL OF FIRE OVER MELTED CHEDDAR CHEESE BURGER, LETTUCE, TOMATO, AND BIG GUP SAUCE. Sounds really good right? It was okay....it really didn't taste very fresh and the SMASHED BALL OF FIRE was significantly underwhelming. The fries were good though. 
Overall, I'd give it another try, there were so  many other things on the menu that looked yummy to me and we did like the atmosphere and service.

I know I shouldn't judge a place for something they're not known for, but I'm about to do it. My boyfriend and I went to Lafayette Square for a house tour yesterday and wanted to get brunch beforehand. Square One's brunch menu sounded really good, so I made an OpenTable reservation the night before. We were seated quickly, and the service was generally stellar throughout the experience. Unfortunately, the food was not. We ordered a Belgian waffle to share which was okay, but not outstanding. I don't know if it needed more butter in the batter or what, but it is not often that I am dissatisfied by a waffle. The real trouble came with my main dish. I ordered the Irish Skillet (I think that's what it was called) which was supposed to be corned beef hash with eggs. I am a CBH aficionado, so I was very much looking forward to it. Upon taking my first bite, my excitement dwindled. I kid you not...the hash was so spicy my nose was running after two or three bites. I have no idea why it was so spicy because the menu mentioned nothing about heat in the dish. Granted, I absolutely LOVE spicy food and the idea of hot corned beef hash is kind of intriguing, but this was so spicy that it was painful. It was the kind of spicy that you regret, and I did. I asked our waitress what made it so hot, and she said it normally wasn't and they must have over-seasoned it. Even before we got up to leave, I knew that heat would haunt me during our house tour, and it did. I had heartburn and indigestion for most of the day which really sucked. I have rarely in my life wasted food, but I didn't even take my leftovers as it was just too hot and my stomach was already upset. Generally, if I order really spicy food, I know there is a possibility I will suffer for it. What sucks is I didn't order spicy food, at least according to the menu. I will be back in the future to try the beer, but I will most certainly be skeptical if I'm ever ordering food again.

OMG!  Great food! Great service! Friendly helpful staff! Good prices with healthy servings!  We had shrimp n grits, black n blue burger, fried green tomatoes,french toast with blueberry sauce, alligator sausage po boy (great sauce) , private club po boy.  All of it it was great!  Highly recommend.  We will be back!

I just had a bad enough experience that I downloaded the yelp app, and created a log in just to be able to share. 

We arrived at 11:26, the restaurant doesn't open until 11:30, but the door was unlocked so we walked in to get out of the 28 degree weather. The gentleman behind the bar said they aren't open to please leave. 

We stood on the side walk for the four minutes until they opened and went back in. We were seated and ordered relatively quickly. The food took nearly an hour to come out and when it did oh boy. The pizzas two members of our party ordered were pretty terrible. One was burnt on the top, and both tasted like cardboard. 

I ordered the muscles appetizer, a side of Brussels sprouts, and a side of sweet potato fries. The sweet potato fries were okay enough-nothing remarkable. The Brussels sprouts were drenched in butter and were soggy. The muscles were sprinkled with slices of sausage that were so dry they looked like they were sandpaper. Onions also peppered across the muscles somehow burnt and shriveled but slimy all at once. The muscles themselves did not look appetizing at all. The broth they were in tasted like nothing and really bad all at once, It looked murky and not appetizing in the slightest. 

I asked our server for the check and nicely explained that none of us were pleased with our food and we wouldn't be eating it we would just like to get the check and leave. She offered something else and I politely declined again letting her know we waited nearly an hour and the food was not worth eating for us.

We were the only table in the entire restaurant and still received food that was well below acceptable standards.

She brought the check for the full table of food that we were unable to eat and had taken 20% off. We were still charged $45 for food that was so bad we couldn't even eat it. She did give us a coupon for a free appetizer, which was left behind because we will not be going back, and we will be telling others about our experience.
Absolutely amazing. Everything was fantastic and the service was superb. I will definitely be back to try more!
We LOVE "The Pub", as we call it! Great atmosphere and even better food and the staff is always super friendly! Best Tenderloin ever!!

So thankful to have found this gem in the middle of all of the chaos caused by the Thomas Fire. There were absolutely no hotels available in Ventura, Carpinteria, or Santa Barbara. Luckily after waiting on hold for hours and hitting nothing but dead ends.. The Inn At East Beach told us they had a room available! They got us right in with our handicap patient and took the best care of us! Their handy man Mike was very friendly and very helpful. From 7:30am-9:30am they have bread, muffins, seasonal fruit, and they usually always have fresh coffee brewed. We took advantage of their laundry room available near the pool with laundry soap available for purchase. Our room's heating source was a built in fireplace that turned on by a knob/thermostat (It made me want one in my house.) Our room was a junior sweet and came equipped with a kitchenette, including an oven, stovetop, apartment size fridge, silverware, plates, pots & pans, etc. Fully stocked and ready for whatever you may need! The staff was decorating the lobby's Christmas tree and using glitter to make presents. Vanessa was very nice and Maria went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of, she checked us right in and ensured us we had a welcoming place to stay after being evacuated from the fire. She provided us with masks and everything you could ever need to have a wonderful stay. I highly recommend the Inn At East Beach, the staff and the location is worth it if you're staying here in Santa Barbara. They will take good care of you!!

Went in the other day to use gift cards as I usually don't shop there as I sort of feel like I don't belong. Like i don't make enough a year or drive an SUV . Anywho... I went in to find stuff to buy like Christmas clearance candy etc and made my way to the cashier. Lines were long as to be expected but my lane was moving faster than the rest. I noticed the cashier lady Hayley was beyond chipper and all smiles despite the crazy stressful holiday shoppers. She was really nice to deal with and helped me with my gift card purchase. You need more employees like her.
One of the best Cuban coffee I have ever taste  . Next time I will try the sandwiches. The location is spectacular.

Always an awesome experience!  This is my wife's fourth CX5 from Ray Skillman Mazda West. We worked with sales managers Vince Freeman and Barry Morris.  

Her first couple times Barry was her sales person.  She absolutely loved working with him because of his professionalism and quick wit. 

It's nice to see Barry promoted to a sales manager, he's an asset to the company.

This time Jonny Much was our sales person... what a  great guy! Come to find out he was just promoted!  It's nice to see an organization promote from within.  I think it keeps the chemistry going!  

We'll see you guys soon when we come in for our oil change and tire rotation... funny how you're always there, letting us know how to get into a new car and lower our payments!!

Come for the sushi, but don't get anything else. Sushi has always been fresh and they are very quick for takeout when we're craving. For their other entrees, the fried rice is too clumpy and the portions do not match the higher price. The inside of the restaurant is usually very quiet. I'd suggest ordering takeout only

LOVED!

I'm a member so I purchased tickets at the discount price of $15. Money well spent! 

We all pondered how many lights there were total wrapped around tree trunks and branches and lights clinging to wrought iron fences. Has to be in the millions, easily.

The choreographed lights in front of Lilly House was a delight to watch. However I wished they had mixed up the music a bit, straying from the Nutcracker Suite (which I think they only played 'Waltz of the Flowers' over and over again). I think some more upbeat music every now and again would have added energy to the event.

I like the small details that went into creating this experience. One would be the warming stations that weren't generic gas lamps, but rather real stoves fueled by wood. Very nice touch and right next to the treat stand. Eat and be warm. Good combo.

The kissing arbor was a big hit! There was a volunteer standing by to assist with photos. How often does someone offer to take your pic!! 

My absolute favorite part was Snowflake Bridge, the first sight you see walking into the display. It was so angelic and lots of dimension. I wanted to stand there forever and look up at the trees. 

IF YOUR EYES HURT BY LOOKING AT BLUE LIGHTS, YOU HAVE AN OCULAR DISEASE... WARNING!!
There is a section near the big tree made of children's toys that is alllllllll blue lights. I literally couldn't even walk through that area. 

I could say about 20 more great things about the evening we spent at Winterlights, but I will leave some for your surprise and delight. Enjoy!

The pizza is okay, atmosphere is more young family oriented but pretty noisy when it's crowded or on a karaoke night. There is better pizza around town but this place is well suited to a family with young children, better than most.

The hostess would not even acknowledge my presence, nor my son's, and we were standing immediately in front of him!!! He looked right at us, turned his head. Then, when another woman walked up (beside us at that) he asked her if she needed to get her name added to the list. I don't know what his problem was, but this was the rudest I've ever been treated in a restaurant! We walked out, taking our business elsewhere! We were visiting family in the hospital in Tampa. I can guarantee you that none of us will come to this rude place again - that refuses to acknowledge customers. If I could give 0 stars, I would!

My wife and I stopped here because she looked up things to do in Nashville. It was a pretty cool place if you have time to kill a few hours. The biscuits you get before your meal were hot & fresh. You get peach, blackberry, and strawberry preserves to go on them. (We bought some biscuit mix & blackberry preserves in the gift shop while we waited to be seated.) For our meal we split the southern sampler (fried chicken, catfish, and meatloaf.) The chicken and catfish were great but the meatloaf was pretty average. Don't waste your meal on the meatloaf when there's plenty of other good things on the menu. The hashbrown casserole and mac&cheese were both really good for sides. This place reminded me of cracker barrel but with more history. Would definitely go back.

I will never be the same.


My friend who I will be forever grateful to, drove me to this beautiful place where I was served the most delicious food. That was when I was in St.Louis. I am now back home in San Jose, CA. I am sad that the closest Raising Cane's to me is 4-5 hours away in Reno, Nevada. I pray every night that they expand more in California. 

I am not exaggerating. This chicken, bread, sauce, fries are so delicious.
The mango burger is good and the fries are okay maybe it had too much seasoning idk but I will def go again and recommend this place

Went for breakfast on Sun, am around 10. Seated pretty quickly by a friendly staff. Sat in a booth, a bit uncomfortable. Ordered the Bissell, a combo of 2 eggs, 2 cakes, hash browns, toast. and bacon for $9.50, really good value. The cakes were pretty good, bacon a tad undercooked for me, but I like it super crispy, hash browns were fluffy and not too greasy, eggs cooked to order. Coffee was above average, service was solid. Really good place, great value.

It's really disappointing to see some Yelp users voted this review as funny or cool.

Bullying and suicide are neither funny nor cool.

Sid Sachs grossly violated my right to a fair education.

I recently took my vehicle there to have some service done due to a check engine light. I'm not sure of the previous management that the service department was under (that would warrant low ratings) but my experience was Outstanding. My service advisor was Dave S. But it wasn't just Dave alone. The entire service department worked together as a Team. It didn't matter if they were your service advisor or not. They were very friendly and attentive and anticipated my needs and addressed them. They didn't just say "who is your advisor"? They took ownership and assisted and that is rare in so many businesses these days. Hopefully I won't need any service soon but if I do; They have my business. Thanks Dave S.

We had an amazing experience at Henrietta Red! The decor is beautiful, service delightful, and the food impeccable. Literally every bite we had was unique and flavorful. I can't wait to go back again!

Food was surprisingly REALLY GOOD. I say that because the outside of the restaurant doesn't look too welcoming. The windows are blocked off. 
But I say again. The food was really good. 
I ordered the beef chow fun and sweet and sour chicken. 
There was the right amount of beef and the noodles were cooked perfectly. The meat was tender and the noodles properly mixed. The sauce wasn't too oily and had the right amount of "smokiness" to it that chow fun should have. 
The sweet and sour chicken was nicely fried and puffy and it was all white meat inside. 
The nicest treat was the fried noodles they add in on that wax bag. I don't know if they make it themselves but I've never had this type before. 
I don't have any pictures of the food because I ate it all! But here's some pictures of the yummy fried noodles!!!
Excellent food. Excellent service. What else is there to say. The French toast is delish and the new coffe the serve is rich and bold... just the way I like it!

Stopped by for a late lunch today and it was wonderful! Reasonable prices, great food and friendly service. 
I'll definitely be back.
Employees at this location make up their own shipping rules. There is no need for a neighborhood post office if residents of New Orleans East have to travel to Loyola to ship packages.
I love El Charro downtown, they have the coolest patio delicious prickly pear margaritas and an awesome vegetarian meal

Can't say enough how much I like this addition to Mass Ave.  While the Avenue is bustling with bars, Burnside made a niche for themselves in that they specialize in Mule cocktails and tasty ones at that.  Don't worry if you don't care much for the traditional Moscow Mule because they have at least a dozen variations using all different types of liquor.  The price is reasonable and average for Mass Ave.  The ambiance is a shotgun room and exposed brick with a nod to the entertainment industry as seen by the pictures and decor boasting entertainment icons most people will recognize.  There are multiple floors, and they have theme events scheduled such as Tiki Bar for New Year's.  The narrow space holds a small number of bar seats as well as high top tables along the wall, and it can fill up quickly.  I am definitely looking forward to my next visit.

We stop here often on our way to New Orleans. Close to the airport if you flying in. Also a easy exit of off the interstate if you are driving into town. Good daiquiris with souvenir cups available for purchase. They even sell daiquiris by the gallon!

Huge screens, great food and cold beer. The best place in Franklin to watch NFL and NCAA Football, and NHL Hockey. They have NFL Sunday Ticket and show all the games. It is in Cool Springs Mall, so the wife and kids can hit the mall as you hang out and watch the game. There is a Bowling alley and game room attached to it and a live music room as well. Pretty cool place.

This is a really great store, especially for finding gifts. I found great Nashville-made foodstuffs and and a bag for my cousin and a great map and frame. 

What I really love about the store is the owner. She's kind and knows so much about each product--how it is made, who made it, etc. in the era of same-day Amazon and Target it is so great to have someplace to go like Hey, Rooster.

She carries Inkkas (a great sneaker), has beautiful cards that might as well be artwork, and great jewelry).

Four of us went for Dinner. We ordered the Steak kabob, Pulled Pork platter, Chicken sandwich, and Ribs appetizer. The sides were french fries, mashed potatoes and gravy, and green beans. Conclusion: the green beans seemed to be canned. They were mushy and had no flavor except a bit of bacon. The fries ordinary at best. Same with the mashed potatoes. Pulled pork was Okay, as was the Chicken sandwich. Nothing special. The Kabob was much too salty and the meat gristly. The ribs were excellent, fall off the bone, moist and no fat. A challenger for best in Reno.

The ordeal of waiting in the crowds, even with the advance call in, and the noise, that makes it impossible to hear your table mates across the table, creates a truly undesirable dining experience.

We will not be returning. BJ's BBQ has better food, all around, and a pleasant atmosphere. So far it's our Go To BBQ place.

Extremely small space and long waits but the food made up for it. My boyfriend, friend, and I stopped in for brunch on a Saturday at 11:30. We had to wait about 45 minutes before getting the table, and were tempted by the Jamaican joint a block down the street, but decided to wait it out for hearty brunch food. Once we were inside we definitely waited awhile to give our order and get our food; service wasn't the best, but they were understandably very busy.
The food was, in one word, satisfying. Unable to decide between sweet or savory, i decided to get both with my friend. We ordered the short rib special, shakshuka, and pumpkin French toast. My personal favorite was the shakshuka. The tomatoey, soupy sauce was hearty and perfectly flavored, perfect on the toasted bread. The pumpkin French toast did not disappoint my sweet tooth, with the fluffy pumpkin toast meshing beautifully with the cream and caramel sauce. My boyfriend got the salmon bagel, which is a good pick if you're looking for something light and fresh. The cucumbers and sauce was refreshing with the thick slices of salmon on a toasted everything bagel. Can't go wrong with a salmon bagel. All in all, Little Spoon Cafe is a great lunch joint, though be prepared to wait if you come for brunch on a weekend.

I went to ship a large musical instrument, and the person working there, Marvin, asked if I packed it property. And he even inspected and repacked it really well. He had to stay there a little after closing, but he got it done. Really awesome job.

Surprisingly good! I assumed that the location would mean so-so food (its right in the middle of our most touristy areas).  Eggs Stanley was divine!  Tip: download the "Nowait" app to get in line before you arrive.

Perfect experience at this restaurant. It was one of those pinch-me situations with the service (good punch!), and the food was spot on. The prime rib was the perfect temperature, the artichoke starter was delicious and filling, and the martinis were fantastic. This may be our new neighborhood spot.

Fish tacos! Holy sh*t. Great service. They had us at a very sunny table, but let us move to a shadier spot. Complimentary margaritas were good too. Good size dining room, accommodated our party of 7 no problem. I will be back for sure

Really good quality food. They have a great selection of raw and cook items on their menu. The ingredients are fresh and healthy.  Their Thai tea and milk tea were perfect. The staff is friendly and attentive, and the vibe of the restaurant was clean and inviting. Definitely coming back!

Hesitate to share how great this place is 'cuz one of the things I love is that it's always full but never crowded. Usually come by to sit outside in nice weather for dinner & drinks. Had an impromptu family holiday hungry after the movie group & everyone loved the place. Food & enough activity for kids from 12 - 60 yrs old. Really fabulous fire grilled menu. The pizzas were great with variety of toppings. I had chicken & veggies cooked just so you didn't feel you were missing something by eating healthy.
Also have great reasonably priced cocktails.

Delicious Empanadas 
A wonderful variety of choices to pick from.
Very nice people.
Hard to find a little.

Salt is the best seafood restaurant in downtown Indianapolis. Every time I foolishly attempt a non-Salt seafood platter I regret not dining again at Salt. 

The Salmon, Chilean Sea Bass are both excellent

3 words: Bam Bam Shrimp. DELISH! Seriously my favorite appetizer on the menu. Being fresh to Mount Juliet, I was super pumped to find a fun place to unwind. The atmosphere at Jonathan's is great. Location is super convenient. I love that this place had a happy hour almost every night, too. Sometimes the bar area can be slow, but that is to be expected when it's busy!
This place is fun for a date night; it has a prohibition style feel with fancy cocktails and very good food. I would recommend the Brussel sprouts and Korean chicken!

I never did find the reason for the name of this restaurant....
Went to the takeout area and ordered an Italian Grinder (large 18") Only after ordering, I found out that it would be 20 minutes or more and that the price was higher than I expected. If I had know this at the time I would have gone elsewhere.... BUT, that would have been a big "MISTAKE". Although it was very busy and the auto sliding door was constantly letting in freezing air we suffered though and finally got the grinder! 

On the first bite ... OMG! - Umami!, Top 10 best bites. I have been to dozens of 3D locations all over the USA, but rarely received the same reaction as Guy Fieri. Pinocchio's Grinder qualifies! - Toasted bread, great crumb/crust, melted cheese, lots of meat and huge!  They got the extras just as ordered. Vinegar/oil, salt/pepper, banana peppers, and extra mayo )no haters please - ha. I would have waited twice as long and paid twice as much (really) it was that good. I'm adding 2 pics, they are very bad (sorry)

Great guys! Great service!

Needed a tire in a pinch, and they took care of it quickly. Highly recommend!

I don't even want to donate this one star. It used to be okay buffet, at least the taste. But that no more lasts. The new way of the kitchen cooked for you and the low quality of the meat will disappoint you with no doubt. And the person who state himself as the manager is fully a swagger and in bad temper to "apologize", what I won't define as the action of apologize. No quality, no taste, bad temper,why do you go?

This is a great pizza place, especially for deep dish pizza. The rotating beer taps & selection is fabulous too (although right now, it's a little heavy on the hoppy side). We always love coming here because we feel like we're out of the norm in Indianapolis. The only drawback is the climate/temperature of the restaurant...there is a draft coming in from the back door of the restaurant and if the temperature outside is cold, you can really feel it. Great pizza & beer though!

Stayed here for two nights before the Christmas weekend. The place has a old school charm to it. We stayed in a deluxe room with a view of the lit up peddler's village. The staff is really friendly, we enjoyed our stay.

I stopped here today for the first time hoping to get something healthy and filling to go. This is a fairly small place and somewhat cramped so personally I would not sit down to eat here. I ended up ordering the white bean tuna salad and a side of focaccia bread to go. My food was ready quicker than I expected which was great. The salad ended up being delicious and the focaccia was just mediocre. The cashier was also very friendly. I would definitely return!

Great deals on shoes and clothes right now thru the end of next week! Hurry!
All of these Fly London 25% off! 
And much more! This place deals in luscious clothes and shoes that let you walk without pain.

Not worth it if you spend over $50. Good for VERY basic stuff but not granular level

The car I was having cleaned probably hasn't been cleaned on the inside for 5-6 years if I had to guess. 

Got the M5 which is inside and outside. They have more expensive packages. It says it takes an hour but they quoted 90 minutes which was fine. Keep in mind if you go beyond the morning it can be multiple hours even in freezing weather bc we are a vain society? Lol

M5 is $119 which is $130 after tax and $150 after tip. I'd rather go get 2 temps or day laborers and give them 45 minutes and $50-$75 each and I'm pretty sure they'd do a better job.

This place is good if you need a quick wash/detail aka hasn't been cleaned in 3 years minimum. 

Service was stellar just FYI but service isn't what I'm taking home.

They did it as estimated and I saw a few spots inside that I assumed were tough to get out bc again this car hasn't been cleaned in a long time. Nothing big. I'd say the equivalent of a few pimple size spots here and there. I gave them the BENEFIT OF DOUBT. I'm sure if I cared enough they would've tried to get it out but what was discovered after was so basic stuff you'd assume wouldve been taken care of originally. 

My brother takes a look at the car and had some cheap wipes from Walmart for $2.84 and I ended up using 6 and the photo you see is evidence of how poor of a job they did. High level they do great work but anything beyond no way is $150 worth it. He LIGHTLY rubbed the seats and dash and they were all filthy. Some spots were visible like coffee drops here and there which i admit were hard to catch but just evidence of how once again they are great for a quick clean but NOT detailed for $150

What makes it worse is that even if they offered a follow up I'd have to give up more of my day once again as I'm not in a position to do drop off service.

The fact that these Walmart wipes were barely used and filthy is where I do not have trust with Miles. I admit ignored Yelp.

My birthday for a princess was made possible by our awesome waiter, the food, and the drinks. OMG the drinks. So good.

Our party of 10 fluctuated from the reservation and they handled it with grace. In addition we had an infant and a gotten allergy -everyone was taken care of, above and beyond.

The plaintains. I'm still dreaming about them.

I can't say enough wonderful things about Shannon and the beautiful hair that she has always given me. She's been the only person I let touch my hair here in Nashville! She took me from blonde to redhead a year and a half ago and she so carefully listened to what I was envisioning and took into consideration some reference pictures I had brought. She intuited what I wanted and was able to give me a finished project that was better than I ever could have dreamed of! Every touch up and cut I've gotten since that first appointment has been masterful, and my color has lasted so beautifully that I still get compliments on my hair months after I've had it re-colored. I'm going back to blonde in January and I can't wait to do it with Shannon! Also, I can only speak for Shannon's work as of now but I trust that she's working alongside other stylists who are the best of the best as well!!

I've tried their bacos here dining in, and have gotten their vermicelli delivered via postmates and both were good but the flavors weren't that special to me. I've had a lot of Vietnamese food in NOLA so I'm kinda picky, but I did love that their chicken vermicelli came with a lot of chicken-almost too much! I actually wish it came with more veggies. Also, the lemongrass sauce that came with is was not very tasty and actually pretty oily, and their fish sauce was a little too spicy for me. Also, on postmates I ordered a jasmine matcha tea, and what I got tasted like a kombucha with milk. Very odd. Overall it was alright, and I'd settle for it again on mondays when almost every Vietnamese restaurant is closed.
Love the staff and food here. Space gets crowded quickly though, so prepare to wait for a table on busy days.

We had another great experience at Pearl's. Our waiter,Jacob was very good. My husband and I ordered the Oysters Rockefeller for an appetizer and they were very large and very delicious. 
  I ordered the Redfish and it was amazing. The sauce was perfect, it came with a few small potatoes that were very tender and great tasting. It also came with asparagus, which was prepared perfectly. 
  Husband ordered the sirloin and a small lobster tail and oh my goodness, they were both very very good. The small tail was really not very small at all and the sirloin was cooked just right. I will say that there is a sauce on the plate that i think was for the steak, but not necessary. Husband did mot care for the sauce, but I did!   Too full for dessert, but the pecan cheesecake was tempting to take home. Perhaps next time

This place is most certainly delicious, yet we don't eat here too often, just for special occasions.  I'm never a fan of navigating downtown Nashville traffic, but last night the dinner was well worth it!  Four of us ate here yesterday evening to celebrate my husband's birthday and there was PLENTY of cheese and chocolate to go around.  A little goes a long way with fondue, so I'd recommend sharing when possible.  

The Melting Pot's menu is large, which is definitely helpful as the four of us had very different cravings.  We started out with the Fiesta fondue, which was a little less spicy than I wanted, but it was very good. When it came to ordering my entree I was pleasantly surprised to find they had a delicious vegetarian platter that had artichoke, asparagus, tofu and edamame.  I'd known that Melting Pot had a good variety of tasty meats but since I've been trying to eat ease my carnivorous ways, it helped that I had other options at hand.  Our server seemed fairly new and not terribly knowledgeable about the menu, but he was so friendly that it didn't matter.

Even though I'd convinced myself that I was too full for dessert, I gobbled down the dark chocolate fondue with lots of bananas, brownies, strawberries and pond cake.  It was too delicious to resist.

Getting a reservation on the weekend was a little harder since they were busy, so I'd say try to come during the week!  And get multiple courses for the full yummy experience.
french dip ,good.Fries,tepid.bam bam shrimp,frozen and pasty. Good place to see a game though.
Beer was very good. I dominated at giant connect 4. My review needs to be longer. Done.

Two of us dropped in here on a Saturday 7:30-8 when the rest of the local establishments had a wait for a place to sit. This place will be among them soon. The food is beautiful, cocktails are eclectic and spot-on, and the staff is knowledgeable, friendly and attentive. The pricing is very reasonable. It was one of the happiest accidents of my holiday season.

A TOTAL RIP OFF. Aside from a clean and well kept facility, this place is seriously a rip off. One thing I miss about living in Los Angeles are the laundromats. I've been to this laundromat (Laundry on Pantano) twice since moving to Tucson and this second time around was the worse experience I've ever had in all of my years of going to laundromats. For starters, they charge $3.00 for the laundry card  cause of the chip on the card. You must only use the card to feed the machines (no coins). That in itself just swayed me the wrong way (the $3.00 for the card). Washers and dryers are ridiculously expensive, it was almost $6.00 for a 4 load washer. What really tipped me over was the big industrial sized dryers. I had to dry blankets and I placed just two blankets in one of these industrial sized dryers (.90/10mins) and after $4.00 having gone into that dryer, my blankets STILL weren't dried. The worker explained to me AFTER my third Dollar, that when I insert the laundry card, it's a good idea to press 10 mins into the dryer, take the card out, do another 10 mins, take care out and do it again (if I want 30 mins) AND THEN start the dryer.  Cause if you run the dryer just for 10 mins every $.90, it wont dry thoroughly cause your getting 8 mins of dry time and 2 mins cool down, its best to run the dryer more than 10 mins. AND THAT I HAD NO IDEA OF. I wish it was notated somewhere by the dryers after having fed my dryer $3.00...idk i spent dang near $40 on washing 5 blankets and 6 pillow cases. Ridiculous! I'm sorry but I won't be back at this laundromat ever again.

Was really looking forward to trying this place, but unfortunately I just wasn't that impressed. I came for lunch and ordered a burrito bowl, complete with rice, beans, chorizo, pico and grilled veggies. They have a salsa bar in the back where you can get cups of salsa to add to your meal so i sampled a few of those and mixed my favorites into my bowl. 

Overall, everything was just OK. The portions are huge, and I was very full and couldn't even finish. But honestly it just wasn't spectacular. It totally
Looks better than it tastes. You can tell they are trying to be like chipotle or moes but in my opinion they just aren't quite there. At least not yet. 

The hype just wasn't there for me, and I left pretty disappointed and honestly not feeling the greatest. Not saying I'll never be back but don't think I'll be there anytime soon

Staying at the Ramada so I ordered a meal for myself to go. I go and pick it up, and it's $18 for the fried steak meal (with eggs, hash browns and pancakes) and a cup of coffee. That seems a little ridiculous to me for ihop. Also, hours after eating it, I got food poisoning. Save yourself the money and your health.
Pretty decent pie for a chain. Good salads too. Been here twice and both times most the tables were dirty. Little over priced considering.

I've been looking forward to trying one of their places and finally had the chance in Philadelphia. Tried the trio and clam chowder. Sandwiches were okay but very pedestrian, while the chowder lacked personality. Kind of overpriced but what do you expect for shellfish. Don't plan to repeat.
Don't get the Chofu tacos! There was an indescribable and unappealing seasoning blend. I ordered two tacos... and decided to just eat the tortillas because I couldn't stomach the odd flavors.
Excellent food at a great price. Old country charm and friendly service. A must-see if you're in the area!

Wasn't the best sushi buffet I've ever been to, wasn't the worst. But in my opinion if my favorite thing was the crepe station for dessert, that's a problem at a seafood and sushi buffet.

The sushi itself was decent-I really liked the rice it was perfectly cooked. My favorite was this vegetarian sushi that had beet rice with avocados, carrots and cucumber. The spicy shrimp and the shrimp tempura was also amazing. Some of the other rolls I tried made me want to puke, but that's probably personal taste over certain types of seafood. I don't like much raw fish, so I skipped those options.

They had snow crab legs, which my fiancé loved and while I thought they were okay, I'm not a fan of them ice cold so I barely had any. 

Their fried and grilled entrees and hibachi station were decent. I loved their beef teriyaki and butterfly shrimp. The hibachi beef and veggies we sampled was just ok but I think I could've made it myself and made it more flavorful.

The dessert was the best part (again, I think that's problematic at a seafood place). The crepe station was awesome and they had so many different fillings. Their soft serve ice cream is also really really good, which is rare at buffets. We both had two servings! They have some other little cookies and cakes but I didn't try too many of those. 

The service was good, our waiter was on top of refilling our water and if you want this place is BYOB so that's also nice if you want to bring alcohol. 

Overall, I just don't think this place is good for $32.99 a person. I would expect it to be amazing and it was just eh. We left a bit disappointed.
Wow, this place is legit! Super friendly staff, delicious rolls--enjoyed the dragon and samurai.  Poke bowl was excellent.   Happened upon this place while passing thru SB, and will come back.

I love this Skyzone in general. But there are some things that I don't absolutely love. Here is everything in a little chart.


Pros:
-Great customer service quality
-Employees in jump zones keep it under control
-Separation of age groups in jump zones (so there are no problems)
-Good food area
-Great for birthday parties

Cons:
-Not many things to do
-Dodgeball games not really fair (all the good players on one team)
-Have to buy SkySocks to jump (if you don't bring your own from previous purchase)
-Restricted from doing some tricks

So those are my pros and cons about this Skyzone.
I don't normally eat burgers and this place was sensational! Great food & great service! The beers were awesome! Highly recommend stoping here.

My husband and I made a reservation at Little Nonna's for a nice evening out. It's a quaint and cozy restaurant on Locust Street perfect for an intimate dinner of comfort food. We ordered the antipasto plate and it was amazing. The cheese (burata), meats, olives, veggies were all delicious and very fresh. We got the caesar salad, Sunday Gravy and Rigatoni Alla vodka for entrees (we usually share everything so we can try more). They were all also very good. The Rigatoni alla vodka was definitely my favorite as it had the most flavor. I definitely recommend coming here for a dinner as a couple or a small group. Come hungry because the pasta is very filling!

I was shopping in King of Prussia and stumbled into this restaurant. The staff welcomed me and talked me through the menu. I ended up creating my own bowl, which was lamb meatball, brown rice, sauce and Nan bread. It was very tasty and prepared fast. The establishment was very modern and clean.

One of the best meals our family has ever eaten, hands down. Great staff, BEAUTIFUL restaurant, and awesome food. If you have the opportunity to go during the holidays, GO! The entire grand ballroom is decked out in magnolia garland and wreaths and is truly stunning. The food and drinks were to die for. My sister-in-law and I split the crab cakes and crabmeat Karen (we couldn't decide) and it was a toss up as to which was better. I would say if you're on the fence and aren't hugely hungry, go the crab cakes, they are smaller and lighter. The endive salad was killer and all of the desserts we shared were the perfect cap to the dinner. This is definitely worth a return visit.

They gave us some burnt egg rolls and when we asked if they were burnt they said they're served like that. The boba tea was hot and not the correct one but wouldn't fix it for me. Our waiter disappeared for about 30 minutes. I will not be going back there ever again. Bad service and bad food.

Horrible customer service. They never answer and keep your car for hours. The whole staff has zero training on customer service. The employees are always on their phones texting. I took my car for an Oil change and right after I picked it up my car started to vibrate each time I press the brakes. I went back in and they guy Named Jordan who is their service manager said their is nothing that we did that would cause this. He was super rude and looked incompetent to know what answer he should provide me. Horrible customer service experience!!! Do not Take your car here. I always get my services done at Toyota but this location has really disappointed me.

Since I've moved to Boise numerous people have told me about this place. My family is Italian so for me it's hard going to an Italian  restaurant everything is compared to my folks cooking. So a friend invited me the other night and I said what the heck. As soon as I walked in i knew this wasn't going to be a great experience. First off the service was meh the bread seriously hard pass on that and the wine was a no as well. I ordered the cioppino an Italian Fish soup/stew. Large serving but I wasn't impressed but it wasn't horrible. I would say this place is a step above olive garden not horrible but not great.

Recently had Focus Photo Suites at our company Holiday Party and they were AWESOME!  Polite, professional staff, great pricing and the pictures looked nothing less than professional quality.  Thank you for helping to make our holiday party a success!!

This location is pretty cool. Lots of space and machines. Cardio is all upstairs which is nice. The locker room could be a little bigger considering the gym size. Typical LA FITNESS gym with a pool sauna and hot tub, the things I care about most. I'll be using this location while I'm in town for the holidays.
Delicious food, great service. The arepas are huge, fresh and tasty. I'll be coming back for more very soon!

The meat is good, often superb.

Fish and poultry are usually nice.

The bakery is good but not exceptionally so.

The groceries are a bit too precious and expensive.

There are some interesting specialty items but not more than a good deli would have.

There is a lot of catering to the urban crowd that believe that 'organic' produce is healthier and will pay the earth for it and that endless non-dairy too has magical properties.

These things take a load of space and reduce the selection for those of use who are not strangers to research and nutrition based on evidence and reason not magical thinking and hope. I have no issues with people's beliefs, just that they tend to overwhelm other possibilities.

For example, the ability to purchase white sugar for baking without being scrutinized for political correctness.

I enjoy the store though, and because it has heated parking it is a great place on those cold winter evenings.

This is a good addition to the Sun King tasting room, but some kinks need to be ironed out first.

I ordered the bratwurst with sauerkraut which was advertised as having Bavarian mustard.   However, when I received my order, there was no mustard on it.    I brought it back up and asked for the mustard that was supposed to be on my wurst.   I received a little cup of their sweet whole mustard seeds instead of the spicy mustard that Bavaria is known for.    Now don't get me wrong, but I love all kinds of mustard.    They just have to be paired properly with the food.

The sausage and kraut were delicious and served on a nice crusty roll, but the mustard situation was a disappointment.  I don't know if the staff are still getting familiar with the menu, or if the menu is wrong, but something wasn't clicking this day.

I am a big fan of Goose the Market ("Oca" means goose) and their meats so I am hopeful that this stays D works out.
This is one of my happy places.  The ambience, the OMG cheeses and the great wine makes me never want to leave.

I was hesitant to call Joe Cool after seeing some scary reviews on here, but I did so because they were the guys who apparently installed my two units for the previous home owner. They got Daniel out to us right away and he was professional, happy, transparent and extremely good at his job. He went above and beyond and went out of his way to minimize the impact to my wallet. I will continue to use them, and I'll ask for Daniel every time.

I had such a great experience at Green Ginger! The restaurant is new, the decor is very fitting. The staff is very friendly, the waitress took her time to explain all the items that I had questions about. I had the shrimp ramen, it was hands down the best ramen I have ever had. The waitress brought out a special spicy sauce that she was so excited to share with us. I will definitely be returning to try the other flavors of ramen, and of course the sushi!
I neglected to add a picture of my dinner,  Duck and Asparagus over noodles. Light cream sauce, very flavorful

I would give no stars if I could. Between the bartender's bad attitude and the fact that they were out of everything, it was a dismal experience and we decided to get the check after the appetizer. This was a favorite restaurant of ours in the past, but we will not be back.

First the waitress forgot my order, then when the shrimp scampi came, the pasta was over cooked, the sauce was runny and salty.  I ate three bites, trying to force it down, alas I gave up.  The waitress didn't even question why a fat guy didn't hate any of his meal.  We had a large party, so tip was included, but so was a service charge.  Twenty+ dollar lunch and it was inedible.  I didn't even like the roll and butter.  This place is a case of style over substance.

10 Barrel is one of our favorite places to go as a family and for date night without the kids.  Great beer AND the Fried Chicken Sando is my fav buffalo chicken sandwich in Boise.  The nachos are unique and definitely a crowd-pleaser!  The kids love the Mac and cheese and the pizza of course... and served on a 10 Barrel frisbee.

Excellent freshly cooked food. My chicken tacos, with avocado added, were perfect.  My husbands regular sized burrito was huge and delicious.  Great stop after buying Florida citrus across the street.

This place has been here for a LONG time and its super good. I couldn't believe how good it was for the price. Its cash only, ATM onsite, and the staff is super fun and friendly. Check it out. Its a good dinner or chill date night. Go here 100%

Have eaten her twice a month for years .
Sometimes great service sometimes ok service .
Food is always worth every nickel for sure .

However went there tonight and ordered create your own 
Ordered the Salmon and shrimp scampi .
Saw the price and figured that was fair 

Waitress didn't give us what we ordered .
2 pieces of salmon and no shrimp scampi ?
She did finally get our scampi to us after we had finished our meal .

But the kicker was for me the " up charge " for Salmon ?

Although the price said $19.95 for the ginger Salmon !
Just below that in smaller print was an
" up charge " for Salmon ?
WTH ?
Put this so called up charge in the price and stop playing stupid games .
Pretty sly and dishonest in my book.

The extra $3.50 per plate isn't going to break anyone ,it's just the bullshit way they do it !
Even the waitress stated they didn't used to do this .

Red Lobster NO MORE 

A lot of other places to eat and not have to study the menu for any
sneaky add on charges  ,

Feels like Obama care tricks ,
#redlobsterscam

I went to the salon to get a Brazilian Wax + Stomach Strip and boy was this a pitch job and messy. My Waxer was Rebekah. She was very pleased to to talk to but she was just not careful. She didn't do small sections like the other waxers, instead she did huge sections. I had Wax all over me. Just strings all over my stomach. EVERYWHERE. I had to peel it off and hand it to her. Overall she is nice however, if I can save someone their money I would 100% not recommend for a Brazilian Wax. I usually just bounce around and take any waxer I can get but this was just horrible. I've gone there every month since Feb and I needed to say something about this one because it was horrible.

I was super impressed with my first Apple Walnut St experience! I made an appt for the Genius Bar via the Apple Store app. I was able to get in the following evening. Upon arrival, I was asked if I needed assistance but I knew where I needed to go. There was someone designated for Genius Bar check ins. I was helped by Chris within 5 min of my appt time. Chris was very knowledgeable and easily helped me with my issue. A diagnostic test was run confirming that I Indeed needed a new battery. I had to leave my phone there for 1.5 hrs but I got a new battery installed for $79 + tax. I noticed how great all the employees were who were interacting w customers. Working at an Apple store at holiday time can't be easy. I was very impressed and was very happy my phone got fixed in store. 

The store is also pet friendly.
We love this place! Great food.  Great service.  Extremely friendly owner who never seems to go home.  A Philly gem that we've been to many times.

Great southern hospitality. The burger is delicious and the chicken and waffles is a-maz-ing! This cozy place is just off of Broadway so it's right by the action but is a great place to just relax. The staff is friendly and makes you feel right at home. It's kid/family friendly and it's open 24 hrs so you can pop in any time. Loved it!

I walked into this antique store having no idea how much I would love it! I came looking for 2 small items but instead found several unexpected large items that I simply must have in my new house. The place is huge with an incredible variety of merchandise. Very accommodating staff as well. Don't rush through...there are hidden gems everywhere.

We had such a great experience shopping for a motor home with salesman Dave W.  He was knowledgeable, asked pertinent questions and showed us only what we'd expressed interest in.  We found "the one" Jayco Greyhawk. The buying process was a bit more challenging as we wanted to do our own financing and that I'd definitely not what the dealership prefers.  When we got to the dealership to pick the motor home up, the troubles began.  The RV had not been "gone through with a fine tooth comb"- the door lock on the coach was rusted and the key didn't work, the armrest on the passenger seat didn't work... in hindsight, we should have left the RV there for them to fix, but alas, we'd paid for it and wanted to take it home!  The service department was a nightmare to work with and the worst part is that NOBODY calls you back... the customer service is terrible, because nobody calls back! Being in the service industry myself, it's frustrating to be treated so poorly and ignored.  Phone calls are easy.  Returning phone calls is easy- if it weren't for Dave W., Marnie B, and Crystal T., we wouldn't ever return to Bish's.  We love our motor home, but we sure hope nothing goes wrong with it and we need (further) help with it.

We love Southwest! 

Every time I look for flights Southwest always has the best deals. And you also get a checked bag to fly for free as long as it's under 50lbs and of course your one carry on bag.

I've flown a few times and this was by far my favorite airline. It was my husbands first time flying and he was nervous. We had a great flight to and from our destination. He said he only wants to fly southwest now. 

The flight attendants and staff were all super nice and friendly.

Definitely one of the best manicures I've received.  They use a brush to help wipe off any excess that gets on your fingers, which is the first time I've seen that (granted I haven't done THAT many manicures.).  I didn't notice any mistakes, and after a whole week, still no chipping at all (not gel).

They also give you an arm message before they do your nails and a neck massage while your nails are drying.

IF you make the mistake of going here, inspect your car thoroughly before paying and leaving.  When I got home found their rags in my car and missing a floor mat.  ALSO make sure they are charging you correctly according to their posted price list.   I was given two different quotes only to be overcharged according to their written prices.  GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!
The food is delicious and the staff is nice. I enjoyed the Pan de Queso, and I highly recommend that. Good job y'all .

Shot down to Tucson for a few days and was able to catch two Breweries that have long been on my list - Borderlands and Pueblo Vita.  I've been a fan of NE Style IPAs and Toole Ave by Borderlands has been one of my favs for a while now.  The Clever Koi and Total Wine up in the Gilbert/Chandler area have both been carrying it and I've been drinking it as fast as I can.  I've also heard great things about their German Chocolate Cake (from the whining pig) which I was surprised to find a porter, not a stout.  

On arrival, I found a laid back and comfy bench style seating and barstools gathered around a good sized bar.  The tender was not a young kid and had a great knowledge of the brews they had and was very welcoming and fun to talk to.  He helped us score some good pizza from around the corner and eventually walked me through all of their beers.  I did a flight and really enjoyed all 5 brews.  I did go back to the Toole Ave which I just love so much but would have been happy with any of the 5 I tasted.    

Cool artwork is scattered throughout the place and some of it is for sale.  Bathrooms are locking and very large and were clean.  They had a few sandwiches behind the bar but also are stocked with a ton of local menus who deliver.  The music was just my style but others in our group were caught whining most likely because they jamming in the 80's to Menudo and not the punk I was.  I heard some DK, Clash, Sex Pistols, and Circle Jerks which I've not heard in quite a while.  Fun!

I hear they have great live music but we were day drinking so we missed it.  Great outdoor area if you want to grab a pint outside as well.  Nothing but nice and chill people were boozin here and we met a lot of fun and interesting peeps - even a few pups (they are very dog-friendly) 

After hitting a few other places I can say that Borderlands was comfy, cool, and know how to brew a great beer.  I'll be back when I head down South and hope to see more of their stuff in the Phx area.  Big cheers to their brew and layout.  A Tuscon winner for sure.

Beignets were cooked once you ordered, so they were piping hot.  They were light and airy.  They are very generous with the powdered sugar that they sift over top.  

It's a nice neighborhood atmosphere.  Glad we stopped by.

Have been there 6 or 7 times always great this past time went with just me and my 2 sons 4 and 6 not the easiest thing to do usually but this place got us in and out quickly boys loved all the TVs to watch and the food. Will keep going back.

Came here on a recommendation from a friend who had visited New Orleans recently, but probably would have stopped by anyway because of the hype!

We lived close to the area, so we walked past Acme multiple times a day and there was always a line!!! We came around 5PM on a Sunday. The restaurant space itself is pretty crowded, and the walking corridors can basically only fit one person at a time...so don't knock anything over or bump into anyone.

The chargrilled are the experience...that buttery flavor, wow. I got the New Orleans Medley and tried a raw oyster, and while the jambalaya and sausage were good and the raw oyster was big, the star is definitely the chargrilled oysters.

My friends also tried the Bread Pudding but said that it was too sweet.

I was at the St. Pete Saturday morning market and am so glad I chose to stop by Sweet Magnolia's tent. I got the last Brie and Bacon (+Caramelized onion) stuffed croissant, and was so glad I did! It was tender and melted in my mouth as I perused the vendors. A lady even stopped the middle of her conversation to ask where I got it, that's how good this looked. It was so delicious I forgot to to take a picture, oops. Other than the wonderful stuffed croissants, they had lots of pastries that looked as delicious. Whenever I'm at the Saturday morning market, this will be my go to place.

Quikaid is the best place to go for all of your Social Security disability needs. Our entire staff is extremely knowledgeable and can answer any questions you may have. We work long days, and even weekends, to make sure that all of our cases are getting the attention they need and deserve. Stop by and see us! We are happy to help!

Fast service, friendly people, and a cool old school vibe. It has been forever since I've been into a Barbershop vs. a salon or franchise haircut chain (where the number of haircuts in an hour is valued over an actual good quality haircut).
And when I say fast service I mean I didn't have to wait, not that my haircut was rushed so they can get the next person in the chair. 
The price is right and is competitive with chain salons, where in my experience you get a good haircut half the time, and the other half is a roll of the dice at best. I'm not trying to bash chain salons, I'm only sharing my personal experience over the years. 
I'm glad I found Douglas Barbershop, being that I need to look presentable to my real estate clients 100% of the time, a good haircut is one less thing for me to worry about.

I come for the sandwiches. I've had them all, and they never fail to disappoint. The chicken kebab sandwich needed a little salt on the chicken but other than that,  delish. 

I suppose  I'll eventually try some of their other dishes lol.

Awesome find!  They have a very clean place with friendly service.  The food is amazing with many options on the buffet.  Lunch buffet is offered Tues-Sun.  First time for me, many others walking in are recognized as regulated.  If I lived closer I would be here often.  Enjoy!!

Picked up a tri-tip plate for dinner. Smallest portions ever! Maybe 4 oz of meat with a tiny pile of mashed potatoes and a few veggies on the side. And the meat was so tough I almost choked to death trying to get the first bite down. Also very bland. They screwed up the dessert also, ordered the butter berry cake for dessert(this was all to go) and they put the berry sauce on the cake, instead of on the side so it was a soggy mess by the time we got home and finished dinner, and they completely forgot the vanilla ice cream that was supposed to be with it. Very disappointing.

Passed by this place many times and thought it looked like a cool bar but was not aware that they have a fair amount of food and not just pub grub. Surprisingly they had some vegan options. I had the buffalo tofu sandwich which I told was nice and spicy. It was good, too much bread and not spicy enough for me. The onion rings were really good, not too greasy and a little burnt (but I liked that). My buddy got the chicken sandwich and he thought it was great. They were out of a lot of the stuff we originally wanted, mostly appetizers and sides but no big deal.
The decor inside was old tyme nautical in nature with sail boat videos playing, old bell diving helmets and seats made out of barrels and ships wheels. Felt like I was a longshoreman  on furlough in some New England town. Super friendly staff to boot. Cool place, I'll be back.

Fantastic! Each tamale flavor we tried was mouth watering. My husband and i couldn't get enough of the side dishes. I could eat the spicy black beans and cole slaw all day. Don't even get me started on the salsa verde, I would drink it just to have more. Bonus points for multiple VEGAN tamale choices!

I've never been to NOLA but when I walked in I definitely knew I was there. This place looks like a mix of Joe's Crab Shack and Bubba Gump Co. I had the Jambalya, it was ok...wasn't impressed. Our waitress was really nice and the manager was really friendly. The Bourbon pecan pie....ummm I needed an Uber after having that. It's SOOOOO strong, kinda takes away from the fact that it's actually good pie. Oh did I mention its  two story place but has no elevators? You have to walk up like 25 Rickety old wooden steps to get to the second floor...kinda sucks for someone with bad knees.
Very cool place!  Great atmosphere!  Great beer!  A great selection of local beers and national beers. Great service!  We will be back!

Let's start with 6oz burgers. When I go out for a burger, I want to go big, but not half-pound big - who invented that idea? Therefore, 6oz is a nice indulgent "just right" middle size. Burgers come in an English muffin, and while I appreciate a nice toasted brioche, I much prefer db's English Muffin - the bread does not overwhelm the burger.

Ah, the burger...perfectly cooked, and graced with green chiles, grilled onions, pesto, and an egg over easy (in my case - dbhouse plus the chiles and onions). The frites are pretty good too, but I am not a fry fanatic; while I put a dent in the pile, the portion was big for me, whereas my kiddo and hubs ate theirs to the bottom. They have malt vinegar (available on request) so I got to scratch a little British-chip-shop itch that came out of nowhere. 

The kid burger was a little small for our 9yo - it's half-size, and he could have eaten a full-size. 2/3 might be just right. Still, it's a good option.

Prices: Tucson seems to be able to support $13-15 burgers, and that's where we are, paying for good quality. Total bill is not your typical burger joint bill, but this isn't your typical burger joint.

Beers: selection is small but solid. We both had Deep Canyon Amber. Delish, especially as I ran the Tucson Marathon in the morning and had really earned it! At $6/pint, it's overpriced. 

Overall - we will be back! Great burgers, fun atmosphere and we enjoyed chatting with the other people at our table. It's kid-friendly too.

Ordered takeout -- got the chicken abruzzi entree which was delicious and perfect size for two people. Also tried the caesar salad. Was $9 for a bunch of cut up romaine, croutons, and some parm cheese. Did not provide enough dressing for the entire salad. Not worth $9. Will try a different salad next time.

I liked this place already when I walked in. The vibe is alive here. Everyone is so friendly and inviting. They have so many topping options. I modified a pizza they already had. I like spicy sausage, basil, tomatoes, white sauce, mushrooms, & asiago. I should have added ricotta too! Oh and I can never turn down pesto. You walk along the assembly line towards the register as you add items to your pizza. I've been to one of these pizza concept places before but the pizza here is better. If you want a beer with your pizza, they got you covered. I like that they have a few different sizes. You can come for snack size or medium personal size. Decent prices and the pizza is ready in no time! This place gets busy. They don't have enough seats for people to take their time to chat. I got up after I finished so that someone else can sit down. Bus your own trays.
Great driving school. Great staff. They do all scheduling and follow your progress til you have your license. Would recommend to all my family and friends.

My new favorite restaurant! The drinks and food are superb even if you're not vegan but if you're vegan it's like finally finding water in a desert as there are very few good vegan options in Santa Barbara. The atmosphere is beautiful both inside and on the patio. Our party just ordered a bunch of the smaller plates and shared them. I especially enjoyed the Brussels sprouts and the artichoke "crab" cakes. The soup was excellent as well. We need more restaurants like this in Santa Barbara.

When I moved from Wilmington, Delaware, I was concerned that I would be unable to find an Indian store which could ever compete with the quality and customer service provided at the Apna Bazaar Indian store near Kirkwood highway in Wilmington. I was wrong. The Bharat bazaar store is a fantastic store with great customer service. Go find Reshma Ji if you ever have any issues in the store or want to order something that you cannot find in the store.

I wouldn't suggest working with the folks at Perry. Although their sales associates are friendly, the business is run terribly. After depositing a hold check that was to be shredded, it took them an entire day to figure out what happened all while maintaining the lowest level of customer service. They had already sold the us vehicle so they couldn't care less about making their mistake right. Last time I buy or refer anyone to Perry Ford and Mazda.
