My puppy got bit from something that caused her entire face to swell, visiting from out of town we came here as it was the only animal hospital open that late and glad we did! Gentle and very informative and helpful! Extremely clean and every pet including mine was helped in a timely manner! Please open another hospital as great as this one in San Jose , Ca!

This drive thru coffee shop is so accommodating and the girls are very friendly. The snowy mocha is perfection and they had something for everyone in my car from the hot chocolate to the smoothies. The customer service was exceptional and I will return every time I'm in the area.

We have been here twice in the last month. First time, the pizza was cooked perfectly. I like it crispy and lots of garlic. We stopped by last Sat nite and it was packed, but our wait for 2 was only 5 minutes. We ordered a pizza and man, it came out charred top and bottom! This pie was beyond well done, and the burnt taste overcame any taste of the toppings. We mentioned it to the waitress and she said next time order it not burnt. We like the place and will try it again.

The lady who works the counter is so nice and the donuts are so good! Def go here! My debit card wouldn't work after I ordered(identity theft) and she let me go with the donuts anyway and trusted I would pay her back(I did). Tasty and fresh

This place was highly recommended but I found the food to be bland for a Mexican restaurant and the margarita was very watered down & not tasty.  I tried the taco salad with fish and my husband had tacos.  Really not remarkable.  Would come back for live music & draft beers though since they have an upper deck for late night.

Not bad for burgers but the sliders are pretty small for $3.  The classic was good and the blue slider wasn't bad.  I also ordered a regular cheesesteak poutine and that was pretty good too.  It wasn't bad to stop for some fast food but it can get pricey if you eat a lot.

Flowers were fine.. But the genius delivery person placed the vase directly in front of- and flat up against my front door.  I couldn't open the front door because of this- I had to knock the vase over with the door in order to open it- spilled water out and mussed up the arrangement a little.  Not too swift of the delivery person.  There was plenty of room off to the side to place these flowers.   Not sure why they chose to place them where they did.

So glad to have a Mexican place in town. The food was fresh and delicious. Combo chicken and steak fajitas, garlic shrimp and chicken burrito were all prepared perfectly. BYOB makes it even better. The cheese dip appetizer was bland and we wouldn't get it again. Only suggestion is to fix the music. It was in and out during our whole meal. The music adds to the ambiance. We will be back.

...so I bought a 2014 Nissan Ultima from this dealership in July 2017. The experience was "ok" overall. It started out great but due to some mishandled followup issues I had to take points away...that is until just 3 wks ago when I needed someone to pull strings with the DMV cause I never received my permanent registration card and here it was December about to go into a new year and Iam driving around with no legitimate registration from Philadelphia to Montgomery County to work everyday. No one had the answer until Stephanie from this Enterprise Dealership stepped in and confidently assured me it is a common problem & her 10 yrs experience could handle this quickly & she did!! What should have happened 3 months ago she resolved in 10 days. Not to mention how pleasant and happy she is. Any referrals I have will go to her for sure. She made this place look "golden"

This was such a weird experience. Because of Yelp, we l went to have their buffet lunch. The tandoori chicken was looking like baked chicken. The tikka masala was broken sauce and very little chicken. Like no other Indian I have ever seen/been to. We left. Not recommended!

Went to Dave and Busters in New Orleans on a Saturday around 4pm. I liked that parking is in a garage. The business is located on the 6th floor and elevators open directly to the facility. We decided to eat here as well. There are two options for eating. You can find your own table next to the gaming area on the floor or head to the back area that has restaurant style service where you are seated by staff. We initially opted to find our own table but after waiting with 2 other parties for a clean table for more than 15 minutes we decided to go in the restaurant area. There was no wait and we were seated immediately. The food was not good. It taste like warm frozen food. The kids barely finished. We spent $80 on food which was a waste! Next time we will eat elsewhere and just visit the gaming area. We had 3 little ones and the each had the $23 cards. They were able to play a lot of the games and had a lot of fun. My recommendation is to go to play, don't go to eat!

My wife and I went in for the first time to get our glasses done, after shopping at other stores in the plaza they texted both of us within 4 mins for my wife's frames, then mine after 11 mins. The fastest service ever :)

This was a very good experience. My family and I were visiting for the holidays and we were told to go there. Almost as soon as we got there we were seated. The food was very very good and the service was amazing. They were very polite, thy told us about everything on the menu (lots of German food) and they made sure that we all got what we needed. And I will say. Their chocolate milkshakes are fabulous!! I would definitely recommend going to The Pharmacy. And I will absolutely go there again when I'm back in Nashville.

The guy at the front desk was very nice and helpful, but the nail tech I had (I believe her name was Kim), could've taken a little more time to do a better job of filing. She filed all of my naturally square nails on a slant which made them look crooked. I had to ask for a file to fix them myself- which I know displeased her. Overall, the experience was ok. Will I return? Maybe... I think I'll try a few other places first.
Great food and service plus the prices were very reasonable! Looks like we found our new favorite Mexican restaurant!

I really enjoyed proper bagel. Their staff was very friendly and was willing to explain everything to me since it was my first time. I got a Nova Sandwich on a poppy seed bagel. It was was fresh and tasty but I did think that $15 was a little expensive for what I got. The parking is pretty terrible if you don't get lucky with finding a spot. But overall I enjoyed it and will come back.

My family and I ordered the fried chicken (sides: Mac n cheese and greens), half sack ribs (sides: Butter beans and sweet potatoes), and kids burger (Mac n cheese). The fried chicken and ribs were delicious. The ribs had a great smoke flavor. They were cooked perfectly. The chicken could have been more crunchy but that's my preference. The sides were okay. The best being the butter beans. The sweet potatoes were more of a purée--made it feel like it was baby food. The environment was nice and clean.

Dr. Trueba (Wiseman Animal Hospital) and his staff are not only capable with the highest training and standards, but caring and thoughtful. I have held " Dr. Joe " in the highest regard for well over 30 years. Highly recommended.

You *must* come here for the fried eggplant. It was incredible. Well spiced, very crispy exterior and soft interior.

Then I'd suggest going somewhere else for the rest of your meal. 

The good: Service was very good. Great french fries. Beautiful location. Came here for lunch and it was sunny outside. The big french doors gave the place's interior an incredible light. 

The average: I got the grilled oysters and the oysters rockerfeller. 

When I ordered the oysters rockerfeller, I somehow said no bacon - mistake! Those oysters came with a overpowering cheese-spinach mix. The texture of the oysters was good.

The grilled oysters texture was near perfect but the parmesan used felt overpowering in flavor.

Went here for my first time and loved it.. the best part is the threading didn't hurt.. one of my biggest pet peeves.. when I did go there was a wait (which counts for something) so expect to be patient.. but the room is small but perfect.. they prefer cash and not card.. don't forget to tip

I really like the whole concept at Athenian Nail Spa & Bar. This was my first time visiting and I can say I will definitely be back for my future pedicures. My nail tech was a little too quite made it a bit awkward but she did a pretty good job. Next time I go I'll be sure to bring a friend. So  I will recommend to friends and family.
Real good Indian food with good vegetarian options. Loved their buffet and the fresh naans. Service is excellent.

Get in here for the St Boniface 3lb IPA. Sunday night after 5 the tacos are mix and match! 

Started with the fish tacos and brew. Add verde sauce or habanero for a kick in the palate. 

Continued my Sunday night hunger fest with the eggplant enchilada. Erin, the bartender also shakes up some nice cocktails. She's very professional and attentive at the bar. Her recommendations are straightforward and true. 

Oh-KAY, recommend a strong finish. Go for the brisket taco, served with jicama adobo. Hearty, succulent, and satisfying. To stop the shaking, go for the Flying Fish Red Ale.
The San Gennaro Pizza was half cooked. Hate uncooked dough, even though the toppings were flavourful.

Terrible customer service...
Very disappointed. 
$27 for a pizza that was not what we ordered, twice.  We asked for extra sauce & light cheese. 
As you can see in the photo, almost no sauce & heavy cheese. 
When asked to speak with management, we were told, the manager was too busy. 
We will not be back.  
Does anyone know who the owners are?

Seriously, so good!! After moving from Hawaii (good Mexican food is nonexistent there) we were craving the good stuff. Low and behold we found it! Queso = fantastic. Burrito supreme = I'll take 2! Enchilada supreme = yes please! Margarita pitcher? Do I really need to let you know they a great?! Seriously we were so happy we found this place when arriving today. We will be going back soon!

After two attempts at this place, it hasn't gotten any better. The Ramen is such a poor quality that it more resembles plain soup. The broth is particularly egregious but the noodle are actually about a 3-Star experience. The gyoza were also not bad. I'd return for another order of those if I were in a pinch. But the ramen....? No. Sorry. Otherwise, the service is OK. Won't be returning, but give them a shot. Maybe you'll like the food.

I have read so many food articles about how Olive and Oak has the best thing going in the St. Louis culinary scene right now. It's taken me a long time to finally try it (namely due to their long waitlist for a reservation and I'm more of a last minute person). If you're like me and have a hard time making a reservation a month in advance come by and try it on a Monday like I did where I had no trouble getting a table. Every choice you have to make is difficult but if the entire wait staff is anything like our waitress on Monday then they do a great job guiding you through your experience. The cocktail menu is complex and creative, where their beer selection is certainly not lacking either. We chose the blue crab dip appetizer which comes highly recommended by both the staff and Yelpers alike. While their menu changes daily the blue crab dip never waivers. It was just as good as advertised with a creamy flavorful dip atop soft pretzel bread slices. Our waitress also brought us slices of Union Loafers bread (mad love for Union Loafers) with honey, cracked pepper, and salted butter sooo delicious! For our entrees my dad had the beef tenderloin which was perfectly cooked and tender atop a beautiful polenta. I had the rabbit pot pie which had a beautiful flaky crust and absolutely delicious! We finished our meal with the much raved about butterscotch pot de crème. It had a delicious granola topping that added a wonderful cinnamon finish. I'm so sold on this restaurant and it's already a new favorite!

Sat at the bar. Wait for a table on a Saturday night (early/6:00ish). Great bartender (Zac). Wait time for food was too long. Food was ok, nothing spectacular. Would try again. Could have been a fluke. Place was mobbed when we left, and the line to get in was almost around the corner.

This place is absolutely divine!!! We started off with the the whipped feta with bacon... great addition to any meal. The butternut squash soup was superb! The fire roasted carrots are always a family favorite. The sweet papas bravas stole the show!!! It was truly amazing!!! One of my all time favorites. As our main entree we got the crispy avocado rice with chicken. It was awesome! We ended the night with a the butternut squash ice cream cake. It was a beautiful dessert and tasted even better. Tonight was truly, delectably exquisite!!!!

A friend & I went on a Saturday night, about 500ish, it was not busy, maybe 3 other tables w/people. Interesting decor. We ordered the Mini bang bang shrimp, which was pretty good, & a tuna roll(so-so), as appetizers.  I had a Delaware roll & a tuna roll, as my main course. The Delaware roll was good, the tuna rolll was bland. It was supposed to come with a side salad & miso soup, but the waitress forgot for several minutes. When she brought the salad, it was very cold- like it just came out of the refrigerator. And it was not good, it was basically just bland iceberg lettuce, shredded carrots, and some kind of orangey dressing. The miso soup was tasteless- it seemed mostly water and after a few minutes separated into 2 layers in the bowl...I've never seen soup do that!  My friend had chicken curry, with rice, he said it was good, but had to ask for another plate to eat it on - the curry was served in a bowl, the rice on a small plate. Strange.  
  All in all, it was an okay place, I may go back for sushi, but not get any salad or miso soup.

What a find!  Went for lunch and had the awesome special:  soup, appetizer, and entree.  Started with the Coconut Tom Kah - a delicious coconut broth chock full of fresh mushrooms, red pepper, onions, and chicken.  Absolutely wonderful.  I chose the avocado salad for the appetizer and although the ginger dressing was tasty, the avocado was severely unripe and rock hard.  Disappointing.  My entree was the Panang curry with chicken - amazing!  Full of tender chicken and fresh vegetables and absolutely perfectly spiced.  Ample portions and very reasonably priced.  Can't wait to go back!

We go to this theatre every time we're in Reno. Not necessarily because its the closest or because we like it the best, but because when we look at all the local theatres, it always seems to have the movies we're looking for and at good times. I decided to write a review because the fact that we always end up here says to me they are current, convenient and reasonable but I also noticed on our last visit, we got decent to good customer service. 
My friend used a girft card for his ticket and even though we purchased together, they used his card and then let us put the rest on credit with no attitude. Doesn't seem like much but a lot of employees get snarky when you use gift cards and coupons, so that was nice. Then, he also used a gift card for his consessions, which were also totaled with mine and not only was the consessions guy nice and helful about it, but he let us use a coupon in addition the the gift card. He was patient and very friendly. 
The consessions area itself is a bit confusing and the theatre should put up signs for a start line, but all the staff were nice so it was fine. The theatre was clean enough and comfy and eventhough there were annoying giggling girls seated behind us and a guy on his phone in the middle of the movie in front of us, I can't hold them responsible for the thoughtless people who might patronize their establishment. 
I am sure we will continue to use this theater whenever we are in Reno.

They don't server the proper food. And they don't care who's order is first.and even after that they dropped food on us.

I can definitely say this is not Indian food..
Don't even think of trying  their soup that's not a soup its a curry 

the attached  photo is for chicken soup
This place had fast service and friendly employees. Everything tasted the way it should. The Hall to the bathroom is alittle hard though with those Edison bulbs

You win some you lose some. Was in the market for a good Philly cheesesteak sandwich but this isn't the place to go. I don't know if it was the garlic Asiago hoagie or all the cheese the ruined it. Probably the bread that doesn't go with a Philly cheesesteak, it was more like eating garlic bread - weird experience didn't even eat half the sandwich. Also the prices here should be a couple dollars lower they might get more business. Maybe I'll try the Greek menu next time...
We were so thrilled to see this place open recently and it does not disappoint!  Wow! The food was great and service was awesome. I just hope that they can keep it!
Iclinic was quick to fix my iPad glass. I was surprised how quick I was able to get it fixed. They were a Lifesaver!!  Thanks for being speedy and professional!!
I have had their pizza delivered and to go, both times were excellent. Highly recommend
Delicious pizza, great atmosphere, tastes fresh, good drink selection, this place is our favorite.  And...  they have gluten free crust options that are the best around.

Service started slow but turned out to be good!  We came for the Chicago-style pizza.  Toppings were delicious & plentiful.  The crust was perfect, but the pie was served in cardboard & soon everything was soggy.  Possibly undercooked?  Possibly just not presented well.  I'll say it was tasty though.

What extraordinary place.Absolute top quality. The steaks are amazing prime beef.The seafood is no joke here.Simply the best restaurant in Tampabay.I'm very impressed.The waiters the staff,atmosphere the view.Wow.I recommend the ribeye steak  oscar style.The surf and turf.The deserts are amazing too.

We were staying at the Ace Hotel just a couple of minutes down the street and were starving past midnight on a Friday. We thought Seaworthy looked like a nice little spot to duck in, though it was obviously a cocktail bar and we weren't sure if they were still serving food. Lucky for us, they had a late night food menu available from 11pm-1am.

We actually didn't order any drinks, and instead got a half a dozen raw oysters and split the burger. The oysters were very fresh from the east, west, and gulf coasts, and average about $3 each, which I found to be higher than what's typically charged at home. The burger was 8oz of half brisket, half beef chuck, which I asked for mid-rare. It was cooked perfectly and had fontal cheese, roasted ham, and garlic aioli in a brioche bun, with a side of seaweed seasoned fries and spicy pickles. It was absolutely delicious, and the fries were crispy, well-seasoned, and actually ended up being a larger portion than we thought. We asked for some garlic aioli on the side for dipping for fries, and it made our meal all the more droolworthy.

Unexpectedly fantastic meal, friendly service, vibe is trendy, and extra points for the late-night mood lighting.

After having a horrible experience elsewhere for my baby's first grooming we decided to give this place a try when we had someone recommend it & after reading the reviews. Nydia was super nice & caring when I called & made the appointment for my furry baby. When I called asking to come in earlier she accommodated me with no problem. When it came to dropping him off she was super nice & cared about our needs for our furry baby. She stated she would keep what we liked on file & also went over his haircut with me in detail! After having such a bad experience somewhere else before! I was nervous on how this would result. It only took them about an hour & 45 mins to finish up with him! When I picked him up he was himself & super excited! Overall we will be returning & taking our furry child here from now on!

I have eaten in many start restAurants and have enjoyed most.This no exception. The manner of service is a shared experience and there is ample food to order for three and serve 4. The pad Thai and dumplings were very good and there was consistent quality. Stay away from the chocolate mouse it has no sugar. You'll leave stuffed

Food is okay but service is very poor. Walked to be seated, waited for a while and no waiter showed up.  No water, no tea, what Chinese restaurant is this? I only go here if everyone else is closed, and so far this place has consistently demonstrated bad in service. Mediocre food I can pass by, but when a place wasted my time by waiting and no device, that deserved some poor review.

Got there to find that you no longer need to put your name down for a table but to seat yourself. So we had a party of 6 squeezed into a booth made for 4. We were gonna accept it since the place was packed and you had to fight for a place to eat here. But then a miracle happened and a larger booth opened up. We already gotten out food but the waitress was really nice and let us move since it was still in her zone. No biggie. But then the service was not up to par. She only bought us one set of silverware. I figured she just put the one down to go and get 5 more. Nope. So we had to ask for plates and more silverware. She brings us the other half of our order and says she'll come back with the plates and silverware. Brings me my drink. By this time we almost done eating. No napkins. Ended up stealing a batch from the bar. No silverware. No plates. Finally she brings plates and silverware. But she only bought 4 silverware sets/napkins and 5 plates. We have a party of 6. You do the math. Then she disappears for the rest of our meal. We don't see her again. We ended up having to hunt her down to ask for our check. Also note that before all this we were almost given someone else's order. The people delivering it totally looked lost. 

This place is still running around with its head cut off. I noticed that there is an entire area in the back that they closed. Then you have people hoarding tables while their brats run around to play games. If they are not actively order a continuous food/drink I think they are done. Maybe give em a hint by giving them the check. Just saying. 

Also, if you parked in the garage they only have pay Stations on the first and 6th Floor. That's makes a whole lotta sense. People can either go down to the first floor pay for parking and then go back upstairs to whatever floor they parked on. That's not enough elevators for all that foot traffic. Or you can pay for parking before leaving the 6th floor where people are lined up to buy cards for the games and the foot traffic from the elevators. So now you adding to the foot traffic as well. Yippie. Have fun.

Great service, good food, reasonable pricing. Tried to go to my regular Chinese food restaurant nearby that abruptly closed recently, so I decided to try Lulu's and was pleasantly surprised. I will definitely be coming back. Also, one of the few places I found where the crab rangoon was not too crispy or burnt and was just right.

Hands down the best coffee is STL! Amazing pour overs and lattes. This place does get busy on the weekends though and seating can be hard to find. They offer a small brunch menu which is good but very small portions. Defiantly one of our favorite spots.

***0*** Stars this company is a subcontractor for retail companies. They did not supply any tracking information and only provided a brief statement about how no information was available for this shipment. I called to track the package as it didn't even have an expected delivery date or time and was left on hold for 2 hours... Yes 2 hours before I was even able to speak to a representative. Absolutely terrible customer service pretty much non existent. I would never recommend this company and as previously stated in a prior post- STAY AWAY!

Place was awesome. Found it on our last night in New Orleans and probably a good thing because we would have eaten there every night...

It is inside the 700 club if anyone has trouble finding it. Walk through the bar to the back which has seat your own tables. 

My fiancé and I ordered a couple dishes to share so we could sample a number of things: Bistro burger, piggyback fries, and a side of Mac and cheese. Everything was delicious. Piggyback fries are a must! Huge portion. Also the side of Mac and cheese is quite a large portion. You're probably getting two cups worth. Super creamy and great. 

Shout out to the staff. Really nice guys and put a lot of care into the food. We really enjoyed ourselves!

Only based on drinks-

Cold brew coffee is smooth and strong. Matcha with almond milk is nicely made and blended. 

The space is large with an industrial vibe. It's nice to watch them make the donuts. There is also outdoor seating. 

The donuts looked beautiful. I wish there were gluten-free or vegan options.

So quiet So so massage So so temperature Heels had little to no scrub so they don't even look like they've been touched. Worst part is that I've got a nick the girl saw it and didn't do anything! Doesn't use liners for pedicures Price was $26 so pretty expensive for so so mediocre pedicure Girl was sweet and did take me last minute so gave place 2 star. But definitely have to be better options in the area!

Absolutely wonderful. My server Tina provided a great experience. 
I had the fried alligator bites, a first for me. Hard to describe taste, a little like calamari. Delicious. The blackened redfish also great.
Love their ribs, Mac and cheese and greens. I just wish they advertise their prices and had a few more items but I was very pleased with my food and the portion. Can't wait to go back.

Best car buying experience we have ever been through.  We had a specific type of truck model in mind and price range that we wanted to stay within and saw a truck on their lot that fit the model.  We decided to stop by to ask about the price and found that it was out of our price range.  Harry Martell was the sales associate assisting us and asked specifically what we wanted and price range.  He said a vehicle matching our specifics had just been traded in and was still in the back.  We test drove the vehicle, loved it and without ANY hassle or annoying haggling that you normally experience at dealerships, Harry had us in our new truck and out the door in no time.  Richard, their finance manager had all of our paperwork ready to go and I have to say it was the easiest transaction we have ever experienced.  We appreciate the honesty, ethics and knowledge these two brought to the table.  We love our truck!  Thanks guys!
The spot for great gumbo and crawfish etouffee. Must try the warm bread pudding with whiskey sauce.

great place away from the madness of the French quarter. Happy hour oysters $1 had a unique topping and were delicious. Octopus was fabulous but the crunchy potatoes served with them were incredible.  Highly recommended

Is it just my imagination, or is the standard of Asian fare in Nashville improving? Last night we went to Korea House after checking the reviews on Yelp. 

The restaurant itself is small, a bit tired in a very Asian sort of way, and packed to the rafters with hungry, mostly Korean, diners. This is always a good sign in a Korean restaurant. We were seated quickly and the waitress was quick to bring our menus and drinks.

We ordered a typical Korean barbeque. While it wasn't of the strict Yaki Niku variety (it was pre-cooked rather than delivered raw to be cooked over an inset BBQ grill on the table) it was truly very good. There was a variety of pickles, vegetables and loads of meat and fried onions.

We had been on the road all day and, after a late lunch, we weren't particularly hungry. The portion served for one was huge and was more than enough food for us both. The price was very low considering the quality and freshness of the food.

The only drawback I noted was the available space. There is simply not enough. We were shoe-horned into chairs behind a well worn table. Behind me on the next table was a small child. Behind my wife on her side of the table, was another small child. I had to sit with the back of my chair perpendicular to the wall to fit in my spot, my wife fared little better.

One less table in this tiny restaurant would make all the difference...unless you are a shorty weighing around 100lbs. We will go back. If it is crowded we would not go in; if it is not so crowded you couldn't keep us out.

The food, price and service are excellent. The room is crowded and noisy.
But, it's good overall.

This review is mostly for the food, which is among the most authentic in all of St. Louis. Here is a dish by dish breakdown (no pics cuz we devoured everything asap!): 

- Soup dumpling - 4.5/5. Paper-thin wrapping, fragrant filling with the perfect amount of soup in each dumpling. They are bite-sized but those bites will be among the most delicious you'll ever take. 

- Lion head meatball - 3/5. Generous amount of meat per serving, but tasted a little bland. Comes floating in a bowl of watery, flavorless broth.

- Squirrel fish - 3.5/5. Visually stunning, drizzled in sweet and sour sauce. It's a whole fish that's been flayed and cubed with all the meat still attached and then deep fried. Wasn't my cup o' tea (or cup o' fish) but it's certainly a crowd pleaser. 

- House beef in chef's sauce - 4/5. Gorgeous plating with a tiny figurine of a bull. Sauce was deliciously savory with a hint of sweetness, but a little heavy-handed for my taste. After a few bites it started to get a little salty, but definitely worth trying. 

- Peking duck - 4/5. Meat is well cooked, tender, with perfectly crisped skin. Served with steam buns, sliced scallions, and plum sauce to make your own little duck buns. This is really the highest rating I can bestow to Peking duck in the US, having eaten the real deal in Beijing which has forever ruined me. 

- Three ingredient vegetables - 3.5/5. And FYI the 3 veggies are eggplant, bell pepper, and potato. Stir fried in a slightly spicy brown sauce, it's quite a tasty dish, but again just a tad salty. 


At the risk of sounding repetitive, it is imperative that you text the phone number on their fb page ahead of time to not only reserve a table but also place your order. 

It will be a struggle if no one in your group can speak/text fluent Mandarin. Thankfully hubby was up for the task, as my broken Chinglish just wasn't gonna cut it. 

Service is limited to bringing you food and check; the experience is mainly for the food. They don't serve liquor here but I believe my group was able to bring our own for a small fee. 

Will update when I try their other dishes!

This is the best nail salon I've ever been to no matter who does your nails they always take their time no rush well worth the money a plus I can get my nails and eyelashes done all at the same place not to mention a ton of colors to pick from gel or dip even if you want any type of design on your nails they well get the job done if you haven't already please give them a try you'll love it

I was excited to try a new taco place but when I tried it I was disappointed. $8 for a burrito that is filled with rice and barely any toppings I asked for. Barely any sour cream in my burrito. The tortilla and the chicken were taste less and cheese tasted old. The tacos were small and soggy when I got them. They were mostly cold, the beans were the only thing that were warm. If you need fast Mexican food I would recommend chipotle instead.

I'm not vegan nor vegetarian, but have enjoyed meals at other vegan/ vegetarian establishments a lot, so I thought I'd give this place a try. I can't complain on the service, it was great! But I really did not like the food. I ordered the breakfast bowl during brunch and it was just too weird tasting for me and had too many pungent flavors, especially heavy on the mustardy flavor. The biscuit was very dry and the multiple sauces did not go well together. The tofu had the weirdest taste of all. I did not enjoy this dish at all. My husband ordered the potato bowl which was better with more familiar flavors of sour cream and salsa. But it was just so average and not tasty either. We were very disappointed with the food and not sure if we will return.

Bleh, Only plus is that it's buffet style, so quick and good variety, includes salad, pasta, pizza and desert...but the quality was buffet quality - so if you're looking for great pizza try something else.

I think I'm hooked. I've been itching to go to one of Ballet Idaho's shows for years, and I am thrilled that my first experience was with the Christmas classic, The Nutcracker. 

There were so many components of this performance that won me over--the combination of professional dancers performing with children from Ballet Idaho's Academy, the live music played by the Boise Philarmonic, and the contrast of beautiful dancing paired with humorous bits that got the whole audience chuckling. 

In my opinion, the first act is mostly storytelling, whereas the second act features the more complex dance pieces. I enjoyed both parts equally and thought that they combined to make for a dreamy entertainment experience--one that was both intelligent and humorous.

The entire show had me pulled in with the same wide-eyed wonder my friend's three-year-old daughter had. I think that is perhaps my favorite part of this whole experience, the feel in the building is so child-like. Before and after the show and during intermission, the lobby of the Morrison Center was buzzing with people of all ages. And during intermission, the top balcony overlooking the lobby outside of the auditorium had a group of grade-school kids singing Christmas carols. 

To put the cherry on top of an already amazing evening, as soon as we stepped out of the building, we experienced our first Boise snowfall of the year. Talk about magical, eh?

Pro Tip: If you are parking in the garage right outside of the Morrison Center, try to get there a little early and get a space on the first floor. We parked on the second floor and it took us about half an hour to get out. Eeeeeep.

From the decor to the food to the staff, the experience here was excellent. It was my first visit but I learned they do change the menu frequently; which I am a big fan of.

I ordered the warm farrow salad which was superb! The omelette (which also comes with goat cheese) was very tasteful as well. Enjoying our trip to Nashville; I'd make this a must stop place in the future.

I've been eating here since I moved back to Boise in 2009 and the prices have skyrocketed in that time. That would be fine if the quality hadn't gone downhill so badly. The salad greens on the salad bar are obviously from a bag and they aren't fresh. The choice is on the salad bar have gone down as well just not nearly as many as there used to be it's mostly pre-made salads now. 
 
I was there the other night on the sushi was warm, not good. My salt and pepper shakers were gross as well. I don't know what's going on but somebody should know about this and fix it. Still I will say that the meat and the grilled pineapple are out of this world! Lots of choices and they're awesome about bringing back the things that you prefer. The kids on the floor or just awesome.

I do want to mention that this last visit was the 29th of November when I walked in the host asked me if I wanted to sit in the bar to which I replied no and then he tried to seat me in the bar. I told him no and asked him if I could have a half and half table. You know, the ones with half bench and on the other side a chair. There were plenty of seats that night that were available and he ignored me and put me at a table by the window. I was not in the mood to argue so I just took it. When I mentioned it to my server she gave me a blank stare and then completely ignored what I had said and asked me what I wanted to drink. Management really needs to take a closer look at the restaurant and the employees. For $25 I should not have had an experience like that.

The woman at the cash register is always very friendly! It's an average car wash, the interior is kinda outdated and the bathrooms aren't that clean. 

They do a good job with the exterior, but I always end up wiping off cloth fibers and wiping off my dashboard. And the vacuuming isn't always that great. 

I really like the staff here though

We couldn't eat there because we had our teenage kids with us.  Sign on the door said 18 & up.  No where on the website does it state this.  We were just disappointed that we couldn't get wings & beer.  Not really sure the purpose of not letting kids eat there too.  ????

I had the coconut shrimp as an appetizer and I also had the key lime grilled mahimahi with the shrimp. 
The waitstaff was amazing also the bit of awaits but completely well worth I  definitely recommend this place if your visiting clearwater

ISC met June 29. Thanks, Sarah S., for your continual spot-on restaurant selection.

El Agave is in Watson Plaza, a large, C-shaped shopping center, with Kohl's at the top (facing west), Shop 'n Save facing Watson and El Agave at the bottom (facing east). Just turn in when you see Kohl's.

This may be the largest Mexican restaurant I've ever patronized. There's a lovely separate bar and numerous smallish dining areas.

Our server was pleasant and knowledgeable of the menu. I asked him for a recommendation, and that's what I got. But I don't know its name. The menu is sporting a picture of it. Nopales are involved.

And this massive, wonderful dish was served in a huge black "pottery" footed bowl lined with foil. Besides nopales, there was chicken, shrimp, pico, sour cream and vegetables . . . no doubt other things.

This was the first time in my life I've had a Mexican dish that didn't include tortillas. And that includes Mexico City, Puerto Vallarta, Cancun and all villages down the road from Cancun to Tulum and up the road from Mexico City to Taxco.

And I was more than ecstatic with that.

Dang-bang it, was that good and continued to be fabulous with the abundance in my to-go vessel.

It was a fun evening with fellow Yelpers. Service was just right. Water was replenished in a timely fashion. And it seemed like everyone was pleased with their selections.

The salmon was probably one of the most simple, yet delicious dishes of salmon I have had in long time. Seasoned and cooked perfectly, the salmon, fingerlings and green beans were excellent. Oh.. and the sangria, both red and white, really hit the spot! This is definitely a "treat-yo-self" dinner but well worth it.

I came here with a large group and the service was very slow. We came during restaurant week so we got several courses to our meal and it took forever for them to come out. We had a reservation and while it was busy, it was not overly busy on a weeknight. We had to wait over 2 hours for our actual entrees to come out. By then it was almost 9:30pm and I was over it after waiting for so long. 

The food itself is very average and it didn't seem like anything special. I probably won't be back here, as there are many other restaurants around the city that I would rather try.

Anyone who recommends this place has never had decent Chinese food. The atmosphere is awful and I felt like I was risking my life just getting out of the car. I never leave reviews, but I am mad at all the people who gave this place a good review. I want my $53 and 1 hour of my life back. I will never forgive you all.

My new favorite restaurant. Great "flocktail" menu and ample selection of draft beers and wines. Reasonably priced entrees. The Acapulco Chicken sandwich was tender and delicious. My husband got a South of the Border burger and he enjoyed it. The star of the show is the pictured key lime pie. The ambiance is vibrant, colorful, and tastefully curated.

The absolute best sushi I've had in the greater Edmonton area! So fresh with fantastic flavour combinations. Their sushi is not only incredibly tasty but is also a treat for the other senses as well. It's art on a plate!

Ok, I admit it, I have a soft spot in my heart for George's. I can't decide if it's the live music in the bar, the kitschy Christmas decorations or the consistently tasty food they serve. Wait! It's probably the fact that it sits right in my neighborhood and actually is very good! The other night we went (on a whim as usual) and I had their special which happened to be meat loaf. I am very picky about my meatloaf. It has to be meat, not gray matter like some other restaurants. This one did not disappoint. Came with some corn and very good mashed potatoes. We highly recommend George's! It is a great go to!!

Called at 445 to pickup at 630. When I arrived total chaos reigned. Staff were rude and food had obviously been sitting for an hour on the shelf. Food deserves 2 stars - generic, brown sauce covered, each dish tasting the same. No idea why this place rates at all. Rubbish food, rubbish service. Just because other places are worse, doesn't make this place good. Wake up New Orleans, you deserve better.
Love this place! Seriously the best place to have a birthday party! They did an amazing job for our little ones 3rd birthday!

I have been a patient for years. Parking can be tight during peak times, so it's best to not be in a rush. The staff definitely tries to keep things moving but it can be difficult. I'm a stickler for customer service so it's important just to be patient because you will wait.  I think because I know what to expect, I really can't complain.  They keep a rotation of patients so it's like forever busy.  Bring your own reading materials or earbuds to keep busy while you wait.
Unreal. Sat in drive thru on a Thursday w NOONE IN FRONT OF ME. Dirty gross person couldn't even count out the money. Pretty sure they spit on my food

Amazing company and even better spas, Kevin was great and everyone is so friendly, the delivery guys were so friendly and very cautious about setting the spa in the perfect spot, I have referred a client of mine who bought a spa and they are very happy as well, best spas in town!!!

This is my favorite Patco stop in New Jersey! This station is located directly off of 295, and when you drive past the traffic light and into the parking lot, you'll find plenty of spaces so you don't have to be as worried about idiots getting too close to your car. This is a big station with a big lobby area with seating and a lots of different newspapers outside where your ride can pick you up.

Alder Properties was a great company to lease from. They helped me out in a pinch when my company moved me from California to Nevada by getting me into a nice place with affordable rent in the short time I had, and have an amazing and friendly staff. Jim was always available if needed and I never had any issues in the 2 years I lived there. I will definitely rent another property from them if I move back to the Reno area.
The food was fantastic. The staff treated us like Queens . The fireplace made the place more romantic then I could hoped. I know this was a small part of dinner but the butter was soft! I love that

DO NOT ORDER THE CRAZY CORN SALAD, unless of course you like caramel popcorn in your salads!  I am not sure if someone in the kitchen was playing a joke or not but half of the ingredients listed on the menu weren't in the salad AND there were about 5 additional ingredients in the salad that weren't on the menu (including clusters of caramel popcorn).  I cannot understand why this item is on the menu.

Giving 2 stars only because the rest of my party really enjoyed their orders (pasta and enchiladas). 

I will certainly give this place another try given all of the good things I have heard but I am truly disappointed by my first experience.

My favorite cheesesteak place in Philly. My family has been coming here for years. It's small local place. Counter seating only. You let the waitresses or waiters know you would like to sit at the counter and they will either tell you which open seats to take or put your name on a wait list. 

I always get a cheesesteaks with American cheese and fried onions. It's always amazing and great! Totally worth the wait and the small location!

Clean restaurant, excellent service and tasty food. I order the same thing all the time and consistency is hard to maintain, yet they do it! My omelet and moms avocado toast is always hot, fast and comes with friendly service. Great go-to place for breakfast anytime. Can get pricy for breakfast though, Min $10 per person. You must order the millionaires bacon. Best self indulgent breakfast treat ever!

Stopped at Vitarelli's for take-out since we were staying overnight at a local hotel. What a great find! Instead of the pizza we'd planned, we ordered delicious dinners to go. Try the stuffed shells-the portion is more than enough (some is in the frig for later!)- and the salad, bread,butter made me feel as if I'd been at my grandmother's for dinner. The other take-out dinner was the Baked Ziti with Eggplant. So much delicious food!!

The extra special treatment we received by the Vitarelli's staff was incredibly kind-- when they realized we were "on the road" they packed up utensils, napkins, extra Parmesan, pepper, butter, etc What a sweet and neighborly gesture.  

We are annual visitors to this area; we'll be back for the best Italian food we've had since dinner at Grandma's.

Everything about this place just screams "home". From the type of food they sell to the ambiance and music, it's just comfortable. The food backs this up in a big way, it's straight up excellent. The Thursday night special porchetta is quite tasty, great sides, salads, and soups. I highly recommend the beets and the collard greens. 

As for dessert, the chocolate chess pie is like fudge with a pie crust, it's amazingly chocolatey and smooth, with a flaky, beautiful crust.
No toilet paper in the lobby men's room.  The concierge did not seem to care at all.  Not really an acceptable thing in the morning when travelers are trying to get where they're going.

Think of the Edmonton City Arts Centre as a cruise ship far out at sea, with lots of activities planned to keep you happy. The catalogue headers give a good idea of the breadth available: cooking and baking, crafts and handiwork, dance, mind and body, music, photography, pottery and sculpture, silversmithing, soaps and lotions, theatre, visual art, and writing.

The hunnybunny has done some silversmithing, pottery (pix added to this review), and painting, and we've done a cooking class together. There's a lot you can use to distract yourself from a particularly heavy snowstorm :-)

The classes have been well planned and leave you with a nice artifact to commemorate your new (or growing) skill. The teachers personalities vary, so not all students will click with all teachers, but the centre seems pretty responsive in allowing switching between classes.

Best tripe sandwiches in St Louis
"I'll be back"
Next time I'll order two.
Can't wait to try the other menu items

As one of the premier Italian options in South Tampa, Bella's has been a favorite of mine since I was a wee lad. We have gathered for numerous celebrations here over the years, simply because the atmosphere is cozy, the service is excellent, and the food is so delicious and never, ever disappoints. The small bruschetta sample plate they bring as a taster at the beginning of the meal sets the tables: The topping is fresh and vibrant, and we always end up ordering more! The carpaccio is another delicious starter as well, the aioli served with the paper-thin steak is a revelation. Try to treat yourself to one of their delicious caesar salads while you wait for your mains. My all time favorite dinner option there is Nate's Chicken. TWO gigantic chicken breasts topped with prosciutto, mozzarella and marsala sauce with sautéed spinach. I always opt to add a side of the wood fired roasted potatoes as well, as they compliment the dish and go great with the sauce. Other favorites are the Pollo Milano, Bella Luna and Grouper Picatta. If you have any room left (and your probably won't), they have an array of delicious desserts, my favorite of which is the Tiramisu. Pair that with a nice cup of coffee and you, my friend, have just had one of the finest Italian meals in the South Tampa area.

Purchased a 10x10 jute rug from here for my dining room and it completely fell apart after a year. I have a medium size dog plus my husband and I so not like there is a huge amount of traffic at our house.  No excuse for this to have unraveled after just a year. What really provoked me to leave this review was their refusal to issue a refund or even store credit. Hours and hours spent on the phone with customer service and I finally just gave up. Used to shop here all the time. Never again.
I bring every out of town visitor here. Great mix of people, huge portions, amazing choices. I always get the curry tofu scramble and the kids size velvet pancakes for desert!!

I'm from out of town but needed to get something printed & sent out asap. I called several places before calling here -- the gentlemen here were super friendly over the phone as well as in person! They were very helpful & went above & beyond to help me! I recommend using this location if you have any printing or shipping needs!

This is where I go to get my sushi fix. Been here at least a dozen times, have tried almost everything on the menu and never been disappointed. The three-roll special is a great deal. Also consider getting the tuna dumplings, they are a delicious meal unto themselves. Good fast service, clearly fresh ingredients, and all-around goodness. Hit 'em up!
Yummmoo!!! Bread nice and toasty, steak tender and delicious and the service was Amazing!
I just can't give them a 5. It was expensive for 2 appetizers and a cup and bowl of soup.  However the food is good.

I had no idea what to expect walking in to ICI, but it was great!!! The macarons were bigger than I expected. We each got a different one with the intention of being able to try each other's.... but that didn't happen. I got the fig & cassis one... WOW!!! So tasty. Absolutely will be back again for another kind of macaron and a coffee.
Excellent place, great beer, and bartender Lisa gave us excellent recommendations in the Dunedin area.  Nice to know you can bring in your own food or use Uber eats.

Just when you thought this place got a little bit better with the self checkout and better shelf management; I hear one female employee talking about "how she gonna beat this bitches ass" and another kid who was stocking shelves literally listening to trap music while he was doing so.  Where the hell is the management in this freaking store?

I love this place! I stopped in here once and it's small, but so cozy. I definitely love the authenticity. The drinks are amazing and the duck fat fries are to die for. The bartenders are all really nice and fun to talk to as well. I didn't have a reservation this time and was lucky to arrive right when some people were leaving the bar. But next time I will definitely make a reservation for one of the closed off tables.

I think this is the only place in South Philly with a restroom for customers! But seriously, buy something if you're gonna use it. Don't be "that guy."

The tables have cool art on them, and the walls are filled with art. I think it might've been for sale and by one of the baristas because we got to chatting, and she said she's a printmaking major. There were three people working when we came, and they were all so friendly! We even talked about the tacos we got before coming here, and she even knew where we went (go to Prima Pizza down the street)! 

The coffee was really good. They use La Colombe and even had regular sized (pound?) bags for sale. Prices were average for a cute little coffee place like this. 

I think I might be going to a different cafe (this one) when I do my Italian Market shopping from now on...

Tex Mex Tacos in New Orleans!!!  Simple tacos and beer kind of place. Indoor seating in pretty artistic dinning room. Tacos where great. I had the brisket tacos with cilantro et all. Loved it. Tacos are 3 for $10. Fish, beef and veggie. They have both hard shell and soft. Both handmade and good.

I'll admit: I don't like chains. Very rarely do I visit them; I'd rather support a local business.

I came here before a local holiday event in Carmel with a friend that was craving sushi. I had never been before, so I was okay with checking it out. 

Reviewing the entire menu, there aren't a lot of vegetarian options (reason for 3 stars instead of 4 stars). I went with an odd variety of food: avocado egg rolls (free Yelp check in offer FYI), veggie sushi rolls, and tomato bisque soup. 

All of the food was delicious, especially those avocado egg rolls. The only food that I had that was just "okay" was the veggie sushi rolls. Nothing special about them at all. The soup was warming and perfect for a chilly, winter night. 

Be sure to check in on the Yelp app and get that free appetizer!

I had burnt tips bbq sandwich on french roll. It was yummy. The bbq sauce is a yummy tangy flavor wish they put a bottle on the table next to the ketchup. Fries were good and they are GREAt with ranch. I had a super delicious pinot noir that was real good with my sandwich. The boys had the classic burger. I dig the pickle .

It was line dancing night so $5 cover i was not cool with that as i did not do it and parking was TIGHT. So took off 2 stars for th2ise two reasons. Server was unremarkable.

To celebrate our Christmas party for my staff we made reservations for a party of 12.  The environment was great however the experience wasn't one that I wanted to have along with my staff, we ordered drinks to start and it came fairly quick however we ordered appetizers which was four orders of wing because they can with fifth-teen and they took at least 45 mins to an hour before they came out!!!  So once they came out we went ahead and placed the order because we had been sitting for so long before the appetizers came now understanding that we had a big party of twelve however our waiter did not check on us hardly we had to keep looking for her the service was not to standard when you have a big party.  It took again another hour to get our food and by that time it was 9:45pm and on top of that the food was horrible everyone outside 3 ppl had the seafood platter the steaks were fresh and hot however the platters were all cold shrimp was soggy, heavy salted, and cold, fries were cold, and oysters were soggy and cold as well.  One of my staff members preceded tell one of the servers (Howard) was his name and he laughed directly in her face and walked away which was very unprofessional.  Once were able to get a manger she was very rude and didn't seem to care at all even though she refunded our meals and only charged us for the wings she didn't apologize or anything of that nature.  I was very displeased and I will not be coming back or referring anyone that I do business with to come to your restaurant with service to that nature.  However the party planner that took care my reservations was very nice and warming she cared more about our experience than anyone else on staff.   We not be planning any other events here again.

This is probably one of the most unwelcome and worst customer service I've seen. They are never standing at the register and when your standing there you have to wait at least a minute or two before they even know that your standing there waiting. And when they finally decide to stop socializing they finally turn around and see you there. I've only been here twice, and the second time I was hoping maybe it was just that one day that the service wasn't good. This place seriously needs a new manager and new employees. I don't expect you to be super enthused I'm here to order but at least have decent customer service. I really wish this place had better service because I like getting something healthy at the mall but I guess I won't until they hire new employees. And you would think with this being a healthier restaurant it would have healthier and nicer people working there.

We've had 3 dinners at the Vizcaya Restaurant in the past couple of  years. Two of the 3 were not good. After the first bad meal, it took us a long time before deciding to give it another try. The second dinner was terrific. We were both so pleased with the food that we were looking forward to our next trip there. 

On our third visit, as we entered the restaurant, the first thing we were asked was if we were using a Groupon. I have no idea if that determined where we were seated or even which menu we were given, but the question gave us pause. 

What I do know is that neither one of us had a good meal. My husband's fish was mushy -- I would not have eaten it. My lamb shanks were tender, but the sauce had an odd flavor and the vegetables looked and tasted like had been reheated too many times. 

We also wondered if since we visited during the middle of the week that perhaps the chef was not working that night. However, even when the chef is not there, they should have someone who can prepare a better dinner than what we were served.

A good, not great pho option in Tucson.  My biggest gripe about this place is that although the food is decent quality it has become a bit pricey making the price/quality ratio a bit uneven.  I would not avoid this place but it also wouldn't be my first choice either.

I had a horrible experience at this location. Refused to acknowledge their own online coupon even after I showed them the order didn't violate any terms or conditions of the coupon. Refused to assist or give options and made no effort to solve the situation. Then had to use the restroom later which was a disgusting mess. This franchise needs to be looked into heavily

Showed up serendipitously for Saturday brunch, got in right before it it started getting busy. The cornmeal waffle cochon was super tasty and the latkes with crawfish etoufee was delicious! Great neighborhood find away but still clise to French Quarter.
this place is now "permanently closed"! despite "open" on website, phone number also disconnected!
Great atmosphere and food is fabulous. Attentive and personable service.  Delicious eclectic dishes.

Excellent food. State & Fig is tucked away in a cool spot off of State St. The ambiance is unique and inviting. I ordered the fried chicken sandwich and it was great! My wife had one of the egg scrambled and it was great as well.

When one comes across a business and a business owner the likes of Flavius you are reminded how wonderful it is to be treated by someone who knows how asses what you need and give you the best advise. After taking his advise his treatment of me was generous and patient.  the expertise in which he installed my unit was unsurpassed. I could not be more satisfied!
I've tried GB FnC in Denver, and I've tried the real deal in Europe. I've got a really high bar for cod. This place is nothing special, and the fish and chips leaves a lot to be desired.

What a fun experience. We took our teen boys and they got a kick out of the show. It was fun to share the experience with other people at our table. It was my birthday so I ate for free yippee. But it was still pricey. Not somewhere we would take the family on a regular basis, but a great place for a special occasion

I'm done with this place. We have tried 4 times to make it a fun place to go, but the management continues to screw it up.  Super long waits and screwing up the order every time. Today was the last straw! How can you screw up a plain hamburger with no cheese? Well they can, had to remake it and ended up being cold along with the fries. The manager could care less when I called her. I will go elsewhere next time.

Just ate here, as I do every week...and wow. Terrible!!!!! Dirty plate, the worst service I've ever seen in any food dining establishment. Little Hispanic girl was my server and wow was she disrespectful and rude. Had to send my food back when she messed up my order. She also asked why I asked for a new plate...BECAUSE YOU SERVED MY FOOD ON A DIRTY PLATE WITH DRY, LEFTOVER EGG ON IT! She didn't even check up or refill my water. I paid with a credit card and she STOOD RIGHT IN FRONT OF ME WAITING FOR ME TO SIGN MY COPY...I WASNT EVEN DONE​ EATING YET. Bad way to eat and that's why she doesn't deserve a damn penny for her garbage service. I'll never let that girl serve me again. Never. I'd rather starve.
Amazing food, love thier salads and great pizza that you can build your own or pick one of this. They always have great service!
Anytime you need to stop by AT&T, visit the Causeway Brandon store and ask for Nicole, she's the best rep in there!!!! You'll have a pleasant experience!

Waited for almost 2 and a half hours to only spend about 2-3 minutes speaking with the nurse practitioner. I went complaining of head congestion, sinus pain, coughing, ear pain, etc. The NP stated that I had a viral infection and that there is nothing they can do to help me. 
I left beyond frustrated that I just wasted so much time and insurance money. I saw my own family doctor the next day, only to learn that I had a raging sinus infection. He gave me an antibiotic and prescription nasal spray. The best part was it only took about 20 mins total and he was irritated as well with this immediate care once I informed him I've already been seen for this. 
Feel free to waste your time and money, that's exactly what they did for me.

Lovely little market in Fairmount with a stellar coffee bar and really scrumptious pastries! I had a London Fog, which was perfect and I loved that they had it on the menu. There's nothing worse than being in the mood for a fog, trying to order one and being met with a blank stare. They used almond milk for mine. Yum! I also ordered a flaky butter croissant and it served as an excellent (but MESSY) road trip snack. I didn't browse the market part itself, but looks like they have a nice selection and a juice bar as well. The big communal tables looked inviting and there were plenty of folks enjoying a fun weekend breakfast. So sad I discovered this place right before I hit the road, but I'll definitely be back when I get back to Philly.

Great quick spot. The line goes by fast and there was seating. Nice people at the counter and jazz music playing in the background. It was close to a restaurant that we put our names at for brunch but ended up getting pastries here. Excellent cafe au lait. My boyfriend got the iced mocha which he really liked. I got the Nutella scone which was really good and he got the blueberry muffin - it was just okay.

Had a 9:00-12:00 window.  No call.  At noon we called.  They couldn't tell us when they would be here.  We cancelled and called Steamy Concepts.  This company is consistently late and their techs don't seem to care.  Stanley Steemer is off our list forever.

Very disappointing.  I ordered a wiz without and cheese fries.  The cheese whiz was so watered down all of it fell out of the sandwich before i was even halfway through. My husband was at the window watching them make the food, and verified that they put water in the big vat of cheese whiz. Shame on you, Steve's. More like the Pauper of steaks. Not the Prince.
Great location. Nice staff. Double cup holders- at arm rest and seat are a fantastic idea. I would give it 5 stars if the seats rocked back a bit, but they don't. They are very upright.

My pizza came out before my husband and sons. I was told they can only put one in the oven at a time do it cooks better. The place was empty so I can't imagine how long it would have taken of or was busy. Plus it was an icebox in there.

I will never eat at this Domino's again after interacting with the "manager," Josh, there, who wouldn't know customer service if it hit him upside the head.

I don't expect anything to be done about it by leaving a review because review after review is posted for this store--almost all regarding the terrible service--and nothing has seemed to change.

After nearly an hour and a half of not hearing a word from anyone and not receiving my order, I checked the tracker online to see the store had labeled my order as delivered and completed. I called the store only to wait nearly twenty minutes on hold. It was a Tuesday night in early December so it is unfathomable that they would be so busy someone would have to wait that long. I suspect the store knew who was calling and purposely tried to wait me out in a poor effort to get me to give up and hang up.

My suspicion was confirmed when Josh finally picked up because he immediately began ranting that he had tried to call me three times and that I was unreachable so the store wasn't responsible for my order as they didn't have the ingredients (supposedly ran out of pepperoni--really?) to complete it. I couldn't even get a word in. Nobody had called me three times. I didn't even know what he was talking about. More importantly, why call anyone three times instead of simply calling once and leaving a message? Is there really no policy to simply leave a message? That alone is baffling.

He sounded pissed and about ready to hang up on me. At this point my first and only priority was to get my money back as I hadn't received a thing from the store. He told me he had just then refunded me and then immediately hung up. No chance to even determine what happened.

After this, I would never again step foot into another Domino's in my life if it wasn't for a delivery driver who called me about half an hour later, attempted to deliver leftovers from the store. This guy, who's name was Dan, seemed to be genuine and was willing to talk and listen regarding the issue earlier.

We concluded that another associate had called a number that wasn't mine three times by her own mistake before she "left the store, pissed off." I assume that Josh, realizing her/their mistake later, then tried to task the delivery driver with amending the situation by delivering what was literally described as "leftovers" to me. I didn't accept them but thanked Dan for at least listening and trying to amend the problem. I will never go to this store again but will probably buy from Domino's again sheerly because of Dan's maturity.

Why someone as condescending and easy-to-anger as Josh is the manager while a guy like Dan is just the delivery driver is beyond me. As I said above, I don't expect anything at the store to change by leaving a review so at this point I'm just trying to warn other consumers to stay clear of a terribly-run store like this one. Buy pizza anywhere but here. It's just not worth an experience like this--being blamed for the store's own mistake and then getting hung up on, just lucky to get your money back after hours of waiting. You've been warned!
I had delicious wonton soup and pad Thai. My wife had Pho.  I would definitely go again.  Specials included Monkfish as well as more traditional dishes.

My husband stopped in this Burger King yesterday, 12.14.17...and we was greeted by the whole staff! They ALL was warm and welcoming and seemed genuinely happy about being at work! Was pleasant and willing to help with anything! We have not experienced anything like this before! Usually people, and for some reason in fast food, seem to hate their jobs, not this place!! Even the cooks in the back was interacting with us!!! I give this store a high five and applaud them....ironically the very next day, today, I went to another Burger King to pick up lunch for my brother, the person was sad and depressing...it just reinforced how great the service was at the store in rivergate. Keep it up! I will definitely go out of my way to go to that Burger King!

The food here is very very fresh and delicious and the mood/ambiance is very pleasing. One of the only complaints I have is the service could have been better, my parents and I were barely checked on and it took about an hour for our food to come with only 2-3 other tables occupied. We definitely plan to go back but hopefully this time the food won't take so long

My family has ordered from this location (delivery and carry out) several times now. Something goes wrong each time. 

Last order, they left the pepperoni off of my gluten free pizza (so it was just tomato, mushroom and pineapple on half) and the crust was really burnt. My family had ordered a large pizza with pepperoni on half and chicken on the other. It had pepperoni on the whole thing. 

Tonight, we tried again. I ordered a gluten free pizza with no cheese (food allergies) with pepperoni, mushroom and tomato. It came with the correct toppings this time!! Eureka! But it was still burnt. Not as bad as last time, but still pretty crispy and the edges were black. My family's pizza came properly, but they wanted cinnamon bites and received brownies instead. ‍

So this location isn't the best ever. It's not so terrible that we'll never order from here again... but if I were you, I'd keep expectations low and know you won't always get what you want.

I was recently hospitalized for two back to back surgeries.  And I have to say I was very impressed with the surgeon who did the emergency surgery and again with the doctor who performed the second surgery a month and a half later.  I know staff does their best to work as a team.  They work hard and have to deal with multiple issues.  I tried to be the best patient.  I had some really amazing nurses and assistants during both stays.  And a few that maybe had a rough day.  I recommend requesting a private room.  My first encounter I had a semi private (not private at all).  And it felt like a nightmare.  My second time around I requested a private room.  I was less depressed and I had a beautiful view.  Heck, hospital stays aren't a vacation.  But I truly felt that I got good care while I was there.

We will never be back. We were meeting friends for drinks on 12-16-2017 (management look who was bar tending that night) and the bartender was the ABSOLUTE RUDEST bartender that I have ever encountered!!! That is a big statement! She had horrible body language, leaning back at the bar, slightly turning her head for the next person to order and shortly saying next, as if we were the most inconvenient people that actually want a drink FROM A BAR. We thought that we were just experiencing this for some weird reason until the next two people sat down. They asked if she had Blanton's (we had already looked for the price on the menu because that is a favorite in our group and it was not on the menu) the bartender quickly snapped back and said "look at the menu, It would be there, AND the bottle is right there (pointed to it on the opposite side of the bar)". Let me tell you, it was NOT on the menu and we had watched them look for it, both on the menu and in the massive stack of bottles. Now she could have handled every conversation (I mean attack) differently. We then made it a game after we ate to see if she still hated us after we ate dinner at a table, and dared our out of town friend to ask for a Togo beer. Same encounter, horrible person and if we were not meeting a group of friends there, I would have spoke to management that night, and if she is management, GOOK LUCK! If you go, don't sit at the bar, the waitress was nice, we will NEVER EVER EVER be back!
Okay, food=amazing. But that was the best cup of coffee I've had in a while. And I am a black coffee snob. Incredibly impressive.

I realized I haven't really reviewed bakeries so I'm going to do a few and this is the first. I find this place is consistently good to excellent. The filled croissants are standard but all his other pastries are superior including the coffee cakes and fancy cakes. What is superior are breads. I particularly like the artisanal French bread both... the white and the multigrain which I will often finish on the way home sans butter or olive oil. I also highly recommend the Volksbrot, a dense bread which makes superior toast. Finally as it is almost Christmas season treat yourself to a Bouche Noel.

I was excited to hear of the new Transit Center.  I'm a pleased that there is a warm place to wait in the winter and a cool place to wait in the summer.  The busses seem to run more regularly and on time.  over all I feel the Transit Center was an excellent idea.  I give the Transit Center 5 stars.

I finally got a chance to visit Otto this past week, and it definitely lived up to the hype. A very cozy neighbourhood establishment, it wasn't all that busy on a Friday night. My server was very friendly and helpful. I loved how the menu was divided into pork and non-pork sausage options. I had the beef bratwurst and a vegan sausage. The vegan sausage was hearty, totally nailed the texture, and had a slightly sweet taste to it. The beef bratwurst was incredible. I'm not a huge fan of beef sausages because I find they often taste like hot dogs, and I don't love hot dogs. However, this sausage had more of a texture and flavour reminiscent of a kofta kebab - ground beef with seasonings in a very thin casing. Intensely flavourful. For my side I had a small dill coleslaw, and it was extremely fresh without the dill being overpowering. The drink list was extensive but I was not in the mood for that, but will return again for that beef sausage and perhaps a libation.

Im a retailer that is trying to get a customer delivery done for a customer that we had a drop shipment in Nashville Tennessee and this has been the worst night mare I have ever encountered and I have been in business for over 33years 
They are having a terrible time of communicating to me what to do about this dilemma 

Buyers beware!

It's not a habit of mine to review on opening day but practically speaking I've been here before.

I've been to Barista Parlor's current three locations, and this is a Barista Parlor joint.  Take away all the signage that says Drug Store and most any Nashvillian walking in would finish their phone call with "I have to hang up now. I'm about to get some coffee at [looks around for 0.77 seconds] Barista Parlor."

I've been here yesterday and Josh said they were not opening for another day but [paraphrasing] you look like you're in withdrawal so have some of this coffee I made for myself.

I won't go on about the attention to detail and the gorgeous execution since there is consistency among all their locations, but I have to point out that this particular location has the most feels like it belongs location of them all.  Heart of downtown.  Wide and tall windows unobstructed to accentuate that fact.

The barista was excited to be there, seemed passionate about barista'ing, made a decent Cortado.

It's downtown so parking is ... downtown.  

The hotel in which it is located, the newly opened Noelle, is beautiful and cosmopolitan much like the BP brand so the partnership seems like a match made in heaven.  Thanks for bringing Nashville up a notch as a world class city.

Doctors were good but billing was horrible. Husband over charged by $55 and despite the fact that I told them I had Eye Med insurance they gave  me a doctor that didn't take it...so I was billed a huge amount.

People giving this place bad reviews do not understand quality Ashkenazi Jewish food. The Lox and bagels, latkes, blintzes, pastrami all made with love and quality you would expect from a top notch Jewish Deli. The place is clean, spacious and with nice ambience. The service is friendly and fast. Yes you will pay a few more bucks than a diner, that serves generic food, but I think that's just stating the obvious.

Great place for a drink and watch the boats get loaded in and out. Wear your sunblock, hat and sunglasses if sitting near the water, the reflection makes it extra hot. But worth it for a view of Downtown St Pete, on a clear day. Peel and eat shrimp also Duke's fish sandwich are my favorite.  Parking is a little challenging at times, it has limited parking next to the actual building, you can park on the street or on a separate parking lot away from the building or you can always valet. This place makes me want to own a boat!

Ordered the chicken finger salad and a side of fries as takeout. It was ready in less than 15 mins and was directly across the street from the courtyard Marriott. The salad was good size. It has a House sauce on the chicken, which wasn't too bad, but a little spicy for my taste. The worst part of the salad was the croutons, which were greasy. I would get the salad again without the croutons. It came with a homemade ranch which I loved.

Easy 5 Star. Really nice ambiance, very relaxing with the low lights and plentiful candles. The service was very good and the prices really reasonable. We shared 5 rolls and had 2 miso soups and our bill was under 50 dollars. We had the dynamite, jazz, veggie, don taun, and Philly rolls. All were delicious and very fresh. They had a huge menu with many options. Everything sounded good. A must try!

Have reservations, but they will not let you cancel even with the Thomas Fire happening in Santa Barbara, real classy AutoCamp.  Their cancellation policies are ridiculous, so don't book unless you can avoid a major disaster.  Serenity now!

This place is awesome! Fresh good quality with a good price, and it's pretty varied!
If you're looking for a reliable stop, this is the place.

Dee-lish food, good variety. German/Austrian twist offers different dishes from schnitzel to spaetzel to Lukelly.  If looking for American dishes of salmon and steak, they have that, too. Desserts were homemade with whipped cream made from scratch. Outstanding!  Cappuccino, iced Viennese coffee all winners. Service was superb. 
Plenty of parking. Cheerily and tastefully decorated for the holidays. Very comfortable seating. Serves beer and wine, too. Portions are so generous, everyone in our party of 6 took home leftovers. 
All around winner.

Not overly impressed by this place. It is typical overpriced airport food. I tried the Korean BBQ taco and the sunset chicken taco. I didn't finish the Korean taco; the chicken was burnt and nothing tasted fresh. The sunset chicken taco was better and had an actual fresh slice of avocado on top. I'd skip this place next time.

2 週前

我要發言，剛剛在超市買貨品，已經買過兩次$3.99,今天去全是$5.99,碰巧旁邊有個工作人員在補貨，隨口問他標價的問題，結果他當我的面把3.99的3撕掉，告訴我那怕是.99收銀台還是刷條碼，但.....這不是重點，重點是態度

Poor breakfast spot. We asked for an americano and latte and they brought drip coffee and drip coffee with milk. I'd prefer some honesty that they don't have an espresso machine. Also no fresh orange juice.

Amazing dive shop with top rated gear and staff!  I've been diving for years and recently moved to the area looking for a dive shop.  I couldn't be happier with infinite descent.  Connor, Maria, and Eric "Hollywood" are all extremely knowledgeable.  I had great dives in the gulf where I saw schools of fish, goliath groupers, and a large turtle.  They also do spearfishing.  It's also one of the only dive shops in the area that has their boats go straight out from behind the shop.  Extremely convenient!  I can't say enough great things about this shop.  Be sure to check it out!

We were excited to try this place out today and were very disappointed with the quality of food.  We ordered pancakes, waffles, eggs, sausage, bacon.
