The only thing we could finish was the bacon (but who doesn't finish bacon?).  The sausage smelled odd and my friend could not finish it, which I have never seen him not finish sausage before. The menu said the pancakes came with two eggs, but it only came with one. They were tepid when we received them. The pancake batter had not fully cooked so we could not eat those. The "Belgian waffle" was clearly just bland batter in a waffle press. If you can't do the basics well, you have no business serving breakfast or food for that matter.
With a great happy hour, a delicious burger, a blt with a literal fried crab on it, and killer margaritas, I would say this is one of my favorite restaurants in New Orleans!

Recently I was with a group of 8 who stopped at the Butcher and the Barkeep to have dinner.  They do not accept reservations or call ahead, but when we arrived the restaurant was not busy.  It was a Sunday evening..  We were told there would be a slight wait while they setup for us.  45 minutes later they indicated the people at the table they wanted to put us at had paid but not yet left.  There was plentiful open space where they could have put two tables together and served us, but instead told us to wait at an out of the way location.  Now having waited an hour, and no word on when we would be seated our group left never to return again.  If you have more than a group of 4 I would strongly recommend you don't go to the Butcher and the Barkeep.

We stopped for lunch and ordered the sample platter to share. Plenty of meat for my husband and I to share. The woman recommended the beans - good pick! We had the coleslaw as the second side, it lacked flavor, but was not overly dressed and the slaw was crunchy, so that was a plus. Clean restaurant but no restroom  brisket was our favorite meat.....we will be back!
Great lunch at The Little Lion after a morning at the American Revolution Museum. Our server, Todd,  was the best server we have had in a long time. Food was fresh and cooked perfectly.

Quaint and relaxing atmosphere with great service and "hits the spot" casual dining!  What a fantastic spot for an outdoor (weather permitting) meal or pub atmosphere indoors.  And plenty of TV's to watch a sporting event that you want to cheer on!

Was craving a burger, so stopped in with my wife who's never been here.  The food didn't disappoint us, and was cooked just as we ordered!  She ordered the "one-eyed"burger with fried egg and white cheddar with lettuce wrap instead of a bun; and I ordered the bacon cheddar burger with jalapeño cheese instead of cheddar.  Burger was charred just right and every bite was juicy and tender - perfect!  Even the fries were hot out of the  fryer, so we didn't leave anything left on our plates to take home for the dog.  This evening they also had a smoked brisket soup that was tasty, creamy and chunky - did not go hungry tonight!  I did ask for some tomato and onion condiments, and they brought several fresh tomato slices and onion, super customer service!

Definitely check out their board specials when stopping here for a meal or cold one.  And if you want to be out of the hustle and bustle, stop in to say hi to the staff and enjoy a good meal.  Cheers!

Really tasty fried chicken.

We stopped by a few minutes after 10 AM on a Friday morning, and the place was already nearly full, but luckily we were seated as a party of four. We split 3 fried chicken platters, including sides of mac and cheese, fried okra, and the red beans. The fried chicken was very lightly breaded and very juicy; overall, it had was very flavorful and among the better fried chickens I've had. The sides were decent--I especially enjoyed the fried okra, while the mac and cheese was not bad. 

It's not the easiest place to get to, and when we left an hour later, there was a pretty lengthy line out the door. It's a nice change of pace relative to the rest of the city and is a good place for a no-frills meal.

Holy. Mother. Of God!! Was in town for a tradeshow, had a desire for Mexican food so yelped my way to a spot that was closed (sad!). Yelped again to this gem and was pleasantly surprised by the amazing food and service! I will definitely be back in the spring when show returns!

Should be number one! Everything is exceptional, fresh, deliciously prepared and presented! Stopped in for lunch on the way back to truckee and had the Tuna and the Cuban along with the Cuban bean cup of soup WOW - biggest cup of soup we have ever seen ! We listened to copious others all enjoying and complimenting Sabrina

This is an old neighborhood staple. The decor is the same as it was over 20 years ago and the staff and customers are too!  Don't expect the best food or newest things but it's reliably friendly and tasty, especially for the price.

perfect way to enjoy new Orleans atmosphere, people watching, yummy beignets and coffee!! The line is long but goes super fast.  Very quick service, cash only though. If you've never been, def stop in!

Extremely disappointed, this place had great reviews but we went in and there were dead bugs under the tables and the floor was so greasy. We left without ordering, the food might be good but if you can't even wash the floor where your customers sit, how clean do you keep your kitchen?
So good every time we go. New age chicken Masala is the best. Just get every naan they have.

We started going to the new Currents location. Great atmosphere and the acoustics allow you to have an enjoyable conversation. The staff "fantastic". 
In the last five weeks we have been there nine times. Tonight as well as last Friday we met with friends in the lounge.  Last week our group ended up sitting next to a six year olds birthday party. Tonight we sat amongst three tables in the lounge with kids three to six years old. In all cases the kids were quiet and well behaved. 
Tonight some of our Friday night group have opted to meet else where because of the kids issue. They make a good point, they are willing to eat their dinner in the lounge rather than the comfort of the dinning room to avoid being around kids.

Located in the Ponchartrain Hotel, this bar (once a penthouse) has intimate indoor seating and opens to an outdoor area with a beautiful view of the city.  Side note: the inside is just as beautiful as the view outside, but this is definitly the place to go if you are looking for a view of NOLA. Their cocktails are great, view and atmosphere on point, but like any good place it can get crowded so I suggest getting there early (before 9pm on the weekends) to grab a drink before a night out or if you can grab a spot with a view you might as well stay the whole night and relax!

Reserved a room online but when I came they said they ran out of same kind of rooms. I was charged 33 more dollars for another room with the microwave and the fridge i don't need.

After I gave the feedback, I got a call from GSR to refund the money. I recommend to talk to a manager for certain situation. 

I'm satisfied that GSR cares about their customers and reputation.

Ate here for a pre-Christmas lunch with coworkers and everything was fantastic.  The queso, guacamole, and chips were irresistible (even the queso was pleasantly spicy instead of the usual bland goop) and my entree - shrimp fajitas - was delicious.  Everyone really enjoyed their entrees and the service was great.  Would love to come back in warm weather for cocktails on the beautiful patio.
A great cuppa joe is all about the experience, and La Colombe is one you do NOT want to miss. The open industrial factory feel has amazing character

Annamaria the GM is absolutely amazing! Her customer service is above and beyond, and we were thoroughly impressed!! We found this place by accident and stayed because the food, service and atmosphere was amazing!!!! What a gem!

Great little sandwich place in the heart of Beverly. Homemade pretzel buns filled with traditional Swiss fillings. Delicious hand made pastries and fresh coffee to complete the meal. My favourites are the Heidi and the Bride. Owner is super friendly and makes you feel welcome. She takes her time making the sandwiches so don't go if you are in a rush.

This was the most authentic pizza restaurant I have found in New Orleans. Everything was DELICIOUS! I'd highly recommend the mozzarella sticks. This place is just a few blocks from me in my new neighborhood, so I'm sure I'll become a regular.

The gel paint job was horrible. It was on my cuticles, on the sides, etc. A portion of the paint snagged a week later and I peeled it right off. This was the worst paint and filing job I have ever had. I will never go back. I had to have my nails redone (another $65) a week after I had them done here! My nails were crap for Christmas, it sucked! Money down the drain.
Best Fish Tacos ever!!!!!!! Totally recommend this place. It's worth it. Have had a few other meals off the menu as well and everything is excellent........now I'm hungry
They support Laundry Love! Gotta be big hearts! See Laundry Love details on www.worthstreetreach.org

These guys are a mess and a waste of time.

My wife, daughter and I drove in from Delaware County PA to see a specific Honda on their website. 
Upon arrival I was told that it was on the Mitsubishi lot and to talk to salesman "W". 
After 15 minutes salesman "W" told me that it was actually at the Fiat lot in Marlton "right down the street" but "maybe you'd like to take a look at another car instead?" The other car was twice the price. We told him we had only come too see the Honda.
Salesman "W" said they will bring the car up for us in 15 minutes.
15 minutes later salesman "W" said it would be quicker to go to the car instead of waiting for it to be brought up. 
We followed Salesman "A" and drove another 15 minutes in our car to Marlton to test drive the car.
After 15 minutes more at the Fiat dealership and nearly and hour in total spent with their staff we were told that the car had been sold earlier in the day, BUT MAYBE WE WOULD LIKE TO SEE SOMETHING ELSE? 
During the process three different salesmen attempted too try to have us look at other cars that we did not want to see. 
Each time I had been asked about other cars I had informed each of the salesmen that we were only interested in seeing the Honda.

In short, the dealership staff was disorganized and seemingly incapable of locating a car that had actually been sold. They wasted an hour of our time knowing full well that we had only come to see one specific car. 

We would never consider buying a car from this dealership, nor can I recommend it to family or friends. I've never seen more disorganization or more of a classic "used car salesman" approach and pressure from a dealership before.

horrible. they will put in system of theirs that u filled your rx their, so when you take your new one to wal-mart bcuz you hate ldi pharmacy and the inconveniece, but if it is a maintenace drug you must use ldi, but you can use retail pharmacy 2 times. Anyway,  they make you look like a fool arughing with walmart that you did not get anything from their pertaining to the rx in question. Just recently i called ldi and demanded to know what lies or pure laziness are you typing in your computer? Then I was told that the medication that I use for seizures so it is of great importance to not miss a dose for nearly 2 weeks one time. Anyway, the lady preceeded to tell me that the med has been sitting there w/o my knowledge of it as I had new rx for wal-mart. ldi had med ready and wariting there for 11 days. they did not bother to deliver or call and say that they had the medication. they r ringing up ik  their system without your knowledge so they cause you to look plain crwzy with the retail pharmacy. they make you look like your lying bcuz of theur crap. ldi is a horrible place to have to use bcuz your unsurance forces you to use them for certain meds. i would give them no stars if avail. they have the laziest staff as well. the girls up front are generally playing with their phones in their laps and ignore that ur there until they complete whatever it ois they are doing. they also take forever to fill medication. u can easily be sitting in their for 45 min b4 they have one script ready. THEY SHOULD LOSE THEIR LICENSE.

This was our first experience here at Del Frisco's, and will definitely not be our last. We started with the ahi tuna tacos, and they were amazing! The coffee pork shank was also delicious. My husband got the salmon, and it was a little salty for our taste. We had a little room for dessert and shared the salted Carmel pudding, and that topped off our dinner- so yummy! The atmosphere there was very nice.

On a cold Wednesday Nashville evening I found myself in need of dinner. Using a combination of Yelp and Open Table I was able to book a table for one at Gray & Dudley. I arrived about 30 minutes early but was able to sit at their fully stocked bar to have a pre dinner drink. I was impressed with their whisky variety as they went way beyond the local offerings with some nice scotches, Irish, and even a bottle of Kavalan (Taiwan). My table was soon available and I pretty much knew what I was going to order as I sat down.

Food: Lots of great selections but I had my eye on the Crispy Pork Shank for a couple days now. I mean they combine two of my favorite culinary words that being Pork and Crispy..how could that not be great dish. My server warns me that it's quite a large portion but I assure her that I am up for the challenge. I also challenge her and the bartender to come up with a cocktail using a smoky scotch and they deliver a delish drink combo of Laphroig, Gin, and Bitters. The entree arrives and it's a sight to behold, that lovely piece of pork sitting on a bed of grilled Brussel sprouts. Brussel Sprouts are supposed to be very healthy right so I consider this dish to be partly vegetarian! It was very good, nicely crisped exterior, juicy tender porkiness under the skin...the sprouts were good as well and complemented it well. It wasn't as fatty as i thought and had wonderful flavor and texture. After that meal I had a little room for dessert so went with their special GD Cluster which was a GooGoo cluster made especially for them. While waiting for my dessert someone drops off a mound of fluffy, airy cotton candy...I was like how can this meal get any better..i know, have some on the house fresh cotton candy!

Server: My server Emily was amazing, she's only been there a short while but she enhanced the evening greatly. She checked on me often, was super friendly (then again is that a southern thing), and really elevated the service experience to match the cuisine.

Atmosphere: Nice restaurant that was down an alley way...seems like many restaurants in Nashville are down an alley so who am I to judge right.  Pretty large space with a nice bar,  I was seated in the back portion of the restaurant which I enjoyed because I had a view of the open kitchen. There's a blue penguin thing by the door..be sure to ask about that when. you dine at G&D.

Value: Great value for the quality and service. Prices in general seem to be lower than other "big" cities and I've found food quality is on par with Chicago, San Francisco, and Manhattan. 

Overall: I'd recommend G&D to anyone going to Nashville, it's definitely worth a visit....just remember the words Crispy Pork!

this is the second time we've come to chelsea's tavern and have had the same server for the second time. anything she does takes FOREVER. i don't understand because honestly it's not that busy. to even be greeted took 10 minutes. had to send back my cider waffle (which didn't even have the crisp on it -which the server didn't even know it was supposed to be on there? how do you not know your menu) because it was SO soggy from sitting under the heat lamps. no ketchup was brought to the table, no water refills until late. waiting for a mimosa and a build it your own bloody mary took forever. which is kind of ironic because we just had to wait for the vodka and you make it yourself. i can't say if i know if i'll be back unless i have 3 hours to spare and want to be annoyed.

Really disappointed in this place. I was greatly looking forward to trying their red beans & rice veggie burger, and was let down by both the food and the service.

I dropped in on Halloween for some take-out. The place was packed and super loud, and I wanted to eat somewhere I could hear myself think. When I get up to the window, the guy makes me wait quite a while to order. Then I wait even longer for my food to arrive. Weird since there's only one other table of diners; most people are just drinking, because it's in a bar after all. 

When at last my burger arrives, in a brown bag toted by a young girl with a decidedly sullen attitude, it is smaller than expected and there's no sauce on it. None. Who the hell wants a burger, veggie or otherwise, with no flippin' mayo? Particularly when the menu proudly states that is comes dressed with tabasco aioli. 

"There's no sauce on this," I say. 
"Did you want some?" asks the girl, as though baffled by such a request. Then she takes the bag into the kitchen and returns it moments later without a word.

I check the sauce levels; there is one dab, the size of a damn nickle. Are you kidding me? I didn't bother to ask for more. My companions were itching to leave, and I had some mustard and mayo packets back at my room. 

The burger tasted as tragic as it looked, too. The patty was dense as clay with very little flavor, and there weren't enough pickles or lettuce to jazz up the texture. The whole thing was very meh and it kind of bummed me out.

On a side note, the bathrooms at Faubourg were reprehensibly filthy, and the doors didn't lock properly.

Can't go wrong with Moe's. Unlimited chips and some of the best queso around. This was our first time at this location. The location was not busy, and the staff were quick. The place was really clean, and they got our food accurate. They also have some good deals if you download their app and sign up for the rewards.

I placed an order online for a comforter and a body pillow same pattern and color.  I went to pickup my order a day later and received the comforter fine however the pillow was a different pattern and color.  I advised the clerk this was incorrect and proceeded to show her my order, which she had access to.  She could clearly see it was wrong.  She then goes to check the floor to see if they had one there.  She came back empty handed and advised she can give me a refund.  I requested she call the Turnersville store as they may have in stock and I can pick up from there.  She calls and they say they don't have it.  She advises she will give me a refund and said someone should have called to advise me the pillow was not in stock.  I did not receive a call or email. 
 
The return is processing and I placed the order again to pickup at the Turnersville store as the website states they have in stock.  I will follow up with another review once my pillow has been received.
 
Not a happy customer at all.  I wish I was notified and that this Cherry Hill Walmart was more organized.

The staff here are very nice. They are always quick with my order and I am noticed right away once I walk into the door. I love coming in this location to satisfy my coffee crave. Black coffee is what I tend to crave and they always show me the selection of flavors.

Best Korean food in Boise, no comparison... it is usually busy but they work very hard and fast and as busy as they always are the food always arrives quickly. My wife and I look for Korean food in every city we ever go to and we have looked for Korean food and gin to every Korean place in the valley and none come close. I only wish we had found it sooner

I am a frequent guest of this establishment and I am always beyond satisfied. The employees are so sweet, the bathrooms are PERFECTION. It is great for afternoon meetings with, lunch date, family friendly, or just to have a cup of coffee and work on your computer. The food --especially the desserts-- are so good, they have broken the code in baking good gluten-free desserts. 

I recently ordered some cupcakes for my daughters birthday ( I called the night before ---I was that person) and there was no issue AND they were ready early! 

If you haven't been here before I highly encourage you stop in whether or not you are on a GF restricted diet you will leave satisfied.

The pizza here is good.  Think California Pizza kitchen with fresh ingredients and a more sophisticated atmosphere.  My favorite thing here is actually not the pizza.  I love the tomato basil soup with the grilled cheese.  The grilled cheese in this case is a white pizza with no sauce.

A great menu that invites you back to try another selection! Andrew, our server, was very helpful, especially choosing the Etude Pinot Noir wine. It was cool in the restaurant and they have light blankets!
We started with the whipped ricotta corn dip with Zeppoles, which seemed like lightly fried pizza  dough. It's a great combination!  This was from the nibbles part of the menu. 
Then we moved to the starters. These are plates to be shared. We over ordered. The hot chicken was a delicious take on chicken fingers. The fig tart was big and messy. Wouldn't order again. 
The main menu had some great choices. I had the  Nduja Bolognese, which was a pasta with a nice spicy sauce. My wife had the short ribs over pasta, another good one. 
We were too full for dessert.

Good food. Location is kinda out there so we went out of our way to eat. Tacos were very good. Chorizo was very very good. All fresh ingredients. Chips and salsa were definitely lacking a little especially for the price. Homemade chips weren't exactly what I was looking for.

Stopped in after the boat parade for a few bites to wait on traffic. Beautiful decor and ambiance. We were seated quickly and brought waters. We ordered vegetable and chicken spring rolls and crab Rangoon to start. A friend trio but they weren't laden  in grease or heavy, but flavorful, crisp and light. The accompanying sauce was a good compliment. I had woon sen soup and while simple it had enough spice and good flavor. Dad had pepper steaks but dug in before I could get a pic. Mom kept to the appetizers and there were plenty to share and be full on. Will be coming back to get through more of the menu for sure!!

My family dined at Antoine's earlier this week and we were terribly disappointed. We expected this iconic restaurant to be so much better (in many ways) than it was. We ordered alligator bisque and two other appetizers for the table. We all got our soup, then here came salads for those who ordered them. Kept thinking the other appetizers were just a little slow coming out. Nope. They never came out, but certainly were on the check!  The entrees were good, but nowhere near how they should've been for the price. Get that.....good, not terrific, fabulous or wonderful. Just good. We've since been to two other iconic NOLA restaurants that ran circles around Antoine's! It's fun to say you've been where a famous dish was developed, so my suggestion is to go for appetizers and drinks. Dinner and service were both disappointments.
Interesting concept but falls short on execution. Menu was very interesting, but food did not deliver. Portion of the burger was small and toppings were not very good.

This place had nice staff a year or two ago when my cats were kittens and I was regularly spending money here. Just stopped in to get a gift for a friend's cat and the woman working there now is the rudest and most condescending salesperson I've ever encountered. Didn't look up when I walked in, barely acknowledged my friendly greeting. She actually reprimanded me for setting off one of the cat toys that makes noise and told me to "never do that again." I won't, since I'll never be back to this store again
Good and friendly service. The char-grilled oysters were very delicious!  If you get the oyster shooter I highly recommend you stir it for a boost of flavor!

I haven't met many people who seem to genuinely enjoy meticulously repairing shoes.  I had some experience doing shoe repair a while ago, and the workshop was dark, and humorless, filled with the sound of talk radio and the smell of chemicals and dirt sanded off suede shoes,.  Dom's is a happy, hectic, welcoming place. There is a chance you'll show up on the day your shoes are ready and be told by Dom to come back in an hour, and when you'll show up an hour later, he'll make you wait another 5 minutes to finish the repair, but the repair work is excellently done and affordable, and the conversation while you also wait is great.

Went in today around 12 in the afternoon. There were two women behind the counter working their asses off and I was greeted with a big smile. The menu is very large right behind the counter and relatively easy to read. Tons of vegan and vegetarian options! I ordered the breakfast burrito with vegan cheese instead of regular and a large coffee. If you bring in your own cup they take 50 cents off. I got the French roast, which is actually really really good... Very robust. They have some really good soy milk out on the self-serve counter... I'm actually pretty picky about soy milk and get really particular about how my coffee is made. I am coming back here a million times. The bathroom was very clean, which makes one feel pretty good about the cleanliness of the kitchen. Also saw a bunch of pretty inspirational things written on the bathroom walls... There's plenty of outlets available in the cafe to plug in for a while and several places to sit. By the way, the burrito was very well made - not soggy, everything was mixed together well, and she grilled it so that it stuck together. Sliced it into perfect halves. I really really like it here.
I love this car wash!! It actually cleans my car! The only part I don't like is the wait, but I'm sure that's because everyone else realizes it's a good car wash.

My husband and I were wandering around State Street looking for a bite and a glass of wine when we stumbled on Mosto Crudo- the answer to all our problems! The decor was fun, eclectic, and felt very cozy. The wine list was well curated. One of the owners, Alejandra, helped guide me through the wine list expertly. She and the chef who own the place were so friendly and knowledgeable. The food was absolutely sublime - we had the steak tartare, crostinis, and the octopus (which was the best I've ever had!) Will definitely come back to this hidden gem next time I'm in SB.
My new favorite sushi spot in the area. Food never disappoints, service is great, and it's a beautiful restaurant.

Not sure why there's such a low rating. I've ordered from here two or three times a month for the past two years and never an issue. Super friendly guys working inside as well. Whatever I like Pizza Hut I guess I'm a trash person.
The food is real tasty.  The egg rolls are a bit greasy for me but I enjoyed the rest of the meal.  We had them cater a work party for us last year and we all enjoyed the food.
Decoration is good! Place is small but taste of food is quite good! We tried the thali and loved it! Will definitely recommend!

Very slow service, nice waitress, just not enough help for an all you can eat.We constantly had to patiently wave them down for orders, felt like we were a nuisance.Some of the sushi we ordered was incorrect and tasted at best mediocre but at least it's made to order.

Impressive experience shopping for ice skate. The store manager actually assisted us. They are sent back East for training four times a year by the manufacturer. He was incredibly knowledgeable, helpful and friendly.

Wonderful location for movies, and I am absolutely thrilled about the seating renovation for the main theatre.  The smaller one upstairs though should have revisions because once seated - trapped! (or greatly annoying people).  With the subject of seating....I do hope for reserved seating. I admit it!

Line was long but worth it! The most delicious tourist trap food I've ever had! I opted for a small white (breast/leg quarter) with a side of Mac and cheese and baked beans. Sweet tea. Everything was amazing and the service was quick considering the # Of people in line. It's a must-try if you're in the area.

Called to check on wait times for Christmas lunch. Was asked the size of my party (2) and told there may be a 15-20 minute wait. So Mister and I dressed and bundled up for the four block walk. Arrived and the place was loud and the staff was snapping at each other. We were approached by a staff member who asked if we were looking to be seated. Not sure why else we would be standing in the doorway but um yes please. Then she asked for a reservation and I explained my phone call earlier. Oh well too bad someone from this establishment told you 15 minutes ago there was a short wait, but we aren't seating anyone without a reservation. Would've been nice to have been told so over the phone when I specifically asked about eating today. That boils down to bad service so we won't be back.

The place was nice. My daughters had an "OK" time. Service was extremely slow however. the seats do have a lot of room.  The food and prices were comparable to a Chillis or Applebees. This theater is cheaper than similar cinema grills, but remember you get what you pay for. It has a lot of potential.

I absolutely love this gym. I have no idea why it has such low rating! Although it doesn't have a pool like most people would like, I am not a pool kind of girl so I am not missing it. It is smaller but that's what I love about it! I have been there when they first open all the way through the end of the night and I have never felt like it was busy which is of course a huge plus. 
The childcare center is phenomenal! My baby boy is just shy of two years old and he loves everyone who works there! They're all so loving and patient and they will do everything they can before they have to come pull you out of your exercise. Some days I don't have him with me and they ask me how he is and why he isn't there. That shows me they take the time to get to know your child and really do care.
The trainers are absolutely top notch! My personal favorites are Laura, Angie and Jamie! They're energy level is unmatched! They kick your butt and make you work hard without belittling you. They make you want to give your all and push yourself which is what I need! I joined Angie's boot camp class and it has completely changed my life and way of thinking! The way she has developed a sense of community is just amazing! I wouldn't dare go  anywhere else! 
The staff that checks you in and that you see throughout the gym is very kind and helpful. 
Overall, I love this gym and the people that is apart of it!

Superb service and awesome food! First off as customers, we were a mess. Toddlers running in and out making noise, we had to change tables there was always something we needed and the waiter was EXTREMELY accomodating even when we made reservations you could tell they wanted to make us confortable. The food was top notch. The mac and cheese came in a small cast iron and it was done to perfection;perfect amount of crisp on the noodles and the cheese was seasoned well. We also had a crostini that had honey and truffle oil on goat cheese. The flavors meshed well with the wine. Everyone enjoyed their meals. We would definitely go back!
Awful, overpriced, cold sides, ribs too fatty, nothing has much taste. Really wanted this to be good!!

Timing is everything.  The place looks like a ton of fun if you come when the fun people are there as well.  We visited from 30 miles away on a cold, snowy Saturday for lunch.  My wife and I were first timers while we accompanied friends who had come before a few times.  

First off, the beer is top notch!  Indiana Amber, Gnaw Bone Pale and the Snake Pit Porter are just fantastic brews.  Nice work, OB brew crew.  (I was a little surprised that I wasn't offered any to purchase and carry out but maybe they just don't have the process or place to do that.)  

Overall, the food was good.  My grilled tuna sandwich & fries was terrific (nice horsey sauce) and my wife's tenderloin met up to Indiana's tough standards regarding such.  The "Cowboy Caviar" was an excellent appetizer, but the name doesn't really do it justice.  If it works for OB, then it works for me too, I guess.  One of my table mates wasn't a fan of the roasted red pepper on her Reuben but her husband was good with it.   The bread pudding for dessert seemed to be a table hit.

While the service and the beer were both excellent, and the food was pretty good, the ambiance / atmosphere of the place didn't quite win me over.  Sitting over on the family side (to the left once you enter), I felt a little bit like I was in a cramped Ponderosa Steakhouse.  Next time I'm going to push to sit in the "Brewhouse" which looks much cooler.

In a city with TONS of other excellent choices, Oaken Barrel is worth a stop or adding to your rotation.

Food it's really good!!!! The waiter my nice but very slow he never comeback to ask for refills my husband asked for a beer we need to ask another waitress for the beer and refills. I will comeback for sure hope next time we have a better service

Not ever going back, do not listen to what you want.  Really disappointed in the services, they use to be good but have gone downhill.  They first messed up putting on nail tips, she cut my nails way down, put tips on and cut them shorter than my fingers, i told her they are way to short but she laughed and said i would like them.  I did not like them, i called and was told to come back.  I waited for them to grow out, i went for fill, horrible, within 1 week gel nail polish is peeling, they charged me 35 for the fill, not cheap.  So the last 2 trips were horrible.  Almost 100 into my nails and they look terrible.  I am going to have to go somewhere else to have them repainted, i have never had gel peel before.  Sad, they use to be good

Short story: good burger, not amazing but good, and over priced. They offer vegetarian options as well which is nice. 

Long story: my husband loves this place so he took me here to try it. I was not blown away by it as he was. He ordered the CEO burger and I ordered the single CEO (same burger with one patty instead of two). The burger itself was good. It wasn't juicy but cooked well done, which I actually like in my burgers, no pink for me! It was good quality meat. It comes on a potato bun, which since I only ordered a single seemed like too much bun to meat ratio, they were fat buns but if you squish it down its not so bad. The condiments it comes with was slim so it was dry. If you cook a burger well done you have to have sauce on it. I added grilled mushrooms to mine ($1 upcharge). Those were good. 

I got a side of the special garlic fries they offer which were good but the garlic aioli is only drizzled on top so most of the fries underneath don't have the sauce, and don't try to ask for extra sauce it's $1 for a side of it. We ordered 2 burgers, 1 drink and 1 side of fries and it was $27!! Sorry too expensive for what it is. 

I appreciate that they do offer veggie burgers as well. I'm not a vegetarian but have many friends that are so that's kinda nice for a burger place. 

The inside is cute but freezing cold! They also have an outside patio which we sat at because, did I mention it was like Antarctica inside?? The outside patio was nice as well. Honestly it wasn't bad food but I probably won't be back. Too pricey when there's so much good competition.

This location is always speedy and I love to use the App. App always has daily deals and gives you free coffee after multiple purchase.

New manager is very helpful and personable. He is an upgrade from past managers. Right now it is buy $10 via masterpass and get an additional $10 free.

This place is joke...ordered a tap of beer it was skunkie I could drink it, the bar was so cold the bartender was wearing a coat and when I went to the men's room it was about 50 degrees in there. Will not be returning
Highly recommend this escape room! We did the Mardi Gras theme and were able to escape! Lucille was a great host.

Took my family of 6 here for the 1st time last week & was not happy at all. Ordered loaded chili cheese fries for $7-$8 & they had 1 spoonful of chili on soggy fries, asked server about cheese & jalapeños & she told me they were underneath - when I checked & they were not, she brought me cold, shredded cheese & cup of jalapeños. When I asked if cheese should be melted she said it was supsd to be cold - WHAT?! I was expecting a heaping portion of hot, LOADED fries for $8, that's the price of Outback loaded fries which are amazing  - these were terrible, TERRIBLE, almost like someone was playing a joke on me. Our double burgers were also served a la carte (for $8 each) & were nothing special at all. Would have much rather gotten the $4 fries & double burgers at Steak N Shake w all their flavored options & grilled onions, fried eggs, etc. The bun on my daughters hot dog was burnt & smelled so strong she would only eat the hot dog, all 6 of our fries were cold & soggy. The veggie burger was pretty good. Everyone at the table was disappointed, server couldn't have cared less, will not be back.

The assistant manager hid her badge so we could not report her. 
They made our order incorrectly at the drive through then told us to pull up and they would redo it. We sat in the car with our baby and no one came out. When my husband went inside 15 mins later they hadn't even started redoing anything....this was Saturday dec 16th at 10:13am... horrible horrible service. 
That assistant manager lady should be fired for such horrible disrespectful service.  Owners and managers should display their contact information so that staff like her can be directly reported. 
Especially since she clearly didn't care since she said we couldn't do anything anyway because she was leaving for Buffalo in 2 weeks

I was recently in Indianapolis (fell in love with the city and the people there).  My husband was having surgery and we flew from Pennsylvania to Indiana because this surgeon was so highly recommended.  That was great too but I'm here to review food.  The night before his surgery I wanted to go someplace I knew he'd like.  One of his favorite things on planet earth is fried chicken.  Looking over options this seemed to be the place to go.  I must insert here now that my husband is 69 and I am 61.  But I'd like to think that we are youthful and delight in new things.  This place is young and hip and we did feel a little out of place.  It's family seating with a modern flare.  We were undoubtedly the oldest is the place.  Now I must tell you that everyone treated us wonderfully.  And the fried chicken was fabulous.  We loved it with the spicy honey.  The mac and cheese and mashed potatoes and biscuits were superb.  I hate it when I order wine and get just a couple of sips.  Alcohol kind of pricy for what you get.  At least wine was.  So there you have it.  Really good food but the ambience was not for us older folks.

Best tacos in Tampa! My boss brought me there and now I stop by after work all the time. Tortillas are homemade right in front of you. Tacos are loaded with flavor. Place is a little small and can feel very crowded, but the food is always fresh. My favorites are the ribeye and shrimp tacos. Definitely a must try!

My friends and I have been the The Edge MANY times! We always get a table and the last handful of times we were taken care of by Alex Kanwetz and Teeazha Akin. They have always been great! We have such a good time and they always go out of their way to make sure we are enjoying ourselves and have everything we need. Id give more starts if I could! See you in Feb for my bday.

My wife and I LOVE Two Chicks. It is our very favorite spot for sausage and eggs. They have the best sausage patties in town, they are locally made and you can tell. Such amazing flavor. I love to get the duck eggs, and put the egg on top of the patty, so the delicious (and perfectly over medium) and rich yolk will run all over the sausage...mmmmmm. Beautiful biscuits with rotating fruit butters, yesterday it was black berry. My wife loves the hash browns and I go for the sweet potato home fries. Both super delicious. If you go during peak times (weekends), be patient. They give you a buzzer pager deal, so you can walk around the little shops. You will have a wait after 9 on a weekend BUT it's totally worth the wait, every time.

Terrible service I returned the rental car two hours after I got it. I prepaid for my rental which the funds were taken out and when I got there to pick up the car the agent asked me for the credit card I used which has happened at other rental places so I thought nothing of it. She then proceeded to try and run the card again but my credit card company immediately Flagged it because I had just prepaid for the rental hours before. I told her that I got a text when she ran it that it was declined because it was ran twice for the same amount.I asked if they could just adjust the prepaid amount since it was already done and she stated that I would have to call the credit card company and see when it would be removed. I asked what was the point of prepaying especially when they already had the funds. I asked was I paying some additional charges and she stated no I was just paying for the rental. I was confused because she could clearly see I had already paid.I then asked if I could use another card as if I stepped out of line I would have to to wait again behind about 20 people and I had to be at work. I would call the credit card company later and remove the charge. I had my debit card and I asked could I use that and she stated yes but they needed to see my ticket for my flight out of the airport. I stepped to the side so I could pull it up and then was helped by another lady who never asked for it. The new lady then went on to tell me my total was over 700.00. I asked so it went from 132.00 to 700.00. Then she stated oh no it's 340.00. I asked is it because I am using a debit card are the charging me a hold. The lady stated yes and I would get it back. So I agreed so I could get the car and get to work. I start driving and get a text message that 565.00 was debited from my account. I get immediately turn around and go back and the was told by another worker in the service area where you pull up she only saw my prepaid amount and no other payment on the account. She asked why would another payment method be required when the total was already prepaid. She turned around the screen and showed me the prepaid amount. I proceeded to go back to the counter and speak with manager and the two ladies who helped me. I told them I was returning the car and I wanted to know where the charge for the 565.00 was at because I was only told that the prepaid amount was showing. They all looked clueless. I pulled up my bank statement and showed them and the manager did something in the computer and said oh I see it. I proceeded to ask why I was made to pay that if it was already prepaid. She stated no there was no prepayment I used my debit card. I laughed and showed her the receipt I was given when I pulled back in that only showed the prepaid amount. She then proceeded to tell me that the funds will be released in 24 to 48 hours from my bank. I told her that's not answering my question but thanks and that 90.00 would be deducted for the two hours I had the car. I left even more confused.

Went to bam bam last night.  The food was tasty and the service was friendly.  They were busy and took a little while to take our order, but brought some free small plates which was a really nice gesture.  Would definitely recommend.
Had a great time in boot camp - Nick is an awesome gamemaster!   We were blown away (except not really - we got out with 7:00 to go!!

My girlfriend had this local in her list of places to try in the city so on the night of the 8th of December we visited. The place is rather small. I counted about 4 tables so sitting can be a problem. Luckily, when we got in, we found an empty table and we took it. After that we ordered an "affogato flight" which consists of 4 affogati and it costs $25 (it seems to be a special concoction). The ladies that were serving customers were nice and polite. One of them worked hard on our order which took about 5 minutes to prepare. He co-worker eventually brought it to our table. My girlfriend took the Cookie Monster (Mexican hot chocolate) and Vietnamese coffee (stracciatella). I took the Matcha Matcha (green tea) and the Classico (Tahitian vanilla). From what I tasted, I really liked both affogati and, as a fan of the affogato in general, they were somewhat pricey but probably worth the money. What wasn't worth was to listen to 3 adult jerks and 2 young kids trashing the place with loud behavior and their raging complete disrespect for the rest of the people around them. As I was trying to enjoy my affogati I was really trying to hold myself from punching the assholes that were sitting next to us (2 women and 1 man who were raised like savages and their kids are nothing different). The only reason I did not get into a fight is because I did not want my girlfriend to see me get into a fight.
Notice: the plural of affogato is affogati and not affogatos!

DO NOT USE THIS COMPANY!!!!! Was supposed to be here at 9a.m. and I'm still waiting while writing this review.  Probably not going to show up.  Paid this company for their services and they've shown up once and have not answered any of my calls.  I actually had to go to the office to find out what was going on and they offered no apologies or reason for ignoring me and not showing up like I paid them to do.  BASICALLY THEY STOLE FROM ME!! Took my money and lied to me.  The one time they did come they guy left my house a mess and did not live up to what he had told me he was going to do.  Absolutely disappointed with this company.  I'll never recommend them to anyone or use them again.  hopefully they'll realize they stole from me and give me my money back.

Had our Daughter's Bat Mitzvah there on 3/11/17. Can not believe it is over already.  2 1/2 years in the making and The Fuge hit it out of the ballpark! Everyone is still calling / emailing us and telling us how fantastic it was. The food was wonderful, the service top notch, and the atmosphere, well that speaks for itself! Everyone was so amazed to learn that this "hidden treasure" was in their backyard!  We can not Thank The Fuge and their staff enough. They truly made it magical!
Great service and facilities. We travel the US in our RV for over three years and have never been disappointed in our massages wherever we have gone.

Sat down with another group in front of us and was ignored for 25 minutes. The group in front and behind us were waited on and served immediately. At the 30 min point we were finally acknowledged and asked for our drink order. Here at the 45 minute mark waiting in our food as the the group in front and behind finish their meals. Here on vacation and will not be coming back or rendering anyone to your establishment.
Great Mexican food and drinks for a small spot in Webster, good service.  Been here twice and have enjoyed the tacos the most.  They tend to have specials also
The eastside with carnitas was delicious... the meat was very tender, poached eggs was cooked perfectly. I had the macchiato and it was delicious and strong!

This place is in my hood so I want to see it succeed but $9 for cauliflower is nuts. The perceived value of a basket of cauli or nachos for the same price...come on now! Also I'd like to make note that their Cuban style nachos have a meat that looks exactly like the word pico de Gallo...so when this girl allergic to beef asks what it is and say oh shit I'm allergic to beef I would have liked to have had the option to switch it out and not scrape it off like the idiot I am (they were good but I did get sick from the beef). I'd recommend putting in meat or peanut things called out in the menu for those of us who have allergies bad enough that we carry around $800 EpiPens (not to add to or immense street cred already). I'd also love a few more vegetarian options. The avacado tacos are baller but I'd love a few more things like Seitan bun or something to have alternative entree options. 

Just some things to think about. I'll be back but it would be a lot more often if I had more options to choose from.

Great location, plenty of parking, the place is presentable and clean. Prices are basic my hourly, half day, full day, etc. and are reasonable. However, the customer service is poor, stinks, not up to par. The employees watch sports in the computer monitor while customers are in store. I needed help and asked the man to help and he was so caught up in his sports that he ignored me until I asked for the second time. I won't go back.

I was waiting for a package, the store sent a text, saying it was delivered. It wasn't. Instead, my package was dropped off at a completely different address. Not even close to my address. Thankfully an honest person got it to me. UPS drivers don't care about their job.

I can't believe it's taken all this time for me to try the infamous, La Segunda! I tried the Cuban and continental special, both pressed. The Cuban was average tasting for me. I much preferred the continental special because the roast beef stood out. I also ordered a cappuccino for a cold day. It came extremely hot! It took forever for it to cool down enough for it to be drinkable, so be careful!

I went here for dinner the night before Christmas Eve. Didn't need any reservations. The staff and service is phenomenal. I'm definitely going back again. Everything on their menu that I tried was amazing. I tried the wagyu hot rock, mozzarella  tempura, oh my god roll, and chicken teriyaki. Loved each and everything. The service was really quick, I was done with everything in less than an hour. A must try.

Great food and service, I'd suggest going Wednesday for their chicken fried pork steak, fills you up for sure prices are good for the amount and quality of food you get, almost a weekly thing for me just a great atmosphere in there
Everything is amazing. If you like collared greens get them. The deviled eggs are awesome, and of course the fried chicken! Every time I come to St. Louis I eat here before leaving town.

Ambiance was great. Food was delicious BUT I ordered Bison New York Strip Medium well and it came out UNDERCOOKED (Medium). My husband ordered Beef Ribeye Medium well and it came out OVERCOOKED (Well). BECAUSE we did not want to wait another 30 mins for our meal we chose to suck it up and just indulge. Our friends sides ended up on the wrong plate, but since they were husband and wife all they had to do was switch their steaks. Would give more stars if our meals were correct. In our case as you can see we are so laid back and simple, we just sucked it up.
They were very nice! I brought my mom along with me to get her nails done and she LOVED IT! Would highly recommend it and am already thinking of heading back next time!

Amazing! The grilled cheese, buffalo cauliflower, burger, turkey burger, and soup all were absolutely delicious. Their apple spiced kombucha on tap was like Christmas in a cup, even the kids liked it. Service was wonderful and even on a Saturday with the place full of people we got our food quickly and with a smile. Coffee and hot chocolate was really good as well. We will be back here for sure!

I'm so happy that Love Park is open again for Christmas. Tons of vendors so you can definitely find a unique gift for that hard to buy for person. Disappointed that the park is still under construction right now but it is still worth going to visit.

Really tasty thin crust pizza. We tried a white with a swirl of basil and a Nona (pepperoni and sausage). Dynamite crust with not too much char. 4/5
Salad was just a bunch of lettuce with some homemade croutons and tomato slices thrown on top. 2/5
Eggplant Parm sandwich was pretty solid. Could have used some fresh bad, but hey we went in the winter so whaddya' expect? 3/5
Ambiance: mostly a take-out joint. We went in December and boy was it cold inside. We had planned to eat there but had to get it to go. 1/5
First night in town.  Found this restaurant and was amazed.  Great food, lovely owners.  Everything we ordered was fantastic.  Highly recommend it.

Ah, The Bay. My roommates and I have an unhealthy obsession with this hole in the wall bar. We are here almost weekly. 

Steak night M/W/F. This means a 16oz steak with a side for $12.99. Beer is a little overpriced and I've never ordered a mix drink but I'm sure the are jacked a bit too. 

Daiquiris are great though! Bartenders are somewhat friendly but they are overworked and under staffed most the time. 

Sometimes grown men fight in the bar, but honestly I find it super entertaining to watch someone over the age of 30 not know how to act in public.

I came here and almost all the tables are highly top,l. It's difficult when you have a short wife or even if you're drinking you could easily stumble. The food is over priced, pretzel are frozen from a box, lemon for my water had mold residue, and my glass was cracked. Not only that I can see how terrible the management is to the severs. I asked a server how much they had to tip out to bartenders and it's nearly ridiculous. It doesn't seem like a great place to work or eat. Way to over priced and terrible management.
They have a very good split fire grilled whole chicken in their hot food section. The lines are often long but it's worth the wait.

Food is good, they're still learning customer service. They have a lot of trouble with coupons/specials so make sure you know what you're getting. I tried to get 2 one topping larges and just add an extra topping to one- expecting to pay a little more. He rang it all in without telling me I couldn't get the coupon at all if I did that and made no effort to apologize or fix it. My 1 extra topping cost $9 more.

I really hate giving a Pizza Hut a low rating .... Their pizza is usually good and I am easy to please... But I am just tired of getting my delivery order and having only one two litter of Diet Pepsi ...... The delivery person always has to make a second trip to replace the missing soda pop .... And I again ordered one of their deals ( Large two topping online ordered for 7.99 ) and it again looks like they counted every crumb as a piece  ......  I would suggest if YOU go to Pizza Hut get Pick Up ( and check it there ) or eat in ....... I think it will be a while till I again forget and order delivery from them ... a shame because I got points to get free pizza ... but their deals are usually not ..... Always better when pay full price ....... Not right but way they treat you .....I should have read others reviews of this place .........

I had dinner here with three friends last night and it was a dismal experience. We were promptly seated at 6:30 and served our first courses in 20 minutes. By 7:45 we had not received our entrees, and our server had not checked back with us. My husband had to yell to Get our server's attention.  Finally a young man came out from the kitchen and apologized saying he had put a later party of six's order ahead of us and offered us free desserts. None of us wanted desserts, we just wanted our entrees. When my entree came out, gnocchi in cheese sauce, it looked like white on white glop with no color or garnish. It tasted ok but looked unappetizing. Another one of us had the beef dish which was heavily salted. Other entrees were edible, but nothing special. 

The staff needs better training and the kitchen needs to be more efficient. We've dined at ITA101 many times and, while slow, we never had to wait so long. Too bad the quality of the food has declined. We won't be going back.

My boyfriend and I went out here for a date night recently and had a great experience! First, we were pleasantly surprised that Blue Monkey has a HUGE selection of beers. After ordering 2 Kolsches, we ordered the stuffed roasted red pepper and onion rings for appetizers. The stuffed roasted red pepper was a bit expensive for how small it was, but delicious nonetheless. The onion rings were also delicious - I really liked them with the sweet chili sauce.
For dinner, I got the Chicken Barcelona, which was chicken stuffed with sausage in a creamy tomato sauce. The sauce, combined with the sides of green beans and bulgar gave the dish a distinctly Mediterranean taste, which was unexpected but delicious. My boyfriend got the Chicken Bella Buca, which had chicken stuffed with prosciutto, served with spinach (my boyfriend was disappointed that it didn't come with a carb like rice or a potato-I personally think it would've paired nicely with mashed potatoes). The balsamic glaze on it was delicious, albeit a bit sweet.
Overall, the food was delicious, and our waitress was very friendly and attentive. I'd definitely return here, especially to try out their pork belly or duck sandwiches which seemed unique!

Thai 5 is really really good. My favorite is the chicken pad Thai with medium spice. It's just the right amount of spice and it's even better the second day. I also recommend the steamed dumplings. The dipping sauce that comes with them is the perfect compliment.

This was a surprisingly great restaurant! It was across from our hotel so we wandered in to a short 20 minute wait during the holiday season and sat outside on their upstairs balcony. The service was great and the food was even better. The quality of the sea-food was top notch and the sides are cheap and yummy. The entrees are expensive for the environment of the restaurant but the quality makes up for it. A fun restaurant in a busy area!

First impression was awesome. The place is very contemporary and clean! Super cute decor and very very friendly staff. I ordered the Pho noodle bowl. I made a substitution to vegetable broth and tofu. It was a very delightful dish. My boyfriend ordered "fresh rolls" and a noodle salad with pork. He enjoyed everything he had. I will definitely be returning!

This establishment is great... the coffee was superb... ordered the smoke salmon on grain bread and buckwheat with goat cheese and egg white. Amazing. Everything was so great that I drove an hour to return before my flight back home to the east and spent about $100 in breakfast and T-shirt's. If I lived in St. Pete's I would frequent this spot and everyone in the area should as well!! Great people and great food...

KenScale: 9.0/10

For the second time in a row, my best meal in New Orleans turned out to be a sandwich shop. Coming to the Big Easy with my wife Jun, I didn't think I would have an experience as memorable as I've had at Cochon Butcher which I had visited a couple of years ago. Even when Turkey and the Wolf was declared the #1 best new restaurant in America by the highly respected Bon Appetit magazine, I was still somewhat skeptical (Cochon Butcher was that good!). After our lunch, however, I'm comfortable declaring that Turkey and the Wolf is one of the best restaurants in New Orleans, period. The ingenuity behind the art of sandwich-making was just so astounding that Jun and I were not sure if we can ever turn back to normal sandwiches again.

The concise menu at Turkey and the Wolf doesn't look like much, but each sandwich that we ordered really stood out on its own. Take the fried bologna, a humongous sandwich that came with mustard, potato chips (whole ones, not crushed in bits and pieces), shredded lettuce ("shrettuce" in their parlance), mayo and American cheese. All of these seemingly random ingredients combined to create bites that are so unique and powerful (but not overwhelmingly heavy or salty) in flavor, a sensation that neither Jun nor I have quite experienced previously when eating sandwiches. I would have been so preoccupied wolfing down this masterpiece the entire time we sat down at the table if not for the other sandwich we ordered. The collar green melt was truly a thing of beauty. How could a simple combination of slow cooked collards with Swiss cheese, pickled cherry, pepper dressing and cole slaw be as impressive as the decadent fried bologna, especially if there is no meat? Our initial doubts were quickly gone once we started biting into the sandwich. I don't know what kind of mad science goes into this one, but it sure was sensational! I didn't expect to be so dazzled by a vegetarian sandwich that displayed a complexity of flavor and texture that was thoughtful and pure genius.   

Turkey and Wolf doesn't take reservations and the place packs up pretty quickly during lunchtime but the turnover rate is also fast so you wouldn't have to wait too long before securing a table (you make orders at the counter and a server brings to food for you). I do encourage anyone coming to the sandwich shop to try one or two cocktails with playful names such as "They Grow Up Slow Fast" (a bourbon based cocktail that I liked very much) or "The Fish That Ate the Whale". I feel sheer joy during my culinary journey with Jun when we discover a place with unassuming, simple philosophy that turns out to hand out some amazing foods. Turkey and the Wolf, not quite hidden after all the accolades, may look like a modest neighborhood sandwich joint but I won't forget their sandwiches in a long, long time.
Love this place amazing pork rolls and fresh food! I would recommend to anyone I always order vermicelli with beef!
Well worth a trip, nice music and staff. Food was very good. Best pizza I've had in Indiana so far

The secret on this patisserie is getting out in St.Louis!
We moved to Huntleigh in May and people continued to tell us how great this bakery was.
The pastries,salads,sandwiches,coffee & Service are all top notch.
Chef Nathaniel is present and humble.

We loved the ambiance of the upstairs bar; however, the downstairs aesthetic is just as appealing. By far the best chimichuri skirt steak available in New Orleans. The mazorco appetizer was a great start to the delicious and well-rounded meal. The house made tres leches did not disappoint. Fabulous wine selection. We definitely highly recommend trying out this establishment. Service was prompt and polite. The manager, John, even took his time to welcome us in. It was an all around welcoming and pleasant experience.

First trip to Nectar, food and service was amazing. The owner visited many times. Group of six, shared the Queso and Chips with guacamole, salsa and Pepita Hummus. All great but the best was the hummus, very unique. Bowls, fish tacos and quesadillas excellent. Will be returning soon!
The employees were the rudest I've ever met and the bathroom was disgusting. Don't go here unless you are ready to avoid interaction with the employees as much as possible.
Most incompetent repair shop that I have ever encountered. Car has been with them for over three months and in 'assembly' for over a month. Don't go here.

After a day of shopping and doing pretty much nothing lol my mom and dad offered to treat my love and I to dinner! They picked the location and picked this  restaurant and I said "sure" "why not"... so we walked in, first of all the restaurant was freezing. Like I ate my dinner with my coat on..... I asked the server if she could turn the heat up but that didn't do much.  I ordered the avocado chicken sandwich, it was decent... I tried my dads chicken Parmesan and that wasn't good. The food needs a little more TLC and seasoning. My love enjoyed his cheeseburger but who can go wrong with cooking that?! Overall, I wasn't impressed but the service was good. If I go back, it will be for a birthday or a reason.. just wasn't a fan of the food. 

Pros 
Cozy but cold 
 Customer service 


Cons 
It was freezing 
Food is basic.

All of their burritos and flautas are still bright white when served, they are pressed to sort of heat the outside up - but the exterior remains room temperature and bright white. Not golden brown, not toasty, but paper white. Also, your first two bites are 100% cold flour! 

Picture being at home, taking a large 12 inch flour tortilla from your pantry, placing beans and fillings on the tortilla and then rolling it up - congratulations you just graduated from Tijuana Flats at Westchase cooking school.

The staff is super nice and the location is clean, but it is obvious that quality is being sacrificed for speed. 

If you like chipotle- this place will definitely be your jam. If you like Mexican food - this ain't your place.

I went for a deep tissue massage.  I was greeted warmly and immediately.  The spa was clean, inviting and soothing.  The massage was amazing!  Stephanie worked wonders on my very tight neck and shoulder muscles.  The 80 minutes went by way too fast!! My checkout was seamless.  I'm scheduling another appointment with Stephanie before I leave town!!

This is just a lovely hotel! It feels so different than any other hotel I've stayed at. It's special and has a very thoughtful design that is all in the details! Our room feels like a place where we can really relax. It's contemporary style makes it very aesthetically pleasing but it also feels like home. They provide friendly service that is accessible but not overly so. This is a well conceived, very welcome addition to downtown Boise and I will seek out "boutique" hotels from now on for the unique experience it provides!
food is average. this place needs some serious clean up top to bottom. junk all over the place grease on the wall and on the ceiling. person behind the counter can use some clean apron.

Came here for dinner on a quiet weeknight, but the line was deep and did not let up. Staff is super friendly and the food is outrageously good.  The price can add up, but the ingredients are so fresh and every thing was top notch, down to the salsa and chips!

This is definitely a gourmet taco stand, so know that coming in. There is a lot of thought, heart and soul going into the food and the stand in general. 

The La Lola Ceviche was one of the best I have ever had with Sea Bass, Tomatillo, Serrano, Avocado, Tangerines, Cucumber, Pickled Onions, and Habanero. The bowl is a really good sized portion and enough for two to share as an app.

The Butternut Squash Taco called to me and was so delicious. Butternut Squash, Queso Fresco, Salsa Macha and Pomegranates on a corn tortilla.

Mole Con Pollo is Mary's Organic Chicken, Black Almond Mole, Rice, Onion Mayo Crema and Fresh Cheese on a corn tortilla. Crazy good!

The Noreteno is Grilled Skirt Steak Asada, Oaxaca Cheese, Guacamole, Salsa Mugrosa and Cilantro on a Homemade Flour Tortilla. Fantastic.

Fried Plantains and Black Beans

The Peanut/Arbol salsa had great spice and so did the Salsa Cruda, which I could drink or bathe in!

A former industrial building very tastefully converted into a pretty hip restaurant. A little loud but the historic industrial ambiance is worth it. We had only appetizers so I can't speak for the entrees but wow! Steak tartar, short ribs in Thai peanut sauce, fried broccoli with sunflower seed aioli and lobster roll. All exceptional. The drinks were well crafted and just amazing. Where I find a lot of restaurants fall short is consistent service. Not here.  Our server, Paige was personable, knowledgeable, engaging  and attentive. I don't write many reviews but this place is a Nashville Gem.

This place is terrible. I'm local to Nashville and have been 4 times. Every single time with the worst service I've ever experienced in this city. Super slow, unmotivated employees who do not care about their customers. They make you feel invisible. Food is pretty bad too. Just don't go here. This place will be closed down in a few months if they keep it up.

My 1st time there, was happy they took me as a call in, very friendly salon, Denise started my nails and Mandy finished them, reason I did not give 5 stars, they both did a great job but different one hand looks different from the other, but that's to me, I will go back but with an appointment
Nice authentic pizza - fresh food, vegetarian options many. We sat by the gulf waters, nice views. They were able to make vegetarian pasta for us - not on the menu. Easy parking and good music.

Sorry - I go to Whole Foods stores all over this country as I travel .... unfortunate that the Whole Foods closest to my home is by far the worst one. Very slim selection. When u see something that says "sold at Whole Foods" it's never here. What a disappointment.

12/16/2017 - We visited this national park and spent the afternoon looking at a variety of cacti and desert plants. It was amazing to see the variety of plants in this desert during a winter month.  The view of the surrounding mountains and view of the sunset was beautiful. If you are in the mood to enjoy looking at cacti then do check out this national park.

What a great place!!!  First time here.  Looks like a dive from the road but it's not.  This place is a perfect fun spot for the whole family. Friendly environment, driving range, putting range and games for the whole family.  Patty at the outside bar is great. This will be our new Sunday funday spot
So in a word, unlike this advertisement, they are not open 24/7. It is open at 7 am. Which did not help when I needed something now.

Service was slow to start, however, once the server approached us I was very pleased. He was very knowledgeable towards all aspects of the menu- very informative. I ordered the Creole Combination, which consisted of red beans and rice and a cup of gumbo. The red beans and rice was full of flavor, especially the beans. Sausage was a nice addition to the dish. The gumbo was delicious- it came served in a warm cup and had a bit of a kick to it. Key lime pie was OUT OF THIS WORLD. It was cold, creamy, and perfect. Would recommend if you are in the area!

Had lunch here today. Got seated at a table upstairs. It was so filthy we almost left. Waitstaff cleaned barely. Our waitress was just bad. She was not attentive, Although did know the menu. She forgot part of our order. That part took way too long to come out after other items. While the food   was decent portions were small. Given the bad service others left while we were there.

First timer. Ordered their turkey chili which was great. Had flavor. Also ordered their turkey provolone panini which was the most unappealing in taste of any sandwich I have eaten out. The turkey had a gamey taste to it and the entire sandwich was hard to chew and bite off even. 
The price was more than I usually pay for lunch. Compared to other establishments in this neighborhood , not worth it. I will attach pictures of the sandwich. I only ate half. It was not worth the effort to chew. 
I wanted to like this place but it did not live up to the hype on the menu.

I was searching for a healthy bite on a frigid day and noticed this downtown storefront with a placard advertising coffee.  It's a simple, clean, modern space with an awesome light fixture.  You order at the counter and the menu ranges from acai bowls to crepes to paninis, many with whimsical names that range from Porky & Petunia (Smoking Goose ham & cheddar) to Hansel & Gretel (pesto, basil tomatos sauce & mozzarella).  Much of the food is sourced locally, it is an independently owned restaurant (not a chain), and the owner is super nice!!
The service was prompt and courteous but beware, no alcoholic drinks so as a brewery the make all the beer and wine in house and the Cabernet tasted like grape juice.

At a wedding in Idaho and needed some late night snacks. These guys were open until 3am which really helped. When I called, the guy I was talking to was incredible nice and genuine. I don't know about you guys, but typically when I call and order a pizza, the person on the other end could care less about providing good service and typically sound rushed and even bothered when helping. But this guy, (maybe Nick or Nathan? Not 100% sure) was so kind and I want to hire him back in Cali because he really was that awesome. Not to mention, it was 12:30am and he still slayed. Another big plus, they came all the way up to my door and didn't make me meet them in the lobby which other places usually do. So huge win on the service piece, guys! Keep it up! 
The food was decent. Not the best pizza I've ever had, but definitely not the worst either. We got the potato bacon just to try something different. I probably wouldn't get it again. It wasn't terrible, just not my fav. I did absolutely love the canned Root beer they had tho! Some folks in Idaho make it and it is one of the best I've had.

Had the samosas and got kadhai chicken (medium spicyness) to go.

The samosas were hot and tasty, I ate them quickly. I took the kadhai home, planned to eat it for lunch tomorrow, but got a taste while it was hot. Wow that was good and stayed nice and hot for a 30 minute drive home. Had a few bites and put it away for tomorrow.

Just had it for lunch, it was just as good reheated the next day. Exactly what I was looking for, executed medium spicyness perfectly, and a nice clean atmosphere. I sat on the outside patio, didn't go inside.

Fun indoor/outdoor bar concept. Great beer selection and decent food.

My go-to:

-Flatbreads (buffalo chicken/bbq chicken)

Ordered a large cheese steak. Apparently they think putting three pieces of cheese on a large (almost $10 long hoagie roll) qualifies as a respectable cheese steak. It's debatable if they even put three entire pieces of cheese on it. I had to add my own cheese. Won't order from them again...

First bowl of asiago bisque soup... MMMMMMM!!! How have I gone so long without trying this delicious soup?!? This isn't just creamy and cheesy, it's filled with small pieces of ham and a variety of vegetables. I was so sad when they changed their potato soup recipe, but now... What potato soup?? Trust me, it's all about the asiago bisque! Chase it with a classic turkey sandwich on soft, fresh country white bread and you'll be set!

My name is vishi Srinivasan and
food was good but the owner was very arrogant. They did not have enough napkins no free refills for drink and the owner accused me for touching dirty hands when I was using my hands accidentally. Never ever entering this business again as this was even close to my workplace. "Next time learn some manners my friend. Show some respect to public instead of insulting me in front of public and you learn some manners in treating people well with dignity and courtesy. It was an accidental mistake on me but you can forgive me on that and this was unintentional"

The food that I got there was really good. I got one of the juices which was a beet juice and I got one of the pre-bottled shots from the refrigerator section. I became extremely ill after drinking one of these. I do not know which one it was but I am still not over it and it has been a week today. Some sort of bacterial infection that has given me severe gastrointestinal problems.I will probably stick to juicing at home where I know the juicer is clean and bacteria free and my vegetables are washed and prepared for juicing and kept at the correct temperature.Just a warning to be very cautious with unpasteurized products.

Found DT after looking online for a bit and based my decision on reviews.  I didn't know exactly what I wanted (percentage or film type) but Dan helped in the decision process with his cool bench setup and I went with a 35% nano-ceramic.  This was 7 months ago and I (deliberately) waited to post this review to see how things would hold up.

I am pleased to report the quality is outstanding.  There are no bubbles or noticable deformations.  There is something extremely minor on the driver side rear window but it only bothers me when my OCD is flaring up and only I (or Dan maybe) would notice it.

Install was done within the timeframe specified and I had a nice walk on the Monon.

In hindsight, I should have gone with 20% tint.  35% looks good but it could be darker.

So why 4 stars?  Well honestly, the cleanup afterwards.  I don't know the precise chemicals used but there were serious amounts of haze and residue that I had to get rid of for a few weeks.  Main carp is there was another car after mine and I don't know if it was a scheduling thing but cleanup felt rushed at the end.  Dan offered to clean up but I really needed to get going.  After 7 months this still just stuck with me...for what I spent it just feels the should be adequate time built in to finish.

That said, zero complaints on the install quality...and ultimately that is what matters.  Nice work Dan.

I just love how their chicken is so high quality, flavourful, crispy and reasonably priced!! I'm in love with this place!!! I got the garlic soy chicken in the 5 piece set with house fries and pesto macaroni. The fries were decent, a little too thick for my liking. The pesto macaroni is tasty! The star of the show was definitely the chicken, cooked to perfection. It smelt great and made everyone in the car super hungry lol. However, the sauce is a little bit sweet, so if you don't like sweeter sauces you might prefer the OG chicken which I'll probably get next time. If you order the chicken online to pick up at the store, you won't have to wait once you get there! Overall, super delicious chicken, and it's a great deal too. For $11.55 you can get the 5 piece set, which is an extremely satisfying and filling meal!

I have to say that this place has the atmosphere that I'm looking for when I'm in-between trains. Their food is excellent. They have very good drink specials also with good beer selections. Highly recommend to stop here.

It was so nice to find a healthy eatery on vacation. The space is small with about a dozen or so seats. The dining area looks through a cut-out wall to the kitchen. The bathroom is clean. 

The young lady working was so helpful. She whipped out a recipe book when I named my partner's dozen allergies. It was comforting to feel safe when eating out. 

The best brownie bites (misnomer) taste like chocolate coconut macaroons- delicious. The burritos are so filling and hearty. I loved the sunflower seed sour cream. The cashew/coconut cream was nice, just wish there was more. I wasn't a big fan of the "jerk" dressing on the salad- very sour and not well balanced. All in all, I would definitely come back for more.

This was my first time here today. I had read a lot of good reviews and only 2 or 3 bad ones. 

For the $25 special.... It's an amazing job. Like an express detail service. It took about 30 minutes for my car which hadn't been washed in a few months. The men were efficient and took their time. It was pretty busy today since it's the day after a holiday. 

There isn't anywhere to sit, and it was cold today. But once you get your car you'll be glad you waited. I haven't seen my car so shiny since the first month I bought it. 

The men here are so nice!! Make sure to tip them too

The food was very very good!  All of the meats that were presented had a wonderful flavor. The salad bar was very nice and you could go in and just get the salad bar without the meats and still be satisfied; there was much more than salad presented and their version of eggplant parmesan was outstanding The only reason I can't give this place 5 stars was the service.
