The servers were hovering about our table the entire meal. They were a little too attentive. They engaged us in WAY too much conversation. I love attentive servers, but this was to the point of overbearing. At one point, one of the servers reached across and over my brother's plate of food in front of his face to pick up the wine carafe to pour more wine (which neither of us wanted). I definitely recommend giving this place a try. Just be prepared to ask the servers to back off a little.

I hesitate sometimes to write reviews until I've tried a few different things on the menu.  Well, we've been here a few times and everything that I've tried has been very good.  Service has always been stellar and one of my favorite things is that there's never really much of a wait.  The street corn is really good, you can't get that anywhere else around here.

Actually not a bad spot for a hotel pub. Tucked way in the back of the Radisson this little pub has been pretty good for beers and food(better than the fancy Atrium place so I'm told). We had the fish and chips and the Asian salad which were both very tasty. 
Food took a little longer to arrive than I expected but it was piping hot and very tasty so that made up for it. 
Had a good selection of beer on tap including the Granville Winterale and some Alley Kat brews. 
If your staying in this hotel this is a great little pub to chill out in- they have some board games as well that we noticed after the fact but totally would have played had we seen them earlier.

This was always my families "go to" for weekend dinners, until ownership changed and everything went downhill. It was sad to see - we loved this diner and it had become a family tradition. I still give them 4 stars, seeing that Gus has come back, I am sure we will be returning customers!!

This is one of my go to places every time my order is ready correctly and on time the staff is amazing and they truly care about the customers if you want an amazing cheese steak or chicken cheesesteak I highly recommend stopping in and give them a try!

4 days. It has been 4 days since the fiasco that was our online lunch order. Tuesday 11-28 online lunch order 71.00. Went to location to pick up. 87.00 charged my card. Wrong order. Charged my card back. Then charged for the correct order. (Which we had to go back because the order was wrong again) 4 days later I am still awaiting my credit. This is not 10.00 this is 87.00 no help from store. Called 3 times. Left 3 messages for management to call me back. Finally called corporate 2 times, 3 now including today. I received a voice mail from someone named Jim from the store yesterday. I do not want to speak to the store at this point. I want corporate. Jim's first sentence of " I received an email from corporate.... " he only called because I went to corporate. My bank account is in limbo and overdrawn because of this, I have filed a transaction dispute and will not be happy until I get answers and an apology from corporate. I don't want gift cards or compensation since I will never set foot in there again. I just want my money I need to feed my family. (The order was for work)

Good first experience at the new Izenbergs. We went for breakfast and didn't order anything complicated, but it was brought out in a timely fashion and the waitress was attentive throughout the meal. We sat near the bakery window and there seemed to be a lot of traffic of locals coming in to buy breads, cake and milk. I am interested in trying the lunch menu next!

Wow what can I say first timer here I'm from Hawaii and we know that something we call aloha comes a long way and the food is great but the service was something else I can't believe the service we got it felt like a restaurant but better Michele the service Coordinator was so nice and sweet she deserve to be recognize for such awesome customer service she made me feel at home and felt so welcomed thank you so much we will be back for sure just because of her hope you see this Michelle have a great Christmas
So delicious! Recommend the build your own bowl as it's smaller and easier to finish for those with smaller appetites. Salmon was delicious!
Great calzones! This was an easy place to pop in for dinner from our hotel. All 4 of us loved our calzones. I tried a local St. Louis brew which was wonderful.

Got here right before midnight and Tanner was kind enough to keep it open later for us to enjoy. 85 draft beer selections (largest in the world). Good news is you choose the portion. Huge area with great music. Highly recommend!

Yet another Tucson eating establishment staffed by rude, cocky millenials who have no clue what good service is. The food is okay but not very impressive; I've only eaten there for lunch and the prices are quite high. I hate the 'order at the counter and we'll bring it to you' method. I've been to Milan and this food isn't a good representation of Italian cuisine. When the antipasto salad comes with big thick chunks of cold cheese, it ruins the whole salad.

We had the pleasure of working with Michael for our wedding in Santa Barbara.  The photos turned out absolutely gorgeous!  He and his wife, Anna, were extremely easy to work with - communicative, flexible, and very professional.  Neither my husband nor I had taken professional photos before, so we had Michael shoot our Rehearsal dinner as a "practice run".  We were instantly comfortable with him which made the following day that much easier.  I definitely recommend this team!

We went here for my husband's birthday & it didn't disappoint.  I highly recommend the lobster roll, grouper blt, and the burger.  All were flavorful and delicious.  Service was excellent and the ambiance was warm & inviting.  This was our first time here & I'll be back!

Great service, clean place, LOVE IT!! Finally a Poke place here in Tampa area so I don't have to drive to Orlando! This place is better than the place in Orlando. I will definitely be back weekly if possible. 

Poke bowls are on point as you can build yours however you like it. The Sushi Burrito isn't my favorite and because of the size, it falls apart so I'm always going to get the poke bowl and eat with a fork . Did not like the flavors in the Hawaiian, I think it as the mango salsa that threw it off. 

Restroom is clean (very important to me)!
Very, very good! 4 stars for service! The food was perfectly seasoned and the soup of the day was

At children's hospital between appointments we had an hour to get snacks. I needed a coffee and was looking forward to trying out Luna! Well we are in New Orleans and I couldn't find parking so circling around to head back to Childrens I seen the CC's sign and decided to try it out!!

Big! This place is much bigger than it looks from the outside!! Plenty of seating including the outdoor seating. The atmosphere was terrifically classic New Orleans. The staff was amazing quick and kind!! The muffin was fresh and tasty as well as the coffee was delicious! 
 I would definitely come back here the next time we are in for an appointment

Matt did an amazing job with our son's first birthday! We made it clear to him that we wanted our 5 year old daughter to be the star of his act and he even did a special trick with her. She was so happy! She couldn't stop talking about it! The children laughed so hard during the performance and my 30 year old brother laughed even harder! The act was professional, appropriate and extremely entertaining for both children and adults. It didn't drag out at all and everyone couldn't believe how fast that hour went by! The balloons were also a big hit! Matt is great and I already have so many guests asking about him, I'm sure he will get lots of bookings!

I loved this place!  True to Chicago with the Italian beef and hot dogs.  Along with all of the memorabilia and flags, it felt like home. 
I ordered the pulled pork and it was amazing. Easily the best I've ever had. A friend ordered the Flat Daniel and said it was really good too. We also got an order of fries. That turned out to be on parchment paper and was the size of the table!  There's no way we could finish them but they were good. 
Our waitress was awesome. She was friendly, funny and helpful.
Friendly knowledgeable staff, great tour! The route we took was excellent and built on information presented to us at each stop.

Chic Asian spot off central. Low lit dinner seating with open style kitchen and brighter bar area with Sunday night football. Outside seating was available but current temp ironically enough is Floridian icicle. Baos pork belly buns were bomb.com! Pork is a tad on the salty side but the buns had a sweet kick that paired perfect. Golden wantons were a good app as well but if you were gonna get one or the other, go with Baos buns. For the main event, miso ramen. If you're into ramen, this one is excellent. Broth = delicious and braised pork belly = super flavorful. Splurged for dessert deciding to go with the Royal Pairing - creme brûlée with mangosteen compote. Very small serving size and not typical of the traditional brûlée dish, yet unique in the best way. Bartender was cool and told my buddy he could have the imperial stout beer he was interested in on the house if he didn't like it - so nice of her to offer! I'll definitely be returning to try a few more menu items next time I'm in the Burg:)

This place is amazing! It definitely beats sitting in Walmart auto for 2+ hours. The guys were really nice and more importantly fast and efficient. 

I waited maybe a total of 5 minutes when I first got there (someone was in front of me), but then once I pulled my car up, the service was 10 minutes tops.

They also gave me $3 off for my first time, but a regular oil change is roughly $21 - so cheap!

I will definitely be going back and spreading the word to friends in the area.

Come on guys it's fast food!

I have read some of the reviews and decided to comment on my own. 
I have been coming here for a few years, I don't check in on fast food places normally but had to defend some of the ratings for this place. 

Yes,  the rush during lunch hour is huge and they might ran out of food before your place in line. So order on the App and get in and out!

Yes you might be out of beans and rice if you come close to closing times! So again order online or using the App to get what you want. 
For example at this visit I had a sofridas bowl, I was not expecting a perfect bowl because it was during the rush. 

However it was pretty close to the standards, and I skipped the huge line by ordering through the app. 

Anyways fast food is not far to come once and give a poor rating, the employees are always rotating...
Fantastic! The Chicken Barataria for breakfast is amazing. Can't wait to return for lunch and dinner.

Soooooooooooooo good. I had read reviews and had high expectations, and this place did not disappoint! $9 pizzaa, no matter how many toppings you have? Pizza heaven. Perfect wood fired crust, fresh, high quality toppings, yummy sauce, and served by friendly people. $6 beers on tap, with $3 refills...how great is that? We did not order a salad, but after seeing some at other tables, we wished we had. We can't wait to go back. We are already planning what we will order next time.

Excellent place! Delicious and the service is pretty good too! The place is very cozy, the food is spectacular. I love that they have vegetarian options, although their wine selection is different from other places, the wine they have is also great!

From the daily lunch choice to frozen meal items you will find everything delicious at Charlie's. had them custom cut and vacuum pack our Thanksgiving steak for Steak Diane. Every serving was top quality.  Going next week to reserve our Christmas meat. Don't forget to tune into their daily Facebook posts and get your name on the list for amazing hot and ready dinners too.  Highly recommend rib night.

Alas, Nicole has moved on, but Melissa and Ali (Aly?) are my go-to stylists for cuts, color, high/low-lights and fun styles for special occasions.
It's not a fancy salon - but the prices are fair (They charge extra for using a flat iron or curling iron - so be aware of that) and I have been with Melissa for 6 years.

Love her.

Love them.

I finally found my place for good hair.

This mall is one of the nicest malls I have been to. They have plenty of outdoor sitting if you want to sit down and eat and they have lots of play areas for the little kids. They could use a Kate Spade store. Nice mall. I would definitely go back if I am in the area.
Great neighborhood hangout spot!! Staff is super nice, excellent beer list, and live music on fridays which made for a fun evening. Would definitely come back, and try some food too.

My new favorite AYCE Korean BBQ in Reno!!!  Excellent food and service.

We didn't expect good service since they were so busy on Christmas day but I was wrong!  Our waiter was so tentative, changed the grill very often and made sure to take our orders again as soon as our food came out. 

Kobe beef, Short rib, and Hawaiian steak were really flavourful and tender!

Will definitely come again!

Came here with my girlfriend due to a friend's recommendation and first walking in we loved the aesthetics immediately! Hardwood floors and a quaint small town vibe! Loved it! Parking is always tricky on one way roads but we found metered parking pretty quickly on the Sunday morning we came around 10am. The food was delicious! Don't let the looks fool you! We got the avocado with egg on rye bread,  cinnamon roll and croissant and each one complimented each other so well while having our coffee. And their bathroom was super nice and clean as well as their staff being super nice and cordial for our first time being there. I can't say anything bad about this place! Must go back!

This is an edit: 12/26/17
We've ordered here several times. Seems like every time we order from them the food and or service gets worse and worse. We made an online order this evening and waited for over an hour after getting a confirmation email that the order went through. Called and they were CLOSED. Never again.

Awesome food! My girlfriend and I decided we wanted to dine in. Dining areas a bit rustic but decent enough to eat in on. Food came out piping hot and very juicy. We got orange chicken and honey chicken lunch specials. Very worth the money.
Amazing cocktails and happy hour deals. Very swanky and chic atmosphere with awesome bartenders.

If possible I would give 0 stars. This location is absolutely the worst Steak N Shake my family and I have ever stepped into. When we walked in to wait to be seated we noticed every open table was full of dirty dishes and the staff was making no effort to clean any of them. Several servers walked passed us without even acknowledging our presence. When we were finally approached we were told to wait again because they had to clean a table. Not ideal but ok. When we finally were sat the table had not been cleaned properly and still had food particles on the table. The floor was sticky and and nasty throughout the whole restaurant. We sat at our table for approximately 10 minutes without any interaction from staff members. While we sat there the staff continued to walk by us and finally one said that somebody would be with us but she continued to walk past us. She never stopped to take our drink order or see if we needed anything. As a general rule my family and I try to remain patient and understanding in restaurants. However, when the place is filthy from the floor to the tables and they employ staff who could care less then our patience runs out. We will go somewhere else to spend our money. I would not reccomed this location to anyone. You will have better luck going to McDonald's than you would at this Steak N Shake.
I always have had a great time and always learn about new artists here. I saw Kevin Seconds give a lecture, Gee's Bend Alabama Quilts, Patssi Valdez, Fro-Hawk Two Feathers and the list goes on...

A great place to chill and enjoy some hookah. Very affordable and the service was great as well. The guy who helped us was very knowledgeable and helped us decide on what to get. They have screens at almost every table where you can watch tv at. Will definitely be coming here again. Ladies night is on a Wednesday I believe, would like to check it out!

This is a family owned restaurant that has an inviting and friendly feel. American cuisine. The staff is friendly and courteous.

I've passed by here a few times, today I have a little bit of time on my hands, so I figured, get a bite here. I was gonna go for some bbq, but,  I couldnt decide on that or quesadillas, so I defaulted to a cheeseburger and fries. 

The menu has quite a few selections. I will try another selection on my next visit.

The cheeseburger was pretty good, along with the fries.
 Cash/Debit/Credit are accepted here.
Also Military, Retired Military and First Responder discounts are honored with a valid form of ID.

Great burger joint in St. Pete. Definitely worth stopping by if you're walking around downtown.

The burgers are amazing! (Say Cheese) Mac-n-cheese topped burger, smothered in more cheese!?!?! YES PLEASE! We also had the Smoke Stack bison burger which was stellar! Why even offer salad options when you have these mouth-watering burger masterpieces on the menu?!

My only thought, and it is a minor one, would be to expand the draft selection. Given the excellence of their burgers, I would've loved to stretch the palate across a wide variety of beers.

Parking is, well, downtown St. Pete. Find a spot on the street and feed the meter or pay up for a space in one of the area garages. 

Staff was very friendly!

I was a little skeptical when I arrived. It was a cold December night 7:27 pm. Dark clouds filled the sky. The wolves were holwing across the nearby mountains as we exit the vehicle. Parked in front of Dickey's we notice something rather odd. THERE IS NO ONE HERE!!  my nephew cried. Are they even opened? I asked. I looked at the business hours as it read, closing time 9pm. In thralled by the scent of the BBq the lady behind the counter waved us in. Taking our time to order the lady asked, need any help deciding? I answered No! I'll pick my own shit God damn it . I ended up getting the brisket Mac attack and jalapeno cheddar kelbasa and it was really good. I highly recommend it.

Tried this place. I think it is new to the area or hasn't been open that long, but the meal was not that great. I ordered a quesadilla and when it was delivered, the pico de gallo juice had soaked all on the underside of the quesadilla, so when I picked it up - it was just dripping. 

The next thing was the tortilla soup - Delivered cool.... wasn't worth sending back, don't think it would have been different since my friend's soup was the same temp.

I might go back after a few months to see if things got better.

One thing to note is that this place is kind of the McDonald's of Mexican food. The place was ok, but the decor is old and tables were a little dirty.

DO NOT GIFT SHOP HERE IF YOU ARE UNCERTAIN IN ANYWAY ABOUT THE GIFT.  went to Diani specifically to buy Birkenstocks for my daughter for Christmas.  I purchased a pair.  I made sure I bought them within 10 days of Christmas so I could return them.  My daughter didn't like the color so we brought them back to see if they had anything else.  They didn't have the size she needed or color she wanted and wouldn't be getting anymore for several months.  It was at this point that they told me we can only do store credit.  They did offer to try and find me a pair but were unable to do so unless I wanted to wait for another two months.  At this point they have my merchandise and my money.  The store is disgustingly over priced and there is nothing in there I would purchase.  I went there specifically for Birkenstocks, not $800 sunglasses.  The Operations Manager did nothing to help me other than saying "Sorry".  If you can't provide the item I want to purchase then refund my money so I can purchase it somewhere else.  This place left me with such a negative feeling.   Will never go there again and I am telling as many people as I can about my experience so they won't make the same mistake

Had a wonderful dinner here last night with friends. Not usually a big Italian restaurant fan but Anthonino's was great. Started out with the stereotypical toasted ravs, which did not disappoint, but what really stood out was their marinara sauce for dipping. I would take a bath in that stuff. For dinner I went with the Palermo chicken and it was a great choice. Chicken was cooked perfectly and the breading was very tasty. The lemon butter sauce was light and had the perfect amount of flavor.  I also enjoyed a few of their house old fashioned's, which I highly recommend. Will definitely be back.

After living in Philly for 4 years I can tell you that they make some of good cheesesteaks. I'm less of the classic meat and cheese on some stale bread type of guy. If that's your jam then hit up Genos or Pats alongside the tourists and those rare, truly die hard locals that actually think those places are delicious (my girlfriend included). For less than 9 bucks you get a cheese steak with your choice of cheese and a side of fries. I always get the mayo added with their fried onions. Soooooo good. If possible, pick it up and eat it ASAP but to be honest their delivery has become increasingly efficient. Their pizza is average but good and cheap. Pro tip: during the week they have great specials. Download their menu from their website and take advantage of major meals

Went here on a Friday night and they seemed pretty busy but overall I wouldn't suggest going back. Our service was probably the biggest issue and I realize it was Friday night and probably busier than normal. We had to wait for like 20 minutes to get our drinks from the bar and It wouldn't be bad except our server never brought us waters in the meantime. We also put an appetizer with our drinks and the appetizers came out literally five minutes before the meal. But I will say their cheese cubes are so good, order them! I ordered the nachos and they were just meh... the pulled pork was great but there wasn't anything that really bonded them together. I'm sure I'm just a nacho snob.  My friend ordered the wings and he said they were amazing! He wouldn't shut up about them. So if I go back I'm ordered them!

We enjoyed Saffron twice in 12/17, first when a friend ordered it for delivery and the second time we went to the restaurant for dinner.  Both meals were richly and flavorably delicious.  Dishes we relished included chicken tikka masala, lamb korma, fish korma, a beautifully flavored basmati rice, onion naan and garlic naan.  Service was friendly and excellent.  The restaurant is clean, simply but tastefully and colorfully appointed.  Another Tucson strip mall gem!  Wish Saffron was in our neighborhood.

Great food. Great drinks. Great staff. Great atmosphere. We had lunch here recently and will absolutely be back. It's a great place to meet up with a group of people and enjoy some food, or just come to watch the weekend football games!

This event just keeps getting better every year! Lots of beautiful light displays, a special dolphin show, and a good handful of animal exhibits are still open. (Not all of them though, so make sure you aren't planning on seeing specific animals.) The little village set up right at the entrance has a variety of activities - visit with Santa, see a reindeer (who unfortunately wasn't there when we went), and even a mirror maze. We were already fans of the zoo, but this is a great new holiday tradition that we'll definitely continue in future years.

This place is so clean and smells great! The staff is very friendly and professional. I always get a gel mani and spa pedi and I have never been disappointed. My nails and toes always look amazing. Making an appointment in advance is highly advised and it's super easy. Oh, and free wine

I really wanted to like the bar at the Ace Hotel. I drove into town and started my night there because I'd heard good things. But from start to finish the customer service was abysmal. I arrived ten minutes before happy hour ended but as I'm standing in the main bar area reading the menu, the hostess grabbed it out of my hand saying "happy hour's over." Rude, but I was going to give her a pass. Walked up to the bar and got the same answer from the bartender, even after showing him on my phone that there was still two minutes left. To make things worse, while getting the drinks ready, he knocked over my can of beer and spilled half of it on me. At this point, most bartenders would get me a fresh one on the house. Not this guy. He still charged me the full price and drank the other half of the spilled one, himself.

The only saving grace for this bar was that the poutine was actually pretty legit. Basically a full meal. If you do go, I recommend that. Shame it's the last time I'll ever have it. There are way too many other good bars I can go to to have overpriced beer spilled on me.

When I go to Angry Chair, I usually leave angry. 

I've been to this bar several times because it's within walking distance of my mom's house and biking distance from my house. I like drinking close to home, who wouldn't? What drew me to this bar was it's reputation and the electric group of beers available for drinking. Each time I've gone to this bar, I leave a little bit more angry than the time before. Here's why:

1. The parking is absolutely terrible and the people who live on the street post signs for you not to park on the street. Unless you can walk or bike, forget it. 

2. The service is rude, rude, rude. Each time I've gone, I feel like I'm inconveniencing the bartender. Once, I had trouble seeing the sign of beers and asked for a menu. The bartender told me they no longer print menus and that I needed to get up and read the sign at the other end of the bar if I wanted to know what was being served that day. 

3. This bar used to have interesting options like milk stouts and sours, making it different from every other brewery in Seminole Heights. Lately, they've been brewing what every other bar brews--IPAs. From a brewing perspective, I get why it's done, but now the bar has lost its originality. 

The design of the building is neat and the decor makes it one of a kind, but for me, I can't move beyond the bad experiences I've had the last few times I've gone there. I probably won't return back to this bar.
Very delicious... Staff is friendly!  Gorgeous atmosphere... Menu is large with great options.  I cannot wait to come back.

Love Love Love...Go early! Less crowds and getting around reno is early on Saturday EARLY! They have the best canned corn on the planet...Yellow label. If you have not tried it by a can...you will be back for more. Ask anyone in Verdi about Christmas corn !

This is a cool little hidden gem outside of St Louis.  Local distillery and bar.  They also host some fun events there.  The owners are onsite and really friendly.  Their Old Monroe Bourbon is is my favorite of the spirits they make.  

Stumpy's is off the beaten path so you likely aren't going to just happen to run across it, you'll have to seek it out.  Worth it though!

I'd give Arrow Automotive 15 or more stars. I have a Ford Focus and was having shifting problems and the check engine light came on. Tried Jones West Ford and two days later they have not returned my request for service. Arrow got my car in and after running diagnostics they are not charging me. I will never go to Jones West and Arrow will always be my go to for auto repairs.

Went last night for happy hour...  drinks were good. Until I picked up my menu and a giant roach ran across the bar top in front of me and went under the fruit bowl. I literally thought I was seeing something until I looked up and it went running out from under the bowl and the bartender then grabbed it with a napkin. This then ruined my appetite and I decided I would not be coming back. I would not suggest eating here. Especially if there are bugs on the bar top. Imagine what the kitchen is like. It was pretty disheartening I had to pay my full bill after this.

Did my first professional portrait with Frank and his team this morning and they were so great. They are so friendly and made me feel very comfortable. They were able to get me my final photo just a few hours after the shoot too! I definitely suggest using their make up artist as well. Thanks so much Frank!

First and last visit last night, Christmas Eve after the saints game.  Manager was rude and hostile to every customer.  They serve beer and wine every day.  But for some reason he refused to sell it last night.  No customers were drunk or unruly.  He said "I'm the manager and I choose not to sell it because I have that authority ". Then threatened to call the police on people who were doing nothing but trying to get some food and drinks.  Don't know if the food was good or bad because everyone left.  I have no idea how they stayed in business this long if they treat all customers like the treated us.  Won't be back and won't recommend

Ichiban is good food combined with great service and entertainment . This was our second time here and we got to the restaurant half an hour before our reservation but were seated immediately. Bar has a good selection of cocktails. They serve sushi and Hibachi style dinner. Ordered chicken and salmon dinner which came as 6-7 course meal and ofcourse the main items cooked infront of us. After dinner, our clothes smelled like we had been working in a kitchen that night but it was a lot of fun. Chef Bryan and server Karli ensured food, appetizers, drinks and service are on point. Chef entertained the table by squirting sake in to guests mouth which turned out to be hilarious because the bottle got empty by the time it was my turn :). He also surprised us with squirt ketchup bottle prank. Manager Sophie was engaged with the guests and checking on tables. We received free sakes with Yelp checkin which was nice. 
Ichiban has become a must stop for us during our trips to Reno/Tahoe and i highly recommend this place.

Great food and even better service! The atmosphere is great too! The menu has a bunch of great options (including plenty of vegetarian options as well). Their stuffed french toast and french fries are both out of this world. Definitely recommend

Tried this place today for a quick cheap bite, they had 2 slices and a soda for $5.99 which my boyfriend and I shared. It was fine but nothing special, not bad but wouldn't go out of my way to return. If I was shopping in that plaza I would stop in though. I got the meat lovers slice and boyfriend got the times square special, slice size was inconsistent......mine was nice and large but his was much smaller. Boyfriend also wanted 12 wings but they only had 10 so that was odd, said they could charge us for the 12 but we would only get 10 since that was all they had.....Nah, no thank you.

Greg's Garage is a good place to get your car looked at and the will take care of you. 

The more I come here to get my vehicles looked at the more I like Greg's Garage. My wife was the one who told me about these guys and they have been taking care of her vehicles for a long time now. I am definitely a fan now. The service is good and they get it done. As with any place is Reno good mechanics are hard to find and once you can trust even more difficult. I am trusting these guys more and more. With that said they are pricey but I think anywhere you go there is a price to pay. But I think they are priced competitively to other mechanic shops around town. I just started trusting these guys more than the alternative. I have been to other mechanics who have pull a fast one on me and I would never wish that on anyone else. Because it cost a lot of time, money and just plain sucked if you have to pay for work on your vehicle just to have it break down on you. 

I will say they do get very busy so wait times can be a bit long but I feel they are worth the wait because I trust them now. Just keep that in mind. I usually leave my vehicle here for a while but I do have another vehicle to use in the mean time so that's not an issue for me. But it might be an issue for you. 

I have been coming here to a couple of years now and like I said the more I take my vehicle here the more I trust them. I hope this helps you decide on you next mechanic shop. Thanks for reading my review.

We tried this place last night and we loved it! So yummy and the atmosphere was open and laid back. We really enjoyed the food so much. We ordered the potatoes with cashew cheese and vegan sour cream to start and it was amazing. Then we order roasted vegetable Alfredo and Brussels and mushroom sandwich. Both super yummy. My sandwich was so incredible I ate the whole thing, Brussels sprouts were roasted and they had an aoli that was to die for on a baguette. Also got side salad with vegan ranch and it was so amazing. Fresh dill in the ranch was top notch in flavor. The vegetables in the Alfredo were so delicious as well. Everything fresh of course but I thought it needed a little salt but the flavor was fantastic. All the food was beautifully prepared and so fresh, tasted like it was just picked out of a garden! We will for sure be back here!! We loved it!

We came here last night to enjoy some pizza with my son and his fiancee, the food was good but the restaurant itself was freezing cold. I asked the server if he could turn the heat up and he said he would. During my whole dining experience it never became warm enough for any of us to take off our coats. It felt like eating out side would have been warmer than in there. It looks we won't be coming back until summer.

Being here only once, but surely won't be my last. I really enjoyed my experience and wanted to share my joy with the world! 

I love the growth the city is going through. Watching Tampa Heights flourish is exciting and the Hall, I believe was pivotal in this. As this really was a game changer for the district. Enough about that. 

This is my summery...providing an elegant flair to the food court experience. Diving into the details...upon entering I felt like I was elsewhere, New York, maybe. I didn't feel like I was in Tampa. Clean, open, spacious. The interior design team did an excellent job on bringing this space to life! (Restrooms included!)

The food. I ordered a waffle. Exciting, I know. However, this to date, is the best damn waffle I have ever had. The syrup was AMAZING! The size left me hungry. Super size me in reverse. Roughly 3 waffles, would make a traditional size waffle. 

I wanted to go 5 stars, but the service was subpar, the waffles are extremely small (for a child).

But I will be back. I love the space. I love the concept. Really can't beat it for large groups, as there is something for everyone!

We chose this restaurant for its proximity to freeFall theatre and the promise of fresh,thoughtful, and tasty food with vegetarian options.  The atmosphere was welcoming and intimate, even though the tables were set in an arrangement with neighbors nearby.  The cheese opener was well paired, but even more so was the variety of crisps, beads, nuts and spreads that accompanied it.  My guest had the plate of root vegetables which was as beautiful as it was delicious.  The fish en papillote was yellow snapper- moist, flaky, and so good as to make me ignore the rest of the plate.  My slippery slope cocktail was the first of two- I nearly ordered a third (hence the name?).  I was disappointed not to find the same desserts on the menu as I'd seen online (needs updating) because I had my heart set on pineapple right-side up cake but was delighted by the apple crisp with quinoa and caramel that we shared.  Service was polite, efficient, but when we overheard the server at another table offering explanations of the menu selections we got server envy.  We might have ordered another course or two with such enticement.  All said we are likely to return, being a superior dining experience.

I came here during the weekend and got a table for 2 and was sat right away. Just to wait  20 minutes before my wife went and asked if someone was going to come over to us so we can order. After another 10 minutes someone finally came over and we ordered. The waitress was very nice and the food helped my opinion on the place. I was able to see the bar from where I was sitting and it looked like a great time. The dj was also amazing.

Came for brunch and wasn't really impressed with it , I will say the Bloody Mary bar was very impressive but I don't drink so I can't say how good it was or wasn't . Overall I would say it's a little over priced and not worth the wait but that's just me .

I like this mall, and if it were closer to my neck of the woods, I'd go to it a lot more frequently.  It's an outdoor mall that is laid out very nicely.  I love how it's landscaped and decorated, especially the central area.  It's very welcoming and it's being maintained very well.  There are plenty of places to sit down and rest if needed, which is probably nice in the hot summer months.

The mall has some good stores and some duds.  You can find some pretty nice deals, some easily and some take some more patience, but they exist.  Some stores have no deals at all and aren't really worth the time.  

I like the selection of the major sports apparel brand stores especially.  It's nice to find a good deal on everyday clothing and work out gear.

They also have an app that has deals in it sometimes.  I scored a $20 gift card to Michael Kors from it (no strings attached).  I ended up with a nice wallet for about $10 after the in-store promo and the gift card.  Not bad!

I like this mall and go whenever I have the opportunity.  I'd go more if it were closer, or if the deals were just a little better/more consistent.

This is truly a gem of a local brewery. The brewers are homegrown and are making high quality beer. I've been to a few (hundred) breweries around the country, and this place tops most local, small town operations. There's a food truck outside four days a week, and also a family friendly atmosphere. If you're in the Philadelphia area, you've got to check this place out.
We had a few small but annoying little jobs and Nick was very efficient and friendly. We are very happy with the work!

Came for dinner with my girlfriend before going to the Andrea Bocelli concert at the WFCenter since the restaurant is not very far from the venue.
The location, the atmosphere, the service and most importantly, the food, made this place absolutely the best dining experience we have had. We considered it better than any similar restaurants we have been to in New York or Italy.
The location is just off of Broad in South Philly and parking was no problem on the street .
It is small, and once one passes the front kitchen/pizza section, two charming little rooms contain small tables set up cosily.It feels one is in a small neighborhood restaurant in Italy.
The waiters were very attentive and without asking they divided my girlfriend's and my dishes on separate plates after overhearing that we were talking about trying each other's dishes. We were very impressed by this!
The food was simply the best we have ever had; the grilled calamari and the shrimp appetizer were out of this world. The gnocci with mushrooms and the duck were also exeptional. The desserts were also fantastic. The tab of approx $85 was very reasonable for what we had.
Now i want to bring back my entire family so they can also experience this exceptional place.

The two meals we had were just basically average. Nothing more nor less.
Only two issues were noted:
Con:  The fish 'n chips batter was a bit soft, not crispy as advertised.
Pro:  The Florida Sunshine Cake was OUTSTANDING.
Bottom line:  We are in no rush to there anytime soon.
-
One addition:  I highly recommend the Happy Hours up to 6 PM with tons of  saving specials on food and drinks.

Bartenders are professionals, one of the best dive bars in the Westbank area, large selection of draft beers. Overall great atmosphere. Btw Zoe is my fav bartender over there, so ask for her if you want the top notch service.

I am a frequent customer at Benihana, I've eaten at locations in Maryland, Miami, San Diego, and Nevada. However, this was my first and last time visiting the Cherry hill location in New Jersey. My family and I made a reservation for nine at 7:45pm. We arrived at 7:40pm and were not seated until 8:50pm, absolutely ridiculous. If there was still going to be an hour wait after our reservation time the hostess should've informed us of that when we called to reserve our table or when we checked in for our reservation. Instead, she just kept telling us "only a few more minutes." After being seated, our server did not come over to take our drink order for an additional 15 minutes. By the time she came over we were all ready to order food. I asked the server if we could order our food with our drinks and she responded "no" (Which I know is not true). She then took an additional 20 minutes to return with our drinks and STILL did not take our order until returning to our table for the third time. At this point, it is about 9:40pm and we still have not ordered our food, despite having a 7:45pm reservation. The waitress finally returns to take our order and the chef began cooking around 10:00. The chef on the other hand was great! However, my family and I did not leave the restaurant until 11pm. This dinner turned into a three hour trip when it is usually about an hour to an hour and a half. Needless to say, this was my worst Benihana experience thus far.
Not great customer service.  Seem bossy.  No room for anyone to sit or even wait.  Shoulder to shoulder.  Terrible experience.

Visited Christmas Day @ 11am ish.  I have a locals reward card which I received a discount and it cost me $12.99 . Was it worth it? Absolutely! 

There is Aaaaaaa Lottttt of selections to chose from and very diverse there is definitely something for everyone's taste buds.  

My favorites - the shrimps and salmon. 

My least favorites - the cream of carrot soup and pumpkin pie. Both very bland and tasteless. 

Drink- Arnold Palmer and it was perfectly made and mixed. 

Line was quick, staff was very nice and helpful. Would I do it again YES !

My favorite place to watch movies in philly. Situated in old city, the theater has an old fashioned feel to it with with an old school popcorn machine, etc. the chairs are so comfy and when you go with a friend or significant other it feels like you're really out on a date night. If you can go here for a movie I recommend it above anywhere else in philly. It makes me want to go out to the theater for my movies rather than wait for them to be available online :).
Ryan was awesome.  He took care of us in a pinch.  As I'm waiting on my car to be done I watched him offer many others the same great customer service.  I would use no one else going forward.

I was searching for a good place to get some authentic indian food so I figured I'd try this place. The food was amazingly good and the thing I loved most about it was that they had a range of spiciness for you to choose from (I'm a sucker for spicy food so this was just amazing!). You can choose from a level of 1-10 for how spicy you want your meal to be. I chose a 8 and it was little hard to get down (so just make sure you don't get anything to spicy that you can't even eat it)
Our waiter was very helpful in informing us on the dishes and making us make our decisions!(super hard cause I'm so decisive oops), So I'm very thankful!

Grabbed a classic, no frills, yummy pizza from here! Found ourselves walking around Yardley looking for a warm place to hide out from the cold with enough space to seat 5. A local suggested Verrelli's to us (in her words, the better pizza in town), so off we went. 

Verrelli's is located in a cute little strip mall in the back of a large private parking lot. Parking was ample and free around noon on a Wednesday, which was an added bonus!! 

The inside is small, but they pack a lot of tables in! There is a large counter where you can order slices or other food to go, or you can choose a table or booth and stay in. 

Only tried the pizza on this trip. The crust was delicious- the perfect blend of crunchy and soft. The sauce was good, but not great. Just a really solid piece of pizza!! Large pizza was huge (as expected) and inexpensive- $12.25 for a large cheese. Took maybe 15 minutes for it to come out after we ordered. 

Definitely a very positive experience here, and I would recommend this to anyone looking to grab a yummy slice!

I broke the camera on my iPhone 7+ after dropping it (sigh), and the guys replaced it no problem! They had to order the part for me so I had to wait a few days. But once in store, I was in and out in 40 minutes or so with a new camera! The fix was around $90. Much better than having to purchase a new phone. Just in time for me to take photos before Christmas! Would recommend!

New location with such amazing staff! Donna, who is the owner of Lotus, advanced from a long career at Ambiance Salon in Springfield to find her new venture of owning a shop. She hit it out of the park with the interior design of this amazing must see salon. Beautiful handmade High woodEn ceiling with crystal chandeliers and modern interior brick walls with a great open atmosphere. Lotus  has the high class elegance and services of the most elite salons without the over priced menu that most salons have. As you come it, sit in an elegant little nook with comfy high-back chairs like a royal. Take a peak at their glam & glitzy jewelry for your night out after your new doo. Donna, Dreama and Elsa are such an amazingly talented friendly hip team. From the moment you walk in they make every second a joy and pleasure. They will pamper you with drinks and goodies as well as top of the line hair products. Looking for a keratin treatment? Lotus offers the lowest prices around the Delco area with the top quality products. From hair cuts, colors, updos, blowouts, waxing and microdermabrasion you will be beyond satisfied with your experience at this little gem of a Salon. It  was a true pleasure to have such an intimate relaxing experience instead of all the hassle and bustle of some larger salons. Thank you again ladies! See you again soon!!

We had a coupon out of the Cardinals calendar for a dozen donuts for $3.99 good until 12/31/17. But today their cash register would not take the coupon and did not over ride the register so charged regular price. They gave us 2 extra donuts like that makes up for not honoring the coupon. Will not go to this location again.

I ordered 23 breakfast burritos for a work party today. I preordered on the phone. When I called, I asked how much they cost and they told me $1 each. I sent my husband to pick them up. He paid $38 for them. I called the store and asked why they weren't $1 each. She said she would talk to her GM to see if they could honor the price. She thought the $1 menu was starting today, but it actually didn't start yet. The GM said she would not honor the price and said that their return button on the cash register didn't work. Really?  They quoted me $1 each, so its their mistake. And the return button is broken. That's the most ridiculous thing I've ever heard. 



I contacted McDonald's.com and they contacted the store. The GM called me and resolved the problem. They refunded the money and were polite.
The staff is very kind and they know how to keep the drinks flowing. This location is tiny so Friday night happy hour is packed. It's a great place to have a drink and watch the game!

This was our first time here. It's close to home and looked great from the street. 

Our waitress was pleasant, but seemed to be covering a lot of tables.

I had 2 eggs,biscuit and homefries. The eggs were great, but the biscuit was a little dry. For the price of our meal I don't think we will be back...unless we get a significant coupon!

Let me just start by saying that the actual physical space is great. Looks very high-end. But the high-end illusion begins and ends there. Our server Ryan was great! But the food he brought out was just not up to our standards. My husband and I are not extremely picky eaters & we can enjoy a meal from pretty much anywhere as long as it's good. We ordered a: medium burger which came out over-cooked & well-done;  the cheddar cornbread which was dry and completely flavorless; a kale salad which was average at best & the grilled chicken on top tasted charred and burnt. We will not be returning to this restaurant unless it's to have drinks only.

Extremely unprofessional, unethical company...avoid them at all cost!  The owner of Portofino and his sale associate are as dishonest as they come.  They told us to CHILL when we confronted them after weeks of nonstop stories and lies.  Cindy L's review from Yelp is correct...this company is struggling, a dying business. There's virtually no traffic each time I was at their showroom. A contractor in SB described the owner as sick, twisted, crazy and shameless; the owner's former employee will not stop telling everyone to avoid Portofino windows & doors at all cost. 

Portofino will not deliver, install and guarantee doors they measured and ordered as agreed in their contract instead they demanded all the money without installation/guarantee/warranty by the manufacturer once they received 50% of your downpayment. They will confront their customers by asking "Where on your invoices does it state installation?" Their invoices doesn't state installation/finishes etc., because they will tell their customers all their door prices include installation/delivery/finishes/hardware etc.  

Before they deposit your 50% downpayment , they will tell you...."We're a ONE-STOP-SHOP, NO NEED TO FIND A PAINTER/STAINER AS WE'RE KNOWN FOR OUR FINISHES. NO NEED FOR A CONTRACTOR TO INSTALL YOUR DOORS AS THE OWNER IS A CONTRACTOR"...THIS IS A COMPLETE LIE!!!  Employees are trained to be dishonest when it's time for them to install the doors. They will tell you they forgot to add the cost of finishes so you actually owe them more and that install isn't part of the cost. I've text messages and emails from and to the owner & his salesman that refute their claims. 

I contact Renewal by Anderson Windows & Doors, setup a free in home estimate. Anderson offer 12 months interest free for all purchases and their product have a 25 years warranty. Their grand total included... install, delivery, tax, factory finishes, professional finishes, trimmings, permit by the county as it's required by the building and safety department, dumping fee, stucco patching, hardware, satisfaction guarantee, etc etc. https://www.renewalbyandersen.com 

Anderson Windows and Doors was so professional, my project was smooth sailing. My doors is so amazing and the people were professional...Top notch, exactly like Neiman Marcus & Horchow. No matter what, ALWAYS GO WITH THE BIG BRAND NAME RATHER THEN A SMALL BUSINESS SUCH AS PORTOFINO WHEN INVESTING IN SUCH A BIG TICKET ITEM.  Portofino have nothing to loose and everything to gain. I had to reach out to the CSLB and they told me to call his Bond. In doing so, the owner of Portofino offered to give me back my 50% downpayment. Do you think Horchow, Anderson Windows & Doors, Sears will behave like this? 

Portofino offer me nothing but a WOW website, at the end my journey with Portofino resulted in legal fees, anger and a waste of my valuable time. Anderson Windows & Doors have been in business since 1903, a truly magnificent company vs. Portofino, a very poor mindset, unethical company where the owner is unable to foreseen the future for his business and his employees. A truly dead end company!

The best breakfast, lunch, brunch spot in Tucson hands down. The food is great. The staff are the best, even new hires prep and pastry knows how to pick who is right for the job. Chefs at both locations are spot on. I love the food there. I've nearly tried the entire menu, and always up for what chef Hannah has to offer with the French toast. I love both locations central and east

Mr. Melton sold me a box springs. Efficient and friendly. I got home and after cutting off the plastic covering I realized I purchased the wrong size.  Mr Melton went to bat for me and found me a replacement at a discount so although I could not return my original purchase I lost very little money by my silly mistake. He is a hero.

Well! well! well! I will keep this review short. If you find yourself in Zephyrhilis for whatever reason, and you're looking for a place to interact with awesome people, and eat delicious, homemade food made with love and passion just being your behind to The GREAT CATCH. You will not be disappointed at all. Please write to me cussing me out if you are.

For my sister in laws 31st birthday last night she wanted to do karaoke extremely badly. We have never been but a quick search found The Point just down the street from where we were at. We didn't know what to expect. First off it's a tiny place, kind of hard to park unless you know where you are going. Yes they have bars on the windows but who cares cause it's a bar/karaoke place. The bartender was one of the hardest working bartenders I've ever seen. Constantly moving but she even had time to sing a song. They do not skimp on the alcohol too. The mixed drinks my wife and sister in law had were extremely strong. Prices were on par with most places. We had 8 rounds of drinks (including 2 rounds of shots) between 4 people and spent $100 including tips. The beer list was what you would expect from a karaoke place, lot of popular domestic beers (Miller, Coors, Blue Moon) and popular imported (Corona, Modelo, Stella). Stuck with Stella the whole night which was fine. The interior was nice and clean, but again since it's a small place it got crowded very quickly and everyone was trying to get a drink. The restrooms were kind of weird because they didn't have doors on them so you could hear people peeing (again not a big deal). 

Now the only reason I gave them 3 stars is because of the complete disdain and quite hostility we received from the regular clientele. Now I get that a business can not control there clientele but the constant stares and judgmental whispers honestly killed the whole experience. Yes my sister in law was dressed in a pretty revealing attire but wore a full length coat over it. She still get disapproving glares and whispers by some of the women there even thought we attempted to be extremely friendly and polite. Unfortunately we all received a lot of glares and whispers regardless of how we acted. It got to the point that I stopped saying excuse me or sorry because the regulars were just rude. We just stuck to our little corner and tried to have a good time and ignore the constant quite hostility. 

So even though the establishment was kind of fun, the mood that the regulars give off to anyone new completely kills the vibe and makes it extremely uncomfortable. Unfortunately I do not think I will ever return which really is a shame.
Great selection, good atmosphere, excellent service (ask for Kat, she is awesome and will take care of you). Will be back soon!
This is the best red beans and rice I've ever put in my mouth! The po'boy sandwiches are basic but very tasty.

We have been coming here for over 10 years. Trying to meet the in laws coming from the south side for breakfast. Empty restaurant and plenty of tables however they couldn't seat us? I get it if the place is busy or slammed but there may have been 6 patrons inside total. 

No, there's too many good breakfast places to eat at in Indy to stick with poor service like this. So long mamas.

Dear Clients,

I'm am the manager of New Image Nail Salon in St. Peterbrug.  The address is:  2129 66TH STREET NORTH ST. PETERBURG, FL 33710.Have you seen the review from Joe O? I wanted to let you  all know that the review that was wrote was for the Nail Image in Tampa, and the nail salon names mixed up. The nail salon I work at is New Image Nail Salon in St. Petersburg. According to the state board, everything was fine. We also passed the state inspection a month also.  Thank you so much, I hope you all recognize the mistake. Thank you all for your support. I wanted to let you all know that we will have a lawsuit with Joe. Because we lost a lot of customers from the bad review and mistake, we are sad we lost our business. If you want to know more about this incident, please click on the link before. Or look at the pictures for proof. 

I, Michael (Bay) Thank you our dear clients for the support. 

http://www.foxnews.com/lifestyle/2017/10/31/trip-to-nail-salon-lands-one-bride-in-hospital.html

http://www.abcactionnews.com/money/consumer/taking-action-for-you/tampa-woman-spends-a-week-in-the-hospital-following-a-pedicure

I think this may have been the best meal I've had and will ever have. I would come back to Santa Barbara just so I could eat at Bouchon again. Everything about our meal was perfect - the lamb, the duck, the bread, the butter, the goat cheese salad... I still dream about the duck dish I had here, and none can ever measure up. 

The one thing that wasn't perfect was the service. We had a very strange interaction with the wait staff here. The first waiter we had spoke so softly that I asked him to speak louder because I  couldn't hear any of the specials he was reciting. He got awkward and left, and we waited for a long time. Then a different waiter returned in his place to take our orders. I remarked something like "oh! What happened to our first waiter?" And he gave me a weird look like I was crazy and said "what? I've been your waiter this whole time." Very odd.
My mom, daughter and I stumbled across this place and we loved it!! Everything was great!! Great sandwiches, soups and salads.  Homemade breads and desserts!! We will be back!

良心推荐！价格合理 真心好吃 生鱼片很新鲜 寿司卷很有新意味道也超赞 推荐 slalom roll 里面有天妇罗炸虾 topping是三文鱼 牛油果 鱼籽等 前菜推荐sunomomo 是一碗海鲜 其实就是切成小块的sashimi 三文鱼 金枪鱼等都有 很爽口 也很解馋 
特殊的卷 14刀左右 一份8个很合理了
还会来吃哒 这里超多卷
love this place, especially on sunday evening for the half price hamburger and fries special , such a great deal!

This place is a classic family favorite serving a bit of Italian and a bit of Greek. I find the cozy atmosphere to be a bit more updated, brighter and less stuffy than other places on The Hill. They have bar, booth, table and patio seating, so take your pick. They have a full service bar that serves the full lunch/dinner menu. The service here is good and it's a safe bet that you'll leave satisfied.  

Must try's: toasted ravioli, pizza and salads. T-ravs are some of the best I've had. Love the pizza--plenty to share and you can get different toppings on each 1/2. Don't forget to get a house salad with your pizza-yum. 

A couple of the pastas I've tried were a bit on the salty side. I would shy away from the pastas if you are sensitive to salt or consult with the wait staff about it before ordering. 

I've only dined on the Italian side of Anthonino's and can't wait to go back and try some of their Greek menu items.

Do you like getting what you ordered? If you do, I don't recommend going here. 

By my count, my order of what I think is pretty simple (Bacon, Egg, and Cheese McGriddle) has been incorrect 3 out of the last 4 times I've gone there. This has all taken place in the last 4 months. 

Another fast food restaurant very close to this location is probably the most efficient and well run fast food restaurant I've ever encountered. This McDonald's, by contrast, has to be one of the worst. These now almost expected mistakes make me question why I should ever visit this establishment again, when better options are in the area.
Received my box today and extremely happy with the results! I was nervous sending my tapes in but happy I did. Thank you for taking care of my precious memories.

This was my first time trying rolled ice cream and I'm so glad I decided to try it here. This a cute, very clean little shop in center city. There are a handful of creative, yummy options and half the fun is watching them roll the ice cream!! I can't remember the name of what I ordered but it had Nutella and truly was HEAVENLY. 

The staff was super nice and welcoming. The guy who took our orders even wrote our names out in chocolate syrup! 

Overall, great experience and I can't wait to go back!

Sweeet People! All very personable!  Excellent creamy cheesecake!  Luigi says all pasta is made in-house! Enjoyed Baked Ravioli. n Tasty little meatballs. Cute wine glasses. Skip the Makers Mark (very light). Got a hug from Biagio ( Dad n Chef) on way out!  Love finding a place in Hendersonville that's not a chain!  Will return.

I used to be a big fan of Ossip when I started seeing them in 2013/14. They were always good with customer service and I really liked my doctor, but this last year something has really changed on the customer service front. I went in for my annual eye exam and they were just having an off day, no big deal, I figured it was a one-off type of thing. They recommended contacts so I agreed to try them out provided my insurance plan would cover them, so they said they would check and the "trial" was all covered by my plan. Later on I receive a bill for 96.00 for a contact lens fitting that my plan apparently does NOT cover. I specifically made sure to verify with the staff that this service was covered before making the appointment in the first place. Thinking this was a misunderstanding I called into the office and spoke with the front desk and nothing was settled. They then had someone named Johnny contact me from their insurance office; they informed me what my plan covered. My issue is of course that I was told by the office the benefit was covered. She said she couldn't do anything to help me but she'd reach out to the regional manager. Really I was just looking for an apology given the fact their office staff incorrectly interpreted my plan. Partially my fault as I should have double checked and been aware. So in the end I get a call from a woman, Not sure her title, but I think she said she was the regional manager. Does this company not know how to resolve issues during the primary complaint, are they seriously this inept that I had to have three conversations and speak to a regional manager? This woman leaves me a message, not even with her personal contact information, but two separate locations that she'll be at that week that I can call and ask to speak with her. At this point I gave up- its was obvious they weren't going to be of assistance, and had no understanding what my complaint was despite my four plus years as a customer. 

After this experience I don't trust doing business with them anymore. They are sneaky with offering clinical and retail services because its quite obvious they do not care about customer relationships, just their profits.

I would give negative 5 stars if I could. By far the worst location. The most ghetto employees work there. Most of the employees can't figure out how to do their job. You will wait in the drive thru line for 30 minutes for milkshakes that are made right when you order them so they are flavored milk by the time you get to pay for them. When you complain that they are melted they try to bs you and say it is from the whipped cream. My advice, drive further down the road and bypass this location. The absolute worst customer service skills. The idiot in drive thru charged us for someone else's order tried to tell me I was wrong. Then the manager comes to help her and not one apology from him. That place is a joke. The owner should fire everyone there and start over and hire people with at least a high school diploma.

So glad I just discovered this place! I had the butternut squash burrito and it was amazing. The Gluten free cupcake was also delicious; not overly sweet or dry like many other GF baked goods I have had before

It was 12/30/2017 around 6:30 and I and my family went to the stand in the mall. There was a small line UPDATE:  I was contacted by one of the owners concerning this issue, however my original Review remains the same. Displeased with CUSTOMER COMMUNICATION . with a group of 3 women being waited on by the two men servers. I was up next to waited on after standing in line approximately 10 to 15 while the women were being serviced. When my turn came I asked the guy behind the register what flavors were available and he said the list is located over there. I was in a wheelchair. I asked to sample the flavor that appeared to be sugar cookie and was totally ignored. The guy was rude and uninterested in serving a handicapped individual. I will never patronize this business. The guy seemed more interested in standing around then making money.

Christmas Eve... full parking lot...full restaurant. Decided to wait. Parked after a few minutes, walking in we were sat within 5 min, ordered and full PERFECT meal came with everything we requested within 10 mins, our server is very sweet and professional. Thank you, we made a good decision to stop by today. Merry Christmas everyone. This is a great representation of East Coast Waffle House Inc

Unfortunately, this place is not what it once was.  Used to be the best burger in Chester County but not any longer. Burger tonight was like something from Applebys. Nothing great and only so so.  If not for the beer selection and great service, I would not be back.

The first real tiki bar in Philadelphia - finally! Nice bartenders and good drinks. Not sure they are quite up to par with the tiki of New Orleans (latitude 29) and Chicago (three dots and a dash) but definitely quality drinks with interesting flavors. Certainly worth a try!

I am super happy with this company's service. It's easy to schedule care and pay for the service. Betty is usually who cares for my two pups. She is excellent and goes beyond expectations.   When she is caring for Vince and Shelby, I know everything will be okay and they are safe and happy.
Juice is diverse and tasty; it would be better if more concentrated. Menu is cute. I ordered the crab egg scramble and it was perfect.

While in vacation we came here for our last dinner and enjoyed a beautiful view on the water.  The strawberry balsalmic martini was amazing,  the flat bread appetizer is delicious,  soy glazed salmon was cooked to perfection am2d the stuffed grouper was so amazing!  If You want a great night,  feeling and atmosphere with delicious food this is your spot!
Delicious, fresh ingredients. Great neighborhood addition for a different kind of pizza option.

Disappointed to say the least. We walked in without a reservation at 11:45 the hostess informed us that she could seat us but we had to leave by 1:00 because they had a reservation for that table. Really? The service was very slow, took forty minutes for us to get our entrees. I ordered chicken enchiladas, the chicken was very dry and the sauce was tasteless. Will not be back.

This hotel is a gem, especially for the price! My fiancé and I booked a trip here to celebrate our anniversary and unwind from a hectic month at work. It was amazing! The staff were all friendly and helpful, making us feel welcome and well taken care of the whole time. We enjoyed both the free cheese/wine hours and the free bike rentals. The bikes allowed us to go for a beautiful ride along the nearby beach to catch the sunset - absolutely breathtaking! We also loved starting off our stay with the complimentary bottle of champagne in our refrigerator and coming back at night for some cuddling in our comfy room with the free milk,cookies, and movie rentals. We left feeling very happy, well rested, and rejuvenated. Will definitely return if we travel to Santa Barbara again!

Hidden jewel on this side of town! So glad I stumbled upon it.  I ordered the yellow curry for lunch, and it was delicious. While it wasn't spicy, it was very flavorful, and I'm sure you could ask for more spice if that's your thing. 

I will definitely be coming back to this establishment.

Duck Donuts was AMAZING!! The donuts come out fresh and hot and I love that you can customize everything. These are the absolute best donuts you can get outside of the city. The service was exceptional...super friendly and helpful. I do wish they had the option of filled donuts but that definitely won't stop me from coming back again and again until I inevitably gain too much donut weight :) One disadvantage of coming here though is that the parking lot is usually insane in the KOP town center...I usually park at Wegman's and walk over if I can't find another spot close by.
friendly bartender, reasonable drink prices, and a chill ambiance. the library is adorable, this is a nice little place!
Food and drinks are good. However there is never enough staff working to handle the amount of patrons in the restaurant.

This is for the location in Lafitte but as they don't have a page...

I went there this morning and bought a can of coffee, a honey bun, and a fig newton. I gave the guy a $20. He gave me incorrect change. I started to count it but there was someone behind me. I stepped outside and counted as I walked through the parking lot. I realized I was $5 short. I went back in and explained and he acted like I didn't know what I was talking about. I then asked him to ring up all the items I bought so that I could see how much it cost cause I thought that maybe I was wrong. Obviously I wasn't because all the adds up to 6 and some change, not damn near 12. 

He then tried to spin it and say that I was wrong because I got in my car and I could have stolen it. He then claimed I laid all the money out and counted for 5 minutes and should have seen. He then claimed that he serviced 5 more people behind me. 

I walked into the parking lot and not my car. I held all the money in my hand along with the items and didn't lay it out. There was only one other person in the store and I know this as the only vehicle in the parking lot was the one I came in. 

I said he should pull the video so that he can just see and this would clear it up. He then started to raise his voice and told me he only works here and he isn't the owner. Naturally I started to raise my voice also. Basically it then got into a screaming match and he told me to come back at 9 and complain. I walked out and yelled that I would come back at 9. He then followed me into the parking lot and told me I better not come back at 9 and that I would not step into the store. I told him I'd see him at 9 and then I left. 

This all took place at or around 4:50 am on 12/23/17 as I was enrolled route to go hunting.

Since buying a new home we wanted everything in order. We called Strongbuilt for an inspection of our heat pump. Zac had called earlier saying he could arrive early which he did. He performed a thorough inspection and followed up online with photos and his inspection notes. We are very happy with Zac and his work. We would not hesitate to schedule again with Strongbuilt.

As we ordered a pizza, we decided to take a picture of a sign that was cute (something about how you're always the cook even when the kitchen is closed). We couldn't get the right lighting so had to take a few. The cook very rudely asked us to stop because he thought we were up to something suspicious. We showed him the pictures and that we only wanted a picture of the sign. If you can't let customers take pictures of the inside of the shop and feel comfortable inside, I'm sorry but you're not right for the business of customer service. BTW, the waitress was super sweet and understanding of the situation and refunded us.

PREVIOUS DRAFT:
1 Tried calling to get matinee days/pricing and no answer/cannot leave a voicemail. 
2 Asked a question on here, no response

UPDATED:
I have been here a few times and none of my experiences have been very good.  The remodel was obnoxious and took a long time, after the remodel there weren't any staffing directing which way to go or take your ticket stub. We consulted with a bar staff member to find out about ordering food and the reclining seats, then we realized our theater didn't have the reclining seats or the access to order alcohol to our seats, it was really disappointing.
Staffing feels like a bunch of young kids that don't care.
It is pretty obvious the management is very hands off.
It still feels run down and smells weird.
The self-serve ticket kiosks I do not think save time or lines, especially because even to a competent electronic savvy adult they weren't very user friendly to get in and out fast, like the potential the kiosks could have.

Overall I don't think I would recommend this location, but it's the only thing that's close enough to make it work without driving about 40+ mins into town and parking.

I don't do this but I have time today. Ordered a medium 2 topping. It was on time; delivery guy left and when I opened the box I found the pizza was burnt. I threw away and left the house. I called while driving and spoke with the lady who answered the phone. I let her know what happened and she gave the phone to Ben. I let him know what happened and he then informed me I had to 'swap it out'. I don't read 'swap it out' on any website , receipt; anything. I asked if I could come by tomorrow and get a refund and of course that was the 'swap it out' procedure came up. So as a patron I would have followed 'procedure' if I knew I had to save the burnt pizza. I'm sure they use for the burnt pizza. I was excited to get it as I'd heard good things and where I'm stationed in the military there's no Imo's. Horrible. Just wanted to let everyone know about the 'swap it out' clause at Imo's.

There really isn't much to say about Taylor's other than you just can't go wrong. We get every single cake for every occasion here and they are superb. We are fortunate that it is in our neck of the woods (or not as my toddler asks to get something every time we are on our way home)! I have to say though that the service quality rivals the dessert quality. They are all efficient yet patient when taking your order and I have never had a flub up. We will continue to get our special occasion desserts from Taylor's!

Love the food love the variety. It's a good joint for less formal food. Do be patient, eating here usually takes 45 min longer than most. Those table legs needs to be sawed because I can't believe I'm the only one that gets bruised by them.

New fave nail salon! Amazing service, felt comfortable, pampered, and like a VIP the whole time! No chemically nail polish stench, which was great, and place was super clean. I love my new gel nails and will be returning in the future!
We had a group of 10 for lunch. I had wings and rings, my wife had the street tacos. Service was great and all enjoyed their meals. Blind Owl is a nice neighborhood place.

My original review was a 1 star (below). The owners reached out to remedy and make sure that their service team was coached. Definitely worth updating to a 4 star. Thank you Jockamos!

Do not order delivery from this Jockamos. I ordered two spinach salads with extra dressing and breadsticks. They arrived with NO salad dressing or sauce for the breadsticks. I called to ask them to please send the dressing and they refused. The woman said that she could ask the driver if he wanted to come back out but he was out on a run and she didn't think he'd "want" to. She then offered if I would like to speak to a manager also stating that I'd be told the same thing again. I wasn't angry at this point until she hung up on me. This is the second and last time they've done this. Beware.

This was the worst meal I have ever had! The crab bisque had chicken. Everything was super salty. Everything was over made. The crab cake was awful. The mussels were in a goopy sauce, not a white wine sauce. The scallops were over cooked and had some nasty sauce. We were looking forward to the corn bread appetizer we read about in the reviews. We got chicken liver pate. The most disappointing meal I had in New Orleans. They also don't have a menu online. 
Only good thing is the space is trendy and cool looking. They should spend more time focusing on their food instead of decorations. Disgusting!

This is one of my favorite Italian spots in the area. This is like the old school Italian restaurant. The food is delicious and is reasonably priced.

My favorite to go dishes are the lobster ravioli and good old lasagna. The main courses come with a side of soup or salad. Also they offer you house bread.

They upgraded and moved the restaurant to a new spot. They have ample parking. Also you will need reservations to be seated on the weekends. Weekdays you maybe able to get away without one.

Super cute and cozy spot!  We were greatly impressed with the snappy casual decor and the welcoming atmosphere of Station 6. Plus our meal was outstanding.  They have a nice bar inside, and cozy happy hour or cocktail seating outside.  The bar inside has nice big screen televisions, and from the banquette/table seating on the opposite wall we could enjoy our lovely early dinner and watch the Saints game at the bar.  Station 6 is a definite keeper on our rotation of eateries.  The seafood is ecclectically spiced and carried out very well.  We had the raw oysters which were fine.  For entrees we enjoyed the pompano with curried brown butter and the blackened snapper with delery sauce.  The preparations were exceptional, and the portions were very generous.  We did not have room for dessert, but hope to try their daily cobbler on our next trip. Station 6 is Excellent.
Great breakfast, good service.  Nice location - 1 block off Bourbon St.
Great place! The food is always consistent and quick. I've been here many times and have never had bad food or service.
I love this place. It's my go to brunch spot whenever I'm in old city. Low key and the food is consistently excellent. The QE2 sandwich on the brunch menu is outstanding.

Fast, friendly delivery. I am giving it 4 stars because my Celiac son said his gluten free pizza was amazing and the service was very good. We paid $50 for 2 large pizzas and a small gluten free pizza. It just wasn't worth it. We actually had to throw away 2 slices of pizza the next day because no one would eat them...which never happens with my family of 5.

My husband and I called in to get matching tattoos which were done by Danny. First we called at 12 he said we could come in at 3. So he calls us and tells us to come in after we had sent him pictures and talked on the phone about what we wanted but it wasn't until 4 We go in and it's the exact same tattoo so we told him that mine was a little different like we talked about he was super sweet about redrawing it up but it took another 2 hours and then about another hour to set up. So none the less we didn't start the tattoos until 8 and it was a Monday my husband and I had to work early the next day. So he finishes my husbands tattoo after about 4 hours which was beautiful. Even though it was super late he wanted to do it. He basically hauled ass through my tattoo and now it's only been about 4 months and there is a random line through my tattoo. It's not colored in all the way and my purple flower has turned brown. My husband called about getting touch up but they said Danny isn't even there anymore.
