I just didn't want my tattoo messed up even more than it already is so I'm going to have to pay for another tattoo artist to fix it. The place was nice and clean but the experience was horrible.

Stopped in at Pinefish on a whim, and extremely happy I did!
From start to finish the hosting and exceptional service from Lauren, was amazing! Lauren is very passionate about the her job and it is clearly displayed by her knowledge and confidence about the food and how well the business is run. I could have enjoyed everything on this menu, but I settled with the swordfish special which was cooked to perfection. The flavors were a true delight to my taste buds!!
Pinefish also has a very nice wine and cocktail selection. Lauren mentioned the very popular happy hour they have every day. 
I can't wait to stop in again at this beautiful gem. 

Thank you Lauren for everything!

Awesome Christmas Eve trip to Coppertail! Upon entering we were immediately greeted and given some good beer recommendations. I ordered the Free Dive IPA, my husband had the Tiny Golem IPA, and my sister had the Blackberry Slam Piece... all were great! There is a good selections of seats inside and out and a large projector TV in the main seating area. We will definitely be back the next time we are in Tampa!

I visited Top Deck Restaurant with my family 2 times when we visited Reno. It is located on the third floor of a casino and can be confused with the steakhouse downstairs. 

One of the days, the wait time was pretty ridiculous. It took about 25 minutes to get seated, then another 20 for the waiter to make her way over to ask us for our drink order. The second visit had a brief wait time and the service was much more efficient. 

The food itself here isn't the highest of quality but is quite large and cheap. An example is the steak and fries (pic will be provided) was only $5 and tasted pretty good. The salads and soups aren't too bad either. Salads are simple with dressing and croutons laid upon some fresh greens. I highly recommend looking at the Cal Neva originals on he menu first because some of them, like the burrito my brother ordered, was huge and delicious.

I would recommend this place to anyone wanting some cheap but large portioned food.

Decent size portions and tasty food coupled with friendly service justifies the price of this non rushed establishment look for their specials too save a few bucks.  

-------------------
Bottom line

I like this place     
Yes, I will be back!

It's now December 9th and I noticed that one side of my hood wasn't properly latched when walking to it. I eventually managed to get it to latch in place, but it's difficult to get the main latch hooked and near impossible to get one side latched without using significant body weight (prior to the repair it required minimal force to latch everything in one go).  

I still haven't heard back from the general manager since our last call a week and a half ago. My assumption is that the parts are still stuck in customs, but regardless any kind of update would've been appreciated. For reference its now been 3 weeks since I picked up the car, 12 weeks since I originally dropped the car off, and 16 weeks since I started the whole process of scheduling my repair.

Small mom & pop thai restaurant. Great food, any dish I have ever had was tasty. The people are nice too. Unfortunately, they are usually (very) short staffed so be prepared to wait a very long time for your food, service. Tonight it took 40 minutes to get a check and some to go containers. Some customers got up left which you hate to see happen. Hope things will improve for them.

I have been dining at Russell's for decades.  It's always a great experience. Because of the awesome, friendly service and food, my family has celebrated many birthdays and special occasions at Russell's. I usually have breakfast, but decided to try something different this time.  Today I ordered the crab cakes, and I'm glad I did.  They were absolutely delicious!  I can't wait to return to try something new.

What a crappy bar. Do not recommend. 

Rude door"man".. if that's what you could call "him"..

Nice bar tender. 

But other than that. Ew.

Super into pabst at this place.. Like they have a whole room dedicated to it. Lame.

Booked a family trip with three rooms on Expedia- we paid over $20 extra a night for lake view and breakfast. I am not sure how legitimate Expedia is. We checked-in around 9pm. Nothing left but one ok room, one handicap and no lake view. They said they were all booked out. I wonder why they can't reserve our rooms knowing we booked and paid extra for specific locations. They tried to fight it saying that Expedia never provides proper channels of communication and that it's not their fault. Fine. At least give us a discount right? I also had a horrible night only to realize my restless sleep was due to 30 high school kids banging and screaming until 5am. I'm assuming the kids got my lake view but yet we paid over $60 per each room for an upgrade. 
So I'm pretty tired, grouchy and frustrated. Also, cleaning was inconsistent. One day they clean and two others they didn't.... not sure why. 

Expedia and Marriott, please communicate better on your deals and description. And for your consumer willing to pay more, please put them on a separate list. Nothing is more frustrating than knowing that I got ripped off and that I was surrounded by high school kids that got better rooms than me.j
Good service- O'Neal was very attentive and polite! Alligator bites and Gumbo are delicious. Don't forget to try a hurricane!

THANK YOU POKE LORDS FOR BRINGING US POLA! 
If you have read my review for Poke King you know I have strong feelings about poke. If you haven't, just know I consider myself a poke connoisseur as I have been eating it most of my life. As I do enjoy poke king it just does not hit the spot for me the way pola does. 

I see there will never be "cheap" poke in this town but I'll happily cough up the money for the freshness and deliciousness provided by pola. 

EVEN BETTER they serve bowls that aren't seafood! It is an arm and a leg for me to get my boyfriend to any place that serves seafood but now there is somewhere close and convenient where we can both get what we want.

PRO TIP: order online- they give generous servings and it is very quick and easy.

This is probably my favorite sushi place in town! The service was caring considerate and timely. The restaurant was clean and cute. Most importantly the fish was fresh. My friends and I did the all you can eat for lunch which is around $18 and that doesn't just include sushi you can get Nigiri or sides like a salad, tempura, etc. next timeI go I'll take pictures because it was very lovely.

I have a great bunch of people that work at the location in Catalina. I opened an account with them because they have a branch here & it was too costly to use the ATM to get money from my bank account. I can't think of EVER having a bad experience with them! They are the BEST financial institution I have done business with and I have been with several different banks over the years! The staff here is ALWAYS friendly and they go the extra mile to assist you with whatever you need. I can't imagine going anywhere else!

For the past six years, PetSuites has always given my Cairn terrie Lizzie the best care whether it has been for boarding, grooming or daycare.  A big plus: She has never gotten sick while in their care.  In addition, the staff members are  professional and pleasant.  While on vacation, I've called to check on her; the staff gives me a detailed report  and patiently answers questions.  As for Lizzie herself, she starts barking when she spots the PetSuites building from the car and is in a hurry to get inside. She gets most impatient -- she's a terrier after all -- when the staff member is putting on the ID collar.  She just can't wait to play with the other dogs!

It was really pretty at night with the lights and stuff. The ice skating rink was bigger than I thought and seemed a lot of fun. Didn't get to ice skate because there was a huge line. Walking around there's a lot of booth selling Christmas decors and a few food options, not too many. Many of the food booth sold out of their menu soo it must be good! Tired the famous "cheese wheel" sandwich and it was absolute delicious!!! The wait in the cold was worth it!

This is my favorite new place in New Hope.  It is small and cozy, so you need to chill in the bar an be patient, but it is so worth the wait.  We showed up on Friday night and the bar was busy, but not near as crowded as I thought it might be.  They don't have a cocktail menu, but they have Russian Standard vodka and a great whiskey selection, which is all we need.  We were greeted by someone that took our name and checked back on us regularly while we chilled in the bar.  There are only a handful of tables in the bar, and the area upstairs also has limited seating, but upstairs are these big leather couches and chairs with coffee tables and small tables.  The feel is if you are sitting in your best friend's house that just happens to have a great kitchen staff and several people that are purely there to make sure you have anything you need.  The decor is absolutely perfect and the historic building is stunning.  After seeing people in the bar order burgers and fries that looked and smelled amazing, I already knew what I wanted.  We were shown upstairs around 35 minutes after we arrived, and we started with the bacon wrapped figs, which are outstanding.  I ordered the burger and fries and they were both perfect.  GF ordered the salmon, but replaced with fries, which is not her normal order, but she was not disappointed and the salmon was great.  We could have sat there all night and were taken care of so perfectly neither of us wanted to leave.  This will absolutely be one of our regular places, and it was one of our best nights out recently.  Thanks so much to all of the staff that took such great care of us.

Time for an upgrade.  Of the theatre's in the area this is by far the worst.  The seats are in desperate need of an upgrade.  You still can't pick your seats at the time of purchasing your tickets online.  The projection quality wasn't even as clean and crisp as other movie theatre's in the area.  I won't be back until they do a major upgrade to this theatre.

Michael and Anna are top notch! My wife and I have used them for our engagement photos, professional work photos, wedding at the Bacara and now baby/family photos at home. We will continue to use them for all of our photography needs! They are VERY talented and professional photographers and I am consistently amazed at the photos we get back and now get to cherish. Worth every penny. Available, flexible, communicative, make you feel comfortable, will work with you to achieve your vision, and they know people or are experienced with most venues. Once I got the pictures back I realized how important it was to have them capture our once-in-a-lifetime moments.

Very, very similar to what was here before. 

They're working with a fairly small space for a grocery so I think they do a decent job with what they have. A few of the standouts during my visit include the impressive cheese counter with big wheels ready for fresh packaging, an impressive salad bar and wine and dessert cases. I also noticed that this Kroger has adopted the new prepared meals concept (similar to Blue Apron). The flower section was meh -they could use a larger variety of offerings and the prices always seem so salty compared to Trader Joe's and Aldi. 

The parking makes this spot a winner- first and second floors of the building (covered) and free. You can also find street parking and bike parking easily. It would hurt for them to offer some of the interactive tasty stations and heightened elements that other groceries are now offering.

Ok, I'll admit it: I'm biased when restaurants try to cover all the bases; so when a place offers Sushi, Thai, & Vietnamese (Pho)- I might have some reservations. I went for Thai: Tom Yum Goong, Pad See Ew and a few Sing Ha beers. Also, some Prik Nam Pla to bring the fire. The food was pretty good and the service friendly, if not the fastest. So, a pretty good place all-in-all. I do recommend Yoshi and will definitely be back to try their Sushi and, this time, I'll change my beer order to Kirin.

After reading all the positive reviews, I decided to take my car here for an oil change, break pad inspection, and brake fluid flush. I drove a little further for this place (~3.5 miles) because of the good reviews. I called the day before and made and appointment for 2:00 the following day. I got my car there at 2 on the dot and was a bit disappointed that they didn't have a shuttle service. I was told that if I wanted to wait they would be starting to work on it in about 25 minutes. I elected to pay ~$7 for a Lyft home instead of sitting and waiting. I did not get a call from them until 3:50 telling me what needed to be done (nothing had been done at this point). I asked what time it would be ready and the guy sounded irritated and said "some time before closing". I arrived at 6:15 to pick my car up (45 minutes before they close) and the car still wasn't ready. I ended up waiting until 7:15 for my car when it was dropped off at 2:00 with an appointment. The other thing that I was unhappy about was i ended up paying $400 for an oil change, brake flush, and cleaning of my brakes. Also, I specifically told them I wanted full Synthetic oil and I was given semi-synthetic. Very unhappy with the service, wait times, and price. Do not go here despite all the other positive reviews.

We came in as a party of 4 for a Fabulous Raffle Prize dinnee that my Mom Won at the Sierra Nevada Donor Awareness Walk this year.
We started with the cheese Fondue and it was fantastic, and our dinners were Wonderful!!!
Great service and atmosphere...Thank YOU Napa Sonoma for a fun evening!!!!
Was slow when we arrived, maybe location.  None the less, service was excellent, food was served hot and timely.  Strawberry Orange Juice delicious

This organization needs help! Their website is difficult to operate and confusing. I'm convinced this organization makes 2/3 of their earnings through their no refund/ exchange policies. 
Absolutely immoral practices.
These people need help, Starting to look like United Airlines... problems at the top!

We were treated like refugees coming across the border. Being a "Platinum for Life" member means nothing to this location so just be prepared for a world of disappointment and of poor treatment. Both of our Credit cards were charged for the same room and that shouldn't have been; we were told that we BOTH had to have a card on file for the same room we were sharing as family(nowhere in the world has THAT happened!) and the three night stay had been reduced to one without knowledge of or permission unless we paid double the original booking rate. When a call to Platinum Guest Services was made, they begrudgingly 'found' our reservation for our room for the three nights. We had requested foam pillows, we had none. We requested luggage racks, we had none. The front desk staff must hate their jobs as they're much too consumed in a game of 'slap and tickle' with each other and seem quite put out to wait on guests. Curt words used to interrupt guests made one feel that you were imposing on them to do the simplest thing like oh, check you in. 
The room on the 16th floor: the rusted fixtures with an extra layer of dust, grease and regret on them gave a creepy feel as well as an odd smell to the room. There was absolutely never any hot water and the lack of water pressure meant that it would indeed catch you with soap in your eyes and/or shampoo in your hair when the water would shudder to a trickle . That was followed by a cold blast of water from the faucet that would hit your feet as you fumbled to get the shower to work again. Talking to the front desk staff is exhausting and you won't get any help whatsoever. The room itself reeked of dirty socks and sweat.
Concierge Breakfast/Snacks: sadly, this is much worse than the rooms, if possible. Hot things were cold, cold things were warm, pretty sure if the health department had been called it would've been closed. Coffee was always luke-warm but the worse was Saturday night/Sunday morning when they 'closed'. The cold, days old coffee was left out so elite level guests would go to get a cup only to get a cup of ice-cold sadness. The trash at the coffee area was overflowing to the point it was stacked on the counter area. This is visible to arriving guests no matter what their level was. ALL bottled water was removed in an attempt to force one to use the bigger $3.50 bottle of the same stuff in the room. When I approached the front desk to alert them to the matter, they were once again poking and playing with each other in a way that made me uncomfortable to see. I checked back an hour later and it was worse than before. We left Sunday morning saddened that the hotel was such a mess in so many ways. 
Stay #2: Again, Platinum member checking in at 7:45 PM and you would have thought we asked the desk clerk to wax her mustache. We gave her our name for the room but she couldn't spell it. We started to spell it to be helpful but she rudely cut us off saying she could find it. "Frau Blücher" couldn't. We spelled the name for her twice only to have her scowl at us as if we had said something nasty to her. She finally found the reservation but acted as if we had none. She scowled at us again and said we could have a king room with a pullout or rent a bed. No, we had requested two beds for two grownups. We also needed foam pillows due to allergies to feather, as requested in the reservation and in our profiles. We were cut off by Frau Blücher again and told, "The hotel is sold out. We have no more pillows for you".  Another desk agent recognized us from when we checked in the first time days before and panicked. She said she would try to get us two foam pillows. In a while a young man came to the room with the frick and frack of pillows; one under-filled one and one of those monstrous egg-shaped weird ones that no one can use. The room itself was like an afterthought or a poorly pieced together puzzle: the bathroom is hidden down a creepy, narrow, dark hallway barely wide enough for a petite woman of 98 lbs and 4 ft tall. The door opens in the middle of the room and onto this awkward kitchen counter space with a microwave and fridge on it. It makes no sense at all and blocks part of the entry to the creepy bathroom hall. The airflow in the room is completely obstructed by the weird counter thing and the fact that the air handler is in the creepy hallway. So the room temperature fluctuated between like a bi-polar person with insomnia. You can also throw a cat ass-first under the room door - the crack is that large.The water was luke-warm but the pressure on the 15th floor seems a tad bit better. I would compare it to the shower water pressure in a 500 year old youth hostel in the south of France. I hope that gives the proper visual to those whom have experienced that.
Hidden gem in Indy. Highly, highly recommended for an excellent evening out!!! Christian is hilarious and Katarina is unbelievable. Wonderful experience

I took my mom here to eat. She has trouble walking and uses a cane. There were no employees to be seen. Finally after minutes of seeing no employees someone came out to take our order. We got our order and the cashier offered us a drink for the long wait. My mom was already sitting at the table waiting. As I walked off I heard the manager yelling at the cashier about why he took our order because she was ready to close and he better give her the 1.09 for the drink he gave me! I Sat down to eat with my mom and the manager then yells at us that we can't eat here. I said we came inside to be able to eat here. My mom has trouble getting around and we were looking forward to our meal there. She says we're closed and you can't be in here, you all need to leave right now. I said we got here way before closing time to eat here and we would've already been done if we didn't have to wait so long for an employee to appear. I said I've never been kicked out of a McDonald's before and it's because people are allowed to be there to eat their meal as long as they arrive before closing. I said at least let my mom eat, she hasn't eaten and is starving. She said no ya'll have to get out of this place. My mom had to get all her stuff together and struggle back to the car. We ate in the car with difficulty dropping lettuce full of sauce on ourselves and the car from the big Macs. As we Sat in the car we watched as the door stayed open with a wet floor cone and no employees going home. Later I had to clean the car from this uncomfortable meal. Manager said her name was Pam. Worst manager ever! Even the 2 employees that were there were embarrassed and tried oppologizing for her. Actually the cashier that took our order was about to clock out but took our order since no one else was coming. I will never eat here again!

This is my favorite Italian restaurant in the New Orleans area.  If you were lucky enough to have a New Orleanian grandmother with a Sicilian heritage, this is the food you would have eaten in her kitchen.  My favorite is the bruciolone, but every thing I've eaten here is good.  Always servings big enough to bring home half.  Service is good.  Just go and eat.

A single man operation.  I took in three silk bridesmaid robes that needed hemming and it only took him 2 hours and 8 dollars a piece. The hemming job was good enough perhaps not perfectly straight. The guy may seem aloof/sarcastic but don't take that personally - it's more a cultural thing. I spoke in Chinese and didn't try English with him. He calls you when he's done with the job. Hours are long 10am - 8pm. If you don't see him inside his shop, he also lingers around the shop or downstairs in the supermarket. He says you can call him if you get there during shop hours and don't see him.

Highly recommend this company. Very quick response when requested quote. Scheduled cleaning within two days. The two guys that came out were extremely efficient and knowledgeable about their job. We had to get the back wall replaced and again was able to get it done within two days. George was the guy who replaced it. We were very pleased with the work he did and appreciate the advice on how to use the fireplace. 
This is a very dependable company. We will definitely call them in need again!

I placed a delivery order for chicken chow mein, broccoli with garlic sauce, and chicken with garlic sauce. They only sent ONE correct order to us, the chicken with garlic sauce. The other two orders were beef with garlic sauce and chicken and cabbage with no noodles. When I called back to ask if they could resend the order and I would give them the incorrect orders back, she yelled and stated that chicken chow mein DOES NOT include noodles, only lo mein does. I'm not Chinese, but I'm pretty sure that "chow mein" translates to "fried noodles." I would recommend never ordering from this restaurant if you want a correct order.. or chow mein WITH noodles. They said the only way they would correct the order was if we brought it back to them.. which doesn't make sense because we ordered delivery and they messed up. The only good thing was how quickly we received the incorrect order.
This is a great place for  salads and soups. Love the staff they are always friendly and eager to help.  Love to stop in for a quick bite and fabulous sweets

First time here and this was an excellent recommendation for the day when I needed feel good food. I liked the fact that the place was busy but I still felt I was able to have a good conversation throughout the meal. Tables are arranged in a way you don't feel packed in but has lots of seating options. Staff was very friendly and in general the place has a nice atmosphere. The location is within the long strip mall on 99 st, so if you're driving south towards it, best to turn at the lights just before, as the road can be quite busy at certain times of days making a left turn difficult.

Food arrived very quickly! It was hot, fresh and great tasting. The spring rolls we ordered ahead of time were the perfect amount to add to the meal. Vermicelli bowl and rice dish are both very reasonable costs and we were very happy with our choices. I think the next time I've got more apatite I'll try the rice dish as it also comes with a small bowl of soup. Definitely will be back again!

That was amazing! Kevin helped me score a great deal on a short-sale. I don't even live in the area, but was able to 'walkthrough' the house thanks to Kevin's 3D walkthrough he was able to put together and send me very quickly. That's one of the neat things I've noticed about Kevin: He looks for ways to solve his client's problems. He opened a second company that helps his clients with staging and handyman repairs (even renovations). That experience was super helpful in our deal as well since the city hit the sellers with code violations during our transaction. Kevin always negotiated hard for us and ended up helping us get $15,000 off the price of the house during escrow! He's trusting and really does provide more than most for his clients -- well, at least he did for me. When it comes time to sell, we will definitely be using him as we know he'll walk us through any recommended improvements and will know the most efficient, cost-effective vendors to use as well. 5 stars!!

I went to this Hospital dr. Herbert Fisher put a dirty stent in the main artery of my heart had an aneurysm on it and marsall around my heart a fever of 105 then the main artery my heart died after heart surgery left me with 50% of blood they admitted they put the dirty standing me and then left me live on welfare there a bunch of fucking scumbags

I worked for the Service Manager many years ago at their Toyota store. He used to call me "youngster." Great manager who taught me a lot about life. I was talking to a friend, who also was an advisor and the one who introduced me to the manager, and I was reflecting on how the current Service Manager was the most honest manager I ever worked for. I can guarantee you that if you go to Conicelli for service, you will be given a fair and honest price.

Excellent food. 

The place wasn't  as clean as one should expect. Every table had crumbles and left overs. Had to engage two staff members to do the job right since the first one  couldn't do nuts. 
Thank you staff member #2 who was apparently on her break but still did the job and in the right way and spirit 

Excellent food is a combination of great prep + clean ambiance + friendly staff

My man loves this place - I was a deer caught in the headlights. 

I found many nice tops and jackets. A bit rich for my blood but quality clothing, of course. 

The sales staff were nice and not too pushy. 

I did see a young employee hitting on a customer on her way out.  Kind of cute - kind of bothersome.   (he got the digits!) 

Id go back, if accompanied!

An adorable organic and whole food market and coffee shop that you'll want to visit often. This place has a little bit of everything. Olive oil and balsamic vinegars on tap, organic packaged and frozen food, fresh organic fruit and veggies, and personal skin care products are available. But there is also a coffee and lunch counter for treats and eats before or after you shop.  Had the curried cauliflower bisque and a chocolate croissant to go today! Yum!
Favorite place in Tampa to eat! Always bring my friends visiting here and everyone raves about it. The owners are awesome and have my order memorized! Great food great people and great value!
A large store that was recently opened in the area. Lots of registers to help with the flow. It is directly attached to the TJ Maxx, which is next door.
First time in and we were very pleased. Friendly, comfortable and great tasting eats. I'll be back for more.
Came on vacation with my entire family.  Michael offered us SUPERB service!! It was his 1st day at the job too!!! Food was delish and fun environment!! Highly recommend this restaurant!!!
Staff at the payment counter is very rude. The person was playing on her cell phone. When a customer wanted to ask something she started behaving very rudely with customers.

Been going here since it opened and they're so consistent. Ordering ahead of time is super easy! Pan au chocolate is great, they make fantastic macarons and they have a lemon meringue pie cake! I always buy one and bring it with me to Vancouver for my family there because they LOVE it. Their lemon tarts are always perfectly tart yet sweet.

I won't shop here again. I picked an item from the shelves after doing routine price and feature comparison, i.e. shopping. It rang up for $3.00 more than the hang tag on the shelf indicated, so I went back to the display, confirmed the price and told to the cashier that there was nothing on display for $27.00. Instead of re-confirming the price, he said "Well that's what it rang up for". I had someone waiting in an idling car, so I paid his price and resolved to shop elsewhere. I am still irritated an hour later, so I wrote this consumer warning.

Let me start off by saying I NEVER EVER complain about restaurants and their service, I know people have bad nights. I get it, I really do. But I  am only giving this a 1 star because you can't give 0 stars. This was the worst service I have ever received from a restaurant. We had reservations at 6:30 for my mom and I's birthday. Got seated at 6:30, waited over and hr and a half for our food, in the mean time our waitress was MIA several times so we were unable to get refills or even check in on our food. Finally a little over 2 hrs later we got our food which wasn't anything to talk about. Our waitress was not apologetic at all and acted like this was okay, and we never saw a manager to talk to. Anyways, 4 hrs later we were able to leave. Needless to say, we will NEVER be going back. Save yourself and go somewhere else
Multi generational corner bar.  Cash only, no problem, not super expensive, but good to hang out in.

Used to go once a week used to always get crusted Victoria filet it was absolutely delicious and reasonable went last week and will never go back again got the Victoria filet with a friend it came to the table not the thick piece of meat we used to get but a real half inch thin piece of crap meet with gristle and over-cooked it was horrible and the price has gone up it's all of a sudden like a low end restaurant now will go to any other Steakhouse in town from now on it was just disgusting skinny tasteless Stakes for twice the amount of money

Seriously the employees here need to be a but faster. Im on my 30 mins lunch waiting 20 mins in the drive through without moving an inch. It's. Not right, they really need to get more people or be faster.

I hate giving bad reviews, especially when the staff was nice, but here goes...
  First off, I found a paper clip in my pad Thai. Seriously. A paper clip. It was one of my last bites and there it was. Had a noticed it earlier, I would not have eaten it, who knows what else fell into my food.
  The pad Thai was not bad, but nothing exciting. I also got overcooked fried wontons and the soup tasted off. Won't go back.

I did a takeout of the falafel platter and it was good.
It had crushed/ sliced falafel, rice, salad, white sauce and mint chutney. The falafel tastes nice and crispy.
Few notes:
It is cash only.
Opposite to the T-mobile store.
You don't get the whole falafel balls rather it is crushed/ sliced. I guess if you request, they may not crush them.
They don't add the hot sauce(Red hot sauce like the halal guys). If you ask for spicy food they will just drizzle some red chilli/ cayenne pepper along with some jalapeños.

I lived in Lansdale for about 8 years and this was the place I used to go to for Chinese because it was the nearest.  The food is your average Americanized Chinese food, nothing to write home about, but if you got that bad Chinese food craving, it's not the worst place in the world in terms of their food.  What makes this the place to avoid is their delivery service.  They take forever, and I've had a delivery guy, who spoke very little English, who refused to let me use the coupon from their own advertisement, and have the audacity to ask for more tip.  I'm an immigrant myself and I like to support foreign people who work hard, but not if they lie and have bad manners (I'm just old fashioned that way).  So I started driving over 15 min if I wanted Chinese food from there on until I moved away.  So if you're visiting Lansdale and think you want Chinese food, just go get yourself some pizza instead (I'd recommend Olces, though they aren't technically in Lansdale).

This place is probably my favorite brunch place. The breakfast menu is great. On the weekend the place has $2 mimosas. You can never go wrong with $2 mimosas !!!!! I would recommend the steak and eggs, breakfast tacos, and for lunch the fried chicken tacos. The service is always great when visiting.

Nicest motel ever. Very thoughtful details (bike rental, curated TV channel, local items in mini-fridge). Friendly staff. Great bar for late night cocktails. The building is a pig, but her lipstick looks great!

Beware. I made an appointment with Joe for an in-town move. He never showed up. He left me stranded on Christmas Eve with all my stuff packed up. He never called or answered my calls, texts, or my Craigslist message. 

I met Joe several times when he was preparing to move my friend across the country. She seemed pleased with his work and I assumed I would be, too. I guess he only works if he feels like it. Now I have to find someone else to move me on short notice ($$) and pay for an extension at my current place.

Conveniently located about 5-7 minutes away from the airport, this Enterprise was one of the better rental car experiences I've had. It only took a few minutes to book the rental online and they called a day ahead to confirm my reservation as well as let us know what documents would be required to secure the rental.

Upon arrival, we were warmly greeted and promptly provided keys. Trey assisted us with picking up and inspecting the rental vehicle upon return. He was so pleasant, polite, knowledgeable, and eager to assist. He was our first impression of Southern hospitality and really got our vacation off to a great start. I liked that after returning the vehicle, we were asked if we needed a ride anywhere and they were so kind as to deliver us back to the airport. Trey also asked how we felt about their customer service before we left which I found to be a nice touch from Enterprise.

I would have given 5 stars but the vehicle we rented was pretty dirty / in need of a wash on the exterior , although the interior was clean and it had a 14 inch crack in the driver's side of the front windshield which Trey asked  whether would be too distracting to drive. While I appreciated him acknowledging the giant crack and gaining manager approval to offer a discount because of it, I don't think a vehicle with such a huge crack in the windshield should remain part of rental inventory at all. On this day, it was also the only available vehicle of its class and capacity so we went with it.

This place is now at the top of my list for favorite places. If you looking for fresh, flavorful, and aromatic food this is the place. The food was great and priced right. It's a definite must try if your in the area.

My absolute favorite coffee shop. Not only is it aesthetically pleasing, it's calm ambiance allows me to do work while relaxing. Bella is also amazing! She is extremely helpful and every time I've come she's had a positive attitude. The only place I suggest for coffee. (And the WiFi is amazing!)

This place is awesome.  The staff and owners are extremely nice and the coffee is outstanding.  We happened to be there when they were doing a cupping and they invited us over to join them.  We got the lowdown on all the cool places from them and it really made our trip better.  

YBC will be on our shortlist next time we visit Tucson.  My only regret is that we only visited it the day before we left so we only had time to visit one of their brewery recommendations.

This location has a lot of bad reviews, but I felt I should balance it out with the great service I received today. 
So I foolishly ordered pizzas online for my office holiday party to arrive at 11:45PM (instead of AM). When I noticed the online order tracker wasn't progressing, I quickly realized my mistake. When I phoned the restaurant to change my order, the employee who answered was friendly and told me they could still get my pizzas to me within the 70-80 minutes currently listed as the delivery time on their website. The pizzas arrived within 60 minutes and everything was cooked perfectly to order. I was pleased, and so were all the people I had ordered for. I would order from this location again.

The stadium DSW is my favorite place to shop for shoes! Located in the same plaza as Home Depot, Nordstrom Rack, Target, Whole Foods & many more businesses, one can accomplish many shopping objectives without even leaving the parking lot! However, getting OUT of the parking lot often requires a great deal of patience. There are basically two main ways in and out, and that is just not sufficient for a business plaza of this size. 

Regardless, DSW makes the trip worth the hassle. They have a wide variety of women's shoes and bags in plenty of sizes and colors at incredibly reasonable prices! Their sale section is located at the rear of the store which is similar to most locations, and the shoes are all in pretty good order. If you're looking for something particular, you can try to hunt down a DSW rep (which can be a little hard to do if they're real busy). I have also noticed that the employees don't exactly seek you out to offer help after you've been greeted at the front entrance. 

Being part of their Member Rewards program is completely free and for those looking to save a few dollars, I have found it to be very beneficial as they mail discount coupons and cards to your home. You also get a birthday coupon during your birthday month which - if memory serves me correctly - is a $10 certificate to spend in-store or online! 

Also, if you are ever searching for a shoe in your size that DSW doesn't have in stock, they will offer to order it from their headquarters and either mail it to your home or you can pick them up in-store.

While I find that DSW sells solid brand-name shoes of high quality, today I discovered that two of the pairs I purchased had some defective marks around the toe area (something that I missed while in-store). I took them back as soon as I noticed and switched them out for something comparable with no defects. After this experience, I will always be sure to triple-check the shoes I am purchasing to avoid multiple trips. But you'd better believe that I will be back soon to use my new $20 coupon!

This place is amazing! I love poke and have had quite a bit in my life. They have a great selection of fish/toppings at a really reasonable price. The employees are super helpful too. Can't wait to back soon... this is my new favorite spot by USF.

There are few times I'm willing to shell out $10+ for a drink, but when it's good - it's good. I waddled in here on a snowy Saturday, and the vibe was perfect for a boozy blizzard snow crawl. They boast many signature cocktails, and honestly, I had a hard time choosing. The drinks are about $10-11 a pop, which is honestly a steal because their vodka is as smooth as it comes. Most of the time, vodka shoots me back to memories of my worst college hangovers, but I left Stateside with nothing but love in my tummy. 

The bartenders were lovely and precise in their mixology, and the drinks were amazing. One came with an ice cube that had FLOWERS frozen into it. It was BEAUTIFUL and made me feel like a fancy, classy lady - this was the "Winter is Coming" cocktail, just incase you're searching for a very instagrammable drink. I chose the Philadelphia Politics, a pink, lemony gin/vodka concoction. It was palatable, smooth, and sophisticated. These are not words I typically throw into a Yelp review, so you know it's sincere.

There was lots of room to sit or stand on the day and time we came here, but I could see how this place could very easily get crowded. They do offer tours and a delicious, unique bar food menu, but I can't comment much on either as I just stuck to my drink. The music, however, was the best playlist of jams to sing along to - I can NEVER resist the "BAH BAH BAHHHH" of Sweet Caroline, no matter the setting. 

I'm definitely keen to come back here. It's a great hang for a girls day or date night, and definitely worth EVERY penny!

So...I ordered the rad thai (arugula, mesclun, bean sprouts, shredded cabbage, sunflower seeds, carrots, cucumbers, basil, and shrimp) and I was given everything except cabbage and cucumbers, but with added beets, broccoli, celery, and a bunch of quinoa. Thank you?

The atmosphere is kinda strange, very family friendly. The place is very big. Once I went and loved my food. Once I went and did not. The first time I got a sandwich which was great. I probably would stick to their sandwiches.

Excellent salad and ordered individual pizza and I was able to choose two different types of pizza. Chose the Hawaiian and chicken BBQ and it was delicious. Crust was perfectly done and warmed up the next day just as good. For dessert ordered the cannoli and the chocolate mouse. Very good and chocolates.

PS & Co is a GEM of a restaurant in Philadelphia. Its located on a quiet block of Locust street, in what seems like a regular town house. Its so beautiful inside with natural woods and plants everywhere. It is a lovely spot for breakfast, lunch, dinner or on the go coffee and treats. They use local, fresh, organic ingredients and I believe the restaurant is 100% powdered by wind which is so cool!

Ive had everything from coffee and a cookie to juices to salads to veggie burgers. I have never been disappointed. Its also a great spot to hang for a while if you need to do work or have a meeting, etc. There is a great little area in the back with so much natural light. Its perfect for mid day work sessions. 

The prices are a little higher than most places in Philadelphia, but you do pay for what you get and THIS place is worth every penny. You will leave feeling nourished and happy.

All food choices empty and nothing on the grill.   No brown rice.  Waited in line with 1 person in front of me for 10 minutes while employees mess around in no hurry cursing at each other.  Burrito had zero flavor.  Had to clean off my own table to sit and eat.  Never again

Performance Bicycle exceeded any and all expectations !
 I had ordered an electric bike for my husband for Christmas and some additional items; a  luggage rack, trunk, saddle bags and a new seat all at the same time and had everything shipped directly to the store for assembly as per Amazon. 
Not only was the bike service completed in  3 days , but they did not charge anything to install the extra add-ons. 
Rod was very polite and professional each time I called , and I called numerous times , with questions . In addition each employee was polite , courteous and friendly and obviously enjoyed their jobs. Such a pleasure to deal with. I highly recommend them and will definitely be back for any future needs or wants. 
For reference I purchased : Ancher Folding Electric Mountain Bike with Alloy 6-spoke Integrated wheels and large capacity battery.
Ps : I brought them some Dunkin Donuts to enjoy for the remaining hours at work.

Suuuuuuper yummy.  Delivery is pretty quick too!  My order has been slightly off a few times, and even so it was delicious.  Hell yes, Dominos

Every experience here is great!!  And I just had the nicest delivery guy, who came back with an extra drink because he said I was nice!!

It's expensive, but worth for awesome sea food they serve. 

We had dargon shrimp wonton sampler and prawans in entree. Dargon shrimp was good, another prawns entree was okish, though too oily.

On Google review it says that this place is veg-friendly, unfortunately it is not I think I should blame Google for this. My friend had to survive on salad and baked potatoes which was really small protion (didn't expected).

Needs to rename to "Urban Outhouse"

Who thinks this is good? My employer orders this droll every few weeks. It's terrible. Everything is tasteless garbage whipped up from Aramark supplies.

Yarf.

Huge fan of their bacon blue cheese burger, its so juicy and tasty!! This diner is so nice, the food is always great and the servers are amazing! Just an all around get diner that deserves its praise!

Ting Wong's is a great place for large parties.  We ordered lots of dishes to share - our favorites were the roasted pork and noodle bowl as well as the lo mein dishes.  We loved the "lazy Susan" in the middle of the table which made sharing very easy.  The service was a little slow to start but once we ordered, the food arrived very quickly.  Plenty on the menu for everyone, including kids.
I love Sally's Beauty Supply, I shop at ONLY Sally's, they are KNOWLEDGEABLE sales people, have NEVER BEEN STEERED wrong. Totally appreciate the staff there, Thank U all...

I normally prefer local businesses but this is my favorite chain in Tucson. It's honestly exactly what I want when I go out to eat... endless salad (that is actually fresh and not wilted), homemade soups, and tasty muffins/desserts. I like that there's a rotating menu so you can try a variety of items. My favorites are the quinoa salad, the chicken noodle soup, tomato bisque, cheesy garlic bread, and the traditional Mac and Cheese. The staff is always friendly at the Broadway location and someone is always there to scoop up an empty plate. I routinely get coupons in the mail as well! Fair prices for such a wide selection.

This is a review for the Half Marathon component of this race. 

While the race course was OK, that stretch of 3.5-4 miles straight without porta potties between the Columbus Blvd. area and Drexel University was incredibly painful, especially after I had to skip the previous one or two potty stops due to the few stalls and insanely long lines at each stop in the first 4-ish miles of the race. For a race of this size and pricing, it was unacceptable not to have anywhere to pee for the first 8 miles! I'm not even sure whether this helped or hurt my pace... Did trying to find a place to pee make me run faster or was I so uncomfortable that I pretty much hobbled from Columbus Blvd all the way to University City? 

Also, the post-race refreshments were weak, highlighted by cold/stale/cement-hard Philly pretzels and preserved fruit cups. (They did have bananas, though, which I do appreciate.) In contrast, other half marathons I've been to this year (all of which had lower entry fees) provided varieties of fresh bagels, fresh doughnuts, multiple bottles of water/gatorade per runner, whole fruits, protein bars, yogurt, hot New England clam chowder, flavored water ice, pizza, and/or hot pancake/bacon/sausage breakfasts. Some of those races also provided free race photos, whereas photo packages for this race are ~$50-100. 

To top it all off, the medal design was horrendous this year. I loved the 2015 medal design with the Liberty Bell and ring around it, and supposedly they chose to do the bell again this year "by popular demand," but instead of a classy-looking frame for the bell like in the 2015 design, the bell this year was supported by two thin rods fixed on top of a rectangular base - so cheaply made that the bell came off the base when a runner accidentally dropped it. The bells also actually rang, which was kind of cool for the first 2 minutes, but then I started getting a migraine being surrounded by thousands of ringing bells all over the Art Museum area. 

Overall, I liked the more city-centric course this year, and even the parts that went through Fairmount Park. The water stations were well-spaced out, though I didn't use them so I could avoid having to pee even more. However, among the 11 organized races that I ran this year, I'd rank this one in the bottom tier and probably won't sign up for it again.

I come here all the time I will travel any distance for this place one of the best nail salons in the county there service is amazing the nail techs are super nice from the moment you walk in to the moment you leave and there super funny 5 stars all around and they do the best eye brows

Huge menu that takes quite a while to get to a decision.  I recommend the simple dishes.  Be prepared to take some pasta home--the portions are quite large.  We have had two meals with friends while in the Tucson area in the just the last month.  Had to try the second visit because there was just too much to sort thru.   Really liked the baked pastas so if in doubt try one of those.  Friendly staff and good service when we were there.  I would like to try the outdoor seating, so another trip is on the list.

I do a lot of my grocery shopping here. The customer service is excellent. They have a little bit of everything. Prices are hit or miss. I try to stick with what's advertised on sale unless it's a must have item. The quality of their produce is A++ . I love their freshly made juices which are reasonably priced, plus you get a dollar off your next fresh juice when you return the mason jar and lid.  

Only negative I have is asking for something to be ordered. Only members who pay a yearly fee have that privilege.

I WOULD NOT recommend this to my worst enemy. Walking up, it looks like an old strip club where they have the d squad working(this should have been our first clue). We thought we would give this place a try but was wrong about this place. The food was horrible. We ordered conch fritters as an appetizer and for our main meal my husband and I attempted to share oysters on the half shell, baked oysters, and the shrimp special. The baked oysters and shrimp weren't awful but they were not great for the price. The oysters on the half shell had beesitting there for awhile you could tell. They were not even close to fresh and we did not eat them!! They did remove them from the bill. Total our bill was $54 minus the oysters on the half shell plus 2 beers. For the price of this place it is ridiculous. I am usually easy going and can enjoy any restaurant, NOT THIS PLACE!!!

The ambience was cool and the space was pretty big. The staff was friendly. It did take a very long time for our drinks to come but the food came pretty quickly. The tacos are very small, if you are hungry you need to order a lot of food here. The guacamole was very good and was a pretty decent size. 
Overall it was a good experience the food was good but nothing to brag about. The bathrooms might be the weirdest I have ever been in. They aren't labeled well so you walk downstairs and see a bunch of sinks. You have to look around to find the right door to go in.

They have some of the best truffle flavors I have ever tried. 

Excellent customer service and comfortable prices - 

Location is not the best, they are below the Elm Furniture store in the former Postal Building - I don't believe there is a elevator to transport, I have only seen stairs.

We walked in they sat us down we just sat down and they said they a closing for a private function and they didn't have a sign nor any info telling me they would have kicked us out and they sat us down so then I filled a growler it was 2 dollars more than it should have, it was overpriced bad experience ended up driving to west Ed and going to earls.

Every single thing I had was exceptionally good, from the olive oil and bread to the coffee after lunch. Eggplant appetizer was outstanding, as was the spaghetti and meatball.  Our waitress was pleasant and efficient.
Wonderful food.)!  We had the following dishes that I would recommend. ..spaghetti and meatballs, eggplant parmigiano. .and pizza.   The server was friendly.  The ambiance great for a family meal!
I got food poisoning from the noodle bar in Parx. Puked and shit my brains out for 24 hours. Will never go back

If you enjoy Vietnamese food, then go to Saigon Deli. My favorite things to order from here include the pork Bahn Mi, the chicken pho, and the grilled pork fried rice. I've had other dishes here, and I'm never disappointed, but those three items are always delicious!

The hours can be tricky, as they are only open until 5 during the week, but if you can get in there before they close, you've got a great dinner ahead!

I have used Buckingham Animal Hospital for more than 15 years. During this entire time i have had an opportunity to interact with all of the Doctors and most, if not all, of the staff  as well. Each of the doctors are wonderful, caring , capable & knowledgable individuals. The staff are also really really great & will go out if their way to answer questions or help when needed. I am rather fussy about my pets & as i have had several animals,  dogs & cats, it was important to me that they all received good capable care & treatment.  I am more than pleased with this group. It definitely deserves a 5 Star rating.

Went here on Christmas Eve.  8 pm reservation.  Got our table right away but it took an hour to get our food after we ordered (8:20).   By the time we were eating the place was pretty cleared out.  Both our meals were very tasty but lukewarm at best.   Our waitress was very nice though.  I'll probably give the place another chance but if the wait time is that long again I'm done

Have been in Reno and this is by far best topless club in Reno!!! Was bored on a Wednesday night and decided to check it out. Have been back a lot since, by myself and once for my cousin's bachelor party after I recommended it to him. He and all his buddies were stoked I did. Always a lot of girl's dancing and good quality and variety. Also have something for everybody. Draft beer, full bar, huge wine list and a specialty craft cocktail menu. If you're hungry they offer everything from Sushi and Live Maine Lobster to Prime Rib, Pastas, and Steaks. If you're not starving or in the mood for higher end food they have a great tapas and appetizer menu with pizzas, wings, lobster avocado egg rolls etc... Check this place out if you are having a bachelor party or just want to get out and enjoy amazing food and drinks with beautiful entertainment and company!!!
Pretty typical tasting food. The wings were ok, but the drinks were awesome! We come here often and the service and drinks are consistently good.

Awesome food, Ive been many times to the original. It's a great place to go for a first date. I'm not sure what day of the week it is but they have live music. Decor, ambience and don't forget the wine

I've been to New Orleans many times over the past 10 years. I've enjoyed many dining establishments in a lot of areas from Kenner to the French Quarter. We were craving charbroiled oysters and headed to Acme Oyster Co. in the French Quarter because it was walking distance from our hotel. The line was around the block. Drago's is fantastic but it was too far to walk and we didn't want to mess with the trolly to get there. We decided to just go back to our hotel on Common St. and just grab anything available. We started to walk past Gallier's but stopped to look at the menu. Charbroiled oysters! We said "why not?" GREAT decision. We got seated right away but the place was still vibrant and active. In short, the food, the service, the staff, and the ambience was EXCELLENT! This place is truly a treasure. SO nice to find smaller places like theirs that do a great job in every aspect of the important areas of providing an excellent dining experience! Great place!!!!!

Ridiculously delicious food and service.  We came here with a group of 5 and were seated right away.  The sandwiches are ginormous, the beer flows generously and the service is amazing.  Highly recommended.
I love this place I haven't tasted anything I didn't like. My favorite is the Glass Noodles & Shrimp Rolls

Hertz's choice lot is very convenient. I love the idea of choosing a vehicle that suits me best. I once reserved a midsize, and drove off with a full-size at no extra charge. I'm currently at Presidents Circle. No complaints.
The only problem I've encountered at this location is Lost & Found. I had forgotten a tablet behind the passenger seat. I submitted a report, they responded saying nothing has been found. I came back the next day and the vehicle was parked cleaned and ready to rent. Out of curiosity, I opened the door, checked the seat, and it was still there! I couldn't believe it but I was just glad because I found it before someone else rented the vehicle.

Had dinner with a small group of friends after the Tampa Florida Orchestra.  Our waitress Gigi was a sweetheart, courteous and professional.  The wait for our dinners was very long, but we were extremely patient since we were part of a group.  However, our meals were served cold and very disappointing.  When we addressed this to Gigi, she was apologetic and asked if we would like to speak with the manager.  We told her we would and we waited.  The manager never had the courtesy to come out and speak with us.  She instead sent out 3 tiny desserts for everyone to share.  We were not interested in dessert, we wanted to address the fact that our food was cold and the kitchen needed to take responsibility.  Very bad customer recovery effort on their part.  We will not be back.

This is one of my favorite car washes in the area. I brought in a car that looked like it had been abandoned for years, and when They were done it looked practically brand new! This was my second visit and they did an amazing job and they are not crazy expensive. I will definitely be a repeat customer!
Love this place...you can get anything and everything. Salad bar is fresh, brisket sandwich is delicious, and finish it off with free ice cream. Great lunch spot.

I'm tough to please. I lived in NYC, San Fran and really appreciate good quality food. The Korean bbq was top notch- quality of the meat was very evident. The light seasoning really allowed us to appreciate the meat. The sushi was very good- a little over priced for the area but I don't mind paying for food that is worth it and it was. I would be going there more often if it was closer to our work and home near the main line area. I have recommended this place to many people I know.

This place has a cool atmosphere! I got a wrap with sweet potato fries. Both were pretty good! Everything tasted fresh and light, which I love. I didn't give 5 stars because I will say it is quite expensive for smaller portions. However, I do have to add that should be a normal portion for lunch. I wasn't stuffed but felt satisfied and content. Definitely a healthy, tasty choice!
Love the staffs happy energy, good music, the free smells, and the great subs. Best sandwiches near campus!

This is absolutely the best Mexican place in Tucson. The food is clean and prepared with thought and finesse. Whether you have the humongous nachos or the street tacos- you won't be disappointed. The restaurant sits adjacent to the famous tucson bakery La Estrella, as well as other delights in the courtyard. Stop by this delightful place- grab a taco- and let your imagination take you to a quaint little town in the center of Mexico!

Never use Delta in Boise, they don't hire enough bagging agents, their flights are delayed so often that you have to rebook the next day even if you are at the airport 3+ hrs in advance....to cheap to hire enough people, I also would never work for them, too much stress when understaffed

I had the fried green tomatoes as an appetizer. I'm from Georgia so when I saw this on the menu I immediately wanted them. They were ok. Nicely seasoned but they were buried in stuff and drizzled with some sort of balsamic. Good fried green tomatoes should be able to hold their own. For my entree I just got the fried shrimp po boy. The bread was amazing and the shrimp were nicely seasoned. My biggest downfall for this place was the service. It was PAINFULLY slow.

Anna of Michael + Anna Costa photographed our June 2017 wedding at Glen Annie Golf Club in Goleta, Santa Barbara. She is so talented, made us feel completely comfortable, knew exactly which parts of the wedding venue to photograph us and was an overall joy to work with. She (and her assistant) were incredible at organizing the large numbers of people for the family pictures as well as so patient with our flower girls. She also did our engagement session at the Santa Barbara Botanical Gardens. We are so happy with how all our pictures turned out. Definitely highly recommend!
Drove ~1000 miles to get a beautiful Arctic Fox.  Excellent Service and Parts department.  One misadventure that the Management team handled promptly.  Would definitely recommend this dealership.

Wanted to try this out and was not disappointed! We ordered a basic ham and cheese and a cheese steak. Both were delicious--the bread was well toasted and just the right thickness, and the flavors were great. Portions were generous; a half sandwich with chips was plenty for lunch. (Also, we got takeout, but there is a full bar and good beer selection for those who want to hang out.) Glad to have a solid sandwich shop so close!

We had Famous Dave's cater my son's wedding and it was FABULOUS!!!! Charles was absolutely perfect!! He came by the house a few days before the event to discuss our plan and show me his ideas. I was already impressed!!! He was top notch!! The food was delicious and Charles handled everything for me!! The guests were raving about the food and raving even more about the service Charles provided. Thankyou Charles and Famous Dave's!! You made everything extra extra spectacular!!!!

I love this place! Great sushi and Ming, the sushi maker is awesome too. Very conversational and willing to make things how the customer requests them without any hassle at all. The sushi is great and so is their Thai menu...the Panang Curry is amazing! The Pad Thai is great!!
Horrible customer service! Lack of Delivery drivers here. When they do have delivery drivers, the pizza arrives cold. Corporate needs to give this location some serious attention!!!!

I have been meaning to check this place out since it opened! What I liked was the chill live music, it is rare to find and made nice ambience. The food was average. I had the pulled chicken grilled cheese which had decent flavor. She had nachos which were pretty good too. Typical bar food, but nice place to hang out and catch up.

Wow what an amazing experience! Key code locks on the door & bedroom doors. Private bathrooms for males & females and friendly, available staff around 24/7, I felt safe. The staff goes above and beyond to make the guests to feel welcome in the Big Easy. They have nightly trips to local spots for fun, which is wonderful when you're by yourself in an unknown city. Who wants to party alone? The place was immaculately clean, highly organized and beautiful. Close to the trolly, the posh garden district,  restaurants and attractions. 

I stayed in the shared female dorms, the people I met were amazing. The only thing I'd say is bring earplugs because it's rather noisy at times between the parties on the patio, the pigeons in the a/c unit, the church next door, ha ha. If you've been in hostels before then you know the deal, I think the noise was worth it for the price & social vibe.

It was cheaper than a hotel room and way more fun!

Had the chicken breast dinner. With a side of collard greens. Chicken was cooked perfectly. Spices were good. But could've used a little more salt. Same for the collard greens. French fries overall were pretty good. Some soggy some crispy. A nice touch of old bay. 
I will be back
Really good food. I recommend this for people that wants to try thai food and you're away from home.

Only been in the area for a little under a year. Stopped into the market to see what all they had. Lots of vendors selling breakfast, crepes, slushys, popcorn. Lots of jewelry, clothing and fresh herbs to look through. They also had live music on the stage. Free to wander through. Also PET FRIENDLY!
Good service, good wings reasonably priced! Twice in 30 Days not disappointed! Tried cheeseburger and was equally satisfied.

I picked Luke solely because it was one of the few restaurants open on Christmas for dinner. It is a hotel restaurant with a generic NOLA menu, raw seafood to steak. The cuisine tilts toward French what with rabbit pate, crab en ravigote, etc. Some dishes are served en cocotte, small cast iron deep pans, and the portions are fairly large, perfect to split. After ordering the mixed seafood platter and waiting a while we received without explanation a slightly altered variation. When we inquired we were told the kitchen had run out of one of the items, so they had upped the oysters. Had to send it back, because one of us can't eat oysters and miffed that the plate was plopped on the table without any explanation. One of the two servers who took care of our table was an absolutely clueless airhead. Luckily, we had the better one wait on us the rest of the meal.
As a second alternative,  we had the boiled gulf shrimp, not deveined and unpeeled. Somewhat messy to eat and the veins soiled the whole experience by making the texture somewhat gritty. The server brought us soaking wet napkins to wipe our hands. LOL. 
We split the grilled drum and ended with a simple salad, both fairly good. 
The kitchen is not where the restaurant is and I think the temperature of the dishes suffer for the distance, the room temp.  fish and accompanying veggies, as well as the butter emulsion, almost solidified. 
The space is large with a handsome main dining room, a pressed tin ceiling and a dark wood bar, newspapers hanging on dowels. I'd avoid the rear room/the Siberia.

Came here with a member to play at 3pm on Saturday. Got cursed out by a man painting the roof for trying to use the restroom. Not sure what is up with this place. It says members can come here at any time? Super unfriendly. But there are lots of courts to play on.

Disappointed as my daughter raved about it so we went for dinner.  I have had better salads in a diner -- don't offer a salad is this is what you will serve.  My lasagna was the worst I have had in any restaurant, including national chains.  I would have sent it back but we were with a group and I didn't want to make an issue of it.  Two out of six meals were  good -- not a good percentage.  Won't be returning.  Was not worth of price.

This was our second visit to Party Fowl and yes, I am a fan.  We stopped by about 9:30 on a Friday night and were seated right away.  The restaurant was still hopping with people, which is always a good sign.

There were four of us and we all tried something different.  Our table got the Hot Chicken and Cheddar sandwich, the Hot Chicken B&B, and the Hot Chicken entrée.  I got the Beer Butt Chicken--even though I could not eat a quarter of it, I got the whole chicken because that was the best presentation.

All of our food was outstanding.  My Beer Butt Chicken was so delicious--smoked chicken but still moist.  I got a side of collard greens and they were amazing as well.  

For those at the table who got the anything that said "hot chicken" on the menu, our waitress warned us that if you like "Hot" chicken wings, you should order mild.  We went with medium.  It was definitely hot.  One person at the table said that while the medium was good, he would go mild next time so he could really enjoy the chicken.

The beignets that were served with the Hot Chicken B&B were really good too.  The sweetness of the beignets mixed with the salty, spicy chicken were really good.

Party Fowl also has a good craft beer selection.

I will definitely be back!

Breakfast review only:
I will not return.  Too many places to spend $35...I did not like that you could not deviate from the menu without an upcharge.  We had the Stanleys breakfast, and it was like they scooped it off a buffet line and served it - warm, but seemed like it had been sitting around a while, even thoughbthe place was busy.  Just seemed premade.  I would recommend the Community coffee.
Very friendly staff, willing to mail you your results at home, no long waits.

I'm going to start by saying I'm kind of a poke bowl snob. I'm originally from Hawaii, so I have a biased opinion when it comes to all things poke, but this place is not bad.

I have tried two different bowls, one with rice and other with Spring mix. The first bowl I got was with spring mix topped with hamachi, tuna, salmon and scallops. I got it with the garlic soy. It wasn't bad. I just wish I had opted out of the scallops. I didn't like them at all. The second bowl I got was with sushi rice and spicy tuna. This bowl was pretty good with the spicy aioli and unagi sauce. The one thing I really like about this place is how generous they are on their serving size. A regular bowl is more than enough to get your fish craving satisfied!

The two girls at the counter were very friendly and very fast at getting my poke bowl made. I so far really like this place and will definitely be back when my poke craving hits once again!

Just started the gym here so far not to bad. Customer service is very helpful and nice. Equipment isnt to bad they offer classes tanning and hydromassage for members. I would recommend if you live in the neighborhood and are looking for a gym to work out in. I will update you in a month or so after being here a little while

Food was absolutely terrible. 2 adults and 4 kids and no one was happy. Fried shrimp was soggy, my son said he had a soggy hamburger, kids ribs were not edible. 

How can you run a 'shrimp company' and serve soggy shrimp?  Everyone who tried the shrimp felt ill that night. 

Although a bit scary, the server was very nice, which is the only reason for one star.

The food here was great! My mother and I split the 2 meat and added a drink and 2 sides. It was plenty for the both of us. The cheese potatoes were amazing and the pulled chicken and pork were great too!

This has become my celebration place. This week, my boyfriend and I went to celebrate my new job. As always, the experience was a delight. Excellent service from the gentleman who status to the busboy to the girl with the dessert tray. It's the only place in town that makes a proper Kir Royale, not to mention the most perfect crème brûlée I've had.

I started with the escargot, which were flavorful and melted in my mouth. I then, upon the server suggestion had to duck entrée. While I would've loved more Kirsch soaked cherries, the flavor was amazing and the duck was cooked perfectly. The potatoes and vegetables that accompanied it were lovely as well. My boyfriend had a chicken dish that he was literally sighing over. 

I highly recommend everything and everyone there. The bistro space is a little more casual- I prefer the back dining room with layered tablecloths and stemmed water glasses personally.

First time customer and will hopefully be back next time in town! Amazing breakfast bowl with rice quinoa, steak, jalapeños, egg, avocado, sweet potatoes, added some goat cheese and sweet chili sauce too. Wow!

My family and I waited almost 30 minutes before we were even asked if we wanted something to drink. There it was a elderly couple sitting a few tables down from us that came in sat down and within 5 minutes they were asked what they wanted to drink. I'm not sure why but I felt really embarrassed so my family and I got up and left the restaurant I have eaten here once before that was several months ago and the service was okay food was really good.
This place is incredible. Impressive wine selection, great ambiance, and impeccable service. The meatball is a must. Will make it a point to go back every time I'm in Philly.

I drove 45 minutes from PA because a friend from Portland gave me a $100 gift certificate to Kabuki Japanese RESTAURANT. The food was very good but took long to come out. The owner refused to accept it saying it's from the Philly location which was false. It should work anywhere with this name. There are hundreds of hibachi restaurants near me, I wouldn't drive this far to do business with this shady owner. I thought about giving two or three stars but honestly I didn't like the attitude I got from him. As Gordon Ramsay would say "A restaurant making excuses is a failing restaurant"

This place is definitely something else. My company and I were here for a trade show so we tried to hit up as many delicious restaurants and I'm glad we came here. 

LOCATION: Parking can be tricky but we got really lucky by getting a sweet spot on the street right by the entrance. It's located on a main street where you can see tour buses and carriages driving by - it's really cute. Ample outside seating and the inside area is enormous! 

FOOD: Where do I start? You need to try their special drinks. They made their spirits in-house so you gotta try it! We shared a salad, eggs rolls, and the baked mac-n-cheese. Salad didn't blow me away, eggs rolls were okay, but the mac-n-cheese was out of this world. YUM. My entree was the Lemongrass Shrimp. My coworker ordered the garlic shrimp and I think those were better!! 

SERVICE: Oh yeah, make sure to make reservations because it gets crazy busy here at all times. 

Will I come back? Yeah and next time I'll just order drinks!

Fine dining experience here is amazing.  From reservation, seating arrangements, ambience is wonderful, Menu selections, exceptional service and amazing flavorful entrees........this is  worth our time & effort for the amount of money spent.  We are coming back for sure.

Today we tried the Seared Salmon, Rack of Lamb, Lobster with asparagus special, and Ribeye steak with onion rings, lobster bisque, and the tart pear with caramelized nut ice cream.  Every bite is very yummy.  Must try the Martinis.  We tried their Martini with Vodka and Lemon drop Martinis.  It went really well with our entrees.  Can't wait to try the pomegranate flavor next time.

Definitely a complete satisfaction and I highly recommend it. See my pictures.

The best thing about this place is their wall,water ambiance and nice staff. I have to be honest that I was a little disappointment with the flavor profile of those meals. I will compare it to whole-foods buffets = good ingredients,eatable but not a wow effect.I also believe its overpriced for what it is.

Delight  pizza with inspired topping combinations. The "guru special" - is an Indian spice inspired chicken pizza and a must to try. I also love their ranch dressing. It has always been easy to get a table and there is never too long of a wait for the food.

I'd neve heard of this place, just stumbled upon it.  
It is counter service. Menu is easy to understand and service was quick and friendly 

I got a crispy tofu teriyaki omelet at $10, was overpriced for just tofu and a very few other ingredients- still filled me up though..Very tasty, maybe add a few more veggies and offer hot sauce or spicy option 
 
You eat it with a glove too so that was pretty funny

The food is good and drinks are great. But the bartenders don't know their own happy hour specials. I called and the guy who answered said their happy hour was 5-9 drinks and apps but then when we arrived, the bartender said it was only a few apps from 5-7 and drinks don't start until 8. Then as were sitting, our food was taken to a party on the patio. The person next to us was told a completely different thing than we were told about happy hour. We told her what the one bartender told us, and that the other bartender must not know. He ended up coming back saying he had no idea that Tuesday's were different. They also don't know about their loyalty program.

DO NOT BUY FROM THESE CRIMINALS. I bought a bmw 135i that had a clean carfax only to discover later that it had been in an accident and the damage was not reported. The entire left rear was severely damaged and the bumper was screwed back on to hide the damage so I couldn't see any issue when I bought it. Alic Motors is a fraud and the guys there are crooks. Stay away.

First off what a beautiful place! 
First time we were there. Finally took a chance on Churchville inn for lunch. Loved my sweet and tangy breaded chicken wrap!  Very tasty and filling. My hub and inlaws had a pulled brisket sandwich, all 3 said the sandwich was pretty good, however it lacked sauce. The cauliflower soup was tasty. 

We will all be definitely be back
Got the sausage and egg biscuit and tater tots delivered (by Uber eats) for breakfast.  Absolutely amazing.  This place is super affordable and you get more than what you pay for!
Worst pho I've ever had. Broth tasted like water, tiny portion size. Avoid this place at all costs.
Another great cafe. Atmosphere was fantastic food was very simple but great. Amazing staff and all around great cafe.
Stopped by while in the area and pick up General Tso's chicken. My first bite was nothing but breading along with the rest of the chicken, very disappointed needless to say.  I won't be returning!

A gem, discovered on our last day as we were looking for a pho breakfast. Fabulous creative dishes, delicious pho, salad, cocktails (firefly) and coffee. If this wasn't our last day we'd surely be back. Waitstaff very helpful.

Used these folks on a few occasions. The first time was good and the driver was excellent, but I won't use them again. On subsequent trips there was a combination of drivers taking me to the wrong address or didn't know the way (really, in the 21st century), late pickup at the airport after I had been traveling for almost 24 hours, and car (and driver) stinking of cigarette smoke. It's hard for me to understand how a business like this survives, hitchhiking might be a better experience.

If this place was supposed to be a destination brewery or was advertised as having an amazing menu (or was located further away from a vacant lot where they store broken pallets), this might be 3 or 4 stars. But it's getting 5 from me for being a complete surprise and delight. Go in with no pre-conceptions, enjoy a solid meal and delicious beer. Their Wit is by far the best American brewed Wit I've ever had. (They need to bring the Steam Beer back though)

This is the best Jimmy John's in town! These cats made the best  sandwich I've had all month and had it ready before I paid the bill. A group of five walked in and one of the staff, who was on his lunch break, sprung into action, leaving his food, to assist two others on the sandwich line until all the sandwiches were complete. Freakin awesome!
Very expensive for a very small amount of food. The food was so basic I could have made it myself. The pancakes were dry and tasted undercooked. Service was nice but it was a waste of money.

This is it. You want a local breakfast place without the foofy stuff.  Eggs Jonathan, creole pancakes, Calas , all excellent choices. Service is family like, like your mom familiar but not too sweet, so don't be rocking your chair back. Shirley will jerk a knot in your tail. Great experience. Great food.
