Their coffee was outstanding, we are dark roast, no flavors, purest coffee drinkers! I like my dark roast to put a little extra hair on my chest and this coffee did so without any bitter aftertaste. Service was excellent and they're sitting area was perfect in the morning. While it gets busy, many people order and leave so I didn't feel rushed to drink my coffee and bolt!

I've been here twice & this place deserves the 5 stars I'm giving :) 

This first time was back in Sept when I needed to get my toddler a physical to start daycare. I used their self pay option instead of insurance . They had us in and out within an hour. I had setup an appt and was seen right on time.

The 2nd time was yesterday when my child suddenly became sick so I didnt have time to make an appt. This time i was out within 45min . Heather (the nurse practitioner) was so good with my child and made her feel very comfortable :) I used self pay again and the ladies at the front desk were nice enough to go over what my final cost would probably be.

If you're worried about expired food in bags or packages, this is not the place for you. K&S offers a variety of international food and products, but the quality of these items may not be as fresh as you would like them to be. The seafood section is my favorite, mainly since they usually have live fish and crab for reasonable prices. As someone who lives in an area with little diversity, this market is probably one of the better markets where you'll get when looking for items not typically sold in grocery stores. You could go somewhere for a certain genre of food selections, but when you just need a place of variety then I would check out this place. Best days would be early Monday and Tuesday when they have products fully stocked.

First off, the jackass that sat us was incredibly rude and thank god he wasn't our server. I loved our server and our food was good but for the first experince I'm disappointed that the frat star that sat us was our first interaction. He was very annoyed that we weren't following him RIGHT behind him and threw the silverware onto the table and walked away without saying anything.

I was very excited to try this place after reading a review in the Riverfront Times, but when I went there it was closed! I tried at 11:30 on a Friday. The door said 11-10 on Fridays, but it didn't look like they were going to open for lunch at all.

Pest Bear is the absolute worst company I've ever dealt with. We had problems with our lawn browning  - it took them a few months to come around - by that time the lawn was ruined - they said they'd come and put plugs in the lawn - after calling several times - they show up with only two trays - they broke my sprinkler trying to put the plugs - they taped up the sprinkler and after they
left - it broke again - when an employee came by the next day to fix it -he discovered bugs in my lawn. I was promised my lawn would get fixed but after calling to get them back - they dropped me as a client. I wrote a letter to BB bureau and explained what they did to me - Pest Bear lied to them and said they fixed the problem and just accused me as being an unsatisfied customer. They lied - deceived - all around terrible company and should be put out of business!
Peanut butter cup donut was excellent! The slider was also amazing, the sauce was had good flavor without being spicy.

About this restaurant was my first time, and for me mean something new to try and Peru  meal are full of flavor, is tasty and very good, so if I have the chance again to go there I will be happy to do it.

This was my second time here and I really enjoy this restaurant. The biscuits and gravy and crepe was super flavorful and delicious. Our server was Matthew and he did a great job and was always attentive. Great little cafe!
I want to move to Conshohocken just to eat this pizza every day for the rest of my life. It is THAT good. And a custom pizza for $8.49? Micro brewed soda? Yes please
This is an awesome new addition to the Havertown food scene. We've been in for breakfast and lunch and will be back again and again!

I had no idea that this place existed until I purchased a groupon. The restaurant isn't anything fancy, but fairly clean. We were greated by a very friendly lady who's service was very attentive. We were the only people in the restaurant when we got there, but soon after, more people showed up, and it seemed to be very popular with the 'skip the dishes' as there were numerous orders being delivered when we were there. There are a few pics up on the walls to give you an idea of what the orders look like. We ordered two different plates of noodles, one with seafood, the other with chicken, and some dumplings. Plate portions are huge, so sharing is suggested. From the time we ordered until the time we got our food was pretty fast. The flavors didn't disappoint at all. The taste of their hand pulled noodles was very fresh, and wasan't bathed in layers of goopy sauces, very simple flavors and spices. The dumplings we had were really good too. Next time I think I will ask to have them pan fried instead of boiled as I missed the crunchiness that I'm used to having, nonetheless, the dumplings were very flavorful  and filling. The order we got had  10 dumplings, so needless to say some came home with us.
All in all, we were very impressed with food. We've been to other noodle houses and this one campares to the higher end places that we've visited minus the fancy decor. Parking in this area can be a challenge as it's right in the heart of chinatown.Next time I would like to try one of their soups to see how those play out. Also, I think they need to take pics of their food so that patrons know what they're buying and the menu needs to be revamped to give better descriptions of what each order is.
I love their sushi. Every time I go in, the line is long. That's a great sign if you ask me! They always greet you when you walk in and are quick to help. I would highly recommend this place!

Me and my sister came for the Pay What You Wish admission day (first Sunday of every month), but the cool thing about this little museum is the option to always pay what you wish, although there are suggested prices listed at the register. We had plenty of fun having a photo shoot inside and outside of the museum, imitating the statues. The statues themselves are really spectacular works of art, but there unfortunately aren't enough pieces to occupy yourself for more than 15 minutes, unless you take advantage of the sketchpads located in at least two locations in this museum. I can't really see myself coming back soon, but I had fun.

This place is awesome great ladies that works there it's like family oriented and friendly ladies. They deserved a good yelp review it's like a hidden miss old building house but it's a lot of history that grew there. I know all the regulars can say so much more. I just moved here looking for a good salon place I highly recommended Mrs bobby. She did my hair I showed her a picture and she did so much better than the picture. She's been working there for 36 years.She so sweet and nice everyone there is nice and sweet. You feel like home but Just make sure to call for appointment since they get booked believe or not. Great people, staff and great environment kid friendly.They also have so much amazing books that you get to pick and bring it home... check them out.

The portions here are HUGE. Trust me you have to make her you order the right things. 

Me and my date ordered just a bit too much and we struggled through it so much. They over stuff their rolls and it's huge. Pretty worth it and the appetizer are so good. 

Around $50 for two. Kind of expensive but the fish was extremely fresh.

Alma de Cuba is a beautiful establishment that gives off an unique casablanca vibe with its high ceilings, soft music, and well-dressed servers. If you take out its ambiance and eccentric charms, however, you are left with slightly overpriced, but good, fancy cuban dining. We came to this joint after an exhaustive day at work and were immediately surprised by the sheer height of the restaurant (three flights of stairs). We shared a flight of cerviche, including the mojito shrimp, yellow tail tiradito and the agua chile cobia, followed by smoked marlin tacos, oxtail croquetas, and we shared the lechon asado. My favorite was actually the oxtail croquetas, served over a giant slab of semi-sectioned leg bone with scrappable marrow at your disposal. I tried the classico mojito...it was good, but nothing to extraordinary. The cerviche came in three small bowls, maybe 1-2 bites total and cost about $30 and the two appetizers were about $16 per piece. While the oxtail was worth it, the over-fried fish tacos were definitely skippable. Finally for the lechon...what can I say, it's hard to find lechon, but as Ala de Cuba proved, it's also hard to make it. The lechon was served over a bed of bacon congri rice, but the meat was so salty, and the skin so dry that it felt like chewing on a tree bark.

At the end of the day, Alma De Cuba is a place that you'd bring your date to impress him/her, but not a place you'd bring your foodie husband/wife. 

Food: 3 stars
Service: 4 stars
Price: 3 stars
Ambiance: 4 stars

The drinks were good however we ordered several things. The chicken tinga tacos were ok, they had some flavor. The Mac and cheese lacked flavor as well as the farmers iron skillet. Presentation was great but overall the food lacked flavor. Servers were nice but forgetful

I've said it before and ill say it again. Hands down the best service in town. If you want good quality service call Clean Fleet. Thank You for going above and beyond to take care of our family. 
Happy Holidays, The Stevens
Really overrated. The drinks were watery and the food was ordinary. I would never go back.

Forget the haters this place rules. By far the best food we have had on our visit. I had a Pimm's Cup and it was delicious. For my meal I had their Louisiana Crab, Wild Mushroom gnocchi and I loved it! My husband had the brisket and said it was one of the best meals he has ever had!

My daughter and I have been in town for two days and decided to try this. Their BBQ is to die for, definitely hit the nail on the head! Best sweet tea around, the cheese biscuits are perfect, mac and cheese is amazing, southern potato salad is out of this world, and the banana pudding OMG!! Our waitress, Brooklyn, was the sweetest thing! Plan on asking for her from now on!

Wow!  The fried green tomatoes with shrimp remoulade made me want to move here!!!  Great fresh local beer on tap. Friendly service and easy listening to jazz music. Neither too loud or quiet. Great ambiance and Mercian was fabulous and very knowledgeable

Small old house successfully converted to a good speciality restaurant on the fringe of downtown. Easy to find from east or west.  We came for an early lunch. Not disappointed!  Two appetizers - liked the zucchini pancakes best.  The flat kebab lamb/beef and the sultans delight.  I really liked the eggplant served with the lamb.  Friendly servers kept the hot tea full. We will be back several more entrees on our list to try.  Watch your step, the bathroom floor has a tilt.

For the love of Gawd order a Bloody Mary with anything you order for breakfast. Best shrimp and cheese grits ever. These are simple in format and delivery. But all the flavor. Hasbrowns will fill any void created from the night before on Bourbon Street. Ask about the Breeders Cup connection.

Great food. Service is ok.
Started off on the wrong note with this place. It's quite frustrating to be excited about a new place in your neighborhood, but they appear to not really want your business. 

I tried twice to get there in time after work before they pre-emptively closed, but finally got there twice. The food is really good. Probably tied for my favorite Crab Rangoons in town, and I love an appetizer spring roll.

Their lunch special is a great deal!  Stir Fry for $5.45, extra $ for fried rice, and Pho lunch for $6.45.  With both, you can add on an additional appetizer/side for about $1, so even with some add-ons or a beverage, you can stay well under $10!  Also, I'm glad they don't default include a soft drink in the lunch deal.  There are so many beverages I could want, why force soda or iced tea on me.  This works particularly well at Super Bowl as they have a wide variety of unique beverages.  I love the hot jasmine tea, but they have Boba tea, milk tea, Thai Coffee and tea, and others! 

The menu has much more variety than I expected, so don't shy away if someone in your group isn't a pho fan, they can order sweet and sour or a bahn mi or other options!

Hours/service not the gleaming example but I got what I ordered in a timely fashion and the food was very good and inexpensive. period. I will come back.

Marvin, that's your guy. Best waiter in the restaurant. He gave our party the most outstanding and detailed description of the entire dinner menu with just a few minutes. He was very punctual with our drinks and gave great suggestions on the orders.

I understand that this is supposed to be some Asian-Southern fusion, but this isn't even close to what Chinese food is like. Putting wasabi on mashed potatoes does not make it Asian. The wontons were literally just ravioli. Those crisps on the salad are from Thai cuisine, not Chinese. Why do you have to put mint in everything?? Also, this "Christmas special" thing a total ripoff. $40-50 for a meal? You can order real Chinese food for a quarter of that price. I feel personally insulted that you would call yourself a Chinese restaurant. The only reason I'm rating this two stars instead of one is that the wonton cheesecake was pretty good.

SPECTACULAR quality!! Just incredible baked goods, perfectly done eggs and a quiche that leaves me speechless!! A little bit of France in Santa Barbra :) a cute little patio, exceptional service and again ... the food was just PERFECTLY executed!!!

I ordered a margharita pizza with anchovies on the side. And other things. Delivered with no anchovies. I called to ask where the anchovies were and the hispanic guy on the phone says they didnt have them today. If he told me that when i ordered the pizza, i wouldve ordered something else. If i drove, i wouldve returned the pizza.

We ordered a vegan taco salad and asked to sub guacamole, in place of meat, cheese, and sour cream. Not only did they charge us an extra $7.00... $17.00 total for nothings more than chips, beans, lettuce, and a bit of guacamole! When we picked it up to remind them that it was substituted, they stated they don't substitute anything. Fine, is what it is. We then noticed before leaving the parking lot that it had cheese on it and when we went back to ask for a refund, they tried to make us another, but after everything, we insisted on a refund. Second time I've been disappointed at this place. Not worth the hassle, there are other places that care about being fair to their customers.
The food is good. However we tried the chili yesterday and it was super spicy! So be prepared for that. Friendly service and I'd recommend the chicken. Overall great place!

This place is awesome. It is so nice to find a bar like this...pristine clean, great drinks, and wonderful customer service. We spent a couple of afternoon hours here and I can't wait to go back! It feels like a bar for adults..an oasis from whalebone daquiris and big ass beers.

My favorite client meeting place in Eagle whether it's breakfast, lunch, afternoon coffee, or dinner. Food is superb (try the Kobe bacon cheeseburger with added egg) and service is top notch (shout out to Che who always take good care of us).

Called them out on a water heater flush and tune-up deal through Groupon, and was advised I needed to replace some rod that keeps the minerals from corroding the inside of the water heater.  Decided against it for now due to finances, but asked if he could clear a slow bathroom sink drain.  Took only a few minutes, got all the gunk out, and neither he nor the company would accept additional payment for what they considered a simple, nontechnical service!  Who does this nowadays?  Needless to say, that earned my appreciation and they are now my plumbing service going forward. Thanks, Nate, and thanks Ben Franklin Plumbing!

I loved this park so much, I came back the next day!  I was in town on business at the end of November 2017 and wanted to stretch my legs at the end of the workday.  This park was close to my hotel, and it only cost $2 to get in, so I thought I'd give it a shot.  The park was BEAUTIFUL! I got to the park at about 5:00pm, and the boardwalk closed at 5:30, so I wasn't able to explore the whole thing.  I came back the next day and had my lunch on the boardwalk while watching and listening to the wildlife. This place was a feast for my soul and senses.

Sunday morning the place was really crowded. We made "a reservation" thru Yelp. Got there late and lost the table but they quickly put us back again and only took like 5 min to get a table. The food took a while to arrive but as I mentioned already the place was packed. 

Our server was really nice, and helped us with our requests. That was really nice of her. Ordered the "guiltless omelet" and "garden omelet" both were really good! Nothing to "die for" but definitely a solid option. 

Ps: the menu is huge! Plenty of options.
Great for vegetarians! There are plenty of options for all meals. Highly recommend the buffalo cauliflower. Also has great cocktails and kombucha on tap.
If you are an IPA fan, don't miss this. Try them all. Scatterbrain or Homestyle and take some cans to go.

Food was not anything to write home about.  Server was very personable but must have been new ...he lacked in knowledge of the menu.  If you are looking for a true smoked BBQ joint this is not your place.  Food was not piping hot and left me feeling a bit disappointed .

Beast is the most popular BBQ joint on this side of the river. The BBQ options are great, especially pulled pork which is my favorite. The sides are also awesome and include options like brussel sprouts and mac and cheese!

This review is coming from a parent of a Temple student. This is a solid bar with solid bar food.  The menu is sparse  but what they do, they do well. Wings are breaded and remind me of the wings from the old Welshies in Sea Isle City. Their chicken sandwiches are massive. I read a few reviews of the bartenders and I agree they are very good and hard working.  I would not recommend for kids or snobs.
I really like the spicy tofu bowl. It's pretty solid. I have not tried anything else on the menu. It is very helpful that there is a really amazing beer store on the same street.

I ordered a cake 48 hours in advance for pickup today. Requirement is only 24 hours. Got an email very late last night saying that my order was not confirmed. They do not give you 24 hours notice so that you can find alternative arrangements. This is an about joke!  I needed that cake today for a birthday party and now I have no cake!  Will never do business with them again!!

If I could give no stars I would. This is a horrible place to buy vinyl from. They couldn't ship an order in two to four days if they had to. Do yourself a favor and buy from anyone else. This place sucks.

My 1st experience at a Cheese Cake Factory - ordered pasta with shrimp & sausage- $18.95 - there was literally 1 shrimp in the entire bowl - but not to worry I got 3 1/2 pieces of sausage all of which easily filled the spoon with one bite ! When brought to the attention of the server " quote " I'll try and get  you some more shrimp ! The manager came over 20 minutes later " quote I heard you were complaining about the shrimp " my response was when was the last time you paid $20 for a bowl of pasta with one shrimp. I think you may want to discuss the quality control in your kitchen his answer was yeah I'll probably mention that to them. Overall service by the waitress was excellent

Such a hidden gem! If you aren't looking for the place you will probably just walk by. My favorite lunch spot for soups and sandwiches. Always friendly and fast service. My favorite is a paperback grilled cheese with the tomato soup. The chicken queso soup is delicious too.

One of my fave pho restaurants in the city.  The quality of the service and the time it takes to get served can vary, but I've had more good experiences than bad.  I wouldn't consider this "cheap" pho, and I feel that the larger serving size is not exactly more noodles, but just more broth.  If the pho wasn't so good, I would have given them 3 stars for the inconsistent service and the pricing, but the broth is just THAT good.  

Free wifi available.

Lots of parking in the area, but because they share the same little corner as the bank and the pet store, it can get a little busy.

Ate here 7/16/17 for lunch, I came here from Ojai because I was craving the Brussel Sprouts and the Lobster Bisque. I was sat down right away and my food came very fast. I ordered the Lobster Bisque cup with a puff pastry (DELICIOUS) Brussel Sprouts (My favorite out of any restaurant around) & I tried the Popcorn Shrimp which were tasty as well. I ordered the Spicy Guava-rita which was sweet & spicy. I sat a while without any drinks but that won't stop me from visiting my favorite fish house. I will definitely be back..

**UPDATE**
Management here is hands down, the best. Due to an Insurance Claim for evacuating my home in relation to the Thomas Fire. I needed an itemized receipt. Diego, the manager did all he could possibly do in effort to find my receipt/transaction. It was a pleasure working with someone who follows through and puts in that much effort to follow up and complete my request. A+ Fish Enterprise & Wonderful Ahi Tartar!

I got the VIP manicure and it was amazing! The owners are nice, funny, and great at what they do! I've been struggling to find a regular nail salon since moving to the area and I'm happy to say this will be my go to place for a mani/pedi from now on.

Amazing place, full of knowledge and an excellent selection of musical instruments.

I have been here a number of times to play a particular Washburn guitar I had my eye on.

Beautiful guitar, and the guys who run the store are very friendly and bought me a lead to plug it into an amp.

I know I will not go any where else for my equipment needs, as businesses like this are some of my personal favorite.

10/10

I never review chains but I HAVE to leave a review and I haven't even gotten my food yet. The man taking orders in the drive thru, Loc, I believe is amazing. I don't know how many have read The Fred Factor, but he's definitely a Fred. He took my order with so much enthusiasm and he even noticed that I'd just come from an interview and gave me much needed words of encouragement. I honestly wanted to sit and chat for a while but the line as usual was huge and can't take away from others' time. I was floored by his attention to detail. Having worked good service it's so easy to go zombie mode and not pay attention to people. So 5 stars to him!

The organization is also fantastic. I dont know how chick fil a pulls it off and it looks so effortless!
Tuna bar was fantastic! We went with friends and were impressed with every dish! The ambiance was really nice. Finally, a great sushi place in old city!

High quality Mexican dining on the main island strip. The place was basically empty around lunch time (2pm) on a weekday.

The prices were very reasonable but the portions were definitely on the small side but worked out for a lunch.

The chips and salsa were tasty. The salsa was very unique with a thicker base than most. The Mahi Mahi tacos were great but I laughed when the menu said "large tortillas" and they were probably the smallest I've ever seen.

My colleagues enjoyed the enchiladas and burrito as well. The pitcher of margaritas was big enough for about 5-6 glasses.

Best chicken, bad service!
- Overview: I came around 8-9pm on Friday to skip the dinner peak time. The wait was around 15 minutes. Parking is very limited. You can order takeout to avoid waiting.
- The food: best hot fried chicken I've ever had. Not sure if it's the combination of hunger, the cold, and the excitement, but it was delicious. They were lots of tourists there when I came. They all talked among each other to see what to get. We got the hot chicken and a side of clucking hot sauce ($0.50). Even though my stomach did not greatly love me the next day, it was still so so good.
- Service: We chatted with some guys in front of us in line who was visiting from Canada. The cashier gave him the wrong change. Luckily, he found out soon enough and the cashier was like, oh ok oopsie. Then we waited for our food and they forgot our side sauce and beer (he said he had accidentally given our beer to someone else instead). Ok I'm not expecting a full restaurant service experience, but these guys don't seem to care at all.
Would I be back? Yes, definitely. Love the chicken. I'd probably do takeout next time!

I have to say for a chain this place is pretty good.

The staff is super friendly and on top of things. The food comes out nice and hot. I would avoid the $1 drinks as they are certainly  not worth it unless you need a lot of sugar in your life. 

The wonton tacos are super good and the drink specials keep us coming back.

Wish I could give a zero 

ordered take out took an hour and a half 

Manager stated that they were short staffed 

Why wouldn't you mention that when I called in my order
good for beer, nice tap selection on niche crafts... was not too thrilled bout my hot wings, barely some meat on some of the drums ... overall good pricing for a local bar and eats ...

My boyfriend in came to this place back in February for our first date and and LOVED it. So much so, that we invited another couple to come join us  here this past Saturday. So we went upstairs for dinner and were seated immediately, however after placing our orders the couple we came with received their food after about 40 minutes. When the waitress came by about 20 minutes after that we flagged her down to ask about our food. She said ours was taking longer because we requested separate checks at the beginning of our meal. Like her excuse made no sense. Another 10 minutes go by and only 1/2 of what we ordered comes out. At this point our waitress is gone and can't be bothered to come check on us. As another item trickles in 20 minutes later I ask for a manager. He comes by, apologizes and is nice enough to offer us drinks on the House. Our last item
Never showed up by this point and he says, I took it off your bill, if they come out enjoy them on me. The waitress comes back at the end, and says "I heard about what happened, but we can't go backwards so can I get you anything else" we all request our checks. She only "heard " about what happened because she went missing and abandoned us after you took our order. My boyfriend pays in cash, and requests his change back, which is exactly $1. The nasty miserable excuse for a waitress brings him his change in all Nickels because she's pissed he requested his change back. I showed the manager and he made her some apologize, then offered To comp us a free hour of bowling for the trouble. It was a really bad experience to say the least. It sucks that "our first date spot" is now an empty low class place with Terrible Service. Do yourself a favor and skip this place!!

My son and I went to Ping Pong last night for dinner. The meal was very good, but the star of the night were the Dan Dan noodles. The best I've had - ever! A must try!!  In addition, the staff - from to host to wait staff - were very nice and attentive. We'll be going back again.
Beautiful food and a beautiful story. This restaurant is one of a kind and cooks with love. You will clear your plate!

I like this place, they're really generous with their portions of fruits. The acai itself kinda has a different texture than other places, but now that I'm used to it I prefer it over the creamy texture elsewhere. 

Get the rainbow bowl. It's the absolute best.

I just took another star off my review because this is absolutely ridiculous. Ordered a small calzone with topping that was almost $9. It is the smallest damn thing I ever gotten in my life from a pizza place. A complete joke. Part of the order someone also got mozzarella cheese fries. They are mcdonalds shoe string fries and only half the container was full. This place just lost my business.

Bad experience - so disappointed after all the good reviews I had read.

First the bad service -A few minutes after being served dessert the maître d' asked us to move to a new table to he could sit someone else. We hadn't even been at our table for that long. It ruined the whole evening. 

This was on top of the wait staff going in and out of a back room with a very squeaky/noisy door opening and closing all night. Also they kept turning on and off the lights in the back room which shined into the main room. The menus were also stained with food. Very disappointing.

Next the ok/bad food - they told me they refused to cook the shaking beef anything above well - I told her I was fine with it being more on the well done side to my liking but she wouldn't budge or even check with the kitchen - not very accommodating at all.

Finally the bad cocktails - I ordered a bottle of sake. They serve it in a little box to drink out of. The waitress then went on an unsolicited 5 minute lecture when she poured me a glass into the box how Western sensibilities aren't sophisticated enough to drink out of overflowing sake boxes - totally bizarre.

We went early and the place which is pretty small to being with wasn't that crowded. The chef kept coming out into the dinning room and watched everyone eat. I think it's nice when the chef comes out but this was like every 5 minutes. 

Overall an odd disappointment - in my opinion go somewhere else - you'll enjoy it more.

This place is FILTHY. Surprised the health department doesn't shut it down. It normally takes a half hour to blow out my hair. This girl took an hour and my hair was greasy and gross. I almost walked out when I saw how filthy it was which I should have done.

We are here for the first time today. It's in a brand new plaza and is gorgeous inside. I ended up getting one of the house special sushi rolls. I believe it was called the 7 delights. It was a fantastic presentation, and an excellent meal. I also got chicken wonton soup and it was some of the best wonton soup I have had. They have a very large menu and I will be spending much time working my way around it.

The best chicken place in town. The restaurant is clean, the employees are always friendly and helpful, the order is always correct, and the chicken is down right tasty. Thanks for finally coming to Nevada. A customer for life
Great selection, professional design and customer service! Love supporting local businesses!!
Delicious!!! We had wings and burgers... everything was cooked perfectly and such a fun and cute atmosphere. Loved it!!!

Food and drinks are all amazing. Top notch staff. The tours are the best part, given by the owners themselves. They also have a great reputation for throwing private events. 

Should definitely check it out as a destination in Philadelphia.

In their defense, I would hate working at a fast food restaurant in New Orleans too. Painfully clear that all the employees hate it here. Only reason it's two stars is that it's close to my house so I still go here a lot and get what I order, and there's an older woman who works the drive-thru overnight who must win Employee of the Month every month because she is fast, efficient, and extremely polite! She's the best!

There are a lot of great ice cream shops around the country, but to find one in Delaware that I would rank as superior is quite rare. Woodside Farm Creamery does in fact fit that description. It's as good of an ice cream you'll find anywhere. They have lots of creative flavors like motor oil and dirt, and they have a peppermint spin to the classic mint chocolate chip. We were there at about 7:30 on a Wednesday night and there were two long lines filled with patrons. WFC's reputation in the region continues to grow, so be prepared to wait. 

I would offer a couple of suggestions, though. First, stop charging by the ounce. It really slows down the servers. They have to weigh everything, so it makes it harder for them when there's a large order of four or more ice cream cones to handle. They do have a food truck that they use for local events where they charge by the scoop. That would speed up things. 

Also, they are cash (or local check) only establishment. Credit cards in this day and age is much faster. 

You can see farm animals during your visit, too.

Nice hotel, good sized rooms and not too far from Bourbon street. My main complaint is what a joke the pool was. We walked all the way up there to find a hot tub size "pool". Especially when across the way we could see at the Roosevelt hotel their ridiculously epic looking pool. I was so jealous.

If I could give negative stars, I would. My friends were in from Ireland and we got a cab after the Eagles game to a hotel in center City. I took a different cab and my friend's driver made her pre pay $40 or he was kicking them out of the cab (mom and two children). Our fare was $14.80. He completely cheated my friends and gave cabs a bad name. Horrible service by a cheat driver. DO NOT use this company under any circumstance. Cab number P-1583

Why did I think this pet store closed years ago?

I was in AT&T (shares a parking lot) and saw some cars close to the store and strolled in.  OMG - Precious Pets is open?!!

I was thrilled and everyone is as nice as I had remembered.

They stock a really large variety of pet products for all creatures and now have a groomer on site (Flossy's).    

There is also a pet hotel upstairs.  If I had time, I would've checked it out.  

I bought our spoiled rotten Dwarf Hamster some treats and eyed other products for my next visit.

There were fresh & pretty gourmet looking dog bisquits for sale at the front check out counter.  

They're doing pet photos this weekend and there is a Yelp coupon for your first pet hotel booking.

Billie Jean. Another masterpiece from Zoe Robinson and her team who transport us to a side street in the West village or North Beach, and more importantly deliver on the high expectations we all have for her creations.  Bille Jean was awesome. We sat at the chic bar and Blake took incredible care of us especially given the intensity of a first night. The spirits are off the radar selections so right away i felt somewhere far away and special. My scotch was perfect and her martini was too.  The lighting in the dark room was just right and the noise never rose to that level where we could not hear each other in our normal talking voice. 

The food had classic familiarity and simplicity. Dining at Billie Jean will be a perfect compliment to this trio of St. Louis' finest experiences (I Fratellini and Bar Les Freres). The Asian influence is meaningful, and even though i dislike the word fusion it fits. No bread here, instead a scallion pancake with a ginger hoisin soy sauce. Again it felt special and different. So tasty. We had the tuna poke style lettuce wraps which definitely pack a spicy punch but I loved them. The mushroom radicchio salad with the warm bacon dressing and parmigiana was - according to the successful chef who tried it next to me - the perfect flavor profile. Julie and I both loved it. I was very happy with the Asian flavored spare ribs perfectly tender and then a split swordfish with a parsley verde sauce so subtle we were able to experience the swordfish in its perfect preparation. Subtlety and style combine wth a bold atmosphere to make Billie Jean another reason Zoe is our towns finest creator and leader of the dining experience. And we can walk there.

I came here today December 2, 2017 around 6:00pm. I witnessed two young girls who work the register partake in very unsanitary behavior. They rang out customers at the front desk and proceeded to sit at a table in the dining area where they handled the cookies and cakes as if they were bags of chips.  They picked up the cookies to bag them for customers to purchase and in the process they are consuming the cookies. Eating over the cookies and dusting their hands over the cookies.  The young girl scratched her head, coughed in her hand, scratched her leg all while dealing and handling food for the guests. Went back to the register and returned to handling the cookies. If you have cashiers they shouldn't handle food until they've thoroughly washed their hands. This promotes disease and sickness.

It's about time I review the restaurant that is one of my favorites in town. When I'm craving Italian food there's no question this is where we dine. We love the atmosphere of the outdoor terrace in the summer months when they have live music some evenings. In the winter months we prefer the bar side where there's a handful of table tops or a nice L-shaped bar to find a seat.

You must start with the Zozo Shrimp for an appetizer. These are like the Bang Bang Shrimp from Bonefish if you've ever experienced those. For your entree I would recommend the Lasagna. It's fantastic and the salad is also delicious. Their house dress is good but they also have a homemade ranch which is really good. Out of all the Italian restaurants in town Iozzos is by far our favorite.

Bad service and sushi is terrible tried it for a second  time. I was going to give three stars but the waitress asked if we wanted a box on the sushi and I said no we didn't like it and her response was ok And she left. Nothing else. We laughed. Usually they'd be like do you want to try something else? We've only been sitting here for a while without any attention. The sushi was premade something you'd get at publix not standard for a restaurant.

I WOULD NOT EAT SUSHI HERE. However we did like the duck tacos and salmon poke bowl.

Great pho! Loved that I was able to ask for no onions and they accommodated (other pho places haven't let me do that in the past). The waitress was patient and answered all our questions. Pad Thai was also delicious! No reason not to give it 5 stars.

Loved the food and ambiance! The restaurant is small and cozy.. kind of feels like you are in a train car.

Had an 8:30 reservation but when we arrived they told us that it didn't seem likely that a table would be available anytime soon and asked if we were okay to sit at the bar, which was fine.

We took our time and ordered 3 rounds of food at different times. All of the plates (including entrees) were on the smaller side but great to share.

To start, we had the fried chickpeas and potatoes. The chickpeas were well seasoned and the potatoes were crispy and drizzled with aioli. For our second round we had the Gouda cheese plate and the ricotta squash toast. The cheese was paired with garlic brushed bread and honey. The toast was phenomenal- butternut squash spread with a hint of salt from the ricotta topped with fresh vegetables. 

To finish we had the meatballs and spinach ricotta gnudi. Both dishes were excellent. The gnudi was creamy melt in your mouth goodness. The meatballs were well prepared and served with more garlic brushed bread because you obviously can never have enough of that. 

They had a good cocktail and wine selection though I stuck with a basic vodka soda. 

I loved every dish I tried here and honestly can't even pick a favorite because everything was so good. I highly recommend!

I was a third of the way through this roll when I realized a had not taken a picture. I may or may not have been a little tipsy. Whoops. I went with the Architect Roll. It's "a chef special roll. Let the chef surprise you with a one of a kind. Spicy, sweet, let us know what you like to eat." I can't really remember what was in this roll, but I do know it was topped with a crab salad. It was delicious! Could have had more. Also asked if they could do an eel hand roll, even though it wasn't on the menu. They had no problem throwing one together for me. My wife loves eel so I wanted to get something for her as well. Great sushi from a food truck. Awesome!

Went in for late lunch around 1:30.  Sat down and waited 10 mins and not once did someone come to our table.  only 4 other tables had people there and the people sat right before us ordered drinks, food, and received their food.  Still no one came to our table.  made eye contact with all three waiters trying to get attention and anytime walked by would just ignore us.  Decided to leave and on way out one of waiters said have a nice new year and i said thanks for not serving us and then he laughed at us and said have a good day.  We did nothing or said anything to anyone that worked there to deserve this.  Used to go at least 1-2 times a month but will never visit again after terrible service/attitude.
Have to get on the wait list for a couple of drinks at the bar...? Plenty of places to spend your money, don't bother here.

This place is horrible.   No matter the time you will wait at least 10 minutes just to get to the front of the line.   All while watching employees stand around doing nothing.   They are always either understaffed, or have incompetent people, and the place is filthy.   This is a direct reflection of management.   If there were any other local place to get a bagel this place would be shut down in a week.  And the bagels aren't even that good.   

On a Sunday morning they need: 2 trained people on registers; one person taking phone orders/backing up the registers; 4 people on the line.   

Do NOT go here.

I am giving 5 stars for 2 reasons- appetizers and great beer. It's not everyday you find a place that has Belgium triples, doubles, regular beer, german beers, IPAs,ambers literary everything. I only drink Belgium beers so of course I was in heaven. 

We got a ton of appetizers and all were great. I will post pictures. Loves the atmosphere, loved the chill environment... just overall a really good experience.

Amazing place. I wouldn't call it a museum. More of an indoor play place on steroids. When we went it was crazy busy. Crowds everywhere and felt a little claustrophobic. Our kid loved it though. We did the 10 story slide. We purchased our admission and got bracelets but I swear no one even checked. Could probably walk in and no one would know. Adults go and find the little hideout. I think it is on the 3rd or 4th floor. Small cafe, seating area, drinks and pinball machines. I would not bring small children here. You could lose them pretty easily with all the nooks and crannies.

As someone who does not consume dairy products I found their selection to be super limited. I would rather go to one of the other multiple options in town that offer milk alternatives or other options that don't necessitate milk! Maybe it was just the person who was helping me at the till, but they only gave me 2 options for a drink selection.
My first visit here... good experience. The deluxe pedi was wonderful! Lily did an awesome job

We've been coming to Garrett's for years. It is usually our first destination when we arrive in Santa Barbara.

One of my favorite breakfast places anywhere, they can't be beat for old-timey taste, quality, service and value. They do all the breakfast staples right--the old fashioned way. No frills or thrills.

Their blueberry pancakes are delicious, as is the chicken fried steak. The hash browns are done right and so are the eggs. If you ordered scrambled, you get actual eggs that are scrambled and not the kind that's poured from a carton. Oh and their coffee. A solid diner-style coffee, they're more than happy to keep refilling every minute or two.

If you're health conscious, you can help walk all this goodness off at the Santa Barbara Mission which is a mere 2 minute drive away.

I called on Saturday afternoon and they said they could someone out on Sunday at 10 A.M. Scott showed up right on time. I can't tell you how thrilled I was to get such fast service on December 24th, no less! Scott did an excellent job cleaning out the main drain and he made sure that everything was draining well before he left. He did the quality job that my FORMER drain company used to do years ago (but not anymore) for $65 MORE than Drain Medics charges. I'm sold!

I love Parx Casino.. been coming here for years even before the built this new one.. I bring my mom every year and other times and now we just made a new tradition with mom and sisters to bring New Years in at the Parx Casino..this is my third year..love it!!

Good turnaround, so far, on service! 

I ordered an island/table on October 23rd and was told "approximately 4 weeks for delivery." I called in the week after Thanksgiving to check status and was told they have no way of tracking my order we just have to wait until it arrives. Hmm, we are in 2017, and you are telling me there is "no way to track it" or you just don't want to take the extra steps to do it? Clearly, unsettled by the response, but gave another week as Sales Rep suggested and still no call to let me know the table is in. We are now two weeks into December and understandably even more frustrated I called and asked to speak directly to a Manager. I was connected to Jen who took the time to look into my order and escalate it, as she agreed it should have been delivered by now. The table is supposed to be in next week and now free delivery!

I am hoping there is no further delay. 

Thank you Jen for stepping in, so far, and helping with the situation. It will be nice to have a table for the remainder holidays!

Amazing food! LT the bartender is really friendly and will make you awesome cocktails! You get complimentary yummy popcorn and my family always love coming. I tried the Hot Cider and it was one of the best I've had!
Got the Hoonan. Suppose to come with protein(I chose chicken). All the chicken I got was that piece in the middle and little tiny bits hahaha. Thanks
I love Tangonadas. The vibe is really cute. Definitely a nice place to stick around.  I come here to satisfy my empanada cravings.  Lucky me it's around!

Very variable. Sometimes they have real deals on liquor, but wine prices are average and selection is so-so. France is very poorly represented and Italy just a bit better. Spain is okay and there's cheap Portuguese. German wines there are dreck. American wines are pretty well represented, but like everywhere else, American wine is expensive if you want quality. The worst aspect of the store are the huge southwest-facing windows which let sunlight cook most of the wines on display. Why don't they pull down blinds in the afternoon? The sun also shines in your eyes, making shopping unpleasant. I rarely buy beer there for two reasons: 1)prices are higher than other places (but selection is good, I'll admit), 2) I've also gotten skunked beer there, so I question their handling of the product. Cashiers are notably grumpy --- sorry to bother you by making a purchase, my dears!  Website is godawful and useless. A high schooler could design a more informative site for Joe Canal's customers.

I enjoy going to Whole Foods when the time permits as this is not your average grocery store so you want to have time to take it all in. I have always enjoyed their food bar which I usually eat at lunch. I have recently been introduced to the breakfast bar and I enjoy that also. This store boast a small flower department also many other unique items including organic and gluten free food.

I am a fan of Sarita's. I only manage to come here when fellow yelp-er Jen L. reminds me of its presence (and awesomeness) but it always leaves me satisfied. I think every time I've been, I've gotten the chicken bowl. The chicken is insanely, perfectly seasoned; I'm re-shocked each time I get it at how delicious this chicken is (and dang jealous cause I can never get anything to taste that good). Add some beans, rice, salsa, sour cream, all on some lettuce and voila! An excellent, rounded, filling meal! There's salsa on the table which I always dab on because *I like it hot* but it's certainly great all on its own.

Happy hour specials pretty much every day, and they vary. I've had the 2-for-1 margaritas and 2 was more than enough to get a little buzz on. I almost forgot the BEST PART though! Free chips and queso dip when you sit are excellent as well! 

Highly recommend Sarita's, it's a great, locally-owned restaurant that takes pride in its product and consistently makes great food.

The worst service ever!!!!! Had a reservation for 6 people on a Thursday. We got there and were seated immediately but then it took 30 minutes for our waitress Felicia to come by. We ordered drinks (wine) and table side guacamole for the table to start. She came back 20 minutes later and was sooooo rude!! She even yelled at one of us "I got them right here" when we asked for more chips bc we didn't see her whole tray. After that every time we wanted another drink we had to hunt her down. Side note: this establishment was NOT BUSY!! On top of that she got a couple drink orders wrong but we could t say anything because she would bring stuff to our table and disappear before we had a chance to speak. An hour later she returns for our food order....we had been there two hours already and couldn't be there all night and had really filled up on the chips bc we were starving when we got there so we all ordered soup. When we explained all this to the manager she decided to talk to the server WHILE WR WERE STILL THERE!!!! Hat was totally inappropriate!! We were still waiting on our bills. I woke up the next day to being charged twice for my bill!! We all agreed this wasn't the first time he service was beyond bad. I doubt any of us will ever be back!! There are plenty of other places to eat at and around Plaza Frontenac.

This is the only Tory Burch store I have ever been in and it's always been a good experience. The positives are there are generally always sales, it's easy to get sizes and check out quickly, and they always offer you that extra step getting you a drink while you browse their small store. The negatives for me have to be how narrow the store is and the way it's set up seems very claustrophobic (I can't even get cell reception in there). And I find it strange how many employees they always have working in such a small store it seems excessive. It's like you have to go through layers of employees that all ask you what you want help with before you get to the end. I'm someone who likes to be left alone while shopping until I need some help so it's offputting to me but very helpful for other people that like more guidance. But I don't feel that's something to judge them too harshly on, more customer service is always better than not enough!
Fantastic job! Not from here but took a recommendation and I'm so glad I did! Wish I lived in the area so that I could frequent here and get my nails done more often

Overly sweet you must have an epic sweet tooth bought a cake for my hubby,s bday in October we ended up throwing out more then half of it which was a shame after spending what i spent. Ordered a choc chocolate cake got a white cake with chocolate icing definitely would not order again. Costco cake would have gone over better and cost half as much.

The reason I give it 3 stars Is their customer service was fantastic 
and had a red velvet from there once before in June  that was dynamite again really sweet but overall yummy

TL;DR this was NOT a good experience. While the atmosphere and waitress were nice, the food was the exact opposite. I ordered a 6oz steak, medium rare, with steamed broccoli and loaded mashed potatoes. What I got was a 4oz steak, cooked medium, with microwaved broccoli that was seasoned to hell and back, and mashed potatoes with cheese, also seasoned to hell. The only enjoyable part of the meal was the garlic butter that was put TO THE SIDE of the steak. Everything is overpriced as well, this was about $14. Every appetizer is at least $7.

Protip: If you want good food, dress up real nice and go by yourself. They will think you're a food critic and go above and beyond to please you. Or you could go somewhere else and pay less for better food.

I like being adventurous with food, but when I find something that a place does well, I stick to it. And Johnny Chang's does a very good shrimp pad thai. I can't speak about their other selections, but I highly recommend that you try out their shrimp pad thai. I would regularly order it from Grubhub and the delivery is super speedy. 

Now, why do I like it so much? Well having attempted to make pad thai at home, I know how difficult it can be to do well. 
Here are the highlights:
+ Doesn't skimp on the protein, like they seriously give enough shrimp for each bite. That's a serious win!
+ Their sauce has a nice sweet & savory blend that is atypical of the more peanut-tamarindy variation. A squeeze of lime into the thick sauce is just perfect.
+ Noodles have the right bite and length to them (and that's really hard to do!)

I'm a fan and you should give them a try!

Ok... So we went here on Christmas Eve because they were open. The staff was super friendly. We ordered the shrimp remi poboy. We thought the shrimp maybe needed a little longer on the grill but everything looked and tasted fine so we ate it. Fast forward an hour later and my wife and I are both violently ill  with food poisoning. A plus to the servers, they were awesome. I would not eat there again after getting sick, though.

I recently purchased a home and when we moved in one of the carpets had stains (thought they may have been pet stains, but there wasn't as odor).  I wanted to start fresh and reached out for a steam clean of the carpet. Nick came out and was very knowledgeable, polite, and thorough.  He kept me informed of unexpected delays due to traffic. After discussing my options for the stains we decided that a deep clean would be better than just a maintenance steam clean. It turned out the stains were pet urine. The deep clean wasn't enough and when I informed Nick a couple days later he returned and did all he could to remove the pet odor. He continued to follow up with me on the status of the carpet over the course of a few days. I highly recommend In and Out Steamers. So much so I have requested Nick to clean the carpets at the rental home I am leaving. Grade A for professionalism!

So we've eaten at Zydeco's down the street from Salvo's and thoroughly enjoyed our meal there. We (my wife and I) were on our way to Zydeco's when we passed Salvo's and made the mistake of choosing to try it. 
I got the all you can eat boiled seafood special for $25.99 while my wife got the all you can eat fried shrimp and catfish special for $14.99. The best part of my meal was the room temperature sausage. The shrimp were dry and under seasoned. They obviously boil the seafood earlier in the day. By the time we arrived at 8pm the shrimp were no longer any good. The crabs were very dirty and had an overly powerful fishiness to them. The best part of my wife's food was the fries, which are the same they serve at Popeyes and Rally's. 
It was when I tried my wife's fries that our night took a turn for the worse. Our waiter who was behind the counter about 10' from our table decided it was OK to scold me for trying my wife's plate. We immediately asked for our bill, didn't tip (for the first time in history; I supported myself for 10 years waiting and bar tending) and left very unhappy. Salvo's aggressiveness regarding sharing did not make us feel welcome. We will never return here, especially after bringing our unhappiness to the attention of the manager without even an ounce of concern. 
Now some might say a business has the right to enforce their policies, but I say they need to use some common sense. If two people sit down to eat, one orders an all you can eat special, and the other person orders a water, then go ahead and enforce your no sharing policy. If two people order two all you can eat dinners, you've got a nice warm place waiting for you in hell, if you feel that is an appropriate situation to call out your customers for trying each other's meals, from 10' away from their table. 
My recommendation, spend a little more, go to Zydeco's, enjoy yourself, and don't worry about being verbally accosted by the wait staff.

Stopped by today to get flowers for my aunt and coffee filters. I don't usually go here but I was Christmas shopping nearby, so I figured I could run in.  I couldn't find the filters so I asked an employee for assistance who was having a conversation with a customer about Hawaii. I said excuse me, and was IGNORED. My mom asked another employee for help and was told she would page the manager. I was in the same isle as the rude employee when he got a page... he said I'm in aisle 6 and continued his conversation. THAT was the manager? The employees need to page a manager for coffee filters??? No wonder they're hiring. Never again. Im going to Whole Foods from now on, along with everyone else.
